TinyAra Configuration Variables

Last Updated: March 07, 2019

Table of Contents
  • 1 Menu: Main
  • 1.1 Menu: Build Setup
    • Expand
    • 1.1.1 CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL: Prompt for development and/or incomplete code/drivers
    • 1.1.2 CONFIG_DEFAULT_SMALL: Default to smallest size
    • 1.1.3 Choice: Build Host Platform
    • 1.1.4 Choice: Windows Build Environment
    • 1.1.5 CONFIG_WINDOWS_MKLINK: Use mklink
    • 1.1.6 Menu: Build Configuration
      • Expand
      • 1.1.6.1 CONFIG_APPS_DIR: Application directory
      • 1.1.6.2 CONFIG_FRAMEWORK_DIR: FRAMEWORK directory
      • 1.1.6.3 CONFIG_TOOLS_DIR: tools directory
      • 1.1.6.4 Choice: Memory organization
      • 1.1.6.5 CONFIG_BUILD_2PASS: Two pass build
      • 1.1.6.6 CONFIG_PASS1_TARGET: Pass one target
      • 1.1.6.7 CONFIG_PASS1_OBJECT: Pass one object
      • 1.1.6.8 CONFIG_TINYARA_USERSPACE: Beginning of user-space blob
    • 1.1.7 Menu: Binary Output Formats
      • Expand
      • 1.1.7.1 CONFIG_INTELHEX_BINARY: Intel HEX binary format
      • 1.1.7.2 CONFIG_MOTOROLA_SREC: Motorola S-Record binary format
      • 1.1.7.3 CONFIG_RAW_BINARY: Raw binary format
      • 1.1.7.4 CONFIG_UBOOT_UIMAGE: U-Boot uImage
      • 1.1.7.5 CONFIG_UIMAGE_LOAD_ADDRESS: uImage load address
      • 1.1.7.6 CONFIG_UIMAGE_ENTRY_POINT: uImage entry point
      • 1.1.7.7 CONFIG_DOWNLOAD_IMAGE: Convert RAW binary to download image
      • 1.1.7.8 CONFIG_SMARTFS_IMAGE: Make smartfs binary image
    • 1.1.8 Menu: Customize Header Files
      • Expand
      • 1.1.8.1 CONFIG_ARCH_STDINT_H: stdint.h
      • 1.1.8.2 CONFIG_ARCH_STDBOOL_H: stdbool.h
      • 1.1.8.3 CONFIG_ARCH_MATH_H: math.h
      • 1.1.8.4 CONFIG_ARCH_FLOAT_H: float.h
      • 1.1.8.5 CONFIG_ARCH_STDARG_H: stdarg.h
    • 1.1.9 Choice: Optimization Level
    • 1.1.10 CONFIG_DEBUG_OPTLEVEL: Custom Optimization Level
  • 1.2 Menu: Chip Selection
    • Expand
    • 1.2.1 Choice: CPU Architecture
    • 1.2.2 Choice: ARM chip selection
    • 1.2.3 CONFIG_ARMV7M_CMNVECTOR: Use common ARMv7-M vectors
    • 1.2.4 CONFIG_ARCH_FPU: FPU support
    • 1.2.5 CONFIG_ARCH_DPFPU: Double precision FPU support
    • 1.2.6 CONFIG_ARMV7M_MPU: MPU support
    • 1.2.7 CONFIG_ARMV7M_MPU_NREGIONS: Number of MPU regions
    • 1.2.8 CONFIG_ARCH_LOWVECTORS: Vectors in low memory
    • 1.2.9 CONFIG_ARCH_ROMPGTABLE: ROM page table
    • 1.2.10 CONFIG_DEBUG_HARDFAULT: Verbose Hard-Fault Debug
    • 1.2.11 CONFIG_ARCH_DABORTSTACK: Dabort Stack Size
    • 1.2.12 CONFIG_ARMV7M_LAZYFPU: Lazy FPU storage
    • 1.2.13 CONFIG_ARMV7M_USEBASEPRI: Use BASEPRI Register
    • 1.2.14 CONFIG_ARMV7M_ICACHE: Use I-Cache
    • 1.2.15 CONFIG_ARMV7M_DCACHE: Use D-Cache
    • 1.2.16 CONFIG_ARMV7M_DCACHE_WRITETHROUGH: D-Cache Write-Through
    • 1.2.17 CONFIG_ARMV7M_ITCM: Use ITCM
    • 1.2.18 CONFIG_ARMV7M_DTCM: Use DTCM
    • 1.2.19 Choice: Toolchain Selection
    • 1.2.20 CONFIG_ARMV7M_OABI_TOOLCHAIN: OABI (vs EABI)
    • 1.2.21 CONFIG_ARMV7M_TARGET2_PREL: R_ARM_TARGET2 is PC relative
    • 1.2.22 CONFIG_ARMV7M_STACKCHECK: Check for stack overflow on each function call
    • 1.2.23 CONFIG_ARMV7M_ITMSYSLOG: ITM SYSLOG support
    • 1.2.24 CONFIG_ARMV7M_ITMSYSLOG_PORT: ITM SYSLOG Port
    • 1.2.25 CONFIG_ARMV7M_ITMSYSLOG_SWODIV: ITM SYSLOG SWO divider
    • 1.2.26 CONFIG_ARMV7R_HAVE_GICv2: ARMV7R_GICv2 support
    • 1.2.27 CONFIG_ARMV7R_ICACHE: Use I-Cache
    • 1.2.28 CONFIG_ARMV7R_DCACHE: Use D-Cache
    • 1.2.29 CONFIG_ARMV7R_DCACHE_WRITETHROUGH: D-Cache Write-Through
    • 1.2.30 Menu: L2 Cache Configuration
      • Expand
      • 1.2.30.1 CONFIG_ARMV7R_L2CC_PL310: ARMv7-A L2CC P310 Support
      • 1.2.30.2 CONFIG_PL310_LOCKDOWN_BY_MASTER: PL310 Lockdown by Master
      • 1.2.30.3 CONFIG_PL310_LOCKDOWN_BY_LINE: PL310 Lockdown by Line
      • 1.2.30.4 CONFIG_PL310_ADDRESS_FILTERING: PL310 Address Filtering by Line
      • 1.2.30.5 Choice: L2 Cache Associativity
      • 1.2.30.6 Choice: L2 Cache Way Size
    • 1.2.31 Choice: Toolchain Selection
    • 1.2.32 CONFIG_ARMV7R_OABI_TOOLCHAIN: OABI (vs EABI)
    • 1.2.33 CONFIG_ARMV7R_DECODEFIQ: FIQ Handler
    • 1.2.34 Choice: Tiva/Stellaris Chip Selection
    • 1.2.35 CONFIG_LM_REVA2: Rev A2
    • 1.2.36 Menu: Tiva/Stellaris Peripheral Support

      • 1.2.36.34 CONFIG_TIVA_FLASH: Internal FLASH driver
    • 1.2.37 Menu: Enable GPIO Interrupts
      • Expand

      • 1.2.37.10 CONFIG_TIVA_GPIOK_IRQS: Enable GPIOK IRQs
      • 1.2.37.11 CONFIG_TIVA_GPIOL_IRQS: Enable GPIOL IRQs
      • 1.2.37.12 CONFIG_TIVA_GPIOM_IRQS: Enable GPIOM IRQs
      • 1.2.37.13 CONFIG_TIVA_GPION_IRQS: Enable GPION IRQs
      • 1.2.37.14 CONFIG_TIVA_GPIOP_IRQS: Enable GPIOP IRQs

      • 1.2.37.18 CONFIG_TIVA_GPIOT_IRQS: Enable GPIOT IRQs
    • 1.2.38 Menu: I2C Configuration
      • Expand
      • 1.2.38.1 CONFIG_TIVA_I2C_DYNTIMEO: Use dynamic timeouts
      • 1.2.38.2 CONFIG_TIVA_I2C_DYNTIMEO_USECPERBYTE: Timeout Microseconds per Byte
      • 1.2.38.3 CONFIG_TIVA_I2C_DYNTIMEO_STARTSTOP: Timeout for Start/Stop (Milliseconds)
      • 1.2.38.4 CONFIG_TIVA_I2C_TIMEOSEC: Timeout seconds
      • 1.2.38.5 CONFIG_TIVA_I2C_TIMEOMS: Timeout Milliseconds
      • 1.2.38.6 CONFIG_TIVA_I2C_TIMEOTICKS: Timeout for Done and Stop (ticks)
      • 1.2.38.7 CONFIG_TIVA_I2C_HIGHSPEED: High speed support
      • 1.2.38.8 CONFIG_TIVA_I2C_REGDEBUG: Register level debug
    • 1.2.39 Menu: Timer Configuration
      • Expand
      • 1.2.39.1 CONFIG_TIVA_TIMER_32BIT: 32-bit timer support
      • 1.2.39.2 CONFIG_TIVA_TIMER32_PERIODIC: 32-bit one-shot/periodic timer support
      • 1.2.39.3 CONFIG_TIVA_TIMER32_RTC: 32-bit RTC (needs 32.768-KHz input)
      • 1.2.39.4 CONFIG_TIVA_TIMER_16BIT: 16-bit timer support
      • 1.2.39.5 CONFIG_TIVA_TIMER16_PERIODIC: 16-bit one-shot/periodic timer support
      • 1.2.39.6 CONFIG_TIVA_TIMER16_EDGECOUNT: 16-bit input edge-count capture support
      • 1.2.39.7 CONFIG_TIVA_TIMER16_TIMECAP: 16-bit input time capture support
      • 1.2.39.8 CONFIG_TIVA_TIMER16_PWM: 16-bit PWM output support
      • 1.2.39.9 CONFIG_TIVA_TIMER_REGDEBUG: Register level debug
    • 1.2.40 Menu: ADC Configuration
      • Expand
      • 1.2.40.1 CONFIG_TIVA_ADC_REGDEBUG: Register level debug
    • 1.2.41 Menu: Stellaris Ethernet Configuration
      • Expand
      • 1.2.41.1 CONFIG_TIVA_ETHLEDS: Ethernet LEDs
      • 1.2.41.2 CONFIG_TIVA_ETHHDUPLEX: Force Half Duplex
      • 1.2.41.3 CONFIG_TIVA_ETHNOAUTOCRC: Disable auto-CRC
      • 1.2.41.4 CONFIG_TIVA_ETHNOPAD: Disable Tx Padding
      • 1.2.41.5 CONFIG_TIVA_MULTICAST: Enable Multicast
      • 1.2.41.6 CONFIG_TIVA_PROMISCUOUS: Enable Promiscuous Mode
      • 1.2.41.7 CONFIG_TIVA_TIMESTAMP: Enable Timestamping
      • 1.2.41.8 CONFIG_TIVA_BADCRC: Enable Bad CRC Rejection
      • 1.2.41.9 CONFIG_TIVA_DUMPPACKET: Dump Packets
    • 1.2.42 Menu: Ethernet Configuration
      • Expand
      • 1.2.42.1 Choice: PHY selection
      • 1.2.42.2 CONFIG_TIVA_AUTONEG: Use autonegotiation
      • 1.2.42.3 CONFIG_TIVA_PHYADDR: PHY address
      • 1.2.42.4 CONFIG_TIVA_ETHFD: Full duplex
      • 1.2.42.5 CONFIG_TIVA_ETH100MBPS: 100 Mbps
      • 1.2.42.6 CONFIG_TIVA_PHYSR: PHY Status Register Address (decimal)
      • 1.2.42.7 CONFIG_TIVA_PHYSR_ALTCONFIG: PHY Status Alternate Bit Layout
      • 1.2.42.8 CONFIG_TIVA_PHYSR_SPEED: PHY Speed Mask
      • 1.2.42.9 CONFIG_TIVA_PHYSR_100MBPS: PHY 100Mbps Speed Value
      • 1.2.42.10 CONFIG_TIVA_PHYSR_MODE: PHY Mode Mask
      • 1.2.42.11 CONFIG_TIVA_PHYSR_FULLDUPLEX: PHY Full Duplex Mode Value
      • 1.2.42.12 CONFIG_TIVA_PHYSR_ALTMODE: PHY Mode Mask
      • 1.2.42.13 CONFIG_TIVA_PHYSR_10HD: 10MBase-T Half Duplex Value
      • 1.2.42.14 CONFIG_TIVA_PHYSR_100HD: 100Base-T Half Duplex Value
      • 1.2.42.15 CONFIG_TIVA_PHYSR_10FD: 10Base-T Full Duplex Value
      • 1.2.42.16 CONFIG_TIVA_PHYSR_100FD: 100Base-T Full Duplex Value
      • 1.2.42.17 CONFIG_TIVA_PHY_INTERRUPTS: PHY interrupt support
      • 1.2.42.18 CONFIG_TIVA_EMAC_NRXDESC: Number of RX descriptors
      • 1.2.42.19 CONFIG_TIVA_EMAC_NTXDESC: Number of TX descriptors
      • 1.2.42.20 CONFIG_TIVA_EMAC_PTP: Precision Time Protocol (PTP)
      • 1.2.42.21 CONFIG_TIVA_EMAC_HWCHECKSUM: Use hardware checksums
      • 1.2.42.22 CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET_REGDEBUG: Register-Level Debug
    • 1.2.43 CONFIG_TIVA_BOARDMAC: Board MAC
    • 1.2.44 Menu: Tiva/Stellaris SSI Configuration

      • 1.2.47.30 CONFIG_S5J_WATCHDOG_INT: S5J Watchdog interrupt enable
      • 1.2.47.31 CONFIG_S5J_WATCHDOG_RESET: S5J Watchdog reset enable

      • 1.2.180.5 CONFIG_IMXRT_SDRAM_SIZE: SDRAM size (bytes)

      • 1.2.180.7 CONFIG_IMXRT_SRAM_START: SRAM start address
      • 1.2.180.8 CONFIG_IMXRT_SRAM_SIZE: SRAM size (bytes)
      • 1.2.180.9 CONFIG_IMXRT_SEMC_NOR: External NOR FLASH installed
      • 1.2.180.10 Choice: i.MX RT Boot Configuration
      • 1.2.180.11 Choice: i.MX RT Primary RAM
      • 1.2.180.12 Menu: i.MX RT Heap Configuration
        • Expand
        • 1.2.180.12.1 CONFIG_IMXRT_OCRAM_HEAP: Add OCRAM to heap
        • 1.2.180.12.2 CONFIG_IMXRT_SDRAM_HEAP: Add SDRAM to heap
        • 1.2.180.12.3 CONFIG_IMXRT_SDRAM_HEAPOFFSET: SDRAM heap offset
        • 1.2.180.12.4 CONFIG_IMXRT_SRAM_HEAP: Add SRAM to heap
        • 1.2.180.12.5 CONFIG_IMXRT_SRAM_HEAPOFFSET: SRAM heap offset
    • 1.2.181 Menu: USDHC Configuration
      • Expand

      • 1.2.181.2 CONFIG_IMXRT_USDHC_WIDTH_D1_ONLY: Use D1 only

    • 1.2.183 CONFIG_IMXRT_PM_SERIAL_ACTIVITY: PM serial activity

    • 1.2.205 CONFIG_ARCH_STACK_DYNAMIC: Dynamic user stack

    • 1.2.208 CONFIG_ARCH_KERNEL_STACK: Kernel process stack
    • 1.2.209 CONFIG_ARCH_KERNEL_STACKSIZE: Kernel stack size
    • 1.2.210 CONFIG_ARCH_PGPOOL_MAPPING: Have page pool mapping

    • 1.2.212 CONFIG_ARCH_PGPOOL_VBASE: Page pool virtual address
    • 1.2.213 CONFIG_ARCH_PGPOOL_SIZE: Page pool size (byes)
    • 1.2.214 CONFIG_PAGING: On-demand paging

    • 1.2.216 CONFIG_PAGING_NLOCKED: Number of locked pages
    • 1.2.217 CONFIG_PAGING_CUSTOM_BASE: Custom paging base address
    • 1.2.218 CONFIG_PAGING_LOCKED_PBASE: Physical base address
    • 1.2.219 CONFIG_PAGING_LOCKED_VBASE: Virtual base address
    • 1.2.220 CONFIG_PAGING_NPPAGED: Number of physical pages
    • 1.2.221 CONFIG_PAGING_NVPAGED: Number of virtual pages
    • 1.2.222 CONFIG_PAGING_NDATA: Number of data pages
    • 1.2.223 CONFIG_PAGING_DEFPRIO: Page fill worker thread priority
    • 1.2.224 CONFIG_PAGING_STACKSIZE: Page fill worker thread stack size
    • 1.2.225 CONFIG_PAGING_BLOCKINGFILL: Blocking fill
    • 1.2.226 CONFIG_PAGING_WORKPERIOD: Work period (usec)
    • 1.2.227 CONFIG_PAGING_TIMEOUT: Paging timeout
    • 1.2.228 CONFIG_PAGING_TIMEOUT_TICKS: Paging timeout ticks
    • 1.2.229 CONFIG_ARCH_IRQPRIO: Prioritized interrupt support
    • 1.2.230 CONFIG_ARCH_STACKDUMP: Dump stack on assertions
    • 1.2.231 CONFIG_DEBUG_DISPLAY_SYMBOL: Display symbols on call stack dump
    • 1.2.232 CONFIG_ARCH_USBDUMP: Dump USB trace data
    • 1.2.233 CONFIG_ENDIAN_BIG: Big Endian Architecture
    • 1.2.234 CONFIG_ARCH_IDLE_CUSTOM: Custom IDLE loop
    • 1.2.235 CONFIG_ARCH_CUSTOM_PMINIT: Custom PM initialization
    • 1.2.236 CONFIG_ARCH_RAMFUNCS: Copy functions to RAM on startup
    • 1.2.237 CONFIG_ARCH_RAMVECTORS: Support RAM interrupt vectors
    • 1.2.238 CONFIG_BOARD_LOOPSPERMSEC: Delay loops per millisecond
    • 1.2.239 CONFIG_ARCH_CALIBRATION: Calibrate delay loop
    • 1.2.240 CONFIG_ARCH_INTERRUPTSTACK: Interrupt Stack Size
    • 1.2.241 CONFIG_ARCH_HIPRI_INTERRUPT: High priority interrupts
    • 1.2.242 CONFIG_ARCH_INT_DISABLEALL: Disable high priority interrupts
    • 1.2.243 Choice: Boot Mode
    • 1.2.244 Menu: Boot Memory Configuration
      • Expand
      • 1.2.244.1 CONFIG_RAM_VSTART: Primary RAM start address (virtual)

      • 1.2.244.3 CONFIG_RAM_REGIONx_SIZE: A size or list of size for RAM region
      • 1.2.244.4 CONFIG_RAM_REGIONx_HEAP_INDEX: List of heap index for RAM region
      • 1.2.244.5 CONFIG_FS_TMPFS_HEAP_INDEX: TMPFS Heap index
      • 1.2.244.6 CONFIG_DDR: Use DDR memory
      • 1.2.244.7 CONFIG_RAM_DDR_START: DDR RAM start address
      • 1.2.244.8 CONFIG_RAM_DDR_SIZE: DDR RAM size
      • 1.2.244.9 CONFIG_FLASH_START: Boot FLASH start address (physical)

      • 1.2.244.12 CONFIG_BOOT_SDRAM_DATA: Data in SDRAM
  • 1.3 Menu: Board Selection
    • Expand
    • 1.3.1 Choice: Select target board
    • 1.3.2 CONFIG_ARCH_LEDS: Board LED support
    • 1.3.3 CONFIG_ARCH_BUTTONS: Board button support
    • 1.3.4 CONFIG_ARCH_IRQBUTTONS: Button interrupt support
    • 1.3.5 CONFIG_BOARD_CRASHDUMP: Enable Board level logging of crash dumps
    • 1.3.6 CONFIG_BOARD_ASSERT_AUTORESET: Reset a board on assert status automatically
    • 1.3.7 CONFIG_LIB_BOARDCTL: Enable boardctl() interface
    • 1.3.8 CONFIG_BOARDCTL_POWEROFF: Enable power off interfaces
    • 1.3.9 CONFIG_BOARDCTL_RESET: Enable reset interfaces
    • 1.3.10 CONFIG_BOARDCTL_UNIQUEID: Return board unique ID
    • 1.3.11 CONFIG_BOARDCTL_UNIQUEID_SIZE: Size of the board unique ID (bytes)
    • 1.3.12 CONFIG_BOARD_FOTA_SUPPORT: Enable board support for FOTA
    • 1.3.13 CONFIG_BOARD_COREDUMP_FLASH: Enable crashlog dump to flash
    • 1.3.14 CONFIG_BOARD_RAMDUMP_FLASH: Enable ramdump to flash
    • 1.3.15 CONFIG_BOARD_RAMDUMP_UART: Enable ramdump via UART
    • 1.3.16 CONFIG_ARTIK05X_BOOT_FAILURE_DETECTION: Clear bootcount when boot completes
    • 1.3.17 CONFIG_ARTIK05X_BOOT_COUNTS_ADDR: Address of scratch pad register to store the bootcount
    • 1.3.18 CONFIG_ARTIK05X_FLASH_CAPACITY: Size of external flash memory (in bytes)
    • 1.3.19 CONFIG_ARTIK05X_FLASH_PAGE_SIZE: Page size of external flash memory (in bytes)
    • 1.3.20 CONFIG_ARTIK05X_AUTOMOUNT: Automount partitions
    • 1.3.21 CONFIG_ARTIK05X_AUTOMOUNT_USERFS: Automount user r/w partiton
    • 1.3.22 CONFIG_ARTIK05X_AUTOMOUNT_USERFS_DEVNAME: Device name of the partition for user r/w file system
    • 1.3.23 CONFIG_ARTIK05X_AUTOMOUNT_USERFS_MOUNTPOINT: Mountpoint of the partition for user r/w file system
    • 1.3.24 CONFIG_ARTIK05X_AUTOMOUNT_SSSRW: Automount secure storage partiton
    • 1.3.25 CONFIG_ARTIK05X_AUTOMOUNT_SSSRW_DEVNAME: Device name of the partition for secure storage
    • 1.3.26 CONFIG_ARTIK05X_AUTOMOUNT_SSSRW_MOUNTPOINT: Mountpoint of the partition for secure storage
    • 1.3.27 CONFIG_ARTIK05X_AUTOMOUNT_ROMFS: Automount romfs partiton
    • 1.3.28 CONFIG_ARTIK05X_AUTOMOUNT_ROMFS_DEVNAME: Device name of the partition for romfs file system
    • 1.3.29 CONFIG_ARTIK05X_AUTOMOUNT_ROMFS_MOUNTPOINT: Mountpoint of the partition for romfs file system
    • 1.3.30 CONFIG_SVR_DB_SECURESTORAGE: Enable storing SVR DB inside secure storage partition
    • 1.3.31 CONFIG_ARTIK05X_RAMMTD_NEBLOCKS: RAM MTD erase block count
    • 1.3.32 CONFIG_ARTIK05X_RAMMTD_DEV_NUMBER: device number for mtd of smartfs
    • 1.3.33 CONFIG_ARTIK05X_RAMMTD_DEV_POINT: Device name of the partition for ramfs r/w file system
    • 1.3.34 CONFIG_ARTIK05X_RAMMTD_MOUNT_POINT: Mountpoint of the partition for ramfs r/w file system
    • 1.3.35 Choice: Build for qemu hardware
    • 1.3.36 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_TLC59116: Support TLC59116 IC
    • 1.3.37 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_S8300: Support S8300 IC
    • 1.3.38 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_M93C66WMN6T: Support M93C66WMN6T EEPROM

    • 1.3.40 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_FLASH_CAPACITY: Size of external flash memory (in bytes)
    • 1.3.41 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_FLASH_PAGE_SIZE: Page size of external flash memory (in bytes)

    • 1.3.43 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_FLASH_PART: Enable partition support on FLASH

    • 1.3.52 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_AUTOMOUNT_USERFS_MOUNTPOINT: Mountpoint of the partition for user r/w file system
    • 1.3.53 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_AUTOMOUNT_SSSRW: Automount sss r/w partiton
    • 1.3.54 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_AUTOMOUNT_SSSRW_DEVNAME: Device name of the partition for SSS r/w file system
    • 1.3.55 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_AUTOMOUNT_SSSRW_MOUNTPOINT: Mountpoint of the partition for SSS r/w file system
    • 1.3.56 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_RAMMTD_NEBLOCKS: RAM MTD erase block count
    • 1.3.57 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_RAMMTD_DEV_NUMBER: device number for mtd of smartfs
    • 1.3.58 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_RAMMTD_DEV_POINT: Device name of the partition for ramfs r/w file system
    • 1.3.59 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_RAMMTD_MOUNT_POINT: Mountpoint of the partition for ramfs r/w file system
    • 1.3.60 CONFIG_STM32F429I_DISCO_FLASH: MTD driver for external 8Mbyte SST25 FLASH on SPI4
    • 1.3.61 CONFIG_STM32F429I_DISCO_FLASH_MINOR: Minor number for the FLASH /dev/smart entry
    • 1.3.62 CONFIG_STM32F429I_DISCO_FLASH_PART: Enable partition support on FLASH
    • 1.3.63 CONFIG_STM32F429I_DISCO_FLASH_CONFIG_PART: Create application config data partition on FLASH
    • 1.3.64 CONFIG_STM32F429I_DISCO_FLASH_CONFIG_PART_NUMBER: Index number of config partition (in list below)
    • 1.3.65 CONFIG_STM32F429I_DISCO_FLASH_PART_LIST: Flash partition size list
    • 1.3.66 CONFIG_STM32F429I_DISCO_FLASH_PART_NAMES: Flash partition name list
    • 1.3.67 CONFIG_STM32F429I_DISCO_RAMMTD: MTD driver for SMARTFS RAM disk
    • 1.3.68 CONFIG_STM32F429I_DISCO_RAMMTD_MINOR: Minor number for RAM /dev/smart entry
    • 1.3.69 CONFIG_STM32F429I_DISCO_RAMMTD_SIZE: Size in KB of the RAM device to create
    • 1.3.70 CONFIG_PM_BUTTONS: PM Button support
    • 1.3.71 CONFIG_PM_BUTTON_ACTIVITY: Button PM activity weight
    • 1.3.72 CONFIG_PM_ALARM_SEC: PM_STANDBY delay (seconds)
    • 1.3.73 CONFIG_PM_ALARM_NSEC: PM_STANDBY delay (nanoseconds)
    • 1.3.74 CONFIG_PM_SLEEP_WAKEUP: PM_SLEEP wake-up alarm
    • 1.3.75 CONFIG_PM_SLEEP_WAKEUP_SEC: PM_SLEEP delay (seconds)
    • 1.3.76 CONFIG_PM_SLEEP_WAKEUP_NSEC: PM_SLEEP delay (nanoseconds)
    • 1.3.77 CONFIG_STM32F429I_DISCO_ILI9341: LCD driver for ILI9341 Liquid Crystal Display Controller
    • 1.3.78 CONFIG_STM32F429I_DISCO_ILI9341_SPIFREQUENCY: SPI frequency
    • 1.3.79 CONFIG_STM32F429I_DISCO_ILI9341_SPIBITS16: Enable 16 bit pixel read/write
    • 1.3.80 CONFIG_STM32F429I_DISCO_ILI9341_LCDIFACE: Enable support for TinyAra lcd interface
    • 1.3.81 CONFIG_STM32F429I_DISCO_ILI9341_LCDDEVICE: LCD interface
    • 1.3.82 CONFIG_STM32F429I_DISCO_ILI9341_FBIFACE: Enable support for TinyAra frambuffer interface
    • 1.3.83 Choice: LCD Orientation
    • 1.3.84 Choice: On-board Crystal Frequency
    • 1.3.85 CONFIG_ESP32CORE_RUN_IRAM: Run from IRAM
    • 1.3.86 Choice: Default serial port
    • 1.3.87 Choice: Default baud rate
    • 1.3.88 CONFIG_ESPTOOLPY_COMPRESSED: Use compressed upload
    • 1.3.89 Choice: Flash SPI mode
    • 1.3.90 Choice: Flash SPI speed
    • 1.3.91 Choice: Flash size
    • 1.3.92 CONFIG_ESPTOOLPY_FLASHSIZE_DETECT: Detect flash size when flashing bootloader
    • 1.3.93 Choice: Before flashing
    • 1.3.94 Choice: After flashing
    • 1.3.95 Choice: Boot Flash
    • 1.3.96 CONFIG_FLASH_PARTITION: Enable partition support on FLASH
    • 1.3.97 CONFIG_FLASH_MINOR: Minor number for the FLASH device
    • 1.3.98 CONFIG_FLASH_PART_LIST: Flash partition size list (in KBytes)
    • 1.3.99 CONFIG_FLASH_PART_TYPE: Flash partition type list
    • 1.3.100 CONFIG_FLASH_PART_NAME: Flash partition name list

    • Expand
    • 1.4.1 CONFIG_CRYPTO: Crypto API Support
    • 1.4.2 CONFIG_CRYPTO_BLAKE2S: BLAKE2s hash algorithm
    • 1.4.3 CONFIG_CRYPTO_RANDOM_POOL: Entropy pool and strong randon number generator
  • 1.5 Menu: Kernel Features
    • Expand
    • 1.5.1 CONFIG_DISABLE_OS_API: Disable TinyAra interfaces
    • 1.5.2 CONFIG_DISABLE_POSIX_TIMERS: Disable POSIX timers
    • 1.5.3 CONFIG_DISABLE_PTHREAD: Disable pthread support
    • 1.5.4 CONFIG_DISABLE_SIGNALS: Disable signal support
    • 1.5.5 CONFIG_DISABLE_MQUEUE: Disable POSIX message queue support
    • 1.5.6 CONFIG_DISABLE_ENVIRON: Disable environment variable support
    • 1.5.7 Menu: Clocks and Timers
      • Expand
      • 1.5.7.1 CONFIG_SCHED_TICKLESS: Support tick-less OS
      • 1.5.7.2 CONFIG_SCHED_TICKLESS_ALARM: Tickless alarm
      • 1.5.7.3 CONFIG_SCHED_TICKLESS_LIMIT_MAX_SLEEP: Max sleep period (in microseconds)
      • 1.5.7.4 CONFIG_USEC_PER_TICK: System timer tick period (microseconds)
      • 1.5.7.5 CONFIG_SYSTEMTICK_EXTCLK: Use external clock
      • 1.5.7.6 CONFIG_SYSTEM_TIME64: 64-bit system clock
      • 1.5.7.7 CONFIG_CLOCK_MONOTONIC: Support CLOCK_MONOTONIC
      • 1.5.7.8 CONFIG_JULIAN_TIME: Enables Julian time conversions
      • 1.5.7.9 CONFIG_START_YEAR: Start year
      • 1.5.7.10 CONFIG_START_MONTH: Start month
      • 1.5.7.11 CONFIG_START_DAY: Start day
      • 1.5.7.12 CONFIG_MAX_WDOGPARMS: Maximum number of watchdog parameters
      • 1.5.7.13 CONFIG_PREALLOC_WDOGS: Number of pre-allocated watchdog timers
      • 1.5.7.14 CONFIG_WDOG_INTRESERVE: Watchdog structures reserved for interrupt handlers
      • 1.5.7.15 CONFIG_PREALLOC_TIMERS: Number of pre-allocated POSIX timers
    • 1.5.8 Menu: Tasks and Scheduling
      • Expand
      • 1.5.8.1 Choice: Initialization Task
      • 1.5.8.2 CONFIG_RR_INTERVAL: Round robin timeslice (MSEC)
      • 1.5.8.3 CONFIG_TASK_NAME_SIZE: Maximum task name size
      • 1.5.8.4 CONFIG_MAX_TASKS: Max number of tasks
      • 1.5.8.5 CONFIG_SCHED_HAVE_PARENT: Support parent/child task relationships
      • 1.5.8.6 CONFIG_SCHED_CHILD_STATUS: Retain child exit status
      • 1.5.8.7 CONFIG_PREALLOC_CHILDSTATUS: Number of pre-allocated child status
      • 1.5.8.8 CONFIG_DEBUG_CHILDSTATUS: Enable Child Status Debug Output
      • 1.5.8.9 CONFIG_SCHED_WAITPID: Enable waitpid() API
      • 1.5.8.10 CONFIG_SIGKILL_HANDLER: Enable user defined SIGKILL handler
    • 1.5.9 Menu: Pthread Options
      • Expand
      • 1.5.9.1 CONFIG_PTHREAD_MUTEX_TYPES: Enable mutex types
      • 1.5.9.2 Choice: pthread mutex robustness
      • 1.5.9.3 Choice: Default NORMAL mutex robustness
      • 1.5.9.4 CONFIG_NPTHREAD_KEYS: Maximum number of pthread keys
      • 1.5.9.5 CONFIG_NPTHREAD_DESTRUCTOR_ITERATIONS: Maximum number of calling pthread destructor
      • 1.5.9.6 CONFIG_PTHREAD_CLEANUP: pthread cleanup stack
      • 1.5.9.7 CONFIG_PTHREAD_CLEANUP_STACKSIZE: pthread cleanup stack size
    • 1.5.10 CONFIG_CANCELLATION_POINTS: Cancellation points
    • 1.5.11 Menu: Performance Monitoring
      • Expand
      • 1.5.11.1 CONFIG_SCHED_CPULOAD: Enable CPU load monitoring
      • 1.5.11.2 CONFIG_SCHED_CPULOAD_EXTCLK: Use external clock
      • 1.5.11.3 CONFIG_SCHED_CPULOAD_TICKSPERSEC: External clock rate
      • 1.5.11.4 CONFIG_SCHED_CPULOAD_TIMECONSTANT: CPU load time constant (in seconds)
      • 1.5.11.5 CONFIG_SCHED_MULTI_CPULOAD: Use multi interval for cpuload measurement (in seconds)
      • 1.5.11.6 CONFIG_SCHED_CPULOAD_TIMECONSTANT_SHORT: Time constant for short-term
      • 1.5.11.7 CONFIG_SCHED_CPULOAD_TIMECONSTANT_MID: Time constant for mid-term
      • 1.5.11.8 CONFIG_SCHED_CPULOAD_TIMECONSTANT_LONG: Time constant for long-term
    • 1.5.12 Menu: Latency optimization
      • Expand
      • 1.5.12.1 CONFIG_SCHED_YIELD_OPTIMIZATION: Improve the scheduling latency of sched_yield API
    • 1.5.13 Menu: Files and I/O
      • Expand
      • 1.5.13.1 CONFIG_DEV_CONSOLE: Enable /dev/console
      • 1.5.13.2 CONFIG_FDCLONE_DISABLE: Disable cloning of file descriptors
      • 1.5.13.3 CONFIG_FDCLONE_STDIO: Disable clone file descriptors without stdio
      • 1.5.13.4 CONFIG_SDCLONE_DISABLE: Disable cloning of socket descriptors
      • 1.5.13.5 CONFIG_NFILE_DESCRIPTORS: Maximum number of file descriptors per task
      • 1.5.13.6 CONFIG_NFILE_STREAMS: Maximum number of FILE streams
      • 1.5.13.7 CONFIG_NAME_MAX: Maximum size of a file name
    • 1.5.14 CONFIG_PRIORITY_INHERITANCE: Enable priority inheritance
    • 1.5.15 CONFIG_SEM_PREALLOCHOLDERS: Number of pre-allocated holders
    • 1.5.16 CONFIG_SEM_NNESTPRIO: Maximum number of higher priority threads

      • 1.6.209.6 CONFIG_UART4_2STOP: Uses 2 stop bits

      • 1.6.209.9 CONFIG_UART4_DMA: UART4 DMA support

    • 1.6.242 CONFIG_SENSOR: Sensor Driver Support
    • 1.6.243 CONFIG_SENSOR_PPD42NS: Shinyei PPD42NS Dust Sensor
    • 1.6.244 CONFIG_SENSOR_PPD42NS_GPIO_NUM: PPD42NS GPIO Pin Number
    • 1.6.245 CONFIG_SENSOR_PPD42NS_DEBUG: PPD42NS driver debug message
    • 1.6.246 CONFIG_USBDEV: USB Device Driver Support
    • 1.6.247 CONFIG_USBDEV_ISOCHRONOUS: Enable isochronous
    • 1.6.248 CONFIG_USBDEV_DUALSPEED: Enable high and full speed
    • 1.6.249 Choice: Select USB device powered
    • 1.6.250 CONFIG_USBDEV_MAXPOWER: Maximum power consumption in mA
    • 1.6.251 CONFIG_USBDEV_DMA: Enable DMA methods
    • 1.6.252 CONFIG_USBDEV_DMAMEMORY: Board DMA Allocation Hooks
    • 1.6.253 CONFIG_USBDEV_TRACE: Enable USB tracing for debug
    • 1.6.254 CONFIG_USBDEV_TRACE_NRECORDS: Number of trace entries to remember
    • 1.6.255 CONFIG_USBDEV_TRACE_STRINGS: Decode device controller events
    • 1.6.256 CONFIG_USBDEV_TRACE_INITIALIDSET: Initial enable bits
    • 1.6.257 CONFIG_USBDEV_COMPOSITE: USB composite device support
    • 1.6.258 CONFIG_COMPOSITE_IAD: Use Interface Associate Descriptor (IAD)
    • 1.6.259 CONFIG_COMPOSITE_EP0MAXPACKET: Max packet size for endpoint 0
    • 1.6.260 CONFIG_COMPOSITE_VENDORID: Composite vendor ID
    • 1.6.261 CONFIG_COMPOSITE_VENDORSTR: Composite vendor ID
    • 1.6.262 CONFIG_COMPOSITE_PRODUCTID: Composite product id
    • 1.6.263 CONFIG_COMPOSITE_PRODUCTSTR: Composite product string
    • 1.6.264 CONFIG_COMPOSITE_SERIALSTR: Composite serial string
    • 1.6.265 CONFIG_COMPOSITE_CONFIGSTR: Configuration string
    • 1.6.266 CONFIG_COMPOSITE_VERSIONNO: Composite version number
    • 1.6.267 CONFIG_PL2303: Prolific PL2303 serial/USB converter emulation
    • 1.6.268 CONFIG_PL2303_CONSOLE: PL2303 console device
    • 1.6.269 CONFIG_PL2303_EPINTIN: Interrupt IN endpoint number
    • 1.6.270 CONFIG_PL2303_EPBULKOUT: Bulk OUT endpoint number
    • 1.6.271 CONFIG_PL2303_EPBULKIN: Bulk IN endpoint number
    • 1.6.272 CONFIG_PL2303_EP0MAXPACKET: Packet and request buffer sizes
    • 1.6.273 CONFIG_PL2303_NWRREQS: Number of read requests that can be in flight
    • 1.6.274 CONFIG_PL2303_NRDREQS: Number of write requests that can be in flight
    • 1.6.275 CONFIG_PL2303_BULKIN_REQLEN: Size of one write request buffer
    • 1.6.276 CONFIG_PL2303_RXBUFSIZE: Receive buffer size
    • 1.6.277 CONFIG_PL2303_TXBUFSIZE: Transmit buffer size
    • 1.6.278 CONFIG_PL2303_VENDORID: Vendor ID
    • 1.6.279 CONFIG_PL2303_PRODUCTID: Product ID
    • 1.6.280 CONFIG_PL2303_VENDORSTR: Vendor string
    • 1.6.281 CONFIG_PL2303_PRODUCTSTR: Product string
    • 1.6.282 CONFIG_CDCACM: USB Modem (CDC ACM) support
    • 1.6.283 CONFIG_CDCACM_CONSOLE: CDC/ACM console device
    • 1.6.284 CONFIG_CDCACM_IFLOWCONTROL: CDC/ACM RTS flow control
    • 1.6.285 CONFIG_CDCACM_COMPOSITE: CDC/ACM composite support
    • 1.6.286 CONFIG_CDCACM_IFNOBASE: Offset the CDC/ACM interface numbers
    • 1.6.287 CONFIG_CDCACM_STRBASE: Offset the CDC/ACM string numbers
    • 1.6.288 CONFIG_CDCACM_EP0MAXPACKET: Endpoint 0 max packet size
    • 1.6.289 CONFIG_CDCACM_EPINTIN: Interrupt IN endpoint number
    • 1.6.290 CONFIG_CDCACM_EPINTIN_FSSIZE: Interupt IN full speed MAXPACKET size
    • 1.6.291 CONFIG_CDCACM_EPINTIN_HSSIZE: Interupt IN high speed MAXPACKET size
    • 1.6.292 CONFIG_CDCACM_EPBULKOUT: Bulk OUT endpoint number
    • 1.6.293 CONFIG_CDCACM_EPBULKOUT_FSSIZE: Bulk OUT full speed MAXPACKET size
    • 1.6.294 CONFIG_CDCACM_EPBULKOUT_HSSIZE: Bulk OUT out high speed MAXPACKET size
    • 1.6.295 CONFIG_CDCACM_EPBULKIN: Bulk IN endpoint number
    • 1.6.296 CONFIG_CDCACM_EPBULKIN_FSSIZE: Bulk IN full speed MAXPACKET size
    • 1.6.297 CONFIG_CDCACM_EPBULKIN_HSSIZE: Bulk IN high speed MAXPACKET size
    • 1.6.298 CONFIG_CDCACM_NWRREQS: Number of read requests that can be in flight
    • 1.6.299 CONFIG_CDCACM_NRDREQS: Number of write requests that can be in flight
    • 1.6.300 CONFIG_CDCACM_BULKIN_REQLEN: Size of one write request buffer
    • 1.6.301 CONFIG_CDCACM_RXBUFSIZE: Receive buffer size
    • 1.6.302 CONFIG_CDCACM_TXBUFSIZE: Transmit buffer size
    • 1.6.303 CONFIG_CDCACM_VENDORID: Vendor ID
    • 1.6.304 CONFIG_CDCACM_PRODUCTID: Product ID
    • 1.6.305 CONFIG_CDCACM_VENDORSTR: Vendor string
    • 1.6.306 CONFIG_CDCACM_PRODUCTSTR: Product string
    • 1.6.307 CONFIG_USBMSC: USB Mass storage class device
    • 1.6.308 CONFIG_USBMSC_COMPOSITE: Mass storage composite support
    • 1.6.309 CONFIG_USBMSC_IFNOBASE: Offset the mass storage interface number
    • 1.6.310 CONFIG_USBMSC_STRBASE: Offset the mass storage string numbers
    • 1.6.311 CONFIG_USBMSC_EP0MAXPACKET: Max packet size for endpoint 0
    • 1.6.312 CONFIG_USBMSC_EPBULKOUT: Bulk OUT endpoint number
    • 1.6.313 CONFIG_USBMSC_EPBULKIN: Bulk IN endpoint number
    • 1.6.314 CONFIG_USBMSC_NWRREQS: The number of write requests that can be in flight
    • 1.6.315 CONFIG_USBMSC_NRDREQS: The number of read requests that can be in flight
    • 1.6.316 CONFIG_USBMSC_BULKINREQLEN: Bulk IN request size
    • 1.6.317 CONFIG_USBMSC_BULKOUTREQLEN: Bulk OUT request size
    • 1.6.318 CONFIG_USBMSC_VENDORID: Mass storage Vendor ID
    • 1.6.319 CONFIG_USBMSC_VENDORSTR: Mass storage vendor string
    • 1.6.320 CONFIG_USBMSC_PRODUCTID: Mass storage Product ID
    • 1.6.321 CONFIG_USBMSC_PRODUCTSTR: Mass storage product string
    • 1.6.322 CONFIG_USBMSC_VERSIONNO: USB MSC Version Number
    • 1.6.323 CONFIG_USBMSC_REMOVABLE: Mass storage removable
    • 1.6.324 CONFIG_USBMSC_SCSI_PRIO: USBMSC SCSI daemon priority
    • 1.6.325 CONFIG_USBMSC_SCSI_STACKSIZE: USBMSC SCSI daemon stack size
    • 1.6.326 CONFIG_FOTA_DRIVER: FOTA Device Driver Support
    • 1.6.327 CONFIG_RAMLOG: RAM log device support
    • 1.6.328 CONFIG_RAMLOG_SYSLOG: Use RAMLOG for SYSLOG
    • 1.6.329 CONFIG_RAMLOG_CONSOLE: Use RAMLOG for /dev/console
    • 1.6.330 CONFIG_RAMLOG_BUFSIZE: RAMLOG buffer size
    • 1.6.331 CONFIG_RAMLOG_UPDATE_LATEST: RAMLOG buffer updates(overwrite)
    • 1.6.332 CONFIG_RAMLOG_CRLF: RAMLOG CR/LF
    • 1.6.333 CONFIG_RAMLOG_NONBLOCKING: RAMLOG non-block reads
    • 1.6.334 CONFIG_RAMLOG_NPOLLWAITERS: RAMLOG number of poll waiters
    • 1.6.335 CONFIG_SYSLOG_CONSOLE: Use SYSLOG for /dev/console
    • 1.6.336 CONFIG_TTRACE: T-trace support
    • 1.6.337 CONFIG_TTRACE_BUFSIZE: Trace buffer size
    • 1.6.338 CONFIG_TTRACE_DEVPATH: T-trace device node path
    • 1.6.339 CONFIG_DRIVERS_WIRELESS: Wireless Device Support
    • 1.6.340 CONFIG_SCSC_WLAN: SCSC Wireless Module support
    • 1.6.341 CONFIG_SLSI_RX_PERFORMANCE_TEST: Enable UDP RX performance test
    • 1.6.342 CONFIG_SCSC_TX_FLOW_CONTROL: Enable TX flow control
    • 1.6.343 CONFIG_SCSC_ENABLE_PORT_CONTROL: Enable controlled/uncontrolled port logic in the driver
    • 1.6.344 CONFIG_SCSC_WLAN_STA_ONLY: Support WLAN STA only (no P2P/AP/IBSS)
    • 1.6.345 CONFIG_SCSC_WLAN_BLOCK_IPV6: Block IPv6
    • 1.6.346 CONFIG_SCSC_WLAN_UDP_FLOWCONTROL: Enable UDP Flow Control by changing LPWORK priority
    • 1.6.347 CONFIG_SCSC_WLAN_AUTO_RECOVERY: Enable Auto Recovery
    • 1.6.348 CONFIG_SCSC_WLAN_POWER_SAVE: Enable Power Save mode
    • 1.6.349 CONFIG_SCSC_WLAN_MAX_INTERFACES: Max number of virtual interfaces supported
    • 1.6.350 CONFIG_SCSC_CORE: SCSC Core driver Module support
    • 1.6.351 CONFIG_SCSC_PLATFORM: Samsung SCSC MIF Platform driver implementation
    • 1.6.352 CONFIG_SCSC_WLANLITE: Samsung SCSC WLANLITE driver mode
    • 1.6.353 CONFIG_SCSC_DISABLE_WLAN_RESET: Never power down the Samsung SCSC WLAN CPU
  • 1.7 Menu: Networking Support
    • Expand
    • 1.7.1 CONFIG_NET: Networking support
    • 1.7.2 Choice: Networking stack
    • 1.7.3 Menu: LwIP options
      • Expand
      • 1.7.3.1 CONFIG_NET_IPv4: IPv4 support
      • 1.7.3.2 CONFIG_NET_IP_DEFAULT_TTL: Default value for Time-To-Live
      • 1.7.3.3 CONFIG_NET_IP_FORWARD: Support IP packet forwarding
      • 1.7.3.4 CONFIG_NET_IP_OPTIONS_ALLOWED: Support IP options
      • 1.7.3.5 CONFIG_NET_IP_FRAG: IP fragment support
      • 1.7.3.6 CONFIG_NET_IP_REASSEMBLY: IP reassembly support
      • 1.7.3.7 CONFIG_NET_IPV4_REASS_MAX_PBUFS: Total maximum amount of pbufs
      • 1.7.3.8 CONFIG_NET_IPV4_REASS_MAXAGE: Maximum time for fragments
      • 1.7.3.9 CONFIG_NET_IPv6: IPv6 support
      • 1.7.3.10 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_NUM_ADDRESSES: Number of IPv6 addresses per netif
      • 1.7.3.11 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_FORWARD: Enable IPv6 packet forwarding
      • 1.7.3.12 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_FRAG: Enable IPv6 packet fragment
      • 1.7.3.13 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_REASS: Enable IPv6 packet reassemble
      • 1.7.3.14 CONFIG_NET_IPV6_REASS_MAXAGE: Maximum time for fragments
      • 1.7.3.15 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_SEND_ROUTER_SOLICIT: Send router solicitation messages during network startup
      • 1.7.3.16 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_AUTOCONFIG: Enable stateless address autoconfiguration as per RFC 4862
      • 1.7.3.17 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_DUP_DETECT_ATTEMPTS: Number of duplicate address detection attempts
      • 1.7.3.18 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_PMTU_FOR_MULTICAST: Support PMTU for multicast destinations
      • 1.7.3.19 Menu: Socket support
        • Expand
        • 1.7.3.19.1 CONFIG_NSOCKET_DESCRIPTORS: Number of socket descriptor
        • 1.7.3.19.2 CONFIG_NET_TCP_KEEPALIVE: TCP keepalive
        • 1.7.3.19.3 CONFIG_NET_RAW: Raw socket support
        • 1.7.3.19.4 CONFIG_NET_SOCKET_OPTION_BROADCAST: Support SO_BROADCAST Option
        • 1.7.3.19.5 CONFIG_NET_RANDOMIZE_INITIAL_LOCAL_PORTS: Randomize the initial local port for TCP/UDP
        • 1.7.3.19.6 CONFIG_NET_SO_SNDTIMEO: Enable send timeout socket option
        • 1.7.3.19.7 CONFIG_NET_SO_RCVTIMEO: Enable receive timeout socket option
        • 1.7.3.19.8 CONFIG_NET_SO_RCVBUF: Enable SO_RCVBUF socket option
        • 1.7.3.19.9 CONFIG_NET_SO_REUSE: Enable SO_REUSE socket option
        • 1.7.3.19.10 CONFIG_NET_SO_REUSE_RXTOALL: Enable RX to All
      • 1.7.3.20 CONFIG_NET_ARP: ARP Support
      • 1.7.3.21 CONFIG_NET_ARP_TABLESIZE: ARP table size
      • 1.7.3.22 CONFIG_NET_ARP_QUEUEING: ARP queueing
      • 1.7.3.23 CONFIG_NET_ETHARP_TRUST_IP_MAC: ARP trust IP mac
      • 1.7.3.24 CONFIG_NET_ETH_PAD_SIZE: Number of ethernet padding bytes
      • 1.7.3.25 CONFIG_NET_ARP_STATIC_ENTRIES: Support ARP static entries
      • 1.7.3.26 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND: ND support
      • 1.7.3.27 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND_QUEUEING: Enable queue outgoing IPv6 packets while MAC address
      • 1.7.3.28 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND_QUEUE: Max number of IPv6 packets to queue during MAC resolution
      • 1.7.3.29 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND_NUM_NEIGHBORS: Number of entries in IPv6 neighbor cache
      • 1.7.3.30 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND_NUM_DESTINATIONS: Number of entries in IPv6 destination cache
      • 1.7.3.31 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND_NUM_PREFIXES: Number of entries in IPv6 on-link prefixes cache
      • 1.7.3.32 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND_NUM_ROUTERS: Number of entries in IPv6 default router cache
      • 1.7.3.33 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND_MAX_MULTICAST_SOLICIT: Max number of multicast solicit messages to send
      • 1.7.3.34 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND_MAX_UNICAST_SOLICIT: Max number of unicast neighbor solicitation messages
      • 1.7.3.35 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND_MAX_SOLICIT_INTERVAL: Max interval time of solicit messages to send
      • 1.7.3.36 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND_REACHABLE_TIME: Default neighbor reachable time (in milliseconds)
      • 1.7.3.37 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND_RETRANS_TIMER: Default retransmission timer for solicitation messages
      • 1.7.3.38 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND_DELAY_FIRST_PROBE_TIME: Delay before first unicast neighbor solicitation
      • 1.7.3.39 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND_ALLOW_RA_UPDATES: Allow Router Advertisement messages to update
      • 1.7.3.40 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND_TCP_REACHABILITY_HINTS: Allow TCP to provide ND with RA hints
      • 1.7.3.41 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND_RDNSS_MAX_DNS_SERVERS: Use IPv6 Router Advertisement Recursive DNS Server Option
      • 1.7.3.42 CONFIG_NET_UDP: UDP Support
      • 1.7.3.43 CONFIG_NET_NETBUF_RECVINFO: Append Destination Infomation
      • 1.7.3.44 CONFIG_NET_UDP_TTL: UDP TTL
      • 1.7.3.45 CONFIG_NET_UDPLITE: Enable UDP-Lite
      • 1.7.3.46 CONFIG_NET_TCP: TCP Support
      • 1.7.3.47 CONFIG_NET_TCP_TTL: TCP TTL
      • 1.7.3.48 CONFIG_NET_TCP_WND: TCP Window Size
      • 1.7.3.49 CONFIG_NET_TCP_MAXRTX: TCP Max Retransmissions
      • 1.7.3.50 CONFIG_NET_TCP_SYNMAXRTX: TCP SYN Max Retransmissions
      • 1.7.3.51 CONFIG_NET_TCP_QUEUE_OOSEQ: TCP out of order support
      • 1.7.3.52 CONFIG_NET_TCP_MSS: TCP MSS
      • 1.7.3.53 CONFIG_NET_TCP_CALCULATE_EFF_SEND_MSS: TCP Enable Effective Send MSS
      • 1.7.3.54 CONFIG_NET_TCP_SND_BUF: TCP Send Buffer
      • 1.7.3.55 CONFIG_NET_TCP_SND_QUEUELEN: TCP Send Buffer Pbuf
      • 1.7.3.56 CONFIG_NET_TCP_OOSEQ_MAX_BYTES: The maximum number of bytes queued on ooseq
      • 1.7.3.57 CONFIG_NET_TCP_OOSEQ_MAX_PBUFS: The maximum number of pbufs queued on ooseq per pcb
      • 1.7.3.58 CONFIG_NET_TCP_LISTEN_BACKLOG: Enable the backlog
      • 1.7.3.59 CONFIG_NET_TCP_DEFAULT_LISTEN_BACKLOG: The maximum allowed backlog
      • 1.7.3.60 CONFIG_NET_TCP_OVERSIZE: TCP Oversize
      • 1.7.3.61 CONFIG_NET_TCP_TIMESTAMPS: Enable Timestamp
      • 1.7.3.62 CONFIG_NET_TCP_WND_UPDATE_THRESHOLD: TCP Window Update Threshold
      • 1.7.3.63 CONFIG_NET_ICMP: ICMP Support
      • 1.7.3.64 CONFIG_NET_ICMP_TTL: ICMP TTL
      • 1.7.3.65 CONFIG_NET_BROADCAST_PING: ICMP respond broadcast pings
      • 1.7.3.66 CONFIG_NET_MULTICAST_PING4: ICMP respond multicast pings
      • 1.7.3.67 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ICMP: ICMP6 support
      • 1.7.3.68 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ICMP_DATASIZE: bytes from original packet to send back in ICMPv6 error messages
      • 1.7.3.69 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ICMP_HL: default hop limit for ICMPv6 messages
      • 1.7.3.70 CONFIG_NET_MULTICAST_PING6: ICMP respond multicast pings
      • 1.7.3.71 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_IGMP: IGMP Support
      • 1.7.3.72 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_MEMP_NUM_IGMP_GROUP: Maximum number of IGMP group
      • 1.7.3.73 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_MLD: MLD Support
      • 1.7.3.74 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_MLD_GROUP: Max number of IPv6 multicast groups
      • 1.7.3.75 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_DHCP: DHCPv6 Support

      • 1.7.3.81 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_VLAN: Support VLAN
      • 1.7.3.82 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_VLAN_CHECK: Check VLAN ID for receiviing packet
      • 1.7.3.83 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_VLAN_CHECK_ID: VLAN ID for receiviing packet
      • 1.7.3.84 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_LOOPBACK_INTERFACE: Support loopback interface
      • 1.7.3.85 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_SLIP_INTERFACE: Support serial line IP interface
      • 1.7.3.86 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_SLIPIF_THREAD_NAME: The name assigned to the slipif_loop thread
      • 1.7.3.87 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_SLIPIF_THREAD_STACKSIZE: The stack size used by the slipif_loop thread
      • 1.7.3.88 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_SLIPIF_THREAD_PRIO: The priority assigned to the slipif_loop thread
      • 1.7.3.89 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_PPP_SUPPORT: Enable PPP
      • 1.7.3.90 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_PPP_SESSIONS: Max PPP sessions
      • 1.7.3.91 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_PAP_SUPPORT: Support PAP
      • 1.7.3.92 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_CHAP_SUPPORT: Support CHAP
      • 1.7.3.93 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_VJ_SUPPORT: Support VJ header compression
      • 1.7.3.94 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_MD5_SUPPORT: Support MD5
      • 1.7.3.95 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_PPP_MTU: PPP MTU size in bytes
      • 1.7.3.96 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_PPP_THREAD_NAME: The name assigned to the pppInputThread
      • 1.7.3.97 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_PPP_THREAD_STACKSIZE: The stack size used by the pppInputThread
      • 1.7.3.98 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_PPP_THREAD_PRIO: The priority assigned to the pppInputThread
      • 1.7.3.99 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_SNMP: Enable SNMP
      • 1.7.3.100 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_SNMP_CONCURRENT_REQUESTS: Number of concurrent requests
      • 1.7.3.101 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_SNMP_TRAP_DESTINATIONS: Number of trap destinations
      • 1.7.3.102 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_SNMP_PRIVATE_MIB: Supports Private MIB
      • 1.7.3.103 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_SNMP_MAX_TREE_DEPTH: The maximum depth of the SNMP tree
      • 1.7.3.104 Menu: Interface Name
        • Expand
        • 1.7.3.104.1 CONFIG_NET_ETH_IFNAME: Ethernet
        • 1.7.3.104.2 CONFIG_NET_LOOP_IFNAME: Loopback
        • 1.7.3.104.3 CONFIG_NET_STA_IFNAME: Wi-Fi Station
        • 1.7.3.104.4 CONFIG_NET_SOFTAP_IFNAME: Wi-Fi SoftAP
      • 1.7.3.105 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_NETDB: Enable LWIP NETDB Library
      • 1.7.3.106 CONFIG_NET_DNS_TABLE_SIZE: DNS maximum number of entries to maintain locally
      • 1.7.3.107 CONFIG_NET_DNS_MAX_NAME_LENGTH: DNS maximum host name length supported in the name table
      • 1.7.3.108 CONFIG_NET_DNS_MAX_SERVERS: The maximum of DNS servers
      • 1.7.3.109 CONFIG_NET_DNS_DOES_NAME_CHECK: DNS do a name checking between the query and the response
      • 1.7.3.110 CONFIG_NET_DNS_SECURE: LWIP_DNS_SECURE: controls the security level of the DNS
      • 1.7.3.111 CONFIG_NET_DNS_LOCAL_HOSTLIST: DNS_LOCAL_HOSTLIST: Implements a local host-to-address list. If enabled, you have to define an initialize
      • 1.7.3.112 CONFIG_NET_DNS_LOCAL_HOSTLIST_IS_DYNAMIC: If this is turned on, the local host-list can be dynamically changed at runtime
    • 1.7.4 Menu: Driver buffer configuration
      • Expand
      • 1.7.4.1 CONFIG_NET_MULTIBUFFER: Use multiple device-side I/O buffers
      • 1.7.4.2 CONFIG_NET_ETH_MTU: Ethernet packet buffer size (MTU)
      • 1.7.4.3 CONFIG_NET_GUARDSIZE: Driver I/O guard size
    • 1.7.5 Menu: Data link support

        • 1.7.7.1.5 CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD_HOST: Host-based DHCPD build
        • 1.7.7.1.6 CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD_IGNOREBROADCAST: Ignore client broadcast
        • 1.7.7.1.7 CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD_LEASETIME: Lease time (seconds)
        • 1.7.7.1.8 CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD_MINLEASETIME: Minimum lease time (seconds)
        • 1.7.7.1.9 CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD_MAXLEASETIME: Maximum lease time (seconds)
        • 1.7.7.1.10 CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD_MAXLEASES: Maximum number of leases
        • 1.7.7.1.11 CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD_STARTIP: First IP address
        • 1.7.7.1.12 CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD_ROUTERIP: Router IP (0 to disable)
        • 1.7.7.1.13 CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD_NETMASK: Netmask (0 to disable)
        • 1.7.7.1.14 CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD_DNSIP: DNS (0 to disable)
        • 1.7.7.1.15 CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD_OFFERTIME: Offer time (seconds)
        • 1.7.7.1.16 CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD_DECLINETIME: Decline time (seconds)
        • 1.7.7.1.17 CONFIG_LWIP_DHCPS_LEASE_DEF: LWIP DHCPS lease time (min)
        • 1.7.7.1.18 CONFIG_LWIP_DHCPS_SERVER_IP: Set DHCP server IP
        • 1.7.7.1.19 CONFIG_LWIP_DHCPS_SERVER_NETMASK: Set netmask
        • 1.7.7.1.20 CONFIG_LWIP_DHCPS_MAX_STATION_NUM: Maximum number of allowed stations
      • 1.7.7.2 CONFIG_NETUTILS_XMLRPC: XML RPC library
      • 1.7.7.3 CONFIG_XMLRPC_STRINGSIZE: Maximum string length
      • 1.7.7.4 CONFIG_NETUTILS_NTPCLIENT: NTP client
      • 1.7.7.5 CONFIG_NETUTILS_NTPCLIENT_STACKSIZE: NTP client daemon stack stack size
      • 1.7.7.6 CONFIG_NETUTILS_NTPCLIENT_SERVERPRIO: NTP client daemon priority
      • 1.7.7.7 CONFIG_NETUTILS_NTPCLIENT_SIGWAKEUP: NTP client wakeup signal number
      • 1.7.7.8 CONFIG_NETUTILS_NTPCLIENT_DEFAULT_SERVER: NTP client default server
      • 1.7.7.9 CONFIG_NETUTILS_NTPCLIENT_DEFAULT_SERVER_PORT: NTP client default server port
      • 1.7.7.10 CONFIG_NETUTILS_NTPCLIENT_DEFAULT_INTERVAL_SECONDS: NTP client default interval seconds
      • 1.7.7.11 CONFIG_NETUTILS_NTPCLIENT_DEBUG: NTP client debug message option
      • 1.7.7.12 CONFIG_NETUTILS_WEBSERVER: Webserver
      • 1.7.7.13 CONFIG_NETUTILS_WEBSERVER_MAX_CLIENT_HANDLER: HTTP maximum client handler
      • 1.7.7.14 CONFIG_NETUTILS_WEBSERVER_LOGD: HTTP debugging log
      • 1.7.7.15 CONFIG_NETUTILS_WEBSERVER_LOGE: HTTP error log
      • 1.7.7.16 CONFIG_NETUTILS_FTPC: FTP client

      • 1.7.7.20 CONFIG_NETUTILS_MDNS_XMDNS: xmDNS for supporting site domain

      • 1.7.7.22 CONFIG_NETUTILS_MDNS_XMDNS_PORT_NUM: xmDNS Port Number

      • 1.7.7.29 CONFIG_NETUTILS_FTPD: FTP server

      • 1.7.7.36 CONFIG_GRPC: gRPC

      • 1.7.7.39 CONFIG_TSI_MBEDTLS_LOG: Set mbedTLS Log Level(0:NONE - 5:ALL)
      • 1.7.7.40 CONFIG_NETUTILS_MQTT: MQTT

      • 1.7.7.44 CONFIG_SUPPORT_FULL_SECURITY: Enable full security features

      • 1.7.8.10 CONFIG_SLSI_WIFI_CONFIG_FILE_NAME: name of the configuration file to use

        • 1.7.8.11.6 CONFIG_CTRL_IFACE_FIFO: wpa_supplicant ctrl_iface type - fifo

        • 1.7.8.11.8 CONFIG_WPA_CTRL_FIFO_DEV_CFM: Path to WPA Control FIFO device for confirm
        • 1.7.8.11.9 CONFIG_WPA_CTRL_FIFO_DEV_GLOBAL_REQ: Path to WPA Control global FIFO device for requests

        • 1.7.8.11.11 CONFIG_WPA_MONITOR_FIFO_DEV: Path to WPA Control monitor FIFO device
        • 1.7.8.11.12 CONFIG_WPA_CTRL_FIFO_MK_MODE: File access mode for WPA control FIFOs
        • 1.7.8.11.13 CONFIG_ELOOP_POLL: wpa_supplicant eloop poll mechanism - poll
        • 1.7.8.11.14 CONFIG_WPA_SUPPLICANT_CMD: wpa_supplicant command line interface
        • 1.7.8.11.15 CONFIG_DRIVER_T20: Driver T20 for SLSI WiFi
      • 1.7.8.12 CONFIG_WIFI_PROFILE_SECURESTORAGE: Store the Wi-Fi Profile in a Secure Storage
      • 1.7.8.13 CONFIG_WIFIMGR_SOFTAP_IFNAME: interface name of softap mode
      • 1.7.8.14 CONFIG_WIFIMGR_STA_IFNAME: interface name of station mode
      • 1.7.8.15 CONFIG_WIFIMGR_DISABLE_AUTO_GET_IP: disable auto get ip (ipv4 dhcp)
      • 1.7.8.16 CONFIG_DISABLE_EXTERNAL_AUTOCONNECT: disable external autoconnect
      • 1.7.8.17 CONFIG_WIFIMGR_INTERNAL_AUTOCONNECT: enable internal auto(re)connect

    • Expand

      • Expand
      • 1.8.3.1 CONFIG_AUDIO_LARGE_BUFFERS: Support Audio Buffers with greater than 65K samples
      • 1.8.3.2 CONFIG_AUDIO_NUM_BUFFERS: Number of buffers for audio processing
      • 1.8.3.3 CONFIG_AUDIO_BUFSIZE: Size of each audio buffer for audio processing

    • 1.8.4 Menu: Exclude Specific Audio Features
      • Expand

      • 1.8.4.3 CONFIG_AUDIO_EXCLUDE_BALANCE: Exclude balance controls
      • 1.8.4.4 CONFIG_AUDIO_EXCLUDE_EQUALIZER: Exclude equalizer controls
      • 1.8.4.5 CONFIG_AUDIO_EQUALIZER_NBANDS: Number of equalizer bands
      • 1.8.4.6 CONFIG_AUDIO_EXCLUDE_TONE: Exclude tone (bass and treble) controls
      • 1.8.4.7 CONFIG_AUDIO_EXCLUDE_PAUSE_RESUME: Exclude pause and resume controls
      • 1.8.4.8 CONFIG_AUDIO_EXCLUDE_STOP: Exclude stop playback controls
      • 1.8.4.9 CONFIG_AUDIO_EXCLUDE_FFORWARD: Exclude fast forward controls
      • 1.8.4.10 CONFIG_AUDIO_EXCLUDE_REWIND: Exclude rewind controls
    • 1.8.5 CONFIG_AUDIO_CUSTOM_DEV_PATH: Use custom device path
    • 1.8.6 CONFIG_AUDIO_DEV_ROOT: Place audio devices in /dev
    • 1.8.7 CONFIG_AUDIO_DEV_PATH: Base path for Audio devices
    • 1.8.8 CONFIG_AUDIO_MIXER: Planned - Enable support for the software based Audio Mixer

      • 1.10.9.5 CONFIG_SMARTFS_BAD_SECTOR: Bad Sector Management

    • 1.10.37 CONFIG_W25_SLOWREAD: W25 Slow Read

    • 1.12.13 CONFIG_DEBUG_PGALLOC: Page Allocator Debug
    • 1.12.14 CONFIG_MM_SHM: Shared memory support
  • 1.13 Menu: Power Management
    • Expand
    • 1.13.1 CONFIG_PM: Power management (PM) driver interfaces
    • 1.13.2 CONFIG_DEBUG_PM: Power Management Debug Features
    • 1.13.3 CONFIG_PM_TEST: Power Management Functionality Test
    • 1.13.4 CONFIG_PM_DEVNAME_LEN: Registered device name length
    • 1.13.5 CONFIG_PM_METRICS: Power management (PM) metrics
    • 1.13.6 CONFIG_PM_METRICS_DURATION: History Duration (secs)
    • 1.13.7 CONFIG_PM_SLICEMS: PM time slice (msec)
    • 1.13.8 CONFIG_PM_NDOMAINS: Number of PM activity domains
    • 1.13.9 CONFIG_PM_MEMORY: PM memory (msec)
    • 1.13.10 CONFIG_PM_COEFN: PM coefficient
    • 1.13.11 CONFIG_PM_COEF1: PM coefficient 1
    • 1.13.12 CONFIG_PM_COEF2: PM coefficient 2
    • 1.13.13 CONFIG_PM_COEF3: PM coefficient 3
    • 1.13.14 CONFIG_PM_COEF4: PM coefficient 4
    • 1.13.15 CONFIG_PM_COEF5: PM coefficient 5
    • 1.13.16 CONFIG_PM_IDLEENTER_THRESH: PM IDLE enter threshold
    • 1.13.17 CONFIG_PM_IDLEEXIT_THRESH: PM IDLE exit threshold
    • 1.13.18 CONFIG_PM_IDLEENTER_COUNT: PM IDLE enter count
    • 1.13.19 CONFIG_PM_STANDBYENTER_THRESH: PM STANDBY enter threshold
    • 1.13.20 CONFIG_PM_STANDBYEXIT_THRESH: PM STANDBY exit threshold
    • 1.13.21 CONFIG_PM_STANDBYENTER_COUNT: PM STANDBY enter count
    • 1.13.22 CONFIG_PM_SLEEPENTER_THRESH: PM SLEEP enter threshold
    • 1.13.23 CONFIG_PM_SLEEPEXIT_THRESH: PM SLEEP exit threshold
    • 1.13.24 CONFIG_PM_SLEEPENTER_COUNT: PM SLEEP enter count

  • 1.16 Menu: Built-in Libraries
    • Expand
    • 1.16.1 CONFIG_STDIO_BUFFER_SIZE: C STDIO buffer size
    • 1.16.2 CONFIG_STDIO_LINEBUFFER: STDIO line buffering
    • 1.16.3 CONFIG_NUNGET_CHARS: Number unget() characters
    • 1.16.4 CONFIG_LIB_HOMEDIR: Home directory
    • 1.16.5 CONFIG_LIBM: Standard Math library
    • 1.16.6 CONFIG_NOPRINTF_FIELDWIDTH: Disable sprintf support fieldwidth
    • 1.16.7 CONFIG_LIBC_FLOATINGPOINT: Enable floating point in printf
    • 1.16.8 CONFIG_LIBC_FLOATPRECISION: Default floating point Precision value
    • 1.16.9 CONFIG_LIBC_SCANSET: Scanset support
    • 1.16.10 CONFIG_NOPRINTF_LONGLONG_TO_ASCII: Disable long long type in printf
    • 1.16.11 CONFIG_LIBC_IOCTL_VARIADIC: Enable variadic ioctl()
    • 1.16.12 CONFIG_LIBC_WCHAR: Enable wide-characters (Unicode) support
    • 1.16.13 CONFIG_LIBC_LOCALE: Enable I18N (LOCALE) support
    • 1.16.14 CONFIG_LIB_RAND_ORDER: Order of the random number generate
    • 1.16.15 Choice: Newline Options
    • 1.16.16 CONFIG_LIBC_STRERROR: Enable strerror
    • 1.16.17 CONFIG_LIBC_STRERROR_SHORT: Use short error descriptions in strerror()
    • 1.16.18 CONFIG_LIBC_PERROR_STDOUT: perror() to stdout
    • 1.16.19 CONFIG_LIBC_TMPDIR: Temporary file directory
    • 1.16.20 CONFIG_LIBC_MAX_TMPFILE: Maximum size of a temporary file path
    • 1.16.21 CONFIG_ARCH_LOWPUTC: Low-level console output
    • 1.16.22 CONFIG_LIBC_LOCALTIME: localtime API call support
    • 1.16.23 CONFIG_TIME_EXTENDED: enable time extended
    • 1.16.24 CONFIG_LIBC_TZ_MAX_TIMES: Maximum number of times in timezone
    • 1.16.25 CONFIG_LIBC_TZ_MAX_TYPES: Maximum number of TZ types
    • 1.16.26 CONFIG_LIBC_TZDIR: zoneinfo directory path
    • 1.16.27 CONFIG_LIB_SENDFILE_BUFSIZE: sendfile() buffer size
    • 1.16.28 CONFIG_ARCH_ROMGETC: Support for ROM string access
    • 1.16.29 CONFIG_ARCH_OPTIMIZED_FUNCTIONS: Enable arch optimized functions
    • 1.16.30 CONFIG_ARCH_MEMCPY: memcpy()
    • 1.16.31 CONFIG_MEMCPY_VIK: Vik memcpy()
    • 1.16.32 CONFIG_MEMCPY_PRE_INC_PTRS: Pre-increment pointers
    • 1.16.33 CONFIG_MEMCPY_INDEXED_COPY: Array indexing
    • 1.16.34 CONFIG_MEMCPY_64BIT: 64-bit memcpy()
    • 1.16.35 CONFIG_ARCH_MEMCMP: memcmp()
    • 1.16.36 CONFIG_ARCH_MEMMOVE: memmove()
    • 1.16.37 CONFIG_ARCH_MEMSET: memset()
    • 1.16.38 CONFIG_MEMSET_OPTSPEED: Optimize memset() for speed
    • 1.16.39 CONFIG_MEMSET_64BIT: 64-bit memset()
    • 1.16.40 CONFIG_ARCH_STPNCPY: stpncpy()
    • 1.16.41 CONFIG_ARCH_STRCHR: strchr()
    • 1.16.42 CONFIG_ARCH_STRCMP: strcmp()
    • 1.16.43 CONFIG_ARCH_STRCPY: strcpy()
    • 1.16.44 CONFIG_ARCH_STRNCPY: strncpy()
    • 1.16.45 CONFIG_ARCH_STRLEN: strlen
    • 1.16.46 CONFIG_ARCH_STRNLEN: strlen()
    • 1.16.47 CONFIG_ARCH_BZERO: bzero()
    • 1.16.48 CONFIG_LIB_USRWORK: User mode worker thread
    • 1.16.49 CONFIG_LIB_USRWORKPRIORITY: User mode priority worker thread priority
    • 1.16.50 CONFIG_LIB_USRWORKPERIOD: User mode worker thread period
    • 1.16.51 CONFIG_LIB_USRWORKSTACKSIZE: User mode worker thread stack size
    • 1.16.52 CONFIG_C99_BOOL8: sizeof(_Bool) is 8-bits
    • 1.16.53 CONFIG_HAVE_CXX: Have C++ compiler
    • 1.16.54 CONFIG_CXX_NEWLONG: size_t is type long
    • 1.16.55 CONFIG_LIBCXX: Build LLVM libcxx
    • 1.16.56 CONFIG_LIBCXX_EXCEPTION: Enable Exception Suppport
    • 1.16.57 CONFIG_LIBCXX_IOSTREAM_BUFSIZE: IO Stream Buffer Size
    • 1.16.58 CONFIG_LIBCXX_HAVE_LIBSUPCXX: Have libsupc++ (required)

    • 1.17.21 CONFIG_GMOCK: gmock

    • 1.17.23 CONFIG_IOTIVITY_RELEASE_VERSION: iotivity stack version
    • 1.17.24 CONFIG_IOTIVITY_ROUTING: Enable routing, allowed values : 'EP' / 'GW'
    • 1.17.25 CONFIG_IOTIVITY_PTHREAD_STACKSIZE: Default pthread stack size for iotivity threads
    • 1.17.26 CONFIG_IOTIVITY_QUEING_PTHREAD_STACKSIZE: Default pthread stack size for the queing thread
    • 1.17.27 CONFIG_IOTIVITY_RETRANSMIT_PTHREAD_STACKSIZE: Default pthread stack size for the retransmission pthread
    • 1.17.28 CONFIG_IOTIVITY_TCPRECEIVE_PTHREAD_STACKSIZE: Default pthread stack size for the TCP-receive thread
    • 1.17.29 CONFIG_IOTIVITY_RECEIVEHANDLER_PTHREAD_STACKSIZE: Default pthread stack size for the receive-handler thread
    • 1.17.30 CONFIG_ENABLE_IOTIVITY_SECURED: enable iotivity security
    • 1.17.31 CONFIG_ENABLE_IOTIVITY_CLOUD: enable iotivity cloud
    • 1.17.32 CONFIG_IOTIVITY_DEBUG: enable iotivity stack logs
    • 1.17.33 CONFIG_IOTIVITY_NS_PROVIDER: enable iotivity notification service(provider only)
    • 1.17.34 CONFIG_NETUTILS_JSON: cJSON library
    • 1.17.35 CONFIG_LIBTUV: libtuv
    • 1.17.36 CONFIG_ENABLE_NGHTTP2: Enable NGHTTP2

    • 1.17.41 CONFIG_LWM2M_LITTLE_ENDIAN: LITTLE_ENDIAN
    • 1.17.42 CONFIG_WL_BCM4390X: BCM4390X Wireless Module support
    • 1.17.43 CONFIG_WIRELESS_FIRMWARE_FILESYSTEM: BCM43909B0 wireless firmware can be loaded from file system
    • 1.17.44 CONFIG_WICED: WICED code Support
    • 1.17.45 CONFIG_NET_NOINTS: NOINTS Support
    • 1.17.46 CONFIG_CODEC_LIBOPUS: libopus 1.2.1
    • 1.17.47 Choice: Opus Application Mode
    • 1.17.48 CONFIG_OPUS_ENCODE_COMPLEXITY: Complexity for encoding, value in [0, 10]
    • 1.17.49 CONFIG_OPUS_ENCODE_FRAMESIZE: Frame size for encoding, value in msec
    • 1.17.50 CONFIG_OPUS_ENCODE_BITRATE: Bitrate for encoding, bits per second
    • 1.17.51 CONFIG_STRESS_TOOL: Enable Stress Tool
    • 1.17.52 CONFIG_VOICE_SOFTWARE_EPD: Software EndPoint Detector(Fixed Float) Support
