  • Appendix A: Hidden Configuration Variables

1 Menu: Main

Overview. The TinyAra RTOS is highly configurable. The TinyAra configuration files are maintained using the kconfig-frontends tool. That configuration tool uses Kconfig files that can be found through the TinyAra source tree. Each Kconfig files contains declarations of configuration variables. Each configuration variable provides one configuration option for the TinyAra RTOS. This configurable options are descrived in this document.

Main Menu. The normal way to start the TinyAra configuration is to enter this command line from the TinyAra os directory: make menuconfig. Note that TinyAra must first be configured before this command so that the configuration file (.config) is present in the os directory. The main menu is the name give to the opening menu display after this command is executed.

Mainenance Note. This documenation was auto-generated using the kconfig2html tool. That tool analyzes the TinyAra Kconfig files and generates this HTML document. This HTML document file should not be editted manually. In order to make changes to this document, you should instead modify the Kconfig file(s) that were used to generated this document and then execute the kconfig2html again to regenerate the HTML document file.

1.1 Menu: Build Setup

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.1.1 CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL: Prompt for development and/or incomplete code/drivers

  • Type: Boolean
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.1.2 CONFIG_DEFAULT_SMALL: Default to smallest size

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    When options are present, the default value for certain options will be the one the results in the smallest size (at a loss of featurs). The default is a fuller feature set at a larger size.

    NOTE: This option does not prevent you from overriding the default to select another alternative. Nor does it affect the settings that have already been selected in your configuration file. This applies only to new settings that require a default value.

1.1.3 Choice: Build Host Platform

  • Default: HOST_LINUX
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_HOST_LINUX: Linux

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    CONFIG_HOST_OSX: OSX

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS: Windows

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    CONFIG_HOST_OTHER: Other

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.1.4 Choice: Windows Build Environment

  • Default: WINDOWS_CYGWIN
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_WINDOWS_NATIVE: Windows Native

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

      Build natively in a CMD.exe environment with Windows style paths (like C:\cgywin\home)

    CONFIG_WINDOWS_CYGWIN: Cygwin

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

      Build natively in a Cygwin environment with POSIX style paths (like /cygdrive/c/cgywin/home)

    CONFIG_WINDOWS_MSYS: MSYS

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

      Build natively in a Cygwin environment with POSIX style paths (like /cygdrive/c/cgywin/home)

    CONFIG_WINDOWS_OTHER: Windows POSIX-like environment

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

      Build natively in another POSIX-like environment. Additional support may be necessary

1.1.5 CONFIG_WINDOWS_MKLINK: Use mklink

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_WINDOWS_NATIVE
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Use the mklink command to set up symbolic links when TinyAra is configured. Otherwise, configuration directories will be copied to establish the configuration.

    If directories are copied, then some confusion can result ("Which version of the file did I modify?"). In that case, it is recommended that you re-build using 'make clean_context all'. That will cause the configured directories to be recopied on each build.

    NOTE: This option also (1) that you have administrator privileges, (2) that you are using Windows 2000 or better, and (3) that you are using the NTFS file system. Select 'n' is that is not the case.

1.1.6 Menu: Build Configuration

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.1.6.1 CONFIG_APPS_DIR: Application directory

  • Type: String
  • Default Values:
    • Default: "../apps"

      Dependency: !CONFIG_WINDOWS_NATIVE

    • Default: "..\apps"

      Dependency: CONFIG_WINDOWS_NATIVE

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Identifies the directory that builds the application to link with TinyAra. Default: ../apps This symbol must be assigned to the path to the application build directory *relative* to the TinyAra top build directory. If you had an application directory and the TinyAra directory each in separate directory trees like this:

      build
|-tinyara
|  |
|  `- Makefile
`-application
|
`- Makefile

    Then you would set APPS_DIR=../application.

    The application direction must contain Makefile and this make file must support the following targets:

    1)libapps$(LIBEXT) (usually libapps.a). libapps.a is a static library ( an archive) that contains all of application object files.

    2)clean. Do whatever is appropriate to clean the application directories for a fresh build.

    3)distclean. Clean everything -- auto-generated files, symbolic links etc. -- so that the directory contents are the same as the contents in your configuration management system. This is only done when you change the TinyAra configuration.

    4)depend. Make or update the application build dependencies.

    When this application is invoked it will receive the setting TOPDIR like:

    $(MAKE) -C $(CONFIG_APPS_DIR) TOPDIR="$(TOPDIR)" <target>

    TOPDIR is the full path to the TinyAra directory. It can be used, for example, to include makefile fragments (e.g., .config or Make.defs) or to set up include file paths.

1.1.6.2 CONFIG_FRAMEWORK_DIR: FRAMEWORK directory

  • Type: String
  • Default Values:
    • Default: "../framework"

      Dependency: !CONFIG_WINDOWS_NATIVE

    • Default: "..\framework"

      Dependency: CONFIG_WINDOWS_NATIVE

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.1.6.3 CONFIG_TOOLS_DIR: tools directory

  • Type: String
  • Default Values:
    • Default: "../tools"

      Dependency: !CONFIG_WINDOWS_NATIVE

    • Default: "..\tools"

      Dependency: CONFIG_WINDOWS_NATIVE

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.1.6.4 Choice: Memory organization

  • Default: BUILD_FLAT
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_BUILD_FLAT: Flat address space

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

      Build TinyAra as one large, executable "blob". All of the code within the blob can interrupt with all of the other code within the blob. There are no special privileges, protections, or restraints.

    CONFIG_BUILD_PROTECTED: TinyAra protected build

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_LIB_SYSCALL, CONFIG_BUILD_2PASS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_USE_MPU
    • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

      Builds TinyAra and selected applications as two "blobs": A protected, privileged kernel blob and a separate unprivileged, user blob. This require sue of the two pass build with each blob being build on each pass.

      NOTE: This build configuration requires that the platform support a memory protection unit (MPU). Support, however, may not be implemented on all platforms.

    CONFIG_BUILD_KERNEL: TinyAra kernel build

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_LIB_SYSCALL
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_USE_MMU && CONFIG_ARCH_ADDRENV && CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL
    • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

      Builds TinyAra as a separately compiled kernel. No applications are built. All user applications must reside in a file system where they can be loaded into memory for execution.

      NOTE: This build configuration requires that the platform support a memory management unit (MMU) and address environments. Support, however, may not be implemented on all platforms.

1.1.6.5 CONFIG_BUILD_2PASS: Two pass build

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: !CONFIG_BUILD_KERNEL
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Enables the two pass build options.

    Two-pass build options. If the 2 pass build option is selected, then these options configure the make system build a extra link object. This link object is assumed to be an incremental (relative) link object, but could be a static library (archive) (some modification to this Makefile would be required if PASS1_TARGET generates an archive). Pass 1 1ncremental (relative) link objects should be put into the processor-specific source directory (where other link objects will be created). If the pass1 object is an archive, it could go anywhere.

1.1.6.6 CONFIG_PASS1_TARGET: Pass one target

  • Type: String
  • Default: "all"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_BUILD_2PASS
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    The name of the first pass build target. This can be specific build target, a special build target (all, default, etc.) or may just be left undefined.

1.1.6.7 CONFIG_PASS1_OBJECT: Pass one object

  • Type: String
  • Default: ""
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_BUILD_2PASS
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    May be used to include an extra, pass1 object into the final link. This would probably be the object generated from the PASS1_TARGET. It may be available at link time in the arch/<architecture>/src directory.

1.1.6.8 CONFIG_TINYARA_USERSPACE: Beginning of user-space blob

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_BUILD_2PASS, CONFIG_BUILD_PROTECTED
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    In the kernel build, the TinyAra kernel and the user-space blob are built separately linked objects. TINYARA_USERSPACE provides the address where the user-space blob is loaded into memory. TinyAra will expect to find and instance of struct userspace_s at this location.

1.1.7 Menu: Binary Output Formats

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.1.7.1 CONFIG_INTELHEX_BINARY: Intel HEX binary format

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Create the tinyara.hex in the Intel HEX binary format that is used with many different loaders. This option will use the GNU objcopy program and should not be selected if you are not using the GNU toolchain.

1.1.7.2 CONFIG_MOTOROLA_SREC: Motorola S-Record binary format

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Create the tinyara.srec in the Motorola S-Record binary format that is used with many different loaders. This option will use the GNU objcopy program and should not be selected if you are not using the GNU toolchain.

1.1.7.3 CONFIG_RAW_BINARY: Raw binary format

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Create the tinyara.bin in the raw binary format that is used with many different loaders using the GNU objcopy program. This option should not be selected if you are not using the GNU toolchain.

1.1.7.4 CONFIG_UBOOT_UIMAGE: U-Boot uImage

  • Type: Boolean
  • Selects: CONFIG_RAW_BINARY
  • Dependencies: !CONFIG_WINDOWS_NATIVE
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Create the uImage binary used with U-Boot.

1.1.7.5 CONFIG_UIMAGE_LOAD_ADDRESS: uImage load address

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_UBOOT_UIMAGE
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.1.7.6 CONFIG_UIMAGE_ENTRY_POINT: uImage entry point

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_UBOOT_UIMAGE
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.1.7.7 CONFIG_DOWNLOAD_IMAGE: Convert RAW binary to download image

  • Type: Boolean
  • Selects: CONFIG_RAW_BINARY
  • Dependencies: !CONFIG_WINDOWS_NATIVE
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Create download image based on RAW binary

1.1.7.8 CONFIG_SMARTFS_IMAGE: Make smartfs binary image

  • Type: Boolean
  • Selects: CONFIG_RAW_BINARY
  • Dependencies: !CONFIG_WINDOWS_NATIVE
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    Generate smartfs image by using nxfuse tools Note that libfuse-dev should be installed on your build system

1.1.8 Menu: Customize Header Files

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.1.8.1 CONFIG_ARCH_STDINT_H: stdint.h

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    The stdint.h header file can be found at tinyara/include/stdint.h. However, that header includes logic to redirect the inclusion of an architecture specific header file like:

      #ifdef CONFIG_ARCH_STDINT_H
#  include <arch/stdint.h>
#else
...
#endif

    Recall that that include path, include/arch, is a symbolic link and will refer to a version of stdint.h at tinyara/arch/<architecture>/include/stdint.h.

1.1.8.2 CONFIG_ARCH_STDBOOL_H: stdbool.h

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    The stdbool.h header file can be found at tinyara/include/stdbool.h. However, that header includes logic to redirect the inclusion of an architecture specific header file like:

      #ifdef CONFIG_ARCH_STDBOOL_H
#  include <arch/stdbool.h>
#else
...
#endif

    Recall that that include path, include/arch, is a symbolic link and will refer to a version of stdbool.h at tinyara/arch/<architecture>/include/stdbool.h.

1.1.8.3 CONFIG_ARCH_MATH_H: math.h

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    There is also a re-directing version of math.h in the source tree. However, it resides out-of-the-way at include/tinyara/math.h because it conflicts too often with the system math.h. If ARCH_MATH_H=y is defined, however, the top-level makefile will copy the redirecting math.h header file from include/tinyara/math.h to include/math.h. math.h will then include the architecture-specific version of math.h that you must provide at tinyara/arch/>architecture</include/math.h.

      #ifdef CONFIG_ARCH_MATH_H
#  include <arch/math.h>
#endif

    So for the architectures that define ARCH_MATH_H=y, include/math.h will be the redirecting math.h header file; for the architectures that don't select ARCH_MATH_H, the redirecting math.h header file will stay out-of-the-way in include/tinyara/.

1.1.8.4 CONFIG_ARCH_FLOAT_H: float.h

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    The float.h header file defines the properties of your floating point implementation. It would always be best to use your toolchain's float.h header file but if none is available, a default float.h header file will provided if this option is selected. However there is no assurance that the settings in this float.h are actually correct for your platform!

1.1.8.5 CONFIG_ARCH_STDARG_H: stdarg.h

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    There is also a redirecting version of stdarg.h in the source tree as well. It also resides out-of-the-way at include/tinyara/stdarg.h. This is because you should normally use your toolchain's stdarg.h file. But sometimes, your toolchain's stdarg.h file may have other header file dependencies and so may not be usable in the TinyAra build environment. In those cases, you may have to create a architecture- specific stdarg.h header file at tinyara/arch/<architecture>/include/stdarg.h

    If ARCH_STDARG_H=y is defined, the top-level makefile will copy the re-directing stdarg.h header file from include/tinyara/stdarg.h to include/stdarg.h. So for the architectures that cannot use their toolchain's stdarg.h file, they can use this alternative by defining ARCH_STDARG_H=y and providing. If ARCH_STDARG_H, is not defined, then the stdarg.h header file will stay out-of-the-way in include/tinyara/.

1.1.9 Choice: Optimization Level

  • Default Values:
    • Default: DEBUG_NOOPT

      Dependency: CONFIG_DEBUG_SYMBOLS

    • Default: DEBUG_FULLOPT

      Dependency: !CONFIG_DEBUG_SYMBOLS

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_DEBUG_NOOPT: Suppress Optimization

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

      Build without optimization. This is often helpful when debugging code.

    CONFIG_DEBUG_CUSTOMOPT: Custom Optimization

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_CUSTOMOPT
    • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

      Select a custom debug level. This is often helpful if you suspect an optimization level error and want to lower the level of optimization.

    CONFIG_DEBUG_FULLOPT: Normal, Full optimization

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

      Build full optimization. This is the normal case for production firmware.

1.1.10 CONFIG_DEBUG_OPTLEVEL: Custom Optimization Level

  • Type: String
  • Default: "-O2"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG_CUSTOMOPT
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    This string represents the custom optimization level that will be used if DEBUG_CUSTOMOPT.

1.2 Menu: Chip Selection

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.2.1 Choice: CPU Architecture

  • Default: ARCH_ARM
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_ARCH_ARM: ARM

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_INTERRUPTSTACK, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_VFORK, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_STACKCHECK, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_CUSTOMOPT
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

      The ARM architectures

    CONFIG_ARCH_XTENSA: Xtensa

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_STACKCHECK, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_CUSTOMOPT
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

      Cadence Tensilica Xtensa architectures.

1.2.2 Choice: ARM chip selection

  • Default: ARCH_CHIP_S5J
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM: TI/Luminary Stellaris

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_CMNVECTOR, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_MPU, CONFIG_ARM_HAVE_MPU_UNIFIED
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

      TI/Luminary Stellaris LMS3 and LM4F architectures (ARM Cortex-M3/4)

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_S5J: Samsung S5J

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_MPU, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_TICKLESS, CONFIG_ARM_HAVE_MPU_UNIFIED, CONFIG_ARMV7R_MEMINIT
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

      Samsung IoT SoC architectures (ARM Cortex R)

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_BCM4390X: Cypress BCM4390X

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_MPU, CONFIG_ARMV7M_MPU, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LOWVECTORS, CONFIG_ARCH_LOWVECTORS, CONFIG_ARM_UNWIND
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

      Cypress BCM4390x SoC architectures (ARM Cortex-R)

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32: STMicro STM32

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_CMNVECTOR, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_MPU, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_I2CRESET, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_HEAPCHECK
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

      STMicro STM32 architectures (ARM Cortex-M3/4).

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT: NXP/Freescale iMX.RT

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM7, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_MPU, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_RAMFUNCS, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_TICKLESS, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_I2CRESET, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_SPI_CS_CONTROL, CONFIG_ARM_HAVE_MPU_UNIFIED, CONFIG_ARMV7M_HAVE_STACKCHECK
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

      NXP i.MX RT (ARM Cortex-M7) architectures

1.2.3 CONFIG_ARMV7M_CMNVECTOR: Use common ARMv7-M vectors

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_CMNVECTOR
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    Some architectures use their own, built-in vector logic. Some use only the common vector logic. Some can use either their own built-in vector logic or the common vector logic. This applies only to ARMv7-M architectures.

1.2.4 CONFIG_ARCH_FPU: FPU support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_FPU
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    Build in support for the ARM Cortex-M4 Floating Point Unit (FPU). Check your chip specifications first; not all Cortex-M4 chips support the FPU.

1.2.5 CONFIG_ARCH_DPFPU: Double precision FPU support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_FPU && CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_DPFPU
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    Enable toolchain support for double precision (64-bit) floating point if both the toolchain and the hardware support it.

1.2.6 CONFIG_ARMV7M_MPU: MPU support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_USE_MPU
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_MPU
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    Build in support for the ARM Cortex-M3/4 Memory Protection Unit (MPU). Check your chip specifications first; not all Cortex-M3/4 chips support the MPU.

1.2.7 CONFIG_ARMV7M_MPU_NREGIONS: Number of MPU regions

  • Type: Integer
  • Default Values:
    • Default: 16

      Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM7

    • Default: 8

      Dependency: !CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM7

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARMV7M_MPU
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    This is the number of protection regions supported by the MPU.

1.2.8 CONFIG_ARCH_LOWVECTORS: Vectors in low memory

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LOWVECTORS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    Support ARM vectors in low memory.

1.2.9 CONFIG_ARCH_ROMPGTABLE: ROM page table

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_USE_MMU
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    Support a fixed memory mapping use a (read-only) page table in ROM/FLASH.

1.2.10 CONFIG_DEBUG_HARDFAULT: Verbose Hard-Fault Debug

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_DEBUG && (CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 || CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM4)
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    Enables verbose debug output when a hard fault is occurs. This verbose output is sometimes helpful when debugging difficult hard fault problems, but may be more than you typcially want to see.

1.2.11 CONFIG_ARCH_DABORTSTACK: Dabort Stack Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_DABORTSTACK
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    This architecture supports an data abort stack. If defined, this symbol will be the size of the data abort stack in bytes. If not defined (or defined to be zero or less than 512 bytes), the user task stacks will be used during data abort handling. Recommended data abort stack size is 1K.

1.2.12 CONFIG_ARMV7M_LAZYFPU: Lazy FPU storage

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 , CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LAZYFPU
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

    There are two forms of the common vector logic. There are pros and cons to each option:

    1) The standard common vector logic exploits features of the ARMv7-M 

      architecture to save the all of floating registers on entry into
each interrupt and then to restore the floating registers when
the interrupt returns.  The primary advantage to this approach is
that floating point operations are available in interrupt
handling logic.  Since the volatile registers are preserved,
operations on the floating point registers by interrupt handling
logic has no ill effect.  The downside is, of course, that more
stack operations are required on each interrupt to save and store
the floating point registers.  Because of the some special
features of the ARMv-M, this is not as much overhead as you might
expect, but overhead nonetheless.

    2) The lazy FPU common vector logic does not save or restore 

      floating point registers on entry and exit from the interrupt
handler. Rather, the floating point registers are not restored
until it is absolutely necessary to do so when a context switch
occurs and the interrupt handler will be returning to a different
floating point context.  Since floating point registers are not
protected, floating point operations must not be performed in
interrupt handling logic.  Better interrupt performance is be
expected, however.

    By default, the "standard" common vector logic is build. This option selects the alternate lazy FPU common vector logic.

1.2.13 CONFIG_ARMV7M_USEBASEPRI: Use BASEPRI Register

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 , CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 || CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM4 || CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM7
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

    Use the BASEPRI register to enable and disable interrupts. By default, the PRIMASK register is used for this purpose. This usually results in hardfaults when supervisor calls are made. Though, these hardfaults are properly handled by the RTOS, the hardfaults can confuse some debuggers. With the BASEPRI register, these hardfaults, will be avoided.

1.2.14 CONFIG_ARMV7M_ICACHE: Use I-Cache

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 , CONFIG_ARMV7M_HAVE_ICACHE
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

1.2.15 CONFIG_ARMV7M_DCACHE: Use D-Cache

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 , CONFIG_ARMV7M_HAVE_DCACHE
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

1.2.16 CONFIG_ARMV7M_DCACHE_WRITETHROUGH: D-Cache Write-Through

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 , CONFIG_ARMV7M_DCACHE
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

1.2.17 CONFIG_ARMV7M_ITCM: Use ITCM

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 , CONFIG_ARMV7M_HAVE_ITCM
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

1.2.18 CONFIG_ARMV7M_DTCM: Use DTCM

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 , CONFIG_ARMV7M_HAVE_DTCM
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

1.2.19 Choice: Toolchain Selection

  • Default Values:
    • Default: ARMV7M_TOOLCHAIN_GNU_EABIW

      Dependency: CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS

    • Default: ARMV7M_TOOLCHAIN_GNU_EABIL

      Dependency: !CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_ARMV7M_TOOLCHAIN_ATOLLIC: Atollic Lite/Pro for Windows

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_TOOLCHAIN_GNU
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 , CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV7M_TOOLCHAIN_BUILDROOT: Buildroot (Cygwin or Linux)

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_TOOLCHAIN_GNU
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 , !CONFIG_WINDOWS_NATIVE
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV7M_TOOLCHAIN_CODEREDL: CodeRed for Linux

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_TOOLCHAIN_GNU
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 , CONFIG_HOST_LINUX
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV7M_TOOLCHAIN_CODEREDW: CodeRed for Windows

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_TOOLCHAIN_GNU
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 , CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV7M_TOOLCHAIN_CODESOURCERYL: CodeSourcery GNU toolchain under Linux

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_TOOLCHAIN_GNU
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 , CONFIG_HOST_LINUX
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV7M_TOOLCHAIN_CODESOURCERYW: CodeSourcery GNU toolchain under Windows

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_TOOLCHAIN_GNU
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 , CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV7M_TOOLCHAIN_DEVKITARM: devkitARM GNU toolchain

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_TOOLCHAIN_GNU
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 , CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV7M_TOOLCHAIN_GNU_EABIL: Generic GNU EABI toolchain under Linux (or other POSIX environment)

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_TOOLCHAIN_GNU
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

      This option should work for any modern GNU toolchain (GCC 4.5 or newer) configured for arm-none-eabi.

    CONFIG_ARMV7M_TOOLCHAIN_GNU_EABIW: Generic GNU EABI toolchain under Windows

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_TOOLCHAIN_GNU
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 , CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV7M_TOOLCHAIN_CLANGL: Generic Clang toolchain under Linux (or other POSIX environment)

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_TOOLCHAIN_GNU
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 , !CONFIG_WINDOWS_NATIVE
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

      This option should work for any modern GNU toolchain (GCC 4.5 or newer) configured for arm-none-eabi.

    CONFIG_ARMV7M_TOOLCHAIN_RAISONANCE: STMicro Raisonance for Windows

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_TOOLCHAIN_GNU
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 , CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

1.2.20 CONFIG_ARMV7M_OABI_TOOLCHAIN: OABI (vs EABI)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 , CONFIG_ARMV7M_TOOLCHAIN_BUILDROOT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

    Most of the older buildroot toolchains are OABI and are named arm-nuttx-elf- vs. arm-nuttx-eabi-

1.2.21 CONFIG_ARMV7M_TARGET2_PREL: R_ARM_TARGET2 is PC relative

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default Values:
    • Default: n

      Dependency: !CONFIG_UCLIBCXX_EXCEPTION

    • Default: y

      Dependency: CONFIG_UCLIBCXX_EXCEPTION

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 , CONFIG_ELF
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

    Perform a PC relative relocation for relocation type R_ARM_TARGET2

1.2.22 CONFIG_ARMV7M_STACKCHECK: Check for stack overflow on each function call

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 , CONFIG_ARMV7M_HAVE_STACKCHECK
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

    This check uses R10 to check for a stack overflow within each function call. This has performances and code size impacts, but it will be able to catch hard to find stack overflows.

    Currently only available only for the STM32 architecture. The changes are not complex and patches for other architectures will be accepted.

1.2.23 CONFIG_ARMV7M_ITMSYSLOG: ITM SYSLOG support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_SYSLOG, CONFIG_SYSLOG
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

    Enable hooks to support ITM syslog output. This requires additional MCU support in order to be used. See arch/arm/src/armv7-m/itm_syslog.h for additional initialization information.

1.2.24 CONFIG_ARMV7M_ITMSYSLOG_PORT: ITM SYSLOG Port

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Range: 0 - 31
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 , CONFIG_ARMV7M_ITMSYSLOG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

1.2.25 CONFIG_ARMV7M_ITMSYSLOG_SWODIV: ITM SYSLOG SWO divider

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 15
  • Range: 1 - 8192
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 , CONFIG_ARMV7M_ITMSYSLOG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

1.2.26 CONFIG_ARMV7R_HAVE_GICv2: ARMV7R_GICv2 support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4 , !CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_BCM4390X
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-r/Kconfig

    Selected by the configuration tool if the architecture supports the Generic Interrupt Controller (GIC)

1.2.27 CONFIG_ARMV7R_ICACHE: Use I-Cache

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-r/Kconfig

1.2.28 CONFIG_ARMV7R_DCACHE: Use D-Cache

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-r/Kconfig

1.2.29 CONFIG_ARMV7R_DCACHE_WRITETHROUGH: D-Cache Write-Through

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4 , CONFIG_ARMV7R_DCACHE
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-r/Kconfig

1.2.30 Menu: L2 Cache Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4 , CONFIG_ARMV7R_HAVE_L2CC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-r/Kconfig

1.2.30.1 CONFIG_ARMV7R_L2CC_PL310: ARMv7-A L2CC P310 Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_L2CACHE
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4 , CONFIG_ARMV7R_HAVE_L2CC , CONFIG_ARMV7R_HAVE_L2CC_PL310 && CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-r/Kconfig

    Enable the 2 Cache Controller (L2CC) is based on the L2CC-PL310 ARM multi-way cache macrocell, version r3p2. The addition of an on-chip secondary cache, also referred to as a Level 2 or L2 cache, is a method of improving the system performance when significant memory traffic is generated by the processor.

1.2.30.2 CONFIG_PL310_LOCKDOWN_BY_MASTER: PL310 Lockdown by Master

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4 , CONFIG_ARMV7R_HAVE_L2CC , CONFIG_ARCH_L2CACHE , CONFIG_ARMV7R_L2CC_PL310
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-r/Kconfig

1.2.30.3 CONFIG_PL310_LOCKDOWN_BY_LINE: PL310 Lockdown by Line

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4 , CONFIG_ARMV7R_HAVE_L2CC , CONFIG_ARCH_L2CACHE , CONFIG_ARMV7R_L2CC_PL310
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-r/Kconfig

1.2.30.4 CONFIG_PL310_ADDRESS_FILTERING: PL310 Address Filtering by Line

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4 , CONFIG_ARMV7R_HAVE_L2CC , CONFIG_ARCH_L2CACHE , CONFIG_ARMV7R_L2CC_PL310
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-r/Kconfig

1.2.30.5 Choice: L2 Cache Associativity

  • Default: ARMV7R_ASSOCIATIVITY_8WAY
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4 , CONFIG_ARMV7R_HAVE_L2CC , CONFIG_ARCH_L2CACHE , CONFIG_ARCH_L2CACHE
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-r/Kconfig

    • This choice specifies the associativity of L2 cache in terms of the number of ways. This value could be obtained by querying cache configuration registers. However, by defining a configuration setting instead, we can avoid using RAM memory to hold information about properties of the memory.

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_ARMV7R_ASSOCIATIVITY_8WAY: 8-Way Associativity

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4 , CONFIG_ARMV7R_HAVE_L2CC , CONFIG_ARCH_L2CACHE
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-r/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV7R_ASSOCIATIVITY_16WAY: 16-Way Associativity

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4 , CONFIG_ARMV7R_HAVE_L2CC , CONFIG_ARCH_L2CACHE
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-r/Kconfig

1.2.30.6 Choice: L2 Cache Way Size

  • Default: ARMV7R_WAYSIZE_16KB
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4 , CONFIG_ARMV7R_HAVE_L2CC , CONFIG_ARCH_L2CACHE , CONFIG_ARCH_L2CACHE
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-r/Kconfig

    • This choice specifies size of each way. This value can be obtained by querying cache configuration registers. However, by defining a configuration setting instead, we can avoid using RAM memory to hold information

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_ARMV7R_WAYSIZE_16KB: 16 KiB

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4 , CONFIG_ARMV7R_HAVE_L2CC , CONFIG_ARCH_L2CACHE
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-r/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV7R_WAYSIZE_32KB: 32 KiB

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4 , CONFIG_ARMV7R_HAVE_L2CC , CONFIG_ARCH_L2CACHE
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-r/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV7R_WAYSIZE_64KB: 64 KiB

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4 , CONFIG_ARMV7R_HAVE_L2CC , CONFIG_ARCH_L2CACHE
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-r/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV7R_WAYSIZE_128KB: 128 KiB

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4 , CONFIG_ARMV7R_HAVE_L2CC , CONFIG_ARCH_L2CACHE
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-r/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV7R_WAYSIZE_256KB: 256 KiB

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4 , CONFIG_ARMV7R_HAVE_L2CC , CONFIG_ARCH_L2CACHE
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-r/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV7R_WAYSIZE_512KB: 512 KiB

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4 , CONFIG_ARMV7R_HAVE_L2CC , CONFIG_ARCH_L2CACHE
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-r/Kconfig

1.2.31 Choice: Toolchain Selection

  • Default Values:
    • Default: ARMV7R_TOOLCHAIN_GNU_EABIW

      Dependency: CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS

    • Default: ARMV7R_TOOLCHAIN_GNU_EABIL

      Dependency: !CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-r/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_ARMV7R_TOOLCHAIN_BUILDROOT: Buildroot (Cygwin or Linux)

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4 , !CONFIG_WINDOWS_NATIVE
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-r/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV7R_TOOLCHAIN_CODESOURCERYL: CodeSourcery GNU toolchain under Linux

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4 , CONFIG_HOST_LINUX
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-r/Kconfig

      For use with the GNU toolchain built with the NuttX buildroot package. This tools may be arm-nuttx-eabi- or, if ARMV7R_OABI_TOOLCHAIN is set, arm-nuttx-elf-.

    CONFIG_ARMV7R_TOOLCHAIN_CODESOURCERYW: CodeSourcery GNU toolchain under Windows

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4 , CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-r/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV7R_TOOLCHAIN_DEVKITARM: devkitARM GNU toolchain

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4 , CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-r/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV7R_TOOLCHAIN_GNU_EABIL: Generic GNU EABI toolchain under Linux (or other POSIX environment)

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-r/Kconfig

      This option should work for any modern GNU toolchain (GCC 4.5 or newer) configured for arm-none-eabi-.

    CONFIG_ARMV7R_TOOLCHAIN_GNU_EABIW: Generic GNU EABI toolchain under Windows

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4 , CONFIG_HOST_WINDOWS
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-r/Kconfig

      This option should work for any modern GNU toolchain (GCC 4.5 or newer) configured for arm-none-eabi-.

    CONFIG_ARMV7R_TOOLCHAIN_GNU_OABI: Generic GNU OABI toolchain

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-r/Kconfig

      This option should work for any GNU toolchain configured for arm-elf-.

1.2.32 CONFIG_ARMV7R_OABI_TOOLCHAIN: OABI (vs EABI)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4 , CONFIG_ARMV7R_TOOLCHAIN_BUILDROOT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-r/Kconfig

    Most of the older buildroot toolchains are OABI and are named arm-nuttx-elf- vs. arm-nuttx-eabi-

1.2.33 CONFIG_ARMV7R_DECODEFIQ: FIQ Handler

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4 , CONFIG_ARMV7R_HAVE_DECODEFIQ
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-r/Kconfig

    Select this option if your platform supports the function arm_decodefiq().

1.2.34 Choice: Tiva/Stellaris Chip Selection

  • Default: ARCH_CHIP_LM3S6965
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM || CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_TIVA
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM3S6918: LM3S6918

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM3S, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_I2C1, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_SSI1, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_TIMER3, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_ETHERNET
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM3S9B96: LM3S9B96

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM3S, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_UART3, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_I2C1, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_SSI1, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_TIMER3, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_ETHERNET, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_GPIOH_IRQS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM3S6432: LM3S6432

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM3S, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_ETHERNET
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM3S6965: LM3S6965

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM3S, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_UART3, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_I2C1, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_TIMER3, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_ETHERNET, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_GPIOH_IRQS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM3S8962: LM3S8962

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM3S, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_UART3, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_I2C1, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_TIMER3, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_TIMER4, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_TIMER5, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_ETHERNET, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_GPIOH_IRQS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM4F120: LM4F120

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM4, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM4F, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_FPU
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_TM4C123GH6ZRB: TM4C123GH6ZRB

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_TM4C, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_TM4C123, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_GPIOP_IRQS, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_GPIOQ_IRQS, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_I2C4, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_I2C5
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_TIVA
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_TM4C123GH6PMI: TM4C123GH6PMI

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_TM4C, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_TM4C123, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_GPIOA_IRQS, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_GPIOB_IRQS, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_GPIOC_IRQS, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_GPIOD_IRQS, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_GPIOE_IRQS, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_GPIOF_IRQS, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_ADC0, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_ADC1
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_TIVA
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_TM4C1294NC: TM4C1294NC

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_TM4C, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_TM4C129, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_ETHERNET
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_TIVA
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_TM4C129XNC: TM4C129XNC

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_TM4C, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_TM4C129, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_ETHERNET
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_TIVA
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_CC3200: CC3200

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM4, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_I2C1
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_TIVA
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

1.2.35 CONFIG_LM_REVA2: Rev A2

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    Some early silicon returned an increase LDO voltage or 2.75V to work around a PLL bug

1.2.36.33 CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET: Ethernet

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_NETDEVICES
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_ETHERNET
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    This must be set (along with NET) to build the Stellaris Ethernet driver.

1.2.36.34 CONFIG_TIVA_FLASH: Internal FLASH driver

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    Enable MTD driver support for internal FLASH.

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_TIVA_GPIO_IRQS
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_GPION_IRQS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

1.2.37.14 CONFIG_TIVA_GPIOP_IRQS: Enable GPIOP IRQs

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_TIVA_GPIO_IRQS
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_GPIOP_IRQS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

1.2.37.15 CONFIG_TIVA_GPIOQ_IRQS: Enable GPIOQ IRQs

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_TIVA_GPIO_IRQS
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_GPIOQ_IRQS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

1.2.37.16 CONFIG_TIVA_GPIOR_IRQS: Enable GPIOR IRQs

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_TIVA_GPIO_IRQS
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_GPIOR_IRQS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

1.2.37.17 CONFIG_TIVA_GPIOS_IRQS: Enable GPIOS IRQs

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_TIVA_GPIO_IRQS
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_GPIOS_IRQS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

1.2.37.18 CONFIG_TIVA_GPIOT_IRQS: Enable GPIOT IRQs

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_TIVA_GPIO_IRQS
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_GPIOT_IRQS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

1.2.38 Menu: I2C Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_I2C
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

1.2.38.1 CONFIG_TIVA_I2C_DYNTIMEO: Use dynamic timeouts

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_I2C
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

1.2.38.2 CONFIG_TIVA_I2C_DYNTIMEO_USECPERBYTE: Timeout Microseconds per Byte

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 500
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_I2C , CONFIG_TIVA_I2C_DYNTIMEO
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

1.2.38.3 CONFIG_TIVA_I2C_DYNTIMEO_STARTSTOP: Timeout for Start/Stop (Milliseconds)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_I2C , CONFIG_TIVA_I2C_DYNTIMEO
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

1.2.38.4 CONFIG_TIVA_I2C_TIMEOSEC: Timeout seconds

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_I2C
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

1.2.38.5 CONFIG_TIVA_I2C_TIMEOMS: Timeout Milliseconds

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 500
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_I2C , !CONFIG_TIVA_I2C_DYNTIMEO , !CONFIG_TIVA_I2C_DYNTIMEO
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

1.2.38.6 CONFIG_TIVA_I2C_TIMEOTICKS: Timeout for Done and Stop (ticks)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 500
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_I2C , !CONFIG_TIVA_I2C_DYNTIMEO , !CONFIG_TIVA_I2C_DYNTIMEO
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

1.2.38.7 CONFIG_TIVA_I2C_HIGHSPEED: High speed support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_I2C , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_TM4C && CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    Enable support for high speed I2C transfers. Only partially implemented and completely untested.

1.2.38.8 CONFIG_TIVA_I2C_REGDEBUG: Register level debug

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_I2C , CONFIG_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    Enables extremely detailed register access debug output.

1.2.39 Menu: Timer Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_TIMER
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

1.2.39.1 CONFIG_TIVA_TIMER_32BIT: 32-bit timer support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_TIMER
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

1.2.39.2 CONFIG_TIVA_TIMER32_PERIODIC: 32-bit one-shot/periodic timer support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_TIMER , CONFIG_TIVA_TIMER_32BIT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

1.2.39.3 CONFIG_TIVA_TIMER32_RTC: 32-bit RTC (needs 32.768-KHz input)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_TIMER , CONFIG_TIVA_TIMER_32BIT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

1.2.39.4 CONFIG_TIVA_TIMER_16BIT: 16-bit timer support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_TIMER
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

1.2.39.5 CONFIG_TIVA_TIMER16_PERIODIC: 16-bit one-shot/periodic timer support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_TIMER , CONFIG_TIVA_TIMER_16BIT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

1.2.39.6 CONFIG_TIVA_TIMER16_EDGECOUNT: 16-bit input edge-count capture support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_TIMER , CONFIG_TIVA_TIMER_16BIT , CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

1.2.39.7 CONFIG_TIVA_TIMER16_TIMECAP: 16-bit input time capture support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_TIMER , CONFIG_TIVA_TIMER_16BIT , CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

1.2.39.8 CONFIG_TIVA_TIMER16_PWM: 16-bit PWM output support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_TIMER , CONFIG_TIVA_TIMER_16BIT , CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

1.2.39.9 CONFIG_TIVA_TIMER_REGDEBUG: Register level debug

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_TIMER , CONFIG_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    Enables extremely detailed register access debug output.

1.2.40 Menu: ADC Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ADC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

1.2.40.1 CONFIG_TIVA_ADC_REGDEBUG: Register level debug

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ADC , CONFIG_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    Enables extremely detailed register access debug output.

1.2.41 Menu: Stellaris Ethernet Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM3S
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

1.2.41.1 CONFIG_TIVA_ETHLEDS: Ethernet LEDs

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    Enable to use Ethernet LEDs on the board.

1.2.41.2 CONFIG_TIVA_ETHHDUPLEX: Force Half Duplex

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    Set to force half duplex operation

1.2.41.3 CONFIG_TIVA_ETHNOAUTOCRC: Disable auto-CRC

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    Set to suppress auto-CRC generation

1.2.41.4 CONFIG_TIVA_ETHNOPAD: Disable Tx Padding

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    Set to suppress Tx padding

1.2.41.5 CONFIG_TIVA_MULTICAST: Enable Multicast

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    Set to enable multicast frames

1.2.41.6 CONFIG_TIVA_PROMISCUOUS: Enable Promiscuous Mode

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    Set to enable promiscuous mode

1.2.41.7 CONFIG_TIVA_TIMESTAMP: Enable Timestamping

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

1.2.41.8 CONFIG_TIVA_BADCRC: Enable Bad CRC Rejection

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    Set to enable bad CRC rejection.

1.2.41.9 CONFIG_TIVA_DUMPPACKET: Dump Packets

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    Dump each packet received/sent to the console.

1.2.42 Menu: Ethernet Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_TM4C
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

1.2.42.1 Choice: PHY selection

  • Default: TIVA_PHY_INTERNAL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_TIVA_PHY_INTERNAL: Internal PHY

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

      Use the built-in, internal Tiva PHY

    CONFIG_TIVA_PHY_MII: External MII interface

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET , CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

      Support external PHY MII interface.

    CONFIG_TIVA_PHY_RMII: External RMII interface

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET , CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

      Support external PHY RMII interface.

1.2.42.2 CONFIG_TIVA_AUTONEG: Use autonegotiation

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    Use PHY autonegotiation to determine speed and mode

1.2.42.3 CONFIG_TIVA_PHYADDR: PHY address

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET , !CONFIG_TIVA_PHY_INTERNAL
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    The 5-bit address of the PHY on the board. Default: 1

1.2.42.4 CONFIG_TIVA_ETHFD: Full duplex

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET , !CONFIG_TIVA_PHY_INTERNAL , !CONFIG_TIVA_AUTONEG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    If TIVA_AUTONEG is not defined, then this may be defined to select full duplex mode. Default: half-duplex

1.2.42.5 CONFIG_TIVA_ETH100MBPS: 100 Mbps

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET , !CONFIG_TIVA_PHY_INTERNAL , !CONFIG_TIVA_AUTONEG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    If TIVA_AUTONEG is not defined, then this may be defined to select 100 MBps speed. Default: 10 Mbps

1.2.42.6 CONFIG_TIVA_PHYSR: PHY Status Register Address (decimal)

  • Type: Integer
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET , !CONFIG_TIVA_PHY_INTERNAL , CONFIG_TIVA_AUTONEG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    This must be provided if TIVA_AUTONEG is defined. The PHY status register address may diff from PHY to PHY. This configuration sets the address of the PHY status register.

1.2.42.7 CONFIG_TIVA_PHYSR_ALTCONFIG: PHY Status Alternate Bit Layout

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET , !CONFIG_TIVA_PHY_INTERNAL , CONFIG_TIVA_AUTONEG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    Different PHYs present speed and mode information in different ways. Some will present separate information for speed and mode (this is the default). Those PHYs, for example, may provide a 10/100 Mbps indication and a separate full/half duplex indication. This options selects an alternative representation where speed and mode information are combined. This might mean, for example, separate bits for 10HD, 100HD, 10FD and 100FD.

1.2.42.8 CONFIG_TIVA_PHYSR_SPEED: PHY Speed Mask

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET , !CONFIG_TIVA_PHY_INTERNAL , CONFIG_TIVA_AUTONEG , !CONFIG_TIVA_PHYSR_ALTCONFIG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    This must be provided if TIVA_AUTONEG is defined. This provides bit mask for isolating the 10 or 100MBps speed indication.

1.2.42.9 CONFIG_TIVA_PHYSR_100MBPS: PHY 100Mbps Speed Value

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET , !CONFIG_TIVA_PHY_INTERNAL , CONFIG_TIVA_AUTONEG , !CONFIG_TIVA_PHYSR_ALTCONFIG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    This must be provided if TIVA_AUTONEG is defined. This provides the value of the speed bit(s) indicating 100MBps speed.

1.2.42.10 CONFIG_TIVA_PHYSR_MODE: PHY Mode Mask

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET , !CONFIG_TIVA_PHY_INTERNAL , CONFIG_TIVA_AUTONEG , !CONFIG_TIVA_PHYSR_ALTCONFIG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    This must be provided if TIVA_AUTONEG is defined. This provide bit mask for isolating the full or half duplex mode bits.

1.2.42.11 CONFIG_TIVA_PHYSR_FULLDUPLEX: PHY Full Duplex Mode Value

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET , !CONFIG_TIVA_PHY_INTERNAL , CONFIG_TIVA_AUTONEG , !CONFIG_TIVA_PHYSR_ALTCONFIG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    This must be provided if TIVA_AUTONEG is defined. This provides the value of the mode bits indicating full duplex mode.

1.2.42.12 CONFIG_TIVA_PHYSR_ALTMODE: PHY Mode Mask

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET , !CONFIG_TIVA_PHY_INTERNAL , CONFIG_TIVA_AUTONEG , CONFIG_TIVA_PHYSR_ALTCONFIG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    This must be provided if TIVA_AUTONEG is defined. This provide bit mask for isolating the speed and full/half duplex mode bits.

1.2.42.13 CONFIG_TIVA_PHYSR_10HD: 10MBase-T Half Duplex Value

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET , !CONFIG_TIVA_PHY_INTERNAL , CONFIG_TIVA_AUTONEG , CONFIG_TIVA_PHYSR_ALTCONFIG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    This must be provided if TIVA_AUTONEG is defined. This is the value under the bit mask that represents the 10Mbps, half duplex setting.

1.2.42.14 CONFIG_TIVA_PHYSR_100HD: 100Base-T Half Duplex Value

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET , !CONFIG_TIVA_PHY_INTERNAL , CONFIG_TIVA_AUTONEG , CONFIG_TIVA_PHYSR_ALTCONFIG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    This must be provided if TIVA_AUTONEG is defined. This is the value under the bit mask that represents the 100Mbps, half duplex setting.

1.2.42.15 CONFIG_TIVA_PHYSR_10FD: 10Base-T Full Duplex Value

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET , !CONFIG_TIVA_PHY_INTERNAL , CONFIG_TIVA_AUTONEG , CONFIG_TIVA_PHYSR_ALTCONFIG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    This must be provided if TIVA_AUTONEG is defined. This is the value under the bit mask that represents the 10Mbps, full duplex setting.

1.2.42.16 CONFIG_TIVA_PHYSR_100FD: 100Base-T Full Duplex Value

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET , !CONFIG_TIVA_PHY_INTERNAL , CONFIG_TIVA_AUTONEG , CONFIG_TIVA_PHYSR_ALTCONFIG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    This must be provided if TIVA_AUTONEG is defined. This is the value under the bit mask that represents the 100Mbps, full duplex setting.

1.2.42.17 CONFIG_TIVA_PHY_INTERRUPTS: PHY interrupt support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_PHY_INTERRUPT, CONFIG_NETDEV_PHY_IOCTL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    Enable logic to signal user tasks when a PHY interrupt occurs. The PHY interrupt may indicate a change in the link status such as, for example, when a cable is plugged in or unplugged.

1.2.42.18 CONFIG_TIVA_EMAC_NRXDESC: Number of RX descriptors

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    Number of RX DMA descriptors to use.

1.2.42.19 CONFIG_TIVA_EMAC_NTXDESC: Number of TX descriptors

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    Number of TX DMA descriptors to use.

1.2.42.20 CONFIG_TIVA_EMAC_PTP: Precision Time Protocol (PTP)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_TIVA_EMAC_ENHANCEDDESC
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET , CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    Precision Time Protocol (PTP). Not supported but some hooks are indicated with this condition.

1.2.42.21 CONFIG_TIVA_EMAC_HWCHECKSUM: Use hardware checksums

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET , CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    Use the hardware checksum capabilities of the Tiva chip

1.2.42.22 CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET_REGDEBUG: Register-Level Debug

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET , CONFIG_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    Enable very low-level register access debug. Depends on DEBUG.

1.2.43 CONFIG_TIVA_BOARDMAC: Board MAC

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_ETHERNET
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    If the board-specific logic can provide a MAC address (via tiva_ethernetmac()), then this should be selected.

1.2.44 Menu: Tiva/Stellaris SSI Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_SSI
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

1.2.44.1 CONFIG_SSI_POLLWAIT: Poll Wait (No-Interrupt) Mode

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_SSI
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

1.2.44.2 CONFIG_SSI_TXLIMIT: Tx Limit

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_SSI
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    Default of 4 assumes half of the 8 entry FIFO

1.2.45 Menu: Tiva/Stellaris Internal Flash Driver Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_FLASH
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

1.2.45.1 CONFIG_TIVA_FLASH_STARTPAGE: First page accessible by the MTD driver

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 250
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM , CONFIG_TIVA_FLASH
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/tiva/Kconfig

    To prevent accessing FLASH sections where code is stored.

1.2.46 Choice: S5J Chip Selection

  • Default: ARCH_CHIP_S5JT200
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_S5J , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_S5J
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/s5j/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_S5JT200: S5JT200

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4, CONFIG_ARMV7A_HAVE_GICv2, CONFIG_ARMV7R_ICACHE, CONFIG_ARMV7R_DCACHE, CONFIG_S5J_S5JT200, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_RESET
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_S5J
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/s5j/Kconfig

1.2.47 Menu: S5J Peripheral Support

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_S5J
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/s5j/Kconfig

1.2.47.1 CONFIG_S5J_ADC: ADC

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ANALOG, CONFIG_ADC, CONFIG_SCHED_WORKQUEUE, CONFIG_SCHED_LPWORK
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_S5J , CONFIG_S5J_HAVE_ADC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/s5j/Kconfig

    S5J has 12-bits ADC with 4 channels. Say Y here, if you want to use it.

1.2.47.2 CONFIG_S5J_DMA: DMA

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_DMA
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_S5J , CONFIG_S5J_HAVE_DMA
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/s5j/Kconfig

1.2.47.3 CONFIG_S5J_I2C: I2C

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_S5J , CONFIG_S5J_HAVE_I2C
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/s5j/Kconfig

1.2.47.4 CONFIG_S5J_I2S: I2S

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_I2S, CONFIG_AUDIO, CONFIG_S5J_DMA
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_S5J , CONFIG_S5J_HAVE_I2S
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/s5j/Kconfig

1.2.47.5 CONFIG_S5J_I2S_RX: S5J I2S RX support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_S5J , CONFIG_S5J_I2S
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/s5j/Kconfig

1.2.47.6 CONFIG_S5J_I2S_TX_P: S5J I2S TX Prime support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_S5J , CONFIG_S5J_I2S
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/s5j/Kconfig

1.2.47.7 CONFIG_S5J_I2S_TX_S: S5J I2S TX Secondary support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_S5J , CONFIG_S5J_I2S
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/s5j/Kconfig

1.2.47.8 CONFIG_S5J_I2S_MAXINFLIGHT: I2S queue size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_S5J , CONFIG_S5J_I2S
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/s5j/Kconfig

    This is the total number of transfers, both RX and TX, that can be enqueue before the caller is required to wait. This setting determines the number certain queue data structures that will be pre-allocated.

1.2.47.9 CONFIG_S5J_TIMER0: TIMER0

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_S5J_MCT
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_S5J , CONFIG_S5J_HAVE_MCT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/s5j/Kconfig

1.2.47.10 CONFIG_S5J_TIMER1: TIMER1

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_S5J_MCT
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_S5J , CONFIG_S5J_HAVE_MCT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/s5j/Kconfig

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_S5J_MCT
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_S5J , CONFIG_S5J_HAVE_MCT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/s5j/Kconfig

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_S5J_MCT
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_S5J , CONFIG_S5J_HAVE_MCT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/s5j/Kconfig

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART0, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_SERIAL_TERMIOS
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_S5J , CONFIG_S5J_HAVE_UART0
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/s5j/Kconfig

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART1, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_SERIAL_TERMIOS
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_S5J , CONFIG_S5J_HAVE_UART1
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/s5j/Kconfig

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n

  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/s5j/Kconfig

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART3, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_SERIAL_TERMIOS
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_S5J , CONFIG_S5J_HAVE_UART3
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/s5j/Kconfig

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_S5J_UART_FLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_S5J , CONFIG_S5J_UART3 , !CONFIG_S5J_PWM0 , !CONFIG_S5J_PWM1
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/s5j/Kconfig

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART4, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_SERIAL_TERMIOS
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_S5J , CONFIG_S5J_HAVE_UART4

  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/s5j/Kconfig

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 7000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_S5J , CONFIG_S5J_WATCHDOG
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/s5j/Kconfig

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_USE_FLASH
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_S5J , CONFIG_S5J_HAVE_SFLASH
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/s5j/Kconfig

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_S5J
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/s5j/Kconfig

1.2.48 Choice: Cypress BCM4390x Chip Selection

  • Default: ARCH_CHIP_BCM43907
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_BCM4390X
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/bcm4390x/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_BCM43907: Cypress BCM43907

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_BCM4390X_BCM43907, CONFIG_BOOT_RESULT
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_BCM4390X
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/bcm4390x/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_BCM43909: Cypress BCM43909

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_BCM4390X_BCM43909, CONFIG_BOOT_RESULT
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_BCM4390X
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/bcm4390x/Kconfig

1.2.49 CONFIG_BCM4390X_BOOT_RESULT_ADDR: boot result address (physical)

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x6A0000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_BCM4390X , CONFIG_BOOT_RESULT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/bcm4390x/Kconfig

1.2.50 CONFIG_ARMCR4_CYCLE_COUNTER_REG: Cpu clock Register address

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x18003028
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_BCM4390X
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/bcm4390x/Kconfig

1.2.51 CONFIG_BCM4390X_USE_EXTMEM: Use external DDR memory

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_BCM4390X
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/bcm4390x/Kconfig

    If the board uses external DDR RAM memory, enable this.

1.2.52 CONFIG_BCM4390X_DVFS: CPU DVFS Support interface

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_USE_DVFS
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_BCM4390X
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/bcm4390x/Kconfig

    BCM4390x has 7 different frequency, This interface helps to switch among them. Say Y here, if you want.

1.2.53 Menu: BCM4390x Peripheral Support

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_BCM4390X
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/bcm4390x/Kconfig

1.2.53.1 CONFIG_BCM4390X_UART0: UART0 (Slow UART)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART0, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_SERIAL_TERMIOS
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_BCM4390X , CONFIG_BCM4390X_HAVE_UART0
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/bcm4390x/Kconfig

    Enable Slow UART0

1.2.53.2 CONFIG_BCM4390X_UART1: UART1 (Fast UART)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART1, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_SERIAL_TERMIOS
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_BCM4390X , CONFIG_BCM4390X_HAVE_UART1
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/bcm4390x/Kconfig

    Enable Fast UART1

1.2.53.3 CONFIG_BCM4390X_UART2: UART2 (GCI UART)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART2, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_SERIAL_TERMIOS
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_BCM4390X , CONFIG_BCM4390X_HAVE_UART2
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/bcm4390x/Kconfig

    Enable GCI UART2

1.2.53.4 CONFIG_BCM4390X_I2C0: I2C0

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_BCM4390X_I2C
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_BCM4390X , CONFIG_I2C
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/bcm4390x/Kconfig

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_BCM4390X_I2C
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_BCM4390X , CONFIG_I2C
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/bcm4390x/Kconfig

1.2.53.6 CONFIG_BCM4390X_I2S: I2S

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_I2S, CONFIG_AUDIO
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_BCM4390X
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/bcm4390x/Kconfig

  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/bcm4390x/Kconfig

  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/bcm4390x/Kconfig

  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/bcm4390x/Kconfig

  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_BCM4390X , CONFIG_CY4390X_RECFG_PWM_TO_GPIO

  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/bcm4390x/Kconfig

  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/bcm4390x/Kconfig

  • Default: 16

  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/bcm4390x/Kconfig

  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/bcm4390x/Kconfig

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Selects: CONFIG_WATCHDOG
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_BCM4390X

  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/bcm4390x/Kconfig

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_BCM4390X
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/bcm4390x/Kconfig

1.2.54 Choice: STM32 Chip Selection

  • Default: ARCH_CHIP_STM32F103ZE
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32 , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32L151C6: STM32L151C6

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3, CONFIG_STM32_STM32L15XX, CONFIG_STM32_ENERGYLITE
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

      STM32L 48-pin EnergyLite, 32KB FLASH, 10KB SRAM, 4KB EEPRROM

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32L151C8: STM32L151C8

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3, CONFIG_STM32_STM32L15XX, CONFIG_STM32_ENERGYLITE
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

      STM32L 48-pin EnergyLite, 64KB FLASH, 10KB SRAM, 4KB EEPRROM

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32L151CB: STM32L151CB

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3, CONFIG_STM32_STM32L15XX, CONFIG_STM32_ENERGYLITE
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

      STM32L 48-pin EnergyLite, 128KB FLASH, 16KB SRAM, 4KB EEPRROM

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32L151R6: STM32L151R6

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3, CONFIG_STM32_STM32L15XX, CONFIG_STM32_ENERGYLITE
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

      STM32L 64-pin EnergyLite, 32KB FLASH, 10KB SRAM, 4KB EEPRROM

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32L151R8: STM32L151R8

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3, CONFIG_STM32_STM32L15XX, CONFIG_STM32_ENERGYLITE
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

      STM32L 64-pin EnergyLite, 64KB FLASH, 10KB SRAM, 4KB EEPRROM

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32L151RB: STM32L151RB

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3, CONFIG_STM32_STM32L15XX, CONFIG_STM32_ENERGYLITE
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

      STM32L 64-pin EnergyLite, 128KB FLASH, 16KB SRAM, 4KB EEPRROM

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32L151V6: STM32L151V6

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3, CONFIG_STM32_STM32L15XX, CONFIG_STM32_ENERGYLITE
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

      STM32L 100-pin EnergyLite, 32KB FLASH, 10KB SRAM, 4KB EEPRROM

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32L151V8: STM32L151V8

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3, CONFIG_STM32_STM32L15XX, CONFIG_STM32_ENERGYLITE
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/stm32/Kconfig

      STM32L 100-pin EnergyLite, 64KB FLASH, 10KB SRAM, 4KB EEPRROM
