  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

1.2.159.1 CONFIG_IMXRT_EDMA: eDMA

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_DMA
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

1.2.159.2 CONFIG_IMXRT_ENET: Ethernet

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_PHY, CONFIG_ARCH_PHY_INTERRUPT, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_NETDEV_STATISTICS
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

  • Type: Boolean

1.2.159.5.15 CONFIG_LPI2C4_FILTSCL: I2C master digital glitch filters for SCL input in clock cycles

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_IMXRT_LPI2C4
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

1.2.159.5.16 CONFIG_LPI2C4_FILTSDA: I2C master digital glitch filters for SDA input in clock cycles

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_IMXRT_LPI2C4
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

1.2.159.6 Menu: LPSPI Peripherals

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

1.2.159.6.1 CONFIG_IMXRT_LPSPI1: LPSPI1

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_IMXRT_LPSPI
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

  • Type: Boolean

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

  • Type: Boolean

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

1.2.159.10 CONFIG_IMXRT_USDHC: USDHC

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_SDIO
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

    Support SD host controller

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n

  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

1.2.179 Menu: Ethernet Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_IMXRT_ENET
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

1.2.179.1 CONFIG_MXRT_ENET_NRXBUFFERS: Number Rx buffers

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 6
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

1.2.179.2 CONFIG_IMXRT_ENET_NTXBUFFERS: Number Tx buffers

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

1.2.179.3 CONFIG_IMXRT_ENET_ENHANCEDBD: # not optional

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

1.2.179.4 CONFIG_IMXRT_ENET_NETHIFS: # Not optional

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

1.2.179.5 CONFIG_IMXRT_ENET_PHYINIT: Board-specific PHY Initialization

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

    Some boards require specialized initialization of the PHY before it can be used. This may include such things as configuring GPIOs, resetting the PHY, etc. If CONFIG_IMXRT_ENET_PHYINIT is defined in the configuration then the board specific logic must provide imxrt_phy_boardinitialize(); The i.MXRT ENET driver will call this function one time before it first uses the PHY.

1.2.180 Menu: Memory Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

1.2.180.1 CONFIG_IMXRT_DTCM: Enable DTCM

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , !CONFIG_IMXRT_OCRAM_PRIMARY && CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

1.2.180.2 CONFIG_IMXRT_ITCM: Enable ITCM

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , !CONFIG_IMXRT_OCRAM_PRIMARY && CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

1.2.180.3 CONFIG_IMXRT_SEMC_SDRAM: External SDRAM installed

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_IMXRT_SEMC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

1.2.180.4 CONFIG_IMXRT_SDRAM_START: SDRAM start address

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x10000000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_IMXRT_SEMC_SDRAM
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

1.2.180.5 CONFIG_IMXRT_SDRAM_SIZE: SDRAM size (bytes)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 268435456
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_IMXRT_SEMC_SDRAM
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

1.2.180.6 CONFIG_IMXRT_SEMC_SRAM: External SRAM installed

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_IMXRT_SEMC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

1.2.180.7 CONFIG_IMXRT_SRAM_START: SRAM start address

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x10000000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_IMXRT_SEMC_SRAM
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

1.2.180.8 CONFIG_IMXRT_SRAM_SIZE: SRAM size (bytes)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 268435456
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_IMXRT_SEMC_SRAM
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

1.2.180.9 CONFIG_IMXRT_SEMC_NOR: External NOR FLASH installed

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_IMXRT_SEMC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

1.2.180.10 Choice: i.MX RT Boot Configuration

  • Default Values:
    • Default: IMXRT_BOOT_NOR

      Dependency: CONFIG_IMXRT_SEMC_NOR

    • Default: IMXRT_BOOT_SDRAM

      Dependency: CONFIG_IMXRT_SEMC_SDRAM && !CONFIG_IMXRT_SEMC_NOR

    • Default: IMXRT_BOOT_SRAM

      Dependency: CONFIG_IMXRT_SEMC_SRAM && !CONFIG_IMXRT_SEMC_SDRAM && !CONFIG_IMXRT_SEMC_NOR

    • Default: IMXRT_BOOT_OCRAM

      Dependency: !CONFIG_IMXRT_SEMC_SRAM && !CONFIG_IMXRT_SEMC_SDRAM && !CONFIG_IMXRT_SEMC_NOR

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

    • The startup code needs to know if the code is running from internal OCRAM, external SDRAM, external NOR, or external SDRAM in order to initialize properly. Note that the boot device is not known for cases where the code is copied into RAM by a bootloader.

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_IMXRT_BOOT_OCRAM: Running from internal OCRAM

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_BOOT_RUNFROMISRAM
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

    CONFIG_IMXRT_BOOT_SDRAM: Running from external SDRAM

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_BOOT_RUNFROMSDRAM
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_IMXRT_SEMC_SDRAM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

    CONFIG_IMXRT_BOOT_NOR: Running from external NOR FLASH

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_BOOT_RUNFROMFLASH
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_IMXRT_SEMC_NOR
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

    CONFIG_IMXRT_BOOT_SRAM: Running from external SRAM

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_BOOT_RUNFROMEXTSRAM
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_IMXRT_SEMC_SRAM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

1.2.180.11 Choice: i.MX RT Primary RAM

  • Default: IMXRT_OCRAM_PRIMARY
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

    • The primary RAM is the RAM that contains the system BLOB's .data and .bss. The unused portion of the primary RAM will automatically be added to the system heap.

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_IMXRT_OCRAM_PRIMARY: Internal OCRAM primary

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

    CONFIG_IMXRT_SDRAM_PRIMARY: External SDRAM primary

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_IMXRT_SEMC_SDRAM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

    CONFIG_IMXRT_SRAM_PRIMARY: External SRAM primary

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_IMXRT_SEMC_SRAM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

1.2.180.12 Menu: i.MX RT Heap Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

1.2.180.12.1 CONFIG_IMXRT_OCRAM_HEAP: Add OCRAM to heap

  • Type: Boolean
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , !CONFIG_IMXRT_OCRAM_PRIMARY
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

    Select to add the entire OCRAM to the heap

1.2.180.12.2 CONFIG_IMXRT_SDRAM_HEAP: Add SDRAM to heap

  • Type: Boolean
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_IMXRT_SEMC_SDRAM && !CONFIG_IMXRT_SDRAM_PRIMARY
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

    Add a region of SDRAM to the heap. A region of SDRAM will be added to the heap that starts at (CONFIG_IMXRT_SDRAM_START + CONFIG_IMXRT_SDRAM_HEAPOFFSET) and extends up to (CONFIG_IMXRT_SDRAM_START + CONFIG_IMXRT_SDRAM_SIZE). Note that the START is the actual start of SDRAM but SIZE is not necessarily the actual SIZE.

1.2.180.12.3 CONFIG_IMXRT_SDRAM_HEAPOFFSET: SDRAM heap offset

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_IMXRT_SDRAM_HEAP
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

    Used to reserve memory at the beginning of SDRAM for, as an example, a framebuffer.

1.2.180.12.4 CONFIG_IMXRT_SRAM_HEAP: Add SRAM to heap

  • Type: Boolean
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_IMXRT_SEMC_SRAM && !CONFIG_IMXRT_SRAM_PRIMARY
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

    Add a region of SRAM to the heap. A region of SDRAM will be added to the heap that starts at (CONFIG_IMXRT_SRAM_START + CONFIG_IMXRT_SRAM_HEAPOFFSET) and extends up to (CONFIG_IMXRT_SRAM_START + CONFIG_IMXRT_SRAM_SIZE). Note that the START is the actual start of SRAM but SIZE is not necessarily the actual SIZE.

1.2.180.12.5 CONFIG_IMXRT_SRAM_HEAPOFFSET: SRAM heap offset

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_IMXRT_SRAM_HEAP
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

    Used to reserve memory at the beginning of SRAM for, as an example, a framebuffer.

1.2.181 Menu: USDHC Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_IMXRT_USDHC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

1.2.181.1 CONFIG_IMXRT_USDHC_DMA: Support DMA data transfers

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Selects: CONFIG_SDIO_DMA
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

    Support DMA data transfers. Enable SD card DMA data transfers. This is marginally optional. For most usages, SD accesses will cause data overruns if used without DMA.

1.2.181.2 CONFIG_IMXRT_USDHC_WIDTH_D1_ONLY: Use D1 only

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

    Select 1-bit transfer mode. Default: 4-bit transfer mode.

1.2.182 Menu: eDMA Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_IMXRT_EDMA
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

1.2.182.1 CONFIG_IMXRT_EDMA_NTCD: Number of transfer descriptors

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

    Number of pre-allocated transfer descriptors. Needed for scatter- gather DMA. Make to be set to zero to disable in-memory TCDs in which case only the TCD channel registers will be used and scatter- will not be supported.

1.2.182.2 CONFIG_IMXRT_EDMA_ELINK: Channeling Linking

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

    This option enables optional minor or major loop channel linking:

    Minor loop channel linking: As the channel completes the minor loop, this flag enables linking to another channel. The link target channel initiates a channel service request via an internal mechanism that sets the TCDn_CSR[START] bit of the specified channel.

    If minor loop channel linking is disabled, this link mechanism is suppressed in favor of the major loop channel linking.

    Major loop channel linking: As the channel completes the minor loop, this option enables the linking to another channel. The link target channel initiates a channel service request via an internal mechanism that sets the TCDn_CSR[START] bit of the linked channel.

1.2.182.3 CONFIG_IMXRT_EDMA_ERCA: Round Robin Channel Arbitration

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

    Normally, a fixed priority arbitration is used for channel selection. If this option is selected, round robin arbitration is used for channel selection.

1.2.182.4 CONFIG_IMXRT_EDMA_HOE: Halt On Error

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

    Any error causes the HALT bit to set. Subsequently, all service requests are ignored until the HALT bit is cleared.

1.2.182.5 CONFIG_IMXRT_EDMA_CLM: Continuous Link Mode

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

    By default, A minor loop channel link made to itself goes through channel arbitration before being activated again. If this option is selected, a minor loop channel link made to itself does not go through channel arbitration before being activated again. Upon minor loop completion, the channel activates again if that channel has a minor loop channel link enabled and the link channel is itself. This effectively applies the minor loop offsets and restarts the next minor loop.

1.2.182.6 CONFIG_IMXRT_EDMA_EMLIM: Minor Loop Mapping

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

    Normally TCD word 2 is a 32-bit NBYTES field. When this option is enabled, TCD word 2 is redefined to include individual enable fields, an offset field, and the NBYTES field. The individual enable fields allow the minor loop offset to be applied to the source address, the destination address, or both. The NBYTES field is reduced when either offset is enabled.

1.2.182.7 CONFIG_IMXRT_EDMA_EDBG: Enable Debug

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

    When in debug mode, the DMA stalls the start of a new channel. Executing channels are allowed to complete. Channel execution resumes when the system exits debug mode or the EDBG bit is cleared

1.2.183 CONFIG_IMXRT_PM_SERIAL_ACTIVITY: PM serial activity

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 10
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_PM
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

    PM activity reported to power management logic on every serial interrupt.

1.2.184 Menu: RTC Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_IMXRT_SNVS_HPRTC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

1.2.184.1 CONFIG_IMXRT_RTC_MAGIC_REG: RTC SNVS GPR

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Range: 0 - 3
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

    The BKP register used to store/check the Magic value to determine if RTC is already setup

1.2.184.2 CONFIG_IMXRT_RTC_MAGIC: RTC Magic 1

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0xfacefeed
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/imxrt/Kconfig

    Value used as Magic to determine if the RTC is already setup

1.2.185 Choice: XTENSA architecture selection

  • Default: ARCH_CHIP_ESP32
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_XTENSA
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/xtensa/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_ESP32: Espressif ESP32

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_FAMILY_LX6, CONFIG_XTENSA_HAVE_INTERRUPTS, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_MULTICPU, CONFIG_ARCH_TOOLCHAIN_GNU
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_XTENSA
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/xtensa/Kconfig

      The ESP32 is a dual-core system from Espressif with two Harvard architecture Xtensa LX6 CPUs. All embedded memory, external memory and peripherals are located on the data bus and/or the instruction bus of these CPUs. With some minor exceptions, the address mapping of two CPUs is symmetric, meaning they use the same addresses to access the same memory.

      The two CPUs are named "PRO_CPU" and "APP_CPU" (for "protocol" and "application"), however for most purposes the two CPUs are interchangeable.

1.2.186 CONFIG_XTENSA_CP_LAZY: Lazy co-processor state restoration

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_XTENSA, CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/xtensa/Kconfig

    Saves and restores the co-processor enabled (CPENABLE) register on each context switch. This has disadvantages in that (1) co-processor context will be saved and restored even if the co- processor was never used, and (2) tasks must explicitly enable and disable co-processors.

    An alternative, "lazy" co-processor state restore is enabled with this option. That logic works like as follows:

    a. CPENABLE is set to zero on each context switch, disabling all co- 

      processors.
    b. If/when the task attempts to use the disabled co-processor, an 
      exception occurs
    c. The co-processor exception handler re-enables the co-processor.

1.2.187 CONFIG_XTENSA_CP_INITSET: Default co-processor enables

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0001
  • Range: 0 - 0xffff
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_XTENSA, !CONFIG_XTENSA_CP_LAZY
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/xtensa/Kconfig

    Co-processors may be enabled on a thread by calling xtensa_coproc_enable() and disabled by calling xtensa_coproc_disable(). Some co-processors should be enabled on all threads by default. That set of co-processors is provided by CONFIG_XTENSA_CP_INITSET. Each bit corresponds to one coprocessor with the same bit layout as for the CPENABLE register.

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_XTENSA, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_ESP32 , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_ESP32 , CONFIG_ESP32_I2C1
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/xtensa/src/esp32/Kconfig

1.2.192.8 CONFIG_ESP32_I2C1_SCLK_PULLUP_EN: I2C 1 Sclk Pullup enable

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_XTENSA, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_ESP32 , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_ESP32 , CONFIG_ESP32_I2C1
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/xtensa/src/esp32/Kconfig

1.2.192.9 CONFIG_ESP32_I2C1_SDA_PIN: I2C 1 SDA Pin

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 19
  • Range: 0 - 39
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_XTENSA, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_ESP32 , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_ESP32 , CONFIG_ESP32_I2C1
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/xtensa/src/esp32/Kconfig

1.2.192.10 CONFIG_ESP32_I2C1_SDA_PULLUP_EN: I2C1 SDA Pullup enable

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_XTENSA, CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_ESP32 , CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_ESP32 , CONFIG_ESP32_I2C1
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/xtensa/src/esp32/Kconfig

1.2.193 CONFIG_ARCH_USE_MMU: Enable MMU

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_MMU
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    The architecture supports MMU. Enable this option in order to enable use of the MMU. For most architectures, this is not really an option: It is required to use the MMU. In those cases, this selection will always be forced.

1.2.194 CONFIG_ARCH_USE_MPU: Enable MPU

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_MPU
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    The architecture supports MPU. Enable this option in order to enable use of the MPU. For most architectures, this option is enabled by other, platform-specific logic. In those cases, this selection will always be forced.

1.2.195 CONFIG_ARCH_ADDRENV: Address environments

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_ADDRENV
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    Support per-task address environments using the MMU... i.e., support "processes"

1.2.196 CONFIG_ARCH_TEXT_VBASE: Virtual .text base

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ADDRENV
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    The virtual address of the beginning the .text region

1.2.197 CONFIG_ARCH_DATA_VBASE: Virtual .bss/.data base

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ADDRENV
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    The virtual address of the beginning of the .bss/.data region.

1.2.198 CONFIG_ARCH_HEAP_VBASE: Virtual heap base

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ADDRENV
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    The virtual address of the beginning of the heap region.

1.2.199 CONFIG_ARCH_SHM_VBASE: Shared memory base

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ADDRENV, CONFIG_MM_SHM
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    The virtual address of the beginning of the shared memory region.

1.2.200 CONFIG_ARCH_TEXT_NPAGES: Max .text pages

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ADDRENV
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    The maximum number of pages that can allocated for the .text region. This, along with knowledge of the page size, determines the size of the .text virtual address space. Default is 1.

1.2.201 CONFIG_ARCH_DATA_NPAGES: Max .bss/.data pages

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ADDRENV
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    The maximum number of pages that can allocated for the .bss/.data region. This, along with knowledge of the page size, determines the size of the .bss/.data virtual address space. Default is 1.

1.2.202 CONFIG_ARCH_HEAP_NPAGES: Max heap pages

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ADDRENV
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    The maximum number of pages that can allocated for the heap region. This, along with knowledge of the page size, determines the size of the heap virtual address space. Default is 1.

1.2.203 CONFIG_ARCH_SHM_MAXREGIONS: Max shared memory regions

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ADDRENV, CONFIG_MM_SHM
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    The maximum number of regions that can allocated for the shared memory space. This hard-coded value permits static allocation of the shared memory data structures and serves no other purpose. Default is 1.

    The size of the virtual shared memory address space is then determined by the product of the maximum number of regions, the maximum number of pages per region, and the configured size of each page.

1.2.204 CONFIG_ARCH_SHM_NPAGES: Max shared memory pages

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ADDRENV, CONFIG_MM_SHM
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    The maximum number of pages that can allocated per region for the shared memory region. Default is 1.

    The size of the virtual shared memory address space is then determined by the product of the maximum number of regions, the maximum number of pages per region, and the configured size of each page.

1.2.205 CONFIG_ARCH_STACK_DYNAMIC: Dynamic user stack

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ADDRENV, CONFIG_BUILD_KERNEL && CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    Select this option if the user process stack resides in its own address space. The naming of this selection implies that dynamic stack allocation is supported. Certainly this option must be set if dynamic stack allocation is supported by a platform. But the more general meaning of this configuration environment is simply that the stack has its own address space.

    NOTE: This option not yet fully implemented in the code base. Hence, it is marked EXPERIMENTAL: Do not enable it unless you plan finish the implementation.

1.2.206 CONFIG_ARCH_STACK_VBASE: Virtual stack base

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ADDRENV, CONFIG_ARCH_STACK_DYNAMIC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    The virtual address of the beginning the stack region

1.2.207 CONFIG_ARCH_STACK_NPAGES: Max. stack pages

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ADDRENV, CONFIG_ARCH_STACK_DYNAMIC
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    The maximum number of pages that can allocated for the stack region. This, along with knowledge of the page size, determines the size of the stack virtual address space. Default is 1.

1.2.208 CONFIG_ARCH_KERNEL_STACK: Kernel process stack

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default Values:
    • Default: n

      Dependency: !CONFIG_LIBC_EXECFUNCS

    • Default: y

      Dependency: CONFIG_LIBC_EXECFUNCS

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ADDRENV, CONFIG_BUILD_KERNEL
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    It this option is selected, then every user process will have two stacks: A large, potentially dynamically sized user stack and small kernel stack that is used during system call process.

    If this option is not selected, then kernel system calls will simply use the caller's user stack. So, in most cases, this option is not required. However, this option is *required* if both BUILD_KERNEL and LIBC_EXECFUNCS are selected. Why? Because when we instantiate and initialize the address environment of the new user process, we will temporarily lose the address environment of the old user process, including its stack contents. The kernel C logic will crash immediately with no valid stack in place.

    When this option is selected, the smaller kernel stack stays in place during system call processing event though the original user stack may or may not be accessible.

1.2.209 CONFIG_ARCH_KERNEL_STACKSIZE: Kernel stack size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1568
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ADDRENV, CONFIG_ARCH_KERNEL_STACK
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    The common size of each process' kernel stack

1.2.210 CONFIG_ARCH_PGPOOL_MAPPING: Have page pool mapping

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ADDRENV
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    If there is a MMU mapping in place for the page pool memory, then this mapping can be utilized to simplify some page table operations. Otherwise, a temporary mapping will have to be established each time it is necessary to modify the contents of a page.

1.2.211 CONFIG_ARCH_PGPOOL_PBASE: Page pool physical address

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ADDRENV, CONFIG_ARCH_PGPOOL_MAPPING
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    The physical address of the start of the page pool memory. This setting is probably equivalent to other platform specific definitions but is required again in order to modularize the common address environment logic.

1.2.212 CONFIG_ARCH_PGPOOL_VBASE: Page pool virtual address

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ADDRENV, CONFIG_ARCH_PGPOOL_MAPPING
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    The virtual address of the start of the page pool memory. This setting is probably equivalent to other platform specific definitions but is required again in order to modularize the common address environment logic.

1.2.213 CONFIG_ARCH_PGPOOL_SIZE: Page pool size (byes)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ADDRENV, CONFIG_ARCH_PGPOOL_MAPPING
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    The size of the page pool memory in bytes. This setting is probably equivalent to other platform specific definitions but is required again in order to modularize the common address environment logic.

1.2.214 CONFIG_PAGING: On-demand paging

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_USE_MMU && !CONFIG_ARCH_ROMPGTABLE
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    If set =y in your configation file, this setting will enable the on-demand paging feature

1.2.215 CONFIG_PAGING_PAGESIZE: Page size (bytes)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4096
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PAGING
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    The size of one managed page. This must be a value supported by the processor's memory management unit

1.2.216 CONFIG_PAGING_NLOCKED: Number of locked pages

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 48
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PAGING
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    This is the number of locked pages in the memory map.

1.2.217 CONFIG_PAGING_CUSTOM_BASE: Custom paging base address

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PAGING
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    By default, the page begins at RAM_START/VSTART. That base address can be changed if this value is selected.

1.2.218 CONFIG_PAGING_LOCKED_PBASE: Physical base address

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PAGING, CONFIG_PAGING_CUSTOM_BASE
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

1.2.219 CONFIG_PAGING_LOCKED_VBASE: Virtual base address

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PAGING, CONFIG_PAGING_CUSTOM_BASE
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

1.2.220 CONFIG_PAGING_NPPAGED: Number of physical pages

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PAGING
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    This is the number of physical pages available to support the paged text region.

1.2.221 CONFIG_PAGING_NVPAGED: Number of virtual pages

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1024
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PAGING
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    This actual size of the virtual paged text region (in pages). This is also the number of virtual pages required to span the entire paged region. The on-demand paging feature is intended to support only the case where the virtual paged text area is much larger the available physical pages. Otherwise, why would you enable on-demand paging?

1.2.222 CONFIG_PAGING_NDATA: Number of data pages

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PAGING
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    This is the number of data pages in the memory map. The data region will extend to the end of RAM unless overridden by a setting in the configuration file.

    NOTE: In some architectures, it may be necessary to take some memory from the end of RAM for page tables or other system usage. The configuration settings and linker directives must be cognizant of that: PAGING_NDATA should be defined to prevent the data region from extending all the way to the end of memory.

1.2.223 CONFIG_PAGING_DEFPRIO: Page fill worker thread priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PAGING
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    The default, minimum priority of the page fill worker thread. The priority of the page fill work thread will be boosted boosted dynamically so that it matches the priority of the task on behalf of which it performs the fill. This defines the minimum priority that will be used. Default: 100.

1.2.224 CONFIG_PAGING_STACKSIZE: Page fill worker thread stack size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1024
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PAGING
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    Defines the size of the allocated stack for the page fill worker thread. Default: 1024.

1.2.225 CONFIG_PAGING_BLOCKINGFILL: Blocking fill

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PAGING
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    The architecture specific up_fillpage() function may be blocking or non-blocking. If defined, this setting indicates that the up_fillpage() implementation will block until the transfer is completed. Default: Undefined (non-blocking).

1.2.226 CONFIG_PAGING_WORKPERIOD: Work period (usec)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 500000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PAGING
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    The page fill worker thread will wake periodically even if there is no mapping to do. This selection controls that wake-up period (in microseconds). This wake-up a failsafe that will handle any cases where a single is lost (that would really be a bug and shouldn't happen!) and also supports timeouts for case of non- blocking, asynchronous fills (see CONFIG_PAGING_TIMEOUT_TICKS).

1.2.227 CONFIG_PAGING_TIMEOUT: Paging timeout

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PAGING
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    If defined, the implementation will monitor the (asynchronous) page fill logic. If the fill takes longer than than a timeout value, then a fatal error will be declared. Default: No timeouts monitored

1.2.228 CONFIG_PAGING_TIMEOUT_TICKS: Paging timeout ticks

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 10
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PAGING, CONFIG_PAGING_TIMEOUT
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    If PAGING_TIMEOUT is defined, then implementation will monitor the (asynchronous) page fill logic. If the fill takes longer than this number if microseconds, then a fatal error will be declared. Default: No timeouts monitored

1.2.229 CONFIG_ARCH_IRQPRIO: Prioritized interrupt support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_IRQPRIO
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    Enable support for prioritized interrupts.

    NOTE: The use of interrupt priorities implies that you also have support for nested interrupts. Most architectures do not support nesting of interrupts or, if they do, they only supported nested interrupts with certain configuration options. So this selection should be used with caution.

1.2.230 CONFIG_ARCH_STACKDUMP: Dump stack on assertions

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    Enable to do stack dumps after assertions. To see symbols on call stack dump, please enable DEBUG_DISPLAY_SYMBOL. It is possible to enable it when FS_ROMFS is enabled.

1.2.231 CONFIG_DEBUG_DISPLAY_SYMBOL: Display symbols on call stack dump

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_DEBUG_SYMBOLS, CONFIG_FRAME_POINTER
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_STACKDUMP, CONFIG_FS_ROMFS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    Enable to show symbol on call stack dump

1.2.232 CONFIG_ARCH_USBDUMP: Dump USB trace data

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV_TRACE
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    Enable to do USB trace after assertions

1.2.233 CONFIG_ENDIAN_BIG: Big Endian Architecture

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    Select if architecture operates using big-endian byte ordering.

1.2.234 CONFIG_ARCH_IDLE_CUSTOM: Custom IDLE loop

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    Each architecture provides a "default" IDLE loop that exits when the MCU has nothing else to do. This default IDLE loop can be replaced by a custom, board-specific IDLE loop by setting this option. Such a custom IDLE loop may do things like a continuous built-in test or perhaps or IDLE low power operations.

    NOTE: As of this writing, this capability is only supported by the STM32. However, the implementation is trivial: If CONFIG_ARCH_IDLE_CUSTOM, then the default IDLE loop file is not included in the MCU-specific Make.defs file.

1.2.235 CONFIG_ARCH_CUSTOM_PMINIT: Custom PM initialization

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PM
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    Each architecture provides default power management (PM) initialization that is called automatically when the system is started. This default PM initialization can be replaced by custom, board-specific PM initialization by setting this option. Such a custom initialization may do additional PM-related initialization that is unique to the board power management requirements.

    NOTE: As of this writing, this capability is only supported by the STM32. However, the implementation is trivial: If CONFIG_ARCH_CUSTOM_PMINIT, then the default PM initialization is not included in the MCU-specific Make.defs file.

1.2.236 CONFIG_ARCH_RAMFUNCS: Copy functions to RAM on startup

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_RAMFUNCS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    Copy some functions to RAM at boot time. This is done in some architectures to improve performance. In other cases, it is done so that FLASH can be reconfigured while the MCU executes out of SRAM.

1.2.237 CONFIG_ARCH_RAMVECTORS: Support RAM interrupt vectors

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_RAMVECTORS
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    If ARCH_RAMVECTORS is defined, then the architecture will support modifiable vectors in a RAM-based vector table.

1.2.238 CONFIG_BOARD_LOOPSPERMSEC: Delay loops per millisecond

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 5000
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    Simple delay loops are used by some logic, especially during boot-up, driver initialization. These delay loops must be calibrated for each board in order to assure accurate timing by the delay loops.

1.2.239 CONFIG_ARCH_CALIBRATION: Calibrate delay loop

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    Enables some built in instrumentation that causes a 100 second delay during boot-up. This 100 second delay serves no purpose other than it allows you to calibrate BOARD_LOOPSPERMSEC. You simply use a stop watch to measure the actual delay then adjust BOARD_LOOPSPERMSEC until the actual delay is 100 seconds.

1.2.240 CONFIG_ARCH_INTERRUPTSTACK: Interrupt Stack Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_INTERRUPTSTACK
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    This architecture supports an interrupt stack. If defined, this symbol will be the size of the interrupt stack in bytes. If not defined (or defined to be zero), the user task stacks will be used during interrupt handling.

1.2.241 CONFIG_ARCH_HIPRI_INTERRUPT: High priority interrupts

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARMV7M_USEBASEPRI, CONFIG_ARCH_IRQPRIO
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_HIPRI_INTERRUPT && CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_IRQPRIO
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    NOTE: This description is currently unique to the Cortex-M family which is the only family that currently supports this feature. The general feature is not conceptually unique to the Cortex-M but it is extended to any other family, then this discussion will have to be generalized.

    If ARMV7M_USEBASEPRI is selected, then interrupts will be disabled by setting the BASEPRI register to NVIC_SYSH_DISABLE_PRIORITY so that most interrupts will not have execution priority. SVCall must have execution priority in all cases.

    In the normal cases, interrupts are not nest-able and all interrupts run at an execution priority between NVIC_SYSH_PRIORITY_MIN and NVIC_SYSH_PRIORITY_MAX (with NVIC_SYSH_PRIORITY_MAX reserved for SVCall).

    If, in addition, ARCH_HIPRI_INTERRUPT is defined, then special high priority interrupts are supported. These are not "nested" in the normal sense of the word. These high priority interrupts can interrupt normal processing but execute outside of OS (although they can "get back into the game" via a PendSV interrupt).

    How do you specify a high priority interrupt? You need to do two things:

      1) You need to change the address in the vector table so that
the high priority interrupt vectors to your special C
interrupt handler.  There are two ways to do this:


      a) If you select CONFIG_ARCH_RAMVECTORS, then vectors will
be kept in RAM and the system will support the interface:


      int up_ramvec_attach(int irq, up_vector_t vector)


      that can be used to attach your C interrupt handler to the
vector at run time.


      b) Alternatively, you could keep your vectors in FLASH but in
order to this, you would have to develop your own custom
vector table.


      2) Then set the priority of your interrupt to NVIC to
NVIC_SYSH_HIGH_PRIORITY using the standard interface:


      int up_prioritize_irq(int irq, int priority)

    NOTE: ARCH_INTERRUPTSTACK must be set in kernel mode (BUILD_KERNEL). In kernel mode without an interrupt stack, the interrupt handler will set the MSP to the stack pointer of the interrupted thread. If the interrupted thread was a privileged thread, that will be the MSP otherwise it will be the PSP. If the PSP is used, then the value of the MSP will be invalid when the interrupt handler returns because it will be a pointer to an old position in the unprivileged stack. Then when the high priority interrupt occurs and uses this stale MSP, there will most likely be a system failure.

    If the interrupt stack is selected, on the other hand, then the interrupt handler will always set the the MSP to the interrupt stack. So when the high priority interrupt occurs, it will either use the MSP of the last privileged thread to run or, in the case of the nested interrupt, the interrupt stack if no privileged task has run

1.2.242 CONFIG_ARCH_INT_DISABLEALL: Disable high priority interrupts

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_HIPRI_INTERRUPT && CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    If ARCH_HIPRI_INTERRUPT is defined, then special high priority interrupts are supported. These are not "nested" in the normal sense of the word. These high priority interrupts can interrupt normal processing but execute outside of OS (although they can "get back into the game" via a PendSV interrupt).

    In the normal course of things, interrupts must occasionally be disabled using the irqsave() inline function to prevent contention in use of resources that may be shared between interrupt level and non-interrupt level logic. Now the question arises, if ARCH_HIPRI_INTERRUPT, do we disable all interrupts (except SVCall), or do we only disable the "normal" interrupts. Since the high priority interrupts cannot interact with the OS, you may want to permit the high priority interrupts even if interrupts are disabled. The setting ARCH_INT_DISABLEALL can be used to select either behavior:

    ----------------------------+--------------+---------------------------- CONFIG_ARCH_HIPRI_INTERRUPT | NO | YES ----------------------------+--------------+--------------+------------- CONFIG_ARCH_INT_DISABLEALL | N/A | YES | NO ----------------------------+--------------+--------------+------------- 

      |              |              |    SVCall
|    SVCall    |    SVCall    |    HIGH
    Disable here and below --------> MAXNORMAL ---> HIGH --------> MAXNORMAL 
      |              |    MAXNORMAL |
    ----------------------------+--------------+--------------+-------------

    NOTE: This does not work now because interrupts get disabled in the standard interrupt handling, prohibiting nesting. Fix is simple: Need to used more priority levels so that we can make a cleaner distinction with the standard interrupt handler.

1.2.243 Choice: Boot Mode

  • Default: BOOT_RUNFROMFLASH
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_BOOT_RUNFROMEXTSRAM: Run from external SRAM

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

      Some configuration support booting and running from external SRAM.

    CONFIG_BOOT_RUNFROMFLASH: Boot and run from flash

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

      Most configurations support XIP operation from FLASH but must copy initialized .data sections to RAM. (This is the default).

    CONFIG_BOOT_RUNFROMISRAM: Boot and run from internal SRAM

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

      Some configuration support booting and running from internal SRAM.

    CONFIG_BOOT_RUNFROMSDRAM: Boot and run from external SDRAM

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

      Some configuration support booting and running from external SDRAM.

    CONFIG_BOOT_COPYTORAM: Boot from FLASH but copy to ram

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

      Some configurations boot in FLASH but copy themselves entirely into RAM for better performance.

1.2.244 Menu: Boot Memory Configuration

  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

1.2.244.1 CONFIG_RAM_VSTART: Primary RAM start address (virtual)

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_USE_MMU
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    The virtual start address of installed primary RAM. "Primary" RAM refers to the RAM that you link program code into. If program code does not execute out of RAM but from FLASH, then you may designate any block of RAM as "primary."

1.2.244.2 CONFIG_RAM_REGIONx_START: An address or list of start address for RAM region

  • Type: String
  • Default: "0x00000000,"
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    The address or address list of the RAM regions. If you want to use more than two RAMs physically, or if you want to divide RAM into multiple heaps, set MM_REGIONS first at memory management, and then set hexa values at RAM_REGIONx_START and RAM_REGIONx_SIZE to support several heap regions. If it will be an address list, the addresses should be given by increasing order, and each region is separated by ',' as shown in example. i.e. "0x02000000,0x4000000"

1.2.244.3 CONFIG_RAM_REGIONx_SIZE: A size or list of size for RAM region

  • Type: String
  • Default: "0,"
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    The size list of RAM region. Refer RAM_REGIONx_START content. One different thing is this has decimal values (START has hexa values). This should have same number of list element with RAM_REGIONx_START's. If it will be an list, each region is separated by ',' as shown in example. i.e. "100,200"

1.2.244.4 CONFIG_RAM_REGIONx_HEAP_INDEX: List of heap index for RAM region

  • Type: String
  • Default: "0,"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MM_NHEAPS != CONFIG_1
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    The heap index list of RAM region. It means that its region can be handled to the index-th heap. Index can be from 0 to (MM_NHEAPS-1).

1.2.244.5 CONFIG_FS_TMPFS_HEAP_INDEX: TMPFS Heap index

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_TMPFS && CONFIG_MM_NHEAPS != CONFIG_1
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    when tmpfs uses an independent memory region. Specifies the index of the heap to allocate.

1.2.244.6 CONFIG_DDR: Use DDR memory

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    If the board uses external DDR RAM memory, enable this.

1.2.244.7 CONFIG_RAM_DDR_START: DDR RAM start address

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DDR
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    If the board uses external DDR RAM memory, you need to define the start address of DDR RAM

1.2.244.8 CONFIG_RAM_DDR_SIZE: DDR RAM size

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DDR
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    If the board uses external DDR RAM memory, you need to define the size of DDR RAM

1.2.244.9 CONFIG_FLASH_START: Boot FLASH start address (physical)

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_BOOT_RUNFROMFLASH
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    The physical start address of installed boot FLASH. "Boot" FLASH refers to the FLASH that you link program code into.

1.2.244.10 CONFIG_FLASH_VSTART: Boot FLASH start address (virtual)

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_BOOT_RUNFROMFLASH
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    The virtual start address of installed boot FLASH. "Boot" FLASH refers to the FLASH that you link program code into.

1.2.244.11 CONFIG_FLASH_SIZE: Boot FLASH size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_BOOT_RUNFROMFLASH
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    The size in bytes of the installed boot FLASH. "Boot" FLASH refers to the FLASH that you link program code into.

1.2.244.12 CONFIG_BOOT_SDRAM_DATA: Data in SDRAM

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_SDRAM && !CONFIG_BOOT_RUNFROMSDRAM
  • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    This selection should be set if data lies in SDRAM (vs. SRAM) and if SDRAM was not previously initialized by a loader. Obviously, this does not apply if we booting from SDRAM because SDRAM must have been initialized priority to loading TinyAra into SDRAM.

    In the case where SDRAM must be initialized by TinyAra, the initialization sequence is a little different: Normally, .data and .bss must be initialized before starting the system. But in this case SDRAM must be configured by board-specific logic before the .data and .bss sections can be initialized.

1.3 Menu: Board Selection

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.3.1 Choice: Select target board

  • Default: ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200
  • Kconfig file: ./board/Kconfig

    • Select the board hosting the architecture. You must first select the exact MCU part number, then the boards supporting that part will be available for selection. Use ARCH_BOARD_CUSTOM to create a new board configuration.

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ARTIK053: Samsung ARTIK-053 Starter Kit

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ARTIK05X_FAMILY
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_S5JT200
    • Kconfig file: ./board/Kconfig

      Samsung ARTIK-053 Starter Kit based on S5JT200 IoT WiFi MCU

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ARTIK053S: Samsung ARTIK-053S Starter Kit

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ARTIK05X_FAMILY
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_S5JT200
    • Kconfig file: ./board/Kconfig

      Samsung ARTIK-053S Starter Kit based on S5JT200 IoT WiFi MCU

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ARTIK055S: Samsung ARTIK-055S Starter Kit

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ARTIK05X_FAMILY
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_S5JT200
    • Kconfig file: ./board/Kconfig

      Samsung ARTIK-055S Starter Kit based on S5JT200 IoT WiFi MCU

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_LM3S6965EK: Stellaris LM3S6965 Evaluation Kit

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LEDS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM3S6965
    • Kconfig file: ./board/Kconfig

      Stellaris LM3S6965 Evaluation Kit. This board is based on the an ARM Cortex-M3 MCU, the Luminary/TI LM3S6965.

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200: Samsung S5JT200 sidk board

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_BUTTONS, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_IRQBUTTONS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_S5JT200
    • Kconfig file: ./board/Kconfig

      Samsung S5JT200 IoT wifi MCU

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_CY4390x: Cypress 4390x board

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_BCM4390X
    • Kconfig file: ./board/Kconfig

      Cypress 4390x IoT wifi MCU

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F407_DISC1: STMicro STM32F407-Discovery board

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LEDS, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_BUTTONS, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_IRQBUTTONS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32
    • Kconfig file: ./board/Kconfig

      STMicro STM32F407-DISC1 board based on the STMicro STM32F407VG MCU.

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F429I_DISCO: STMicro STM32F429I-Discovery board

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LEDS, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_BUTTONS, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_IRQBUTTONS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32
    • Kconfig file: ./board/Kconfig

      STMicro STM32F429I-Discovery board based on the STMicro STM32F429ZIT6 MCU.

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ESP32_DEVKITC: Espressif ESP32-DevKitC board

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ESP32_FAMILY
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_ESP32
    • Kconfig file: ./board/Kconfig

      Espressif esp32 WIFI/BLE MCU

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ESP_WROVER_KIT: Espressif ESP-WROVER-KIT board

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ESP32_FAMILY
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_ESP32
    • Kconfig file: ./board/Kconfig

      Espressif esp32 WIFI/BLE LCDs MCU

    CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_IMXRT1050_EVK: NXP i.MX RT 1050 EVK

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LEDS, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_BUTTONS, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_IRQBUTTONS
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_MIMXRT1052DVL6A
    • Kconfig file: ./board/Kconfig

      This is the board configuration for the port of TinyARA to the NXP i.MXRT evaluation kit, MIMXRT1050-EVKB. This board features the MIMXRT1052DVL6A MCU.

1.3.2 CONFIG_ARCH_LEDS: Board LED support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LEDS
  • Kconfig file: ./board/Kconfig

    Use board LEDs to show TinyAra execution status state. Unique to boards that have LEDs

1.3.3 CONFIG_ARCH_BUTTONS: Board button support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_BUTTONS
  • Kconfig file: ./board/Kconfig

    "Support interfaces to use buttons provided by the board."

1.3.4 CONFIG_ARCH_IRQBUTTONS: Button interrupt support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BUTTONS && CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_IRQBUTTONS
  • Kconfig file: ./board/Kconfig

    "Support interrupts on button presses and releases."

1.3.5 CONFIG_BOARD_CRASHDUMP: Enable Board level logging of crash dumps

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./board/Kconfig

    If selected up_asseert will call out to board_crashdump, in the case of an assertion failure, prior to calling exit. Or in the case of a hardfault prior to looping indefinitely. board_crashdump then has a chance to save the state of the machine.

    The purpose of board_crashdump is to save as much information as it can about the cause of the fault and then most likely reset the system.

    N.B. There is limited system resources that can be used, who knows what memory is trashed? So all we can expect to do is save the "machine state" in a place where on the next reset can write it to more sophisticated storage in a sane operating environment.

1.3.6 CONFIG_BOARD_ASSERT_AUTORESET: Reset a board on assert status automatically

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_BOARDCTL_RESET
  • Kconfig file: ./board/Kconfig

    Some cases do not need to stay assert status. This supports board reset.

1.3.7 CONFIG_LIB_BOARDCTL: Enable boardctl() interface

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./board/Kconfig

    Enables support for the boardctl() interface. Architecture specific logic must provide board_app_initialize() interface.

1.3.8 CONFIG_BOARDCTL_POWEROFF: Enable power off interfaces

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_LIB_BOARDCTL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_POWEROFF
  • Kconfig file: ./board/Kconfig

    Enables support for the BOARDIOC_POWEROFF boardctl() command. Architecture specific logic must provide the board_power_off() interface.

1.3.9 CONFIG_BOARDCTL_RESET: Enable reset interfaces

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_LIB_BOARDCTL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_RESET
  • Kconfig file: ./board/Kconfig

    Enables support for the BOARDIOC_RESET boardctl() command. Architecture specific logic must provide the board_reset() interface.

1.3.10 CONFIG_BOARDCTL_UNIQUEID: Return board unique ID

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_LIB_BOARDCTL
  • Kconfig file: ./board/Kconfig

    Enables support for the BOARDIOC_UNIQUEID boardctl() command. Architecture specific logic must provide the board_uniqueid() interface.

1.3.11 CONFIG_BOARDCTL_UNIQUEID_SIZE: Size of the board unique ID (bytes)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_LIB_BOARDCTL, CONFIG_BOARDCTL_UNIQUEID
  • Kconfig file: ./board/Kconfig

    Provides the size of the memory buffer that must be provided by the caller of board_uniqueid() in which to receive the board unique ID.

1.3.12 CONFIG_BOARD_FOTA_SUPPORT: Enable board support for FOTA

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_FOTA_DRIVER
  • Kconfig file: ./board/Kconfig

    If selected the board provides support for FOTA.

1.3.13 CONFIG_BOARD_COREDUMP_FLASH: Enable crashlog dump to flash

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_BOARD_CRASHDUMP
  • Kconfig file: ./board/Kconfig

    If selected it will dump the assert log information to flash.

1.3.14 CONFIG_BOARD_RAMDUMP_FLASH: Enable ramdump to flash

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_BOARD_CRASHDUMP
  • Kconfig file: ./board/Kconfig

    If selected it will dump the RAM contents to flash.

1.3.15 CONFIG_BOARD_RAMDUMP_UART: Enable ramdump via UART

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_BOARD_CRASHDUMP
  • Kconfig file: ./board/Kconfig

    If selected it will send the RAM dump via UART.

1.3.16 CONFIG_ARTIK05X_BOOT_FAILURE_DETECTION: Clear bootcount when boot completes

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ARTIK05X_FAMILY
  • Kconfig file: ./board/artik05x/Kconfig

    BL2 sets up a watchdog before it jumps to TinyARA to detect boot failures. On a successful boot, the secondary OS should turn the watchdog off and clear the bootcount register that stores the number of tries to boot. Otherwise, the watchdog will bark and BL2 may go into recovery mode.

1.3.17 CONFIG_ARTIK05X_BOOT_COUNTS_ADDR: Address of scratch pad register to store the bootcount

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x80090810
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ARTIK05X_FAMILY, CONFIG_ARTIK05X_BOOT_FAILURE_DETECTION
  • Kconfig file: ./board/artik05x/Kconfig

    The number of tries to boot will be stored in this address. On successful boot, it is cleared to zero. The register should be kept intact even on watchdog resets.

1.3.18 CONFIG_ARTIK05X_FLASH_CAPACITY: Size of external flash memory (in bytes)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8388608
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ARTIK05X_FAMILY, CONFIG_S5J_SFLASH
  • Kconfig file: ./board/artik05x/Kconfig

    Sets the capacity of the external flash memory on the ARTIK-05x Series Starter Kit board.

1.3.19 CONFIG_ARTIK05X_FLASH_PAGE_SIZE: Page size of external flash memory (in bytes)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4096
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ARTIK05X_FAMILY, CONFIG_S5J_SFLASH
  • Kconfig file: ./board/artik05x/Kconfig

    Sets the page size of the external flash memory on the ARTIK-05x Series Starter Kit board. It can be the size of erase unit flash memory supports.

1.3.20 CONFIG_ARTIK05X_AUTOMOUNT: Automount partitions

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ARTIK05X_FAMILY, CONFIG_FLASH_PARTITION , !CONFIG_DISABLE_MOUNTPOINT
  • Kconfig file: ./board/artik05x/Kconfig

    If enabled, mount userrw and sssrw partitions at boot.

1.3.21 CONFIG_ARTIK05X_AUTOMOUNT_USERFS: Automount user r/w partiton

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ARTIK05X_FAMILY, CONFIG_ARTIK05X_AUTOMOUNT , CONFIG_FS_SMARTFS
  • Kconfig file: ./board/artik05x/Kconfig

    If enabled, user r/w partition will be mounted automatically at boot.

1.3.22 CONFIG_ARTIK05X_AUTOMOUNT_USERFS_DEVNAME: Device name of the partition for user r/w file system

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/dev/smart0p8"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ARTIK05X_FAMILY, CONFIG_ARTIK05X_AUTOMOUNT_USERFS
  • Kconfig file: ./board/artik05x/Kconfig

    Specifies the device name (/dev/smart0pX) of the partition for user r/w file system. when SMARTFS_MULTI_ROOT_DIRS is enabled the device name will be appended by "d1" (/dev/smart0pxd1).

1.3.23 CONFIG_ARTIK05X_AUTOMOUNT_USERFS_MOUNTPOINT: Mountpoint of the partition for user r/w file system

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/mnt"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ARTIK05X_FAMILY, CONFIG_ARTIK05X_AUTOMOUNT_USERFS
  • Kconfig file: ./board/artik05x/Kconfig

    Specifies the mount point where user r/w file system will be mounted at.

1.3.24 CONFIG_ARTIK05X_AUTOMOUNT_SSSRW: Automount secure storage partiton

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ARTIK05X_FAMILY, CONFIG_ARTIK05X_AUTOMOUNT
  • Kconfig file: ./board/artik05x/Kconfig

    If enabled, secure storage partition will be mounted automatically at boot.

1.3.25 CONFIG_ARTIK05X_AUTOMOUNT_SSSRW_DEVNAME: Device name of the partition for secure storage

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/dev/smart0p10"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ARTIK05X_FAMILY, CONFIG_ARTIK05X_AUTOMOUNT_SSSRW
  • Kconfig file: ./board/artik05x/Kconfig

    Specifies the device name (/dev/smart0pX) of the partition for secure storage.

1.3.26 CONFIG_ARTIK05X_AUTOMOUNT_SSSRW_MOUNTPOINT: Mountpoint of the partition for secure storage

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/sss"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ARTIK05X_FAMILY, CONFIG_ARTIK05X_AUTOMOUNT_SSSRW
  • Kconfig file: ./board/artik05x/Kconfig

    Specifies the mount point where secure storage will be mounted at.

1.3.27 CONFIG_ARTIK05X_AUTOMOUNT_ROMFS: Automount romfs partiton

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ARTIK05X_FAMILY, CONFIG_ARTIK05X_AUTOMOUNT , CONFIG_FS_ROMFS
  • Kconfig file: ./board/artik05x/Kconfig

    If enabled, romfs partition will be mounted automatically at boot.

1.3.28 CONFIG_ARTIK05X_AUTOMOUNT_ROMFS_DEVNAME: Device name of the partition for romfs file system

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/dev/mtdblock9"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ARTIK05X_FAMILY, CONFIG_ARTIK05X_AUTOMOUNT_ROMFS
  • Kconfig file: ./board/artik05x/Kconfig

    Specifies the device name (/dev/mtdblock9) of the partition for romfs file system.

1.3.29 CONFIG_ARTIK05X_AUTOMOUNT_ROMFS_MOUNTPOINT: Mountpoint of the partition for romfs file system

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/rom"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ARTIK05X_FAMILY, CONFIG_ARTIK05X_AUTOMOUNT_ROMFS
  • Kconfig file: ./board/artik05x/Kconfig

    Specifies the mount point where romfs file system will be mounted at.

1.3.30 CONFIG_SVR_DB_SECURESTORAGE: Enable storing SVR DB inside secure storage partition

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ARTIK05X_FAMILY, (CONFIG_SUPPORT_FULL_SECURITY && CONFIG_ARTIK05X_AUTOMOUNT_SSSRW)
  • Kconfig file: ./board/artik05x/Kconfig

    If enabled, SVR DB is stored in secure storage partion mounted at the specified mount point.

1.3.31 CONFIG_ARTIK05X_RAMMTD_NEBLOCKS: RAM MTD erase block count

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ARTIK05X_FAMILY, CONFIG_RAMMTD
  • Kconfig file: ./board/artik05x/Kconfig

    Ramfs size will be RAMMTD_ERASESIZE * ARTIK05X_RAMMTD_NEBLOCKS. You have to consider total ramsize to alloc ramfs size.

1.3.32 CONFIG_ARTIK05X_RAMMTD_DEV_NUMBER: device number for mtd of smartfs

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 3
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ARTIK05X_FAMILY, CONFIG_RAMMTD
  • Kconfig file: ./board/artik05x/Kconfig

1.3.33 CONFIG_ARTIK05X_RAMMTD_DEV_POINT: Device name of the partition for ramfs r/w file system

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/dev/smart3"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ARTIK05X_FAMILY, CONFIG_RAMMTD
  • Kconfig file: ./board/artik05x/Kconfig

1.3.34 CONFIG_ARTIK05X_RAMMTD_MOUNT_POINT: Mountpoint of the partition for ramfs r/w file system

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/ramfs"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ARTIK05X_FAMILY, CONFIG_RAMMTD
  • Kconfig file: ./board/artik05x/Kconfig

1.3.35 Choice: Build for qemu hardware

  • Default: QEMU_NONE
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_LM3S6965EK, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_LM3S6965EK
  • Kconfig file: ./board/lm3s6965-ek/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_QEMU_SRAM: Build for SRAM increased QEMU Hardware

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_LM3S6965EK, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_LM3S6965EK
    • Kconfig file: ./board/lm3s6965-ek/Kconfig

      Build for SRAM increased QEMU Hardware.

    CONFIG_QEMU_SDRAM: Build for SDRAM(External RAM) enabled QEMU Hardware

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_LM3S6965EK, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_LM3S6965EK
    • Kconfig file: ./board/lm3s6965-ek/Kconfig

      Build for SDRAM(External RAM) enabled QEMU Hardware.

    CONFIG_QEMU_NONE: NONE

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_LM3S6965EK, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_LM3S6965EK
    • Kconfig file: ./board/lm3s6965-ek/Kconfig

      Dont build for Qemu Hardware.

1.3.36 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_TLC59116: Support TLC59116 IC

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200 , CONFIG_S5J_I2C
  • Kconfig file: ./board/sidk_s5jt200/Kconfig

    SIDK S5JT200 evaluation board has TLC59116 IC attached to its I2C bus. It can generate PWM signals to control RGB LEDs.

1.3.37 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_S8300: Support S8300 IC

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200 , CONFIG_S5J_PWM
  • Kconfig file: ./board/sidk_s5jt200/Kconfig

    SIDK S5JT200 evaluation board has S8300 linear LED driver IC which is driven by PWMs from S5J chipset.

1.3.38 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_M93C66WMN6T: Support M93C66WMN6T EEPROM

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200 , CONFIG_SPI_BITBANG , CONFIG_SPI_BITBANG_VARWIDTH
  • Kconfig file: ./board/sidk_s5jt200/Kconfig

    SIDK S5JT200 evaluation board has an SPI MicroWire serial access EEPROM attached to GPIO pins.

1.3.39 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_PWM_CHNUM: Number of PWM channel

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 6
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200 , CONFIG_S5J_PWM
  • Kconfig file: ./board/sidk_s5jt200/Kconfig

    Sets the number of pwm channel exposed on SIDK S5JT200 evaluation board

1.3.40 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_FLASH_CAPACITY: Size of external flash memory (in bytes)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8388608
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200 , CONFIG_S5J_SFLASH
  • Kconfig file: ./board/sidk_s5jt200/Kconfig

    Sets the capacity of the external flash memory on the SIDK S5JT200 evaluation board.

1.3.41 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_FLASH_PAGE_SIZE: Page size of external flash memory (in bytes)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4096
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200 , CONFIG_S5J_SFLASH
  • Kconfig file: ./board/sidk_s5jt200/Kconfig

    Sets the page size of the external flash memory on the SIDK S5JT200 evaluation board. It can be the size of erase unit flash memory supports.

1.3.42 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_FLASH_MINOR: Minor number for the FLASH /dev/smart entry

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200 , CONFIG_S5J_SFLASH
  • Kconfig file: ./board/sidk_s5jt200/Kconfig

    Sets the minor number for /dev node of the external flash device.

1.3.43 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_FLASH_PART: Enable partition support on FLASH

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_MTD_PARTITION, CONFIG_MTD_PROGMEM
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200 , CONFIG_S5J_SFLASH , CONFIG_NFILE_DESCRIPTORS != CONFIG_0
  • Kconfig file: ./board/sidk_s5jt200/Kconfig

    Enables creation of partitions on the FLASH

1.3.44 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_FLASH_PART_LIST: Flash partition size list (in KBytes)

  • Type: String
  • Default: "8192,"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200 , CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_FLASH_PART
  • Kconfig file: ./board/sidk_s5jt200/Kconfig

    Comma separated list of partition sizes in KB.

1.3.45 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_FLASH_PART_TYPE: Flash partition type list

  • Type: String
  • Default: "none,"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200
  • Kconfig file: ./board/sidk_s5jt200/Kconfig

    Comma separated list of partition types that can be one of followings: none, smartfs, config

1.3.46 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_FLASH_PART_NAME: FLash partition name list

  • Type: String
  • Default: "mx25,"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200 , CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_FLASH_PART , CONFIG_MTD_PARTITION_NAMES
  • Kconfig file: ./board/sidk_s5jt200/Kconfig

    Comma separated list of partition names.

1.3.47 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_AUTOMOUNT: Automount partitions

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200 , CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_FLASH_PART , !CONFIG_DISABLE_MOUNTPOINT
  • Kconfig file: ./board/sidk_s5jt200/Kconfig

    If enabled, mount userrw and sssrw partitions at boot.

1.3.48 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_AUTOMOUNT_ROMFS: Automount ROM read only partiton

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200 , CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_AUTOMOUNT , CONFIG_FS_ROMFS
  • Kconfig file: ./board/sidk_s5jt200/Kconfig

    If enabled, rom readonly partition will be mounted automatically at boot.

1.3.49 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_AUTOMOUNT_ROMFS_MOUNTPOINT: Mountpoint of the partition for rom read only file system

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/rom"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200 , CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_AUTOMOUNT_ROMFS
  • Kconfig file: ./board/sidk_s5jt200/Kconfig

    Specifies the mount point where rom readonly file system will be mounted at.

1.3.50 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_AUTOMOUNT_USERFS: Automount user r/w partiton

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200 , CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_AUTOMOUNT
  • Kconfig file: ./board/sidk_s5jt200/Kconfig

    If enabled, user r/w partition will be mounted automatically at boot.

1.3.51 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_AUTOMOUNT_USERFS_DEVNAME: Device name of the partition for user r/w file system

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/dev/smart0p13"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200 , CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_AUTOMOUNT_USERFS
  • Kconfig file: ./board/sidk_s5jt200/Kconfig

    Specifies the device name (/dev/smart0pX) of the partition for user r/w file system. when SMARTFS_MULTI_ROOT_DIRS config is enabled the device name will be appended by "d1" (/dev/smart0pxd1).

1.3.52 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_AUTOMOUNT_USERFS_MOUNTPOINT: Mountpoint of the partition for user r/w file system

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/mnt"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200 , CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_AUTOMOUNT_USERFS
  • Kconfig file: ./board/sidk_s5jt200/Kconfig

    Specifies the mount point where user r/w file system will be mounted at.

1.3.53 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_AUTOMOUNT_SSSRW: Automount sss r/w partiton

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200 , CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_AUTOMOUNT
  • Kconfig file: ./board/sidk_s5jt200/Kconfig

    If enabled, SSS r/w partition will be mounted automatically at boot.

1.3.54 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_AUTOMOUNT_SSSRW_DEVNAME: Device name of the partition for SSS r/w file system

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/dev/smart0p14"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200 , CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_AUTOMOUNT_SSSRW
  • Kconfig file: ./board/sidk_s5jt200/Kconfig

    Specifies the device name (/dev/smart0pX) of the partition for SSS r/w file system.

1.3.55 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_AUTOMOUNT_SSSRW_MOUNTPOINT: Mountpoint of the partition for SSS r/w file system

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/sss"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200 , CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_AUTOMOUNT_SSSRW
  • Kconfig file: ./board/sidk_s5jt200/Kconfig

    Specifies the mount point where SSS r/w file system will be mounted at.

1.3.56 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_RAMMTD_NEBLOCKS: RAM MTD erase block count

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200 , CONFIG_RAMMTD
  • Kconfig file: ./board/sidk_s5jt200/Kconfig

    Ramfs size will be RAMMTD_ERASESIZE * SIDK_S5JT200_RAMMTD_NEBLOCKS. You have to consider total ramsize to alloc ramfs size.

1.3.57 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_RAMMTD_DEV_NUMBER: device number for mtd of smartfs

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 3
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200 , CONFIG_RAMMTD
  • Kconfig file: ./board/sidk_s5jt200/Kconfig

1.3.58 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_RAMMTD_DEV_POINT: Device name of the partition for ramfs r/w file system

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/dev/smart3"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200 , CONFIG_RAMMTD
  • Kconfig file: ./board/sidk_s5jt200/Kconfig

1.3.59 CONFIG_SIDK_S5JT200_RAMMTD_MOUNT_POINT: Mountpoint of the partition for ramfs r/w file system

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/ramfs"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_SIDK_S5JT200 , CONFIG_RAMMTD
  • Kconfig file: ./board/sidk_s5jt200/Kconfig

1.3.60 CONFIG_STM32F429I_DISCO_FLASH: MTD driver for external 8Mbyte SST25 FLASH on SPI4

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_MTD_SST25XX, CONFIG_MTD_SMART, CONFIG_FS_SMARTFS, CONFIG_STM32_SPI4, CONFIG_MTD_BYTE_WRITE
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F429I_DISCO, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F429I_DISCO
  • Kconfig file: ./board/stm32f429i-disco/Kconfig

    Configures an MTD device for use with the onboard flash

1.3.61 CONFIG_STM32F429I_DISCO_FLASH_MINOR: Minor number for the FLASH /dev/smart entry

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F429I_DISCO, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F429I_DISCO , CONFIG_STM32F429I_DISCO_FLASH
  • Kconfig file: ./board/stm32f429i-disco/Kconfig

    Sets the minor number for the FLASH MTD /dev entry

1.3.62 CONFIG_STM32F429I_DISCO_FLASH_PART: Enable partition support on FLASH

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F429I_DISCO, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F429I_DISCO , CONFIG_STM32F429I_DISCO_FLASH
  • Kconfig file: ./board/stm32f429i-disco/Kconfig

    Enables creation of partitions on the FLASH

1.3.63 CONFIG_STM32F429I_DISCO_FLASH_CONFIG_PART: Create application config data partition on FLASH

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F429I_DISCO, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F429I_DISCO , CONFIG_STM32F429I_DISCO_FLASH_PART , CONFIG_PLATFORM_CONFIGDATA
  • Kconfig file: ./board/stm32f429i-disco/Kconfig

    Enables creation of a /dev/config partition on the FLASH

1.3.64 CONFIG_STM32F429I_DISCO_FLASH_CONFIG_PART_NUMBER: Index number of config partition (in list below)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F429I_DISCO, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F429I_DISCO , CONFIG_STM32F429I_DISCO_FLASH_CONFIG_PART
  • Kconfig file: ./board/stm32f429i-disco/Kconfig

    Specifies the index number of the config data partition from the partition list.

1.3.65 CONFIG_STM32F429I_DISCO_FLASH_PART_LIST: Flash partition size list

  • Type: String
  • Default: "4,8188"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F429I_DISCO, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F429I_DISCO , CONFIG_STM32F429I_DISCO_FLASH_PART
  • Kconfig file: ./board/stm32f429i-disco/Kconfig

    Comma separated list of partition sizes in KB.

1.3.66 CONFIG_STM32F429I_DISCO_FLASH_PART_NAMES: Flash partition name list

  • Type: String
  • Default: "config,rfs"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F429I_DISCO, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F429I_DISCO , CONFIG_STM32F429I_DISCO_FLASH_PART , CONFIG_MTD_PARTITION_NAMES
  • Kconfig file: ./board/stm32f429i-disco/Kconfig

    Comma separated list of partition names.

1.3.67 CONFIG_STM32F429I_DISCO_RAMMTD: MTD driver for SMARTFS RAM disk

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_RAMMTD
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F429I_DISCO, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F429I_DISCO
  • Kconfig file: ./board/stm32f429i-disco/Kconfig

    Configures an MTD based RAM device for use with SMARTFS.

1.3.68 CONFIG_STM32F429I_DISCO_RAMMTD_MINOR: Minor number for RAM /dev/smart entry

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F429I_DISCO, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F429I_DISCO , CONFIG_STM32F429I_DISCO_RAMMTD
  • Kconfig file: ./board/stm32f429i-disco/Kconfig

    Sets the minor number for the RAM MTD /dev entry

1.3.69 CONFIG_STM32F429I_DISCO_RAMMTD_SIZE: Size in KB of the RAM device to create

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 32
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F429I_DISCO, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F429I_DISCO , CONFIG_STM32F429I_DISCO_RAMMTD
  • Kconfig file: ./board/stm32f429i-disco/Kconfig

    Sets the size of static RAM allocation for the SMART RAM device

1.3.70 CONFIG_PM_BUTTONS: PM Button support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F429I_DISCO, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F429I_DISCO , CONFIG_PM && CONFIG_ARCH_IRQBUTTONS
  • Kconfig file: ./board/stm32f429i-disco/Kconfig

    Enable PM button EXTI interrupts to support PM testing

1.3.71 CONFIG_PM_BUTTON_ACTIVITY: Button PM activity weight

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 10
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F429I_DISCO, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F429I_DISCO , CONFIG_PM_BUTTONS
  • Kconfig file: ./board/stm32f429i-disco/Kconfig

    The activity weight to report to the power management subsystem when a button is pressed.

1.3.72 CONFIG_PM_ALARM_SEC: PM_STANDBY delay (seconds)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 15
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F429I_DISCO, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_STM32F429I_DISCO , CONFIG_PM && CONFIG_RTC_ALARM
  • Kconfig file: ./board/stm32f429i-disco/Kconfig

    Number of seconds to wait in PM_STANDBY before going to PM_STANDBY mode.

1.3.73 CONFIG_PM_ALARM_NSEC: PM_STANDBY delay (nanoseconds)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
