    This selection enables configuration of a real time clock (RTCdriver. See include/tinyara/rtc.h for further watchdog timer driver information. Most RTC drivers are MCU specific and may require other specific settings.

1.6.68 CONFIG_RTC_DATETIME: Date/Time RTC Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_RTC
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/Kconfig

    There are two general types of RTC: (1) A simple battery backed counter that keeps the time when power is down, and (2) a full date / time RTC the provides the date and time information, often in BCD format. If RTC_DATETIME is selected, it specifies this second kind of RTC.

1.6.69 CONFIG_RTC_HIRES: Hi-Res RTC Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_RTC, !CONFIG_RTC_DATETIME
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/Kconfig

    If RTC_DATETIME not selected, then the simple, battery backed counter is used. There are two different implementations of such simple counters based on the time resolution of the counter: The typical RTC keeps time to resolution of 1 second, usually supporting a 32-bit time_t value.

1.6.70 CONFIG_RTC_FREQUENCY: Hi-Res RTC frequency

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_RTC, !CONFIG_RTC_DATETIME , CONFIG_RTC_HIRES
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/Kconfig

    If RTC_HIRES is defined, then the frequency of the high resolution RTC must be provided. If RTC_HIRES is not defined, RTC_FREQUENCY is assumed to be one Hz.

1.6.71 CONFIG_RTC_ALARM: RTC Alarm Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_RTC
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/Kconfig

    Enable if the RTC hardware supports setting of an alarm. A callback function will be executed when the alarm goes off.

1.6.72 CONFIG_RTC_DRIVER: RTC Driver Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_RTC
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/Kconfig

    This selection enables building of the "upper-half" RTC driver. See os/include/tinyara/rtc.h for further RTC driver information.

1.6.73 CONFIG_RTC_PERIODIC: RTC Periodic Interrupts

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_RTC, CONFIG_RTC_DRIVER , CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/Kconfig

    Add interrupt controls for RTCs that support periodic interrupts.

1.6.74 CONFIG_RTC_ONESEC: RTC Once-per-second interrupts

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_RTC, CONFIG_RTC_DRIVER , CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/Kconfig

    Add interrupt controls for RTCs that support once-per-second interrupts.

1.6.75 CONFIG_RTC_EPOCHYEAR: RTC epoch year

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_RTC, CONFIG_RTC_DRIVER , CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/Kconfig

    Add controls for RTCs that support epoch year settings.

    Many RTCs encode the year in an 8-bit register which is either interpreted as an 8-bit binary number or as a BCD number. In both cases, the number is interpreted relative to this RTC's Epoch. The RTC's Epoch is initialized to 1900 on most systems but on Alpha and MIPS it might also be initialized to 1952, 1980, or 2000, depending on the value of an RTC register for the year. With some RTCs, these operations can be used to read or to set the RTC's Epoch, respectively.

1.6.76 CONFIG_RTC_IOCTL: RTC IOCTLs

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_RTC, CONFIG_RTC_DRIVER
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/Kconfig

    Support the RTC interface ioctl() method. This allows you to add architecture-specific RTC operations to the RTC interface

1.6.77 CONFIG_WATCHDOG: Watchdog Timer Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/Kconfig

    This selection enables building of the "upper-half" watchdog timer driver. See include/tinyara/watchdog.h for further watchdog timer driver information.

1.6.78 CONFIG_WATCHDOG_DEVPATH: Watchdog Device Path

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/dev/watchdog0"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_WATCHDOG
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/Kconfig

1.6.79 CONFIG_TIMER: Timer Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/Kconfig

    This selection enables building of the "upper-half" timer driver. See include/tinyara/timer.h for further timer driver information.

1.6.80 CONFIG_ANALOG: Analog Device(ADC/DAC) Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/Kconfig

    This directory holds implementations of analog device drivers. This includes drivers for Analog to Digital Conversion (ADC)as well as drivers for Digital to Analog Conversion (DAC). See include/tinyara/analog/*.h for registration information.

1.6.81 CONFIG_ADC: Analog-to-Digital Conversion

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ANALOG
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/analog/Kconfig

    Select to enable support for analog input device support. This includes not only Analog-to-Digital Converters (ADC) but also amplifiers and analog multiplexers.

1.6.82 CONFIG_ADC_FIFOSIZE: ADC buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ANALOG, CONFIG_ADC
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/analog/Kconfig

    This variable defines the size of the ADC ring buffer that is used to queue received ADC data until they can be retrieved by the application by reading from the ADC character device. NOTE: Since this is a ring buffer, the actual number of bytes that can be retained in buffer is (ADC_FIFOSIZE - 1).

1.6.83 CONFIG_DAC: Digital-to-Analog Conversion

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ANALOG
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/analog/Kconfig

    Select to enable support for Digital-to-Analog Converters (DACs).

1.6.84 CONFIG_NETDEVICES: Network Device/PHY Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default Values:
    • Default: n

      Dependency: !CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_PHY

    • Default: y

      Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_PHY

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/Kconfig

    Network interface driver and PHY selections. This options enables selection of drivers for external Ethernet MAC chips. The majority of MCUs, however, have built-in, internal Ethernet MAC peripherals and that Ethernet support is selected in the MCU-specific configuration menus.

    Most Ethernet MAC drivers, whether internal or external, will require configuration of an external PHY device. That external PHY device is also selected via this menu.

1.6.85 CONFIG_NETDEV_TELNET: Telnet driver

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    The Telnet driver generates a character driver instance to support a Telnet session. This driver is used by the Telnet daemon. The Telnet daeman will instantiate a new Telnet driver to support standard I/O on the new Telnet session.

1.6.86 CONFIG_NETDEV_MULTINIC: Multiple NIC support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    Select this option if you board and/or MCU are capable of supporting multiple Ethernet MAC drivers.

1.6.87 CONFIG_NET_DUMPPACKET: Enable packet dumping

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    Some Ethernet MAC drivers supporting dumping of received and transmitted packets as a debug option. This setting enables that debug option. Also needs DEBUG.

1.6.88 CONFIG_NET_DM90x0: Davicom dm9000/dm9010 support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    References: Davicom data sheets (DM9000-DS-F03-041906.pdf, DM9010-DS-F01-103006.pdf) and looking at lots of other DM90x0 drivers.

1.6.89 CONFIG_DM9X_BASE: DM90x0 base address

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_NET_DM90x0
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

1.6.90 CONFIG_DM9X_IRQ: DM90x0 IRQ number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_NET_DM90x0
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

1.6.91 Choice: DM90x0 bus width

  • Default: DM9X_BUSWIDTH16
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_NET_DM90x0
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_DM9X_BUSWIDTH8: 8-bits

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_NET_DM90x0
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    CONFIG_DM9X_BUSWIDTH16: 16-bits

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_NET_DM90x0
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    CONFIG_DM9X_BUSWIDTH32: 32-bits

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_NET_DM90x0
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

1.6.92 CONFIG_DM9X_CHECKSUM: Checksum enable

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_NET_DM90x0
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

1.6.93 CONFIG_DM9X_ETRANS: TX poll

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_NET_DM90x0
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

1.6.94 Choice: DM90x0 mode

  • Default: DM9X_MODE_AUTO
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_NET_DM90x0
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_DM9X_MODE_AUTO: Autonegotion

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_NET_DM90x0
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    CONFIG_DM9X_MODE_10MHD: 10BaseT half duplex

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_NET_DM90x0
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    CONFIG_DM9X_MODE_10MFD: 10BaseT full duplex

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_NET_DM90x0
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    CONFIG_DM9X_MODE_100MHD: 100BaseT half duplex

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_NET_DM90x0
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    CONFIG_DM9X_MODE_100MFD: 100BaseT full duplex

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_NET_DM90x0
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

1.6.95 CONFIG_DM9X_NINTERFACES: Nubmer of DM90x0 interfaces

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_NET_DM90x0 , CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

1.6.96 CONFIG_DM9X_STATS: DM90x0 statistics

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_NET_DM90x0
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

1.6.97 CONFIG_NET_CS89x0: CS89x0 support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    Under construction -- do not use

1.6.98 CONFIG_ENC28J60: Microchip ENC28J60 support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SPI
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    References: ENC28J60 Data Sheet, Stand-Alone Ethernet Controller with SPI Interface, DS39662C, 2008 Microchip Technology Inc.

1.6.99 CONFIG_ENC28J60_NINTERFACES: Number of physical ENC28J60

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Range: 1 - 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_ENC28J60
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    Specifies the number of physical ENC28J60 devices that will be supported.

1.6.100 CONFIG_ENC28J60_SPIMODE: SPI mode

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_ENC28J60
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    Controls the SPI mode. The ENC28J60 spec says that it supports SPI mode 0,0 only: "The implementation used on this device supports SPI mode 0,0 only. In addition, the SPI port requires that SCK be at Idle in a low state; selectable clock polarity is not supported." However, sometimes you need to tinker with these things.

1.6.101 CONFIG_ENC28J60_FREQUENCY: SPI frequency

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 20000000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_ENC28J60
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    Define to use a different bus frequency

1.6.102 CONFIG_ENC28J60_STATS: Link statistics support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_ENC28J60
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    Collect network statistics

1.6.103 CONFIG_ENC28J60_HALFDUPPLEX: Enable half dupplex

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_ENC28J60
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    Default is full duplex

1.6.104 CONFIG_ENC28J60_DUMPPACKET: Dump Packets

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_ENC28J60
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    If selected, the ENC28J60 driver will dump the contents of each packet to the console.

1.6.105 CONFIG_ENC28J60_REGDEBUG: Register-Level Debug

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_ENC28J60 , CONFIG_DEBUG && CONFIG_DEBUG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    Enable very low-level register access debug. Depends on DEBUG and DEBUG_NET.

1.6.106 CONFIG_ENC28J60_USE_PBUF: Enable PBUF based packet transmission

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_ENC28J60
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    Enable PBUF based packet transmission required for LWIP network stack.

1.6.107 CONFIG_ENCX24J600: Microchip ENCX24J600 support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SPI, CONFIG_NET_RXAVAIL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    References: ENC424J600/624J600 Data Sheet Stand-Alone 10/100 Ethernet Controller with SPI or Parallel Interface DS39935B, 2009 Microchip Technology Inc.

1.6.108 CONFIG_ENC28J60_NINTERFACES: Number of physical ENCX24J600

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Range: 1 - 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_ENCX24J600
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    Specifies the number of physical ENCX24J600 devices that will be supported.

1.6.109 CONFIG_ENCX24J600_SPIMODE: SPI mode

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_ENCX24J600
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    Controls the SPI mode. The ENCX24J600 spec says that it supports SPI mode 0,0 only: "The implementation used on this device supports SPI mode 0,0 only. In addition, the SPI port requires that SCK be at Idle in a low state; selectable clock polarity is not supported." However, sometimes you need to tinker with these things.

1.6.110 CONFIG_ENCX24J600_FREQUENCY: SPI frequency

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 14000000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_ENCX24J600
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    Define to use a different bus frequency

1.6.111 CONFIG_ENCX24J600_NRXDESCR: Descriptor Count

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_ENCX24J600
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    Defines how many descriptors are preallocated for the transmission and reception queues. The ENC has a relative large packet buffer of 24kB which can be used to buffer multiple packets silmutaneously

1.6.112 CONFIG_ENCX24J600_STATS: Network statistics support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_ENCX24J600
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    Collect network statistics

1.6.113 CONFIG_ENCX24J600_DUMPPACKET: Dump Packets

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_ENCX24J600
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    If selected, the ENCX24J600 driver will dump the contents of each packet to the console.

1.6.114 CONFIG_ENCX24J600_REGDEBUG: Register-Level Debug

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_ENCX24J600 , CONFIG_DEBUG && CONFIG_DEBUG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    Enable very low-level register access debug. Depends on DEBUG and DEBUG_NET.

1.6.115 CONFIG_NET_E1000: E1000 support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

1.6.116 CONFIG_E1000_N_TX_DESC: Number of TX descriptors

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 128
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_NET_E1000
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

1.6.117 CONFIG_E1000_N_RX_DESC: Number of RX descriptors

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 128
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_NET_E1000
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

1.6.118 CONFIG_E1000_BUFF_SIZE: Buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2048
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_NET_E1000
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

1.6.119 CONFIG_NET_SLIP: SLIP (serial line) support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    Reference: RFC 1055

1.6.120 CONFIG_NET_VNET: VNET support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

1.6.121 CONFIG_VNET_NINTERFACES: Number of VNET interfaces

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_NET_VNET
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

1.6.122 Choice: Board PHY Selection (ETH0)

  • Default: ETH0_PHY_NONE
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_PHY
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    • Identify the PHY on your board. This setting is not used by all Ethernet drivers nor do all Ethernet drivers support all PHYs.

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_ETH0_PHY_NONE: No PHY support

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_PHY
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ETH0_PHY_AM79C874: AMD Am79C874 PHY

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_PHY
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ETH0_PHY_KS8721: Micrel KS8721 PHY

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_PHY
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ETH0_PHY_KSZ8051: Micrel KSZ8051 PHY

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_PHY
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ETH0_PHY_KSZ8081: Micrel KSZ8081 PHY

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_PHY
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ETH0_PHY_KSZ90x1: Micrel KSZ9021/31 PHY

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_PHY
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ETH0_PHY_DP83848C: National Semiconduction DP83848C PHY

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_PHY
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ETH0_PHY_LAN8720: SMSC LAN8720 PHY

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_PHY
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ETH0_PHY_DM9161: Davicom DM9161 PHY

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_PHY
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

1.6.123 Choice: Board PHY Selection (ETH1)

  • Default: ETH1_PHY_NONE
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_PHY , CONFIG_NETDEV_MULTINIC
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    • Identify the PHY on your board. This setting is not used by all Ethernet drivers nor do all Ethernet drivers support all PHYs.

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_ETH1_PHY_NONE: No PHY support

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_PHY
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ETH1_PHY_AM79C874: AMD Am79C874 PHY

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_PHY
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ETH1_PHY_KS8721: Micrel KS8721 PHY

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_PHY
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ETH1_PHY_KSZ8051: Micrel KSZ8051 PHY

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_PHY
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ETH1_PHY_KSZ8081: Micrel KSZ8081 PHY

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_PHY
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ETH1_PHY_KSZ90x1: Micrel KSZ9021/31 PHY

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_PHY
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ETH1_PHY_DP83848C: National Semiconduction DP83848C PHY

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_PHY
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ETH1_PHY_LAN8720: SMSC LAN8720 PHY

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_PHY
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ETH1_PHY_DM9161: Davicom DM9161 PHY

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_PHY
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

1.6.124 CONFIG_NETDEV_PHY_DEBUG: PHY debug

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEVICES, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_PHY , CONFIG_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/net/Kconfig

    Normally debug output is controlled by DEBUG_NET. However, that may generate a LOT of debug output, especially if DEBUG_VERBOSE is also selected. This option is intended to force VERVOSE debug output from certain PHY-related even if DEBUG_NET or DEBUG_VERBOSE are not selected.

1.6.125 CONFIG_PIPES: FIFO and named pipe drivers

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/Kconfig

    FIFO and named pipe drivers. Standard interfaces are declared in include/unistd.h

1.6.126 CONFIG_DEV_PIPE_SIZE: Default pipe size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1024
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PIPES
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/pipes/Kconfig

    Sets the default size of the pipe ringbuffer in bytes. A value of zero disables pipe support.

1.6.127 CONFIG_POWER: Power Management Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/Kconfig

    Enable building of power-related devices (battery monitors, chargers, etc).

1.6.128 CONFIG_BATTERY_CHARGER: Battery Charger support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_POWER
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/power/Kconfig

1.6.129 CONFIG_BATTERY_GAUGE: Battery Fuel Gauge support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_POWER
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/power/Kconfig

1.6.130 CONFIG_SERIAL: Serial Driver Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/Kconfig

    Front-end character drivers for chip-specific UARTs.

1.6.131 CONFIG_DEV_LOWCONSOLE: Low-level console support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_LOWPUTC , CONFIG_DEV_CONSOLE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Use the simple, low-level, write-only serial console driver (minimal support)

1.6.132 CONFIG_16550_UART: 16550 UART Chip support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.6.133 CONFIG_16550_UART0: 16550 UART0

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.6.134 CONFIG_16550_UART0_BASE: 16550 UART0 base address

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART0
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.6.135 CONFIG_16550_UART0_CLOCK: 16550 UART0 clock

  • Type: Integer
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART0
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.6.136 CONFIG_16550_UART0_IRQ: 16550 UART0 IRQ number

  • Type: Integer
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART0
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.6.137 CONFIG_16550_UART0_BAUD: 16550 UART0 BAUD

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 115200
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART0
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.6.138 CONFIG_16550_UART0_PARITY: 16550 UART0 parity

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Range: 0 - 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART0
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    16550 UART0 parity. 0=None, 1=Odd, 2=Even. Default: None

1.6.139 CONFIG_16550_UART0_BITS: 16550 UART0 number of bits

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART0
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    16550 UART0 number of bits. Default: 8

1.6.140 CONFIG_16550_UART0_2STOP: 16550 UART0 two stop bits

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART0
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    0=1 stop bit, 1=Two stop bits. Default: 1 stop bit

1.6.141 CONFIG_16550_UART0_RXBUFSIZE: 16550 UART0 Rx buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART0
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    16550 UART0 Rx buffer size. Default: 256

1.6.142 CONFIG_16550_UART0_TXBUFSIZE: 16550 UART0 Tx buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART0
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    16550 UART0 Tx buffer size. Default: 256

1.6.143 CONFIG_16550_UART0_IFLOWCONTROL: 16550 UART0 RTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_IFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART0
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Enable 16550 UART0 RTS flow control

1.6.144 CONFIG_16550_UART0_OFLOWCONTROL: 16550 UART0 CTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_OFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART0
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Enable 16550 UART0 CTS flow control

1.6.145 CONFIG_16550_UART1: 16550 UART1

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.6.146 CONFIG_16550_UART1_BASE: 16550 UART1 base address

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART1
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.6.147 CONFIG_16550_UART1_CLOCK: 16550 UART1 clock

  • Type: Integer
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART1
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.6.148 CONFIG_16550_UART1_IRQ: 16550 UART1 IRQ number

  • Type: Integer
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART1
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.6.149 CONFIG_16550_UART1_BAUD: 16550 UART1 BAUD

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 115200
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART1
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.6.150 CONFIG_16550_UART1_PARITY: 16550 UART1 parity

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Range: 0 - 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART1
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    16550 UART1 parity. 0=None, 1=Odd, 2=Even. Default: None

1.6.151 CONFIG_16550_UART1_BITS: 16550 UART1 number of bits

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART1
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    16550 UART1 number of bits. Default: 8

  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART1
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    0=1 stop bit, 1=Two stop bits. Default: 1 stop bit

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART1
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    16550 UART1 Rx buffer size. Default: 256

  • Default: 256

  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    16550 UART1 Tx buffer size. Default: 256

  • Type: Boolean

  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

  • Default: 115200

  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    0=1 stop bit, 1=Two stop bits. Default: 1 stop bit

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART2
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    16550 UART2 Rx buffer size. Default: 256

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART2
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    16550 UART2 Tx buffer size. Default: 256

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_IFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART2
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.6.168 CONFIG_16550_UART2_OFLOWCONTROL: 16550 UART2 CTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART2
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.6.169 CONFIG_16550_UART3: 16550 UART3

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART3
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

  • Type: Integer
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART3
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.6.172 CONFIG_16550_UART3_IRQ: 16550 UART3 IRQ number

  • Type: Integer
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART3
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.6.173 CONFIG_16550_UART3_BAUD: 16550 UART3 BAUD

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 115200
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART3
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.6.174 CONFIG_16550_UART3_PARITY: 16550 UART3 parity

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Range: 0 - 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART3
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    16550 UART3 parity. 0=None, 1=Odd, 2=Even. Default: None

1.6.175 CONFIG_16550_UART3_BITS: 16550 UART3 number of bits

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART3
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    16550 UART3 number of bits. Default: 8

1.6.176 CONFIG_16550_UART3_2STOP: 16550 UART3 two stop bits

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART3
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    0=1 stop bit, 1=Two stop bits. Default: 1 stop bit

1.6.177 CONFIG_16550_UART3_RXBUFSIZE: 16550 UART3 Rx buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART3
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    16550 UART3 Rx buffer size. Default: 256

1.6.178 CONFIG_16550_UART3_TXBUFSIZE: 16550 UART3 Tx buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART3
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    16550 UART3 Tx buffer size. Default: 256

1.6.179 CONFIG_16550_UART3_IFLOWCONTROL: 16550 UART3 RTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_IFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART3
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Enable 16550 UART3 RTS flow control

1.6.180 CONFIG_16550_UART3_OFLOWCONTROL: 16550 UART3 CTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_OFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART3
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Enable 16550 UART3 CTS flow control

1.6.181 Choice: 16550 Serial Console

  • Default: 16550_NO_SERIAL_CONSOLE
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_DEV_CONSOLE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_16550_UART0_SERIAL_CONSOLE: 16550 UART0 serial console

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART0
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_16550_UART1_SERIAL_CONSOLE: 16550 UART1 serial console

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART1
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_16550_UART2_SERIAL_CONSOLE: 16550 UART2 serial console

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART2
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_16550_UART3_SERIAL_CONSOLE: 16550 UART3 serial console

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART , CONFIG_16550_UART3
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_16550_NO_SERIAL_CONSOLE: No 16550 serial console

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.6.182 CONFIG_16550_SUPRESS_CONFIG: Suppress 16550 configuration

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    This option is useful, for example, if you are using a bootloader that configures the 16550_UART. In that case, you may want to just leave the existing console configuration in place. Default: n

1.6.183 CONFIG_16550_REGINCR: Address increment between 16550 registers

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    The address increment between 16550 registers. Options are 1, 2, or 4. Default: 1

1.6.184 CONFIG_16550_REGWIDTH: Bit width of 16550 registers

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    The bit width of registers. Options are 8, 16, or 32. Default: 8

1.6.185 CONFIG_16550_ADDRWIDTH: Address width of 16550 registers

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_16550_UART
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    The bit width of registers. Options are 8, 16, or 32. Default: 8

1.6.186 CONFIG_USART0_ISUART: USART0 is a UART

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Selects: CONFIG_MCU_SERIAL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_USART0
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.6.187 CONFIG_USART1_ISUART: USART1 is a UART

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Selects: CONFIG_MCU_SERIAL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_USART1
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.6.188 CONFIG_USART2_ISUART: USART2 is a UART

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Selects: CONFIG_MCU_SERIAL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_USART2
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.6.189 CONFIG_USART3_ISUART: USART3 is a UART

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Selects: CONFIG_MCU_SERIAL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_USART3
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.6.190 CONFIG_USART4_ISUART: USART4 is a UART

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Selects: CONFIG_MCU_SERIAL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_USART4
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.6.191 CONFIG_USART5_ISUART: USART5 is a UART

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Selects: CONFIG_MCU_SERIAL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_USART5
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.6.192 CONFIG_USART6_ISUART: USART6 is a UART

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Selects: CONFIG_MCU_SERIAL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_USART6
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.6.193 CONFIG_USART7_ISUART: USART7 is a UART

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Selects: CONFIG_MCU_SERIAL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_USART7
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.6.194 CONFIG_USART8_ISUART: USART8 is a UART

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Selects: CONFIG_MCU_SERIAL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_USART8
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.6.195 CONFIG_STANDARD_SERIAL: Enable standard \"upper-half\" serial driver

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default Values:
    • Default: y

      Dependency: CONFIG_MCU_SERIAL

    • Default: n

      Dependency: !CONFIG_MCU_SERIAL

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, !CONFIG_DEV_LOWCONSOLE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Enable the standard, upper-half serial driver used by most MCU serial peripherals.

1.6.196 CONFIG_SERIAL_NPOLLWAITERS: Number of poll threads

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, !CONFIG_DISABLE_POLL && CONFIG_STANDARD_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Maximum number of threads than can be waiting for POLL events. Default: 2

1.6.197 CONFIG_SERIAL_IFLOWCONTROL_WATERMARKS: RX flow control watermarks

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_SERIAL_IFLOWCONTROL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Call the "lower half" rxflowcontrol method whenever the number of characters in the serial RX buffer falls above an upper water mark level or below a lower watermark level. The default behavior is to call the rxflowcontrol method only when the RX buffer is empty or full.

1.6.198 CONFIG_SERIAL_IFLOWCONTROL_LOWER_WATERMARK: RX lower Watermark (percent)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 10
  • Range: 0 - 100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_SERIAL_IFLOWCONTROL_WATERMARKS
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Call the rxflowcontrol method then there are this amount (or or less) data buffered in the serial drivers RX buffer. This is expressed as a percentage of the total size of the RX buffer which may vary from instance-to-instance.

1.6.199 CONFIG_SERIAL_IFLOWCONTROL_UPPER_WATERMARK: RX upper Watermark (percent)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 90
  • Range: 0 - 100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_SERIAL_IFLOWCONTROL_WATERMARKS
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Call the rxflowcontrol method then there are this amount (or more) data buffered in the serial drivers RX buffer. This is expressed as a percentage of the total size of the RX buffer which may vary from instance-to-instance.

1.6.200 CONFIG_SERIAL_TIOCSERGSTRUCT: Support TIOCSERGSTRUCT

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_DEBUG && (CONFIG_MCU_SERIAL || CONFIG_16550_UART)
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    As a debug option, many serial bottom half drivers support the TIOCSERGSTRUCT that allows you to get the internal driver data structure. By default, this IOCTL is not supported in order to reduce footprint. But if (1) the driver supports the TIOCSERGSTRUCT ioctl, and (2) this option is selected, then support for the TIOCSERGSTRUCT will be enabled.

1.6.201 CONFIG_SERIAL_TERMIOS: Serial TERMIOS support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_SERIAL_TERMIOS
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Serial driver supports termios.h interfaces (tcsetattr, tcflush, etc.). If this is not defined, then the terminal settings (baud, parity, etc). are not configurable at runtime; serial streams cannot be flushed, etc..

1.6.202 Choice: Serial console

  • Default Values:
    • Default: NO_SERIAL_CONSOLE

      Dependency: !CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_OTHER_UART && !CONFIG_OTHER_UART_SERIALDRIVER

    • Default: OTHER_SERIAL_CONSOLE

      Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_OTHER_UART || CONFIG_OTHER_UART_SERIALDRIVER

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_MCU_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_UART_SERIAL_CONSOLE: UART

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_CONSOLE
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART || CONFIG_UART_SERIALDRIVER
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_UART0_SERIAL_CONSOLE: UART0

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_CONSOLE
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART0
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_USART0_SERIAL_CONSOLE: USART0

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_CONSOLE
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_USART0_ISUART
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_UART1_SERIAL_CONSOLE: UART1

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_CONSOLE
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART1
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_USART1_SERIAL_CONSOLE: USART1

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_CONSOLE
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_USART1_ISUART
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_UART2_SERIAL_CONSOLE: UART2

    • Type: Boolean

    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART2
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_CONSOLE

    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_UART3_SERIAL_CONSOLE: UART3

    • Type: Boolean

    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_USART3_SERIAL_CONSOLE: USART3

    • Type: Boolean

    CONFIG_UART4_SERIAL_CONSOLE: UART4

    CONFIG_USART5_SERIAL_CONSOLE: USART5

    CONFIG_UART6_SERIAL_CONSOLE: UART6

    CONFIG_UART7_SERIAL_CONSOLE: UART7

    CONFIG_USART7_SERIAL_CONSOLE: USART7

    • Type: Boolean

    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_UART8_SERIAL_CONSOLE: UART8

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART8
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_USART8_SERIAL_CONSOLE: USART8

    • Type: Boolean

    CONFIG_SCI0_SERIAL_CONSOLE: SCI0

    CONFIG_SCI1_SERIAL_CONSOLE: SCI1

    • Type: Boolean

    CONFIG_LPUART1_SERIAL_CONSOLE: LPUART1

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_CONSOLE
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_LPUART1_SERIALDRIVER
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_LPUART2_SERIAL_CONSOLE: LPUART2

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_CONSOLE
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_LPUART2_SERIALDRIVER
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_LPUART3_SERIAL_CONSOLE: LPUART3

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_CONSOLE
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_LPUART3_SERIALDRIVER
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    CONFIG_NO_SERIAL_CONSOLE: No serial console

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.6.203 Menu: UART Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART || CONFIG_UART_SERIALDRIVER
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.6.203.1 CONFIG_UART_RXBUFSIZE: Receive buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Characters are buffered as they are received. This specifies the size of the receive buffer.

1.6.203.2 CONFIG_UART_TXBUFSIZE: Transmit buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Characters are buffered before being sent. This specifies the size of the transmit buffer.

1.6.203.3 CONFIG_UART_BAUD: BAUD rate

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 115200
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    The configured BAUD of the UART.

1.6.203.4 CONFIG_UART_BITS: Character size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    The number of bits. Must be either 7 or 8.

1.6.203.5 CONFIG_UART_PARITY: Parity setting

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Range: 0 - 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    0=no parity, 1=odd parity, 2=even parity

1.6.203.6 CONFIG_UART_2STOP: use 2 stop bits

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    1=Two stop bits

1.6.203.7 CONFIG_UART_IFLOWCONTROL: UART RTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_IFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Enable UART RTS flow control

1.6.203.8 CONFIG_UART_OFLOWCONTROL: UART CTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_OFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Enable UART CTS flow control

1.6.204 Menu: UART0 Configuration

  • Default: 0
  • Range: 0 - 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    0=no parity, 1=odd parity, 2=even parity

  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    1=Two stop bits

1.6.204.7 CONFIG_UART0_IFLOWCONTROL: UART0 RTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_IFLOWCONTROL

  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.6.204.8 CONFIG_UART0_OFLOWCONTROL: UART0 CTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Enable UART0 CTS flow control

1.6.205 Menu: UART0 Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_UART0_SERIALDRIVER
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-uart

1.6.205.1 CONFIG_UART0_RXBUFSIZE: Receive buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-uart

    Characters are buffered as they are received. This specifies the size of the receive buffer.

1.6.205.2 CONFIG_UART0_TXBUFSIZE: Transmit buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-uart

    Characters are buffered before being sent. This specifies the size of the transmit buffer.

1.6.205.3 CONFIG_UART0_BAUD: BAUD rate

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 115200
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-uart

    The configured BAUD of the UART.

1.6.205.4 CONFIG_UART0_BITS: Character size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-uart

    The number of bits. Must be either 7 or 8.

1.6.205.5 CONFIG_UART0_PARITY: Parity setting

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Range: 0 - 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-uart

    0=no parity, 1=odd parity, 2=even parity

1.6.205.6 CONFIG_UART0_2STOP: use 2 stop bits

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-uart

    1=Two stop bits

1.6.205.7 CONFIG_UART0_IFLOWCONTROL: UART0 RTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_IFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-uart

    Enable UART0 RTS flow control

1.6.205.8 CONFIG_UART0_OFLOWCONTROL: UART0 CTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_OFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-uart

    Enable UART0 CTS flow control

1.6.205.9 CONFIG_UART0_DMA: UART0 DMA support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_DMA
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-uart

    Enable DMA transfers on UART0

1.6.206 Menu: UART1 Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_UART1_SERIALDRIVER
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-uart

1.6.206.1 CONFIG_UART1_RXBUFSIZE: Receive buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-uart

    Characters are buffered as they are received. This specifies the size of the receive buffer.

1.6.206.2 CONFIG_UART1_TXBUFSIZE: Transmit buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-uart

    Characters are buffered before being sent. This specifies the size of the transmit buffer.

1.6.206.3 CONFIG_UART1_BAUD: BAUD rate

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 115200
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-uart

    The configured BAUD of the UART.

1.6.206.4 CONFIG_UART1_BITS: Character size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-uart

    The number of bits. Must be either 7 or 8.

1.6.206.5 CONFIG_UART1_PARITY: Parity setting

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Range: 0 - 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-uart

    0=no parity, 1=odd parity, 2=even parity

1.6.206.6 CONFIG_UART1_2STOP: Uses 2 stop bits

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-uart

    1=Two stop bits

1.6.206.7 CONFIG_UART1_IFLOWCONTROL: UART1 RTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_IFLOWCONTROL

  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-uart

    Enable UART1 RTS flow control

  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_OFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-uart

    Enable UART1 CTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_DMA
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-uart

    Enable DMA transfers on UART1

1.6.207 Menu: UART2 Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_UART2_SERIALDRIVER
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-uart

1.6.207.1 CONFIG_UART2_RXBUFSIZE: Receive buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-uart

    Characters are buffered as they are received. This specifies the size of the receive buffer.

1.6.207.2 CONFIG_UART2_TXBUFSIZE: Transmit buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-uart

    Characters are buffered before being sent. This specifies the size of the transmit buffer.

1.6.207.3 CONFIG_UART2_BAUD: BAUD rate

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 115200
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-uart

    The configured BAUD of the UART.

1.6.207.4 CONFIG_UART2_BITS: Character size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-uart

    The number of bits. Must be either 7 or 8.

1.6.207.5 CONFIG_UART2_PARITY: Parity setting

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Range: 0 - 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-uart

    0=no parity, 1=odd parity, 2=even parity

1.6.207.6 CONFIG_UART2_2STOP: Uses 2 stop bits

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-uart

    1=Two stop bits

1.6.207.7 CONFIG_UART2_IFLOWCONTROL: UART2 RTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_IFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-uart

    Enable UART2 RTS flow control

1.6.207.8 CONFIG_UART2_OFLOWCONTROL: UART2 CTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_OFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-uart

    Enable UART2 CTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_DMA
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-uart

    Enable DMA transfers on UART2

  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_DMA
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-lpuart

    Enable DMA transfers on LPUART2

1.6.217 Menu: LPUART3 Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_LPUART3_SERIALDRIVER
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-lpuart

1.6.217.1 CONFIG_LPUART3_RXBUFSIZE: Receive buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-lpuart

    Characters are buffered as they are received. This specifies the size of the receive buffer.

1.6.217.2 CONFIG_LPUART3_TXBUFSIZE: Transmit buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-lpuart

    Characters are buffered before being sent. This specifies the size of the transmit buffer.

1.6.217.3 CONFIG_LPUART3_BAUD: BAUD rate

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 115200
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-lpuart

    The configured BAUD of the LPUART.

1.6.217.4 CONFIG_LPUART3_BITS: Character size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-lpuart

    The number of bits. Must be either 7 or 8.

1.6.217.5 CONFIG_LPUART3_PARITY: Parity setting

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Range: 0 - 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-lpuart

    0=no parity, 1=odd parity, 2=even parity

1.6.217.6 CONFIG_LPUART3_2STOP: Uses 2 stop bits

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-lpuart

    1=Two stop bits

1.6.217.7 CONFIG_LPUART3_IFLOWCONTROL: LPUART3 RTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_IFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-lpuart

    Enable LPUART3 RTS flow control

1.6.217.8 CONFIG_LPUART3_OFLOWCONTROL: LPUART3 CTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_OFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-lpuart

    Enable LPUART3 CTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_DMA
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-lpuart

    Enable DMA transfers on LPUART3

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Characters are buffered as they are received. This specifies the size of the receive buffer.

1.6.227.2 CONFIG_USART2_TXBUFSIZE: Transmit buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Characters are buffered before being sent. This specifies the size of the transmit buffer.

1.6.227.3 CONFIG_USART2_BAUD: BAUD rate

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 115200
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    The configured BAUD of the USART.

1.6.227.4 CONFIG_USART2_BITS: Character size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    The number of bits. Must be either 7 or 8.

1.6.227.5 CONFIG_USART2_PARITY: Parity setting

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Range: 0 - 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    0=no parity, 1=odd parity, 2=even parity

1.6.227.6 CONFIG_USART2_2STOP: Uses 2 stop bits

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    1=Two stop bits

1.6.227.7 CONFIG_USART2_IFLOWCONTROL: USART2 RTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_IFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Enable USART2 RTS flow control

1.6.227.8 CONFIG_USART2_OFLOWCONTROL: USART2 CTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_OFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Enable USART2 CTS flow control

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    0=no parity, 1=odd parity, 2=even parity

1.6.238.6 CONFIG_USART8_2STOP: Uses 2 stop bits

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    1=Two stop bits

1.6.238.7 CONFIG_USART8_IFLOWCONTROL: USART8 RTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_IFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Enable USART8 RTS flow control

1.6.238.8 CONFIG_USART8_OFLOWCONTROL: USART8 CTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_OFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Enable USART8 CTS flow control

1.6.239 Menu: UART8 Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_UART8
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.6.239.1 CONFIG_UART8_RXBUFSIZE: Receive buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Characters are buffered as they are received. This specifies the size of the receive buffer.

1.6.239.2 CONFIG_UART8_TXBUFSIZE: Transmit buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Characters are buffered before being sent. This specifies the size of the transmit buffer.

1.6.239.3 CONFIG_UART8_BAUD: BAUD rate

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 115200
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    The configured BAUD of the UART.

1.6.239.4 CONFIG_UART8_BITS: Character size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    The number of bits. Must be either 7 or 8.

1.6.239.5 CONFIG_UART8_PARITY: Parity setting

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Range: 0 - 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    0=no parity, 1=odd parity, 2=even parity

1.6.239.6 CONFIG_UART8_2STOP: Uses 2 stop bits

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    1=Two stop bits

1.6.239.7 CONFIG_UART8_IFLOWCONTROL: UART8 RTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_IFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Enable UART8 RTS flow control

1.6.239.8 CONFIG_UART8_OFLOWCONTROL: UART8 CTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_OFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Enable UART8 CTS flow control

1.6.240 Menu: SCI0 Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_SCI0
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.6.240.1 CONFIG_SCI0_RXBUFSIZE: SCI0 receive buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Characters are buffered as they are received. This specifies the size of the receive buffer.

1.6.240.2 CONFIG_SCI0_TXBUFSIZE: SCI0 transmit buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Characters are buffered before being sent. This specifies the size of the transmit buffer.

1.6.240.3 CONFIG_SCI0_BAUD: SCI0 BAUD rate

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 115200
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    The configured BAUD of the SCI.

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    The number of bits. Must be either 7 or 8.

1.6.240.5 CONFIG_SCI0_PARITY: Parity setting

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Range: 0 - 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    0=no parity, 1=odd parity, 2=even parity

1.6.240.6 CONFIG_SCI0_2STOP: SCI0 use 2 stop bits

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    1=Two stop bits

1.6.241 Menu: SCI1 Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_SCI1
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

1.6.241.1 CONFIG_SCI1_RXBUFSIZE: SCI1 receive buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Characters are buffered as they are received. This specifies the size of the receive buffer.

1.6.241.2 CONFIG_SCI1_TXBUFSIZE: SCI1 transmit buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    Characters are buffered before being sent. This specifies the size of the transmit buffer.

1.6.241.3 CONFIG_SCI1_BAUD: SCI1 BAUD rate

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 115200
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    The configured BAUD of the SCI.

1.6.241.4 CONFIG_SCI1_BITS: SCI1 character size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    The number of bits. Must be either 7 or 8.

1.6.241.5 CONFIG_SCI1_PARITY: Parity setting

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Range: 0 - 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    0=no parity, 1=odd parity, 2=even parity

1.6.241.6 CONFIG_SCI1_2STOP: SCI1 use 2 stop bits

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig

    1=Two stop bits

1.6.242 CONFIG_SENSOR: Sensor Driver Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/Kconfig

    This selection enables building of the sensor driver.

1.6.243 CONFIG_SENSOR_PPD42NS: Shinyei PPD42NS Dust Sensor

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_GPIO
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SENSOR
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/sensors/Kconfig

    Enable driver support for the Shinyei PPD42NS Dust Sensor

1.6.244 CONFIG_SENSOR_PPD42NS_GPIO_NUM: PPD42NS GPIO Pin Number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 58
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SENSOR, CONFIG_SENSOR_PPD42NS
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/sensors/Kconfig

    the pin number of GPIO that is connected to PPD42NS's Dust Signal Pin

1.6.245 CONFIG_SENSOR_PPD42NS_DEBUG: PPD42NS driver debug message

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SENSOR, CONFIG_SENSOR_PPD42NS
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/sensors/Kconfig

    enable PPD42ns dust sensor driver's debug message

1.6.246 CONFIG_USBDEV: USB Device Driver Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/Kconfig

    USB device drivers. See also include/tinyara/usb/usbdev.h

1.6.247 CONFIG_USBDEV_ISOCHRONOUS: Enable isochronous

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Build in extra support for isochronous endpoints

1.6.248 CONFIG_USBDEV_DUALSPEED: Enable high and full speed

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Hardware handles high and full speed operation (USB 2.0)

1.6.249 Choice: Select USB device powered

  • Default: USBDEV_SELFPOWERED
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_USBDEV_SELFPOWERED: Self powered

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

      Will cause USB features to indicate that the device is self-powered

    CONFIG_USBDEV_BUSPOWERED: Bus powered

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

      Will cause USB features to indicate that the device is self-powered

1.6.250 CONFIG_USBDEV_MAXPOWER: Maximum power consumption in mA

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Maximum power consumption in mA. This selection should only apply if the device is bus powered (USBDEV_BUSPOWERED). It is, however, used unconditionally in several USB device drivers.

1.6.251 CONFIG_USBDEV_DMA: Enable DMA methods

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Select this enable DMA-related methods in USB device controller driver interface. These methods include the DMA buffer allocation methods: allobuffer() and freebuffer().

    The USB class driver allocates packet I/O buffers for data transfer by calling the driver allocbuffer() and freebuffer() methods. Those methods are only available if USBDEV_DMA is defined in the system configuration.

1.6.252 CONFIG_USBDEV_DMAMEMORY: Board DMA Allocation Hooks

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBDEV_DMA
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The USB class driver allocates packet I/O buffers for data transfer by calling the driver allocbuffer() and freebuffer() methods. Those methods are only available if USBDEV_DMA is defined in the system configuration.

    If USBDEV_DMAMEMORY is also defined in the TinyAra configuration, then the driver implementations of the allocbuffer() and freebuffer() methods may use board-specific usbdev_dma_alloc() and usbdev_dma_free(). If USBDEV_DMA and USBDEV_DMAMEMORY are both defined, then the board- specific logic must provide the functions usbdev_dma_alloc() and usbdev_dma_free(): usbdev_dma_alloc() will allocate DMA-capable memory of the specified size; usbdev_dma_free() is the corresponding function that will be called to free the DMA-capable memory.

1.6.253 CONFIG_USBDEV_TRACE: Enable USB tracing for debug

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Enables USB tracing for debug

1.6.254 CONFIG_USBDEV_TRACE_NRECORDS: Number of trace entries to remember

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 128
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBDEV_TRACE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Number of trace entries to remember

1.6.255 CONFIG_USBDEV_TRACE_STRINGS: Decode device controller events

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBDEV_TRACE || CONFIG_DEBUG_USB
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    If USBDEV_TRACE_STRINGS is defined, then the USB device controller driver must provide arrays of strings to support decoding of device- specific trace events. These arrays of strings (and the type struct trace_msg_t) are defined in include/tinyara/usb/usbdev_trace.h:

    #ifdef CONFIG_USBDEV_TRACE_STRINGS extern const struct trace_msg_t g_usb_trace_strings_deverror[]; extern const struct trace_msg_t g_usb_trace_strings_intdecode[]; #endif

1.6.256 CONFIG_USBDEV_TRACE_INITIALIDSET: Initial enable bits

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBDEV_TRACE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    This is the set of initial USB features that are enabled at boot time. See the event ID class bit definitions in include/tinyara/usbdev_trace.h.

1.6.257 CONFIG_USBDEV_COMPOSITE: USB composite device support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Enables USB composite device support

1.6.258 CONFIG_COMPOSITE_IAD: Use Interface Associate Descriptor (IAD)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBDEV_COMPOSITE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    If one of the members of the composite has multiple interfaces (such as CDC/ACM), then an Interface Association Descriptor (IAD) will be necessary. Default: IAD will be used automatically if needed. It should not be necessary to set this.

1.6.259 CONFIG_COMPOSITE_EP0MAXPACKET: Max packet size for endpoint 0

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBDEV_COMPOSITE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Max packet size for endpoint 0

1.6.260 CONFIG_COMPOSITE_VENDORID: Composite vendor ID

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBDEV_COMPOSITE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

1.6.261 CONFIG_COMPOSITE_VENDORSTR: Composite vendor ID

  • Type: String
  • Default: "NuttX"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBDEV_COMPOSITE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The vendor ID code/string

1.6.262 CONFIG_COMPOSITE_PRODUCTID: Composite product id

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBDEV_COMPOSITE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

1.6.263 CONFIG_COMPOSITE_PRODUCTSTR: Composite product string

  • Type: String
  • Default: "Composite device"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBDEV_COMPOSITE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The product ID code/string

1.6.264 CONFIG_COMPOSITE_SERIALSTR: Composite serial string

  • Type: String
  • Default: "001"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBDEV_COMPOSITE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Device serial number string

1.6.265 CONFIG_COMPOSITE_CONFIGSTR: Configuration string

  • Type: String
  • Default: "NuttX COMPOSITE config"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBDEV_COMPOSITE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Configuration string

1.6.266 CONFIG_COMPOSITE_VERSIONNO: Composite version number

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x1010
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBDEV_COMPOSITE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Interface version number.

1.6.267 CONFIG_PL2303: Prolific PL2303 serial/USB converter emulation

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_REMOVABLE
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    This logic emulates the Prolific PL2303 serial/USB converter

1.6.268 CONFIG_PL2303_CONSOLE: PL2303 console device

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_PL2303
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Register the USB device as /dev/console so that is will be used as the console device.

1.6.269 CONFIG_PL2303_EPINTIN: Interrupt IN endpoint number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_PL2303
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

1.6.270 CONFIG_PL2303_EPBULKOUT: Bulk OUT endpoint number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_PL2303
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

1.6.271 CONFIG_PL2303_EPBULKIN: Bulk IN endpoint number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 3
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_PL2303
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

1.6.272 CONFIG_PL2303_EP0MAXPACKET: Packet and request buffer sizes

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_PL2303
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

1.6.273 CONFIG_PL2303_NWRREQS: Number of read requests that can be in flight

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_PL2303
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The number of read requests that can be in flight

1.6.274 CONFIG_PL2303_NRDREQS: Number of write requests that can be in flight

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_PL2303
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The number of write/read requests that can be in flight

1.6.275 CONFIG_PL2303_BULKIN_REQLEN: Size of one write request buffer

  • Type: Integer
  • Default Values:
    • Default: 768

      Dependency: CONFIG_USBDEV_DUALSPEED

    • Default: 96

      Dependency: !CONFIG_USBDEV_DUALSPEED

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_PL2303
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Ideally, the BULKOUT request size should *not* be the same size as the maxpacket size. That is because IN transfers of exactly the maxpacket size will be followed by a NULL packet. The BULKOUT, on the other hand, request buffer size is always the same as the maxpacket size.

    There is also no reason from PL2303_BULKIN_REQLEN to be greater than PL2303_TXBUFSIZE-1, since a request larger than the TX buffer can never be sent.

1.6.276 CONFIG_PL2303_RXBUFSIZE: Receive buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default Values:
    • Default: 513

      Dependency: CONFIG_USBDEV_DUALSPEED

    • Default: 257

      Dependency: !CONFIG_USBDEV_DUALSPEED

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_PL2303
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Size of the serial receive buffers. The actual amount of data that can be held in the buffer is this number minus one due to the way that the circular buffer is managed. So an RX buffer size of 257 will hold four full-speed, 64 byte packets; a buffer size of 513 will hold one high-speed, 512 byte packet.

1.6.277 CONFIG_PL2303_TXBUFSIZE: Transmit buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default Values:
    • Default: 769

      Dependency: CONFIG_USBDEV_DUALSPEED

    • Default: 193

      Dependency: !CONFIG_USBDEV_DUALSPEED

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_PL2303
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Size of the serial transmit buffers. The actual amount of data that can be held in the buffer is this number minus one due to the way that the circular buffer is managed. So a TX buffer size of 769 will hold one request of size 768; a buffer size of 193 will hold two requests of size 96 bytes.

1.6.278 CONFIG_PL2303_VENDORID: Vendor ID

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x067b
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_PL2303
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

1.6.279 CONFIG_PL2303_PRODUCTID: Product ID

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x2303
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_PL2303
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

1.6.280 CONFIG_PL2303_VENDORSTR: Vendor string

  • Type: String
  • Default: "NuttX"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_PL2303
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

1.6.281 CONFIG_PL2303_PRODUCTSTR: Product string

  • Type: String
  • Default: "PL2303 Emulation"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_PL2303
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

1.6.282 CONFIG_CDCACM: USB Modem (CDC ACM) support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_REMOVABLE
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Enables USB Modem (CDC ACM) support

1.6.283 CONFIG_CDCACM_CONSOLE: CDC/ACM console device

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Register the USB device as /dev/console so that is will be used as the console device.

1.6.284 CONFIG_CDCACM_IFLOWCONTROL: CDC/ACM RTS flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SERIAL_IFLOWCONTROL
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM , CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Enable CDC/ACM RTS flow control

1.6.285 CONFIG_CDCACM_COMPOSITE: CDC/ACM composite support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM , CONFIG_USBDEV_COMPOSITE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Configure the CDC serial driver as part of a composite driver (only if USBDEV_COMPOSITE is also defined)

1.6.286 CONFIG_CDCACM_IFNOBASE: Offset the CDC/ACM interface numbers

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM , CONFIG_CDCACM_COMPOSITE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    If the CDC driver is part of a composite device, then this may need to be defined to offset the CDC/ACM interface numbers so that they are unique and contiguous. When used with the Mass Storage driver, the correct value for this offset is zero.

1.6.287 CONFIG_CDCACM_STRBASE: Offset the CDC/ACM string numbers

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM , CONFIG_CDCACM_COMPOSITE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    If the CDC driver is part of a composite device, then this may need to be defined to offset the CDC/ACM string numbers so that they are unique and contiguous. When used with the Mass Storage driver, the correct value for this offset is four (this value actuallly only needs to be defined if names are provided for the Notification interface, config CDCACM_NOTIFSTR, or the data interface, CDCACM_DATAIFSTR).

1.6.288 CONFIG_CDCACM_EP0MAXPACKET: Endpoint 0 max packet size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Endpoint 0 max packet size. Default 64.

1.6.289 CONFIG_CDCACM_EPINTIN: Interrupt IN endpoint number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The logical 7-bit address of a hardware endpoint that supports interrupt IN operation. Default 1.

1.6.290 CONFIG_CDCACM_EPINTIN_FSSIZE: Interupt IN full speed MAXPACKET size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Max package size for the interrupt IN endpoint if full speed mode. Default 64.

1.6.291 CONFIG_CDCACM_EPINTIN_HSSIZE: Interupt IN high speed MAXPACKET size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Max package size for the interrupt IN endpoint if high speed mode. Default 64.

1.6.292 CONFIG_CDCACM_EPBULKOUT: Bulk OUT endpoint number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 3
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The logical 7-bit address of a hardware endpoint that supports bulk OUT operation. Default: 3

1.6.293 CONFIG_CDCACM_EPBULKOUT_FSSIZE: Bulk OUT full speed MAXPACKET size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Max package size for the bulk OUT endpoint if full speed mode. Default 64.

1.6.294 CONFIG_CDCACM_EPBULKOUT_HSSIZE: Bulk OUT out high speed MAXPACKET size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 512
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Max package size for the bulk OUT endpoint if high speed mode. Default 512.

1.6.295 CONFIG_CDCACM_EPBULKIN: Bulk IN endpoint number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The logical 7-bit address of a hardware endpoint that supports bulk IN operation. Default: 2

1.6.296 CONFIG_CDCACM_EPBULKIN_FSSIZE: Bulk IN full speed MAXPACKET size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Max package size for the bulk IN endpoint if full speed mode. Default 64.

1.6.297 CONFIG_CDCACM_EPBULKIN_HSSIZE: Bulk IN high speed MAXPACKET size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 512
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Max package size for the bulk IN endpoint if high speed mode. Default 512.

1.6.298 CONFIG_CDCACM_NWRREQS: Number of read requests that can be in flight

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The number of read requests that can be in flight

1.6.299 CONFIG_CDCACM_NRDREQS: Number of write requests that can be in flight

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The number of write/read requests that can be in flight

1.6.300 CONFIG_CDCACM_BULKIN_REQLEN: Size of one write request buffer

  • Type: Integer
  • Default Values:
    • Default: 768

      Dependency: CONFIG_USBDEV_DUALSPEED

    • Default: 96

      Dependency: !CONFIG_USBDEV_DUALSPEED

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Ideally, the BULKOUT request size should *not* be the same size as the maxpacket size. That is because IN transfers of exactly the maxpacket size will be followed by a NULL packet. The BULKOUT, on the other hand, request buffer size is always the same as the maxpacket size.

    There is also no reason from CDCACM_BULKIN_REQLEN to be greater than CDCACM_TXBUFSIZE-1, since a request larger than the TX buffer can never be sent.

1.6.301 CONFIG_CDCACM_RXBUFSIZE: Receive buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default Values:
    • Default: 513
