      Dependency: CONFIG_USBDEV_DUALSPEED

    • Default: 257

      Dependency: !CONFIG_USBDEV_DUALSPEED

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Size of the serial receive buffers. The actual amount of data that can be held in the buffer is this number minus one due to the way that the circular buffer is managed. So an RX buffer size of 257 will hold four full-speed, 64 byte packets; a buffer size of 513 will hold one high-speed, 512 byte packet.

1.6.302 CONFIG_CDCACM_TXBUFSIZE: Transmit buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default Values:
    • Default: 769

      Dependency: CONFIG_USBDEV_DUALSPEED

    • Default: 193

      Dependency: !CONFIG_USBDEV_DUALSPEED

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Size of the serial transmit buffers. The actual amount of data that can be held in the buffer is this number minus one due to the way that the circular buffer is managed. So a TX buffer size of 769 will hold one request of size 768; a buffer size of 193 will hold two requests of size 96 bytes.

1.6.303 CONFIG_CDCACM_VENDORID: Vendor ID

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0525
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The vendor ID code/string. Default 0x0525 and "NuttX" 0x0525 is the Netchip vendor and should not be used in any products. This default VID was selected for compatibility with the Linux CDC ACM default VID.

1.6.304 CONFIG_CDCACM_PRODUCTID: Product ID

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0xa4a7
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The product ID code/string. Default 0xa4a7 and "CDC/ACM Serial" 0xa4a7 was selected for compatibility with the Linux CDC ACM default PID.

1.6.305 CONFIG_CDCACM_VENDORSTR: Vendor string

  • Type: String
  • Default: "NuttX"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

1.6.306 CONFIG_CDCACM_PRODUCTSTR: Product string

  • Type: String
  • Default: "CDC/ACM Serial"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_CDCACM
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

1.6.307 CONFIG_USBMSC: USB Mass storage class device

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_FS_READABLE, CONFIG_FS_WRITABLE
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    References: "Universal Serial Bus Mass Storage Class, Specification Overview," Revision 1.2, USB Implementer's Forum, June 23, 2003.

    "Universal Serial Bus Mass Storage Class, Bulk-Only Transport," Revision 1.0, USB Implementer's Forum, September 31, 1999.

    "SCSI Primary Commands - 3 (SPC-3)," American National Standard for Information Technology, May 4, 2005

    "SCSI Primary Commands - 4 (SPC-4)," American National Standard for Information Technology, July 19, 2008

    "SCSI Block Commands -2 (SBC-2)," American National Standard for Information Technology, November 13, 2004

    "SCSI Multimedia Commands - 3 (MMC-3)," American National Standard for Information Technology, November 12, 2001

1.6.308 CONFIG_USBMSC_COMPOSITE: Mass storage composite support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBMSC , CONFIG_USBDEV_COMPOSITE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Configure the mass storage driver as part of a composite driver (only if USBDEV_COMPOSITE is also defined)

1.6.309 CONFIG_USBMSC_IFNOBASE: Offset the mass storage interface number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBMSC , CONFIG_USBMSC_COMPOSITE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    If the CDC driver is part of a composite device, then this may need to be defined to offset the mass storage interface number so that it is unique and contiguous. When used with the CDC/ACM driver, the correct value for this offset is two (because of the two CDC/ACM interfaces that will precede it).

1.6.310 CONFIG_USBMSC_STRBASE: Offset the mass storage string numbers

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBMSC , CONFIG_USBMSC_COMPOSITE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    If the CDC driver is part of a composite device, then this may need to be defined to offset the mass storage string numbers so that they are unique and contiguous. When used with the CDC/ACM driver, the correct value for this offset is four (or perhaps 5 or 6, depending on if CDCACM_NOTIFSTR or CDCACM_DATAIFSTR are defined).

1.6.311 CONFIG_USBMSC_EP0MAXPACKET: Max packet size for endpoint 0

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Max packet size for endpoint 0

1.6.312 CONFIG_USBMSC_EPBULKOUT: Bulk OUT endpoint number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The logical 7-bit address of a hardware endpoints that support bulk OUT and IN operations

1.6.313 CONFIG_USBMSC_EPBULKIN: Bulk IN endpoint number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 3
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The logical 7-bit address of a hardware endpoints that support bulk OUT and IN operations

1.6.314 CONFIG_USBMSC_NWRREQS: The number of write requests that can be in flight

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The number of write/read requests that can be in flight

1.6.315 CONFIG_USBMSC_NRDREQS: The number of read requests that can be in flight

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The number of write/read requests that can be in flight

1.6.316 CONFIG_USBMSC_BULKINREQLEN: Bulk IN request size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default Values:
    • Default: 512

      Dependency: CONFIG_USBDEV_DUALSPEED

    • Default: 64

      Dependency: !CONFIG_USBDEV_DUALSPEED

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The size of the buffer in each WRITE request. This value should to be at least as large as the endpoint maxpacket size . Most DCDs can divide a large request buffer down and enqueue the smaller, outgoing packets for better performance. So, ideally, the size of write request buffer should be the size of one block device sector which is, often, 512 bytes. The default, however, is the minimum size of 512 or 64 bytes (depending upon if dual speed operation is supported or not).

1.6.317 CONFIG_USBMSC_BULKOUTREQLEN: Bulk OUT request size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default Values:
    • Default: 512

      Dependency: CONFIG_USBDEV_DUALSPEED

    • Default: 64

      Dependency: !CONFIG_USBDEV_DUALSPEED

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The size of the buffer in each READ request. This value should to be at least as large as the endpoint maxpacket size. Most DCDs will return the completed READ request to the caller as each packet is received. Therefore, there is no benefit in increasing the size of this buffer beyond the maximum size of one packet. Default: 512 or 64 bytes (depending upon if dual speed operation is supported or not).

1.6.318 CONFIG_USBMSC_VENDORID: Mass storage Vendor ID

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x584e
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The vendor ID (VID). The value here is bogus. You should not use it in any commercial products! You must go through the proper channels to request a vendor ID for your company if you do not already have one!

1.6.319 CONFIG_USBMSC_VENDORSTR: Mass storage vendor string

  • Type: String
  • Default: "NuttX"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The vendor ID code/string

1.6.320 CONFIG_USBMSC_PRODUCTID: Mass storage Product ID

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x5342
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    The product ID (PID).

1.6.321 CONFIG_USBMSC_PRODUCTSTR: Mass storage product string

  • Type: String
  • Default: "Mass Storage"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

1.6.322 CONFIG_USBMSC_VERSIONNO: USB MSC Version Number

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: "0x399"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

1.6.323 CONFIG_USBMSC_REMOVABLE: Mass storage removable

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Select if the media is removable USB Composite Device Configuration

1.6.324 CONFIG_USBMSC_SCSI_PRIO: USBMSC SCSI daemon priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 128
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Priority of the SCSI kernel thread. This must be a relatively high priority so that the SCSI daemon can be response to USB block driver accesses.

1.6.325 CONFIG_USBMSC_SCSI_STACKSIZE: USBMSC SCSI daemon stack size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2048
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV, CONFIG_USBMSC
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

    Stack size used with the SCSI kernel thread. The default value is not tuned.

1.6.326 CONFIG_FOTA_DRIVER: FOTA Device Driver Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/Kconfig

    FOTA Device Driver

1.6.327 CONFIG_RAMLOG: RAM log device support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/syslog/Kconfig

    This is a driver that was intended to support debugging output, aka syslogging, when the normal serial output is not available. For example, if you are using a telnet or USB serial console, the debug output will get lost. However, the RAMLOG device should be usable even if system logging is disabled.

    This driver is similar to a pipe in that it saves the debugging output in a FIFO in RAM. It differs from a pipe in numerous details as needed to support logging.

1.6.328 CONFIG_RAMLOG_SYSLOG: Use RAMLOG for SYSLOG

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_RAMLOG, CONFIG_SYSLOG
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/syslog/Kconfig

    Use the RAM logging device for the syslogging interface. If this feature is enabled (along with SYSLOG), then all debug output (only) will be re-directed to the circular buffer in RAM. This RAM log can be view from TASH using the 'dmesg'command.

    Do not enable more than one SYSLOG device.

1.6.329 CONFIG_RAMLOG_CONSOLE: Use RAMLOG for /dev/console

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_RAMLOG, CONFIG_DEV_CONSOLE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/syslog/Kconfig

    Use the RAM logging device as a system console. If this feature is enabled (along with DEV_CONSOLE), then all console output will be re-directed to a circular buffer in RAM. This is useful, for example, if the only console is a Telnet console. Then in that case, console output from non-Telnet threads will go to the circular buffer and can be viewed using the TASH 'dmesg' command.

1.6.330 CONFIG_RAMLOG_BUFSIZE: RAMLOG buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1024
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_RAMLOG, CONFIG_RAMLOG_SYSLOG || CONFIG_RAMLOG_CONSOLE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/syslog/Kconfig

    Size of the console RAM log. Default: 1024

1.6.331 CONFIG_RAMLOG_UPDATE_LATEST: RAMLOG buffer updates(overwrite)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_RAMLOG, CONFIG_RAMLOG_SYSLOG || CONFIG_RAMLOG_CONSOLE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/syslog/Kconfig

    Updates the latest contents of circular buffer if write overflow occurs.

1.6.332 CONFIG_RAMLOG_CRLF: RAMLOG CR/LF

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_RAMLOG
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/syslog/Kconfig

    Pre-pend a carriage return before every linefeed that goes into the RAM log.

1.6.333 CONFIG_RAMLOG_NONBLOCKING: RAMLOG non-block reads

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_RAMLOG
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/syslog/Kconfig

    Reading from the RAMLOG will never block if the RAMLOG is empty. If the RAMLOG is empty, then zero is returned (usually interpreted as end-of-file).

1.6.334 CONFIG_RAMLOG_NPOLLWAITERS: RAMLOG number of poll waiters

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_RAMLOG, !CONFIG_DISABLE_POLL
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/syslog/Kconfig

    The maximum number of threads that may be waiting on the poll method.

1.6.335 CONFIG_SYSLOG_CONSOLE: Use SYSLOG for /dev/console

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEV_CONSOLE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/syslog/Kconfig

    Use the syslog logging device as a system console. If this feature is enabled (along with DEV_CONSOLE), then all console output will be re-directed to syslog output (syslog_putc). This is useful, for example, if the only console is a Telnet console. Then in that case, console output from non-Telnet threads will go to the syslog output.

1.6.336 CONFIG_TTRACE: T-trace support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/ttrace/Kconfig

    Present T-trace driver, library, TASH commands. T-trace can trace and measure times between TPs that defined by T-trace API.(trace_begin, trace_end)

1.6.337 CONFIG_TTRACE_BUFSIZE: Trace buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 13200
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_TTRACE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/ttrace/Kconfig

    Size of the trace buffer size at kernel. Default: 13200

1.6.338 CONFIG_TTRACE_DEVPATH: T-trace device node path

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/dev/ttrace"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_TTRACE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/ttrace/Kconfig

1.6.339 CONFIG_DRIVERS_WIRELESS: Wireless Device Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/Kconfig

    Drivers for various wireless devices.

1.6.340 CONFIG_SCSC_WLAN: SCSC Wireless Module support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SPI
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DRIVERS_WIRELESS, CONFIG_LIBM && CONFIG_SCHED_WORKQUEUE && !CONFIG_DISABLE_PTHREAD && CONFIG_WPA_SUPPLICANT
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/wireless/scsc/Kconfig

1.6.341 CONFIG_SLSI_RX_PERFORMANCE_TEST: Enable UDP RX performance test

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DRIVERS_WIRELESS, CONFIG_SCSC_WLAN
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/wireless/scsc/Kconfig

    This option enables RX UDP performance measurement without involving the LWIP stack

1.6.342 CONFIG_SCSC_TX_FLOW_CONTROL: Enable TX flow control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DRIVERS_WIRELESS, CONFIG_SCSC_WLAN
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/wireless/scsc/Kconfig

    This option enables TX flow control

1.6.343 CONFIG_SCSC_ENABLE_PORT_CONTROL: Enable controlled/uncontrolled port logic in the driver

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DRIVERS_WIRELESS, CONFIG_SCSC_WLAN
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/wireless/scsc/Kconfig

    This option enables controlled/uncontrolled port logic in the driver

1.6.344 CONFIG_SCSC_WLAN_STA_ONLY: Support WLAN STA only (no P2P/AP/IBSS)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DRIVERS_WIRELESS, CONFIG_SCSC_WLAN
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/wireless/scsc/Kconfig

    Enable only basic STA mode for debugging purposes

1.6.345 CONFIG_SCSC_WLAN_BLOCK_IPV6: Block IPv6

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DRIVERS_WIRELESS, CONFIG_SCSC_WLAN
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/wireless/scsc/Kconfig

    This option blocks IPv6 packets.

1.6.346 CONFIG_SCSC_WLAN_UDP_FLOWCONTROL: Enable UDP Flow Control by changing LPWORK priority

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DRIVERS_WIRELESS, CONFIG_SCSC_WLAN
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/wireless/scsc/Kconfig

    This option enables when iperf UDP Rx packet drops exist when mbox has been full, LPWORK drops its priority

1.6.347 CONFIG_SCSC_WLAN_AUTO_RECOVERY: Enable Auto Recovery

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DRIVERS_WIRELESS, CONFIG_SCSC_WLAN
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/wireless/scsc/Kconfig

    Enables auto recovery on FW panic and SCSC driver watch dog timeouts, which will reset subsystem and re-enable state.

1.6.348 CONFIG_SCSC_WLAN_POWER_SAVE: Enable Power Save mode

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DRIVERS_WIRELESS, CONFIG_SCSC_WLAN
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/wireless/scsc/Kconfig

    This option enables driver to configure power save mode in firmware.

1.6.349 CONFIG_SCSC_WLAN_MAX_INTERFACES: Max number of virtual interfaces supported

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DRIVERS_WIRELESS, CONFIG_SCSC_WLAN
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/wireless/scsc/Kconfig

    The driver structures are sized to support this number of interfaces.

1.6.350 CONFIG_SCSC_CORE: SCSC Core driver Module support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SPI
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DRIVERS_WIRELESS
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/wireless/scsc/Kconfig

1.6.351 CONFIG_SCSC_PLATFORM: Samsung SCSC MIF Platform driver implementation

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DRIVERS_WIRELESS, CONFIG_SCSC_CORE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/wireless/scsc/Kconfig

1.6.352 CONFIG_SCSC_WLANLITE: Samsung SCSC WLANLITE driver mode

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DRIVERS_WIRELESS, CONFIG_SCSC_CORE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/wireless/scsc/Kconfig

1.6.353 CONFIG_SCSC_DISABLE_WLAN_RESET: Never power down the Samsung SCSC WLAN CPU

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DRIVERS_WIRELESS, CONFIG_SCSC_CORE
  • Kconfig file: ./drivers/wireless/scsc/Kconfig

1.7 Menu: Networking Support

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.7.1 CONFIG_NET: Networking support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    Enable or disable all system network features

1.7.2 Choice: Networking stack

  • Default: NET_LWIP
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_NET_LWIP: LwIP

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
    • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

1.7.3 Menu: LwIP options

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

1.7.3.1 CONFIG_NET_IPv4: IPv4 support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

    Build in support for IPv4.

1.7.3.2 CONFIG_NET_IP_DEFAULT_TTL: Default value for Time-To-Live

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 255
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv4
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/ipv4/Kconfig

    Default value for Time-To-Live used by transport layers.

1.7.3.3 CONFIG_NET_IP_FORWARD: Support IP packet forwarding

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv4
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/ipv4/Kconfig

    Enables the ability to forward IP packets across network interfaces. If you are going to run lwIP on a device with only one network interface, define this to 0.

1.7.3.4 CONFIG_NET_IP_OPTIONS_ALLOWED: Support IP options

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv4
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/ipv4/Kconfig

    If disabled, all packets with IP options are dropped. If enabled, IP options are allowed (but not parsed).

1.7.3.5 CONFIG_NET_IP_FRAG: IP fragment support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv4
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/ipv4/Kconfig

    Fragment outgoing IP packets if their size exceeds MTU. Note that this option does not affect incoming packet sizes, which can be controlled via IP_REASSEMBLY.

1.7.3.6 CONFIG_NET_IP_REASSEMBLY: IP reassembly support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv4
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/ipv4/Kconfig

    Reassemble incoming fragmented IP packets. Note that this option does not affect outgoing packet sizes, which can be controlled via IP_FRAG.

1.7.3.7 CONFIG_NET_IPV4_REASS_MAX_PBUFS: Total maximum amount of pbufs

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 20
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv4 , CONFIG_NET_IP_REASSEMBLY
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/ipv4/Kconfig

    Total maximum amount of pbufs waiting to be reassembled. Since the received pbufs are enqueued, be sure to configure PBUF_POOL_SIZE > IP_REASS_MAX_PBUFS so that the stack is still able to receive packets even if the maximum amount of fragments is enqueued for reassembly!

1.7.3.8 CONFIG_NET_IPV4_REASS_MAXAGE: Maximum time for fragments

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 3
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv4 , CONFIG_NET_IP_REASSEMBLY
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/ipv4/Kconfig

    Maximum time (in multiples of IP_TMR_INTERVAL - so seconds, normally) a fragmented IP packet waits for all fragments to arrive. If not all fragments arrived in this time, the whole packet is discarded.

1.7.3.9 CONFIG_NET_IPv6: IPv6 support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

    Build in support for IPv6.

1.7.3.10 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_NUM_ADDRESSES: Number of IPv6 addresses per netif

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 3
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv6
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/ipv6/Kconfig

    Number of IPv6 addresses per netif.

1.7.3.11 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_FORWARD: Enable IPv6 packet forwarding

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv6
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/ipv6/Kconfig

    Enables forward IPv6 packets across netifs.

1.7.3.12 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_FRAG: Enable IPv6 packet fragment

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv6
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/ipv6/Kconfig

    Enables fragment outgoing IPv6 packets that are too big.

1.7.3.13 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_REASS: Enable IPv6 packet reassemble

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv6
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/ipv6/Kconfig

    Enables reassemble incoming IPv6 packets that fragmented.

1.7.3.14 CONFIG_NET_IPV6_REASS_MAXAGE: Maximum time for fragments

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 60
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv6
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/ipv6/Kconfig

    Maximum time (in multiples of IP6_REASS_TMR_INTERVAL - so seconds, normally) a fragmented IP packet waits for all fragments to arrive. If not all fragments arrived in this time, the whole packet is discarded.

1.7.3.15 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_SEND_ROUTER_SOLICIT: Send router solicitation messages during network startup

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv6
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/ipv6/Kconfig

    Send router solicitation messages during network startup.

1.7.3.16 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_AUTOCONFIG: Enable stateless address autoconfiguration as per RFC 4862

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv6
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/ipv6/Kconfig

    Enable stateless address autoconfiguration as per RFC 4862.

1.7.3.17 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_DUP_DETECT_ATTEMPTS: Number of duplicate address detection attempts

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv6
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/ipv6/Kconfig

    Number of duplicate address detection attempts.

1.7.3.18 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_PMTU_FOR_MULTICAST: Support PMTU for multicast destinations

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv6
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/ipv6/Kconfig

    Support PMTU for multicast destinations

1.7.3.19 Menu: Socket support

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/socket/Kconfig

1.7.3.19.1 CONFIG_NSOCKET_DESCRIPTORS: Number of socket descriptor

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_SOCKET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/socket/Kconfig

    Maximum number of socket descriptors per task/thread.

1.7.3.19.2 CONFIG_NET_TCP_KEEPALIVE: TCP keepalive

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_SOCKET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/socket/Kconfig

    Enable TCP_KEEPIDLE, TCP_KEEPINTVL and TCP_KEEPCNT options processing. Note that TCP_KEEPIDLE and TCP_KEEPINTVL have to be set in seconds. (does not require sockets.c, and will affect tcp.c)

1.7.3.19.3 CONFIG_NET_RAW: Raw socket support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_SOCKET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/socket/Kconfig

1.7.3.19.4 CONFIG_NET_SOCKET_OPTION_BROADCAST: Support SO_BROADCAST Option

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_SOCKET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/socket/Kconfig

    Enable SO_BROADCAST option support.

1.7.3.19.5 CONFIG_NET_RANDOMIZE_INITIAL_LOCAL_PORTS: Randomize the initial local port for TCP/UDP

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_SOCKET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/socket/Kconfig

    Randomize the local port for the first local TCP/UDP pcb (default==0). This can prevent creating predictable port numbers after booting a device.

1.7.3.19.6 CONFIG_NET_SO_SNDTIMEO: Enable send timeout socket option

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_SOCKET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/socket/Kconfig

    Enable send timeout for sockets/netconns and SO_SNDTIMEO processing.

1.7.3.19.7 CONFIG_NET_SO_RCVTIMEO: Enable receive timeout socket option

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_SOCKET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/socket/Kconfig

    Enable receive timeout for sockets/netconns and SO_RCVTIMEO processing.

1.7.3.19.8 CONFIG_NET_SO_RCVBUF: Enable SO_RCVBUF socket option

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_SOCKET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/socket/Kconfig

    Enable SO_RCVBUF processing.

1.7.3.19.9 CONFIG_NET_SO_REUSE: Enable SO_REUSE socket option

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_SOCKET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/socket/Kconfig

    Enable SO_REUSEADDR option.

1.7.3.19.10 CONFIG_NET_SO_REUSE_RXTOALL: Enable RX to All

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_SOCKET , CONFIG_NET_SO_REUSE
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/socket/Kconfig

    Pass a copy of incoming broadcast/multicast packets to all local matches if SO_REUSEADDR is turned on. WARNING: Adds a memcpy for every packet if passing to more than one pcb!

1.7.3.20 CONFIG_NET_ARP: ARP Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_ETHERNET && CONFIG_NET_IPv4
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

    This setting is currently overridden by logic in include/nuttx/net

1.7.3.21 CONFIG_NET_ARP_TABLESIZE: ARP table size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 10
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_ARP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/arp/Kconfig

    Number of active MAC-IP address pairs cached

1.7.3.22 CONFIG_NET_ARP_QUEUEING: ARP queueing

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_ARP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/arp/Kconfig

    Multiple outgoing packets are queued during hardware address resolution.

1.7.3.23 CONFIG_NET_ETHARP_TRUST_IP_MAC: ARP trust IP mac

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_ARP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/arp/Kconfig

    Incoming IP packets cause the ARP table to be updated with the source MAC and IP addresses supplied in the packet.

1.7.3.24 CONFIG_NET_ETH_PAD_SIZE: Number of ethernet padding bytes

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_ARP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/arp/Kconfig

    Number of bytes added before the ethernet header to ensure alignment of payload after that header. Since the header is 14 bytes long, without this padding e.g. addresses in the IP header will not be aligned on a 32-bit boundary, so setting this to 2 can speed up 32-bit-platforms.

1.7.3.25 CONFIG_NET_ARP_STATIC_ENTRIES: Support ARP static entries

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_ARP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/arp/Kconfig

    Enable code to support static ARP table entries (using etharp_add_static_entry/etharp_remove_static_entry).

1.7.3.26 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND: ND support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv6
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

    Build in support for IPv6 Neighbor Discovery.

1.7.3.27 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND_QUEUEING: Enable queue outgoing IPv6 packets while MAC address

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/nd/Kconfig

    Enable queue outgoing IPv6 packets while MAC address.

1.7.3.28 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND_QUEUE: Max number of IPv6 packets to queue during MAC resolution

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 20
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/nd/Kconfig

    Max number of IPv6 packets to queue during MAC resolution.

1.7.3.29 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND_NUM_NEIGHBORS: Number of entries in IPv6 neighbor cache

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 10
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/nd/Kconfig

    Number of entries in IPv6 neighbor cache.

1.7.3.30 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND_NUM_DESTINATIONS: Number of entries in IPv6 destination cache

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 10
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/nd/Kconfig

    Number of entries in IPv6 destination cache.

1.7.3.31 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND_NUM_PREFIXES: Number of entries in IPv6 on-link prefixes cache

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 5
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/nd/Kconfig

    Number of entries in IPv6 on-link prefixes cache.

1.7.3.32 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND_NUM_ROUTERS: Number of entries in IPv6 default router cache

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 3
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/nd/Kconfig

    Number of entries in IPv6 default router cache.

1.7.3.33 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND_MAX_MULTICAST_SOLICIT: Max number of multicast solicit messages to send

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 3
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/nd/Kconfig

    Max number of multicast solicit messages to send.

1.7.3.34 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND_MAX_UNICAST_SOLICIT: Max number of unicast neighbor solicitation messages

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 3
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/nd/Kconfig

    Max number of unicast neighbor solicitation messages to send during neighbor reachability detection.

1.7.3.35 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND_MAX_SOLICIT_INTERVAL: Max interval time of solicit messages to send

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/nd/Kconfig

    Max interval time of solicit message to send

1.7.3.36 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND_REACHABLE_TIME: Default neighbor reachable time (in milliseconds)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 30000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/nd/Kconfig

    Default neighbor reachable time (in milliseconds). May be updated by router advertisement messages.

1.7.3.37 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND_RETRANS_TIMER: Default retransmission timer for solicitation messages

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/nd/Kconfig

    Default retransmission timer for solicitation messages.

1.7.3.38 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND_DELAY_FIRST_PROBE_TIME: Delay before first unicast neighbor solicitation

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 5000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/nd/Kconfig

    Delay before first unicast neighbor solicitation message is sent, during neighbor reachability detection.

1.7.3.39 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND_ALLOW_RA_UPDATES: Allow Router Advertisement messages to update

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/nd/Kconfig

    Allow Router Advertisement messages to update Reachable time and retransmission timers, and netif MTU.

1.7.3.40 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND_TCP_REACHABILITY_HINTS: Allow TCP to provide ND with RA hints

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/nd/Kconfig

    Allow TCP to provide Neighbor Discovery with reachability hints for connected destinations. This helps avoid sending unicast neighbor solicitation messages.

1.7.3.41 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND_RDNSS_MAX_DNS_SERVERS: Use IPv6 Router Advertisement Recursive DNS Server Option

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ND
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/nd/Kconfig

    Use IPv6 Router Advertisement Recursive DNS Server Option (as per RFC 6106) to copy a defined maximum number of DNS servers to the DNS module.

1.7.3.42 CONFIG_NET_UDP: UDP Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv4 || CONFIG_NET_IPv6
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

    UDP support on or off

1.7.3.43 CONFIG_NET_NETBUF_RECVINFO: Append Destination Infomation

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_UDP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/udp/Kconfig

    append destination addr and port to every netbuf.

1.7.3.44 CONFIG_NET_UDP_TTL: UDP TTL

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 255
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_UDP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/udp/Kconfig

    Default Time-To-Live value.

1.7.3.45 CONFIG_NET_UDPLITE: Enable UDP-Lite

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_UDP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/udp/Kconfig

    Turn on UDP-Lite. (Requires LWIP_UDP)

1.7.3.46 CONFIG_NET_TCP: TCP Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv4 || CONFIG_NET_IPv6
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

    TCP support on or off

1.7.3.47 CONFIG_NET_TCP_TTL: TCP TTL

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 255
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_TCP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/tcp/Kconfig

    Default Time-To-Live value

1.7.3.48 CONFIG_NET_TCP_WND: TCP Window Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2144
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_TCP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/tcp/Kconfig

    The size of a TCP window. This must be at least (2 * TCP_MSS) for things to work well

1.7.3.49 CONFIG_NET_TCP_MAXRTX: TCP Max Retransmissions

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 12
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_TCP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/tcp/Kconfig

    Maximum number of retransmissions of data segments.

1.7.3.50 CONFIG_NET_TCP_SYNMAXRTX: TCP SYN Max Retransmissions

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 6
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_TCP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/tcp/Kconfig

    Maximum number of retransmissions of SYN segments.

1.7.3.51 CONFIG_NET_TCP_QUEUE_OOSEQ: TCP out of order support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_TCP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/tcp/Kconfig

    TCP will queue segments that arrive out of order. Select 'n' if your device is low on memory.

1.7.3.52 CONFIG_NET_TCP_MSS: TCP MSS

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 536
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_TCP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/tcp/Kconfig

    TCP Maximum segment size. (default is 536, a conservative default, you might want to increase this.) For the receive side, this MSS is advertised to the remote side when opening a connection. For the transmit size, this MSS sets an upper limit on the MSS advertised by the remote host.

1.7.3.53 CONFIG_NET_TCP_CALCULATE_EFF_SEND_MSS: TCP Enable Effective Send MSS

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_TCP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/tcp/Kconfig

    The maximum size of a segment that TCP really sends, the 'effective send MSS, ' MUST be the smaller of the send MSS (which reflects the available reassembly buffer size at the remote host) and the largest size permitted by the IP layer (RFC 1122) Setting this to 1 enables code that checks TCP_MSS against the MTU of the netif used for a connection and limits the MSS if it would be too big otherwise.

1.7.3.54 CONFIG_NET_TCP_SND_BUF: TCP Send Buffer

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1072
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_TCP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/tcp/Kconfig

    TCP sender buffer space (bytes). To achieve good performance, this should be at least 2 * TCP_MSS.

1.7.3.55 CONFIG_NET_TCP_SND_QUEUELEN: TCP Send Buffer Pbuf

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_TCP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/tcp/Kconfig

    TCP sender buffer space (pbufs). This must be at least as much as (2 * TCP_SND_BUF/TCP_MSS) for things to work.

1.7.3.56 CONFIG_NET_TCP_OOSEQ_MAX_BYTES: The maximum number of bytes queued on ooseq

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_TCP , !CONFIG_NET_TCP_QUEUE_OOSEQ
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/tcp/Kconfig

    The maximum number of bytes queued on ooseq per pcb. Default is 0 (no limit). Only valid for TCP_QUEUE_OOSEQ==n.

1.7.3.57 CONFIG_NET_TCP_OOSEQ_MAX_PBUFS: The maximum number of pbufs queued on ooseq per pcb

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_TCP , !CONFIG_NET_TCP_QUEUE_OOSEQ
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/tcp/Kconfig

    The maximum number of pbufs queued on ooseq per pcb. Default is 0 (no limit). Only valid for TCP_QUEUE_OOSEQ==n.

1.7.3.58 CONFIG_NET_TCP_LISTEN_BACKLOG: Enable the backlog

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_TCP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/tcp/Kconfig

    Enable the backlog option for tcp listen pcb.

1.7.3.59 CONFIG_NET_TCP_DEFAULT_LISTEN_BACKLOG: The maximum allowed backlog

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0xff
  • Range: 0x0 - 0xff
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_TCP , CONFIG_NET_TCP_LISTEN_BACKLOG
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/tcp/Kconfig

    The maximum allowed backlog for TCP listen netconns. This backlog is used unless another is explicitly specified. 0xff is the maximum (u8_t).

1.7.3.60 CONFIG_NET_TCP_OVERSIZE: TCP Oversize

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 536
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_TCP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/tcp/Kconfig

    TCP_OVERSIZE: The maximum number of bytes that tcp_write may allocate ahead of time in an attempt to create shorter pbuf chains for transmission. The meaningful range is 0 to TCP_MSS. Some suggested values are: * 0: Disable oversized allocation. 

      Each tcp_write() allocates a new pbuf (old behaviour).
    * 1: Allocate size-aligned pbufs with minimal excess. 
      Use this if your scatter-gather DMA requires aligned fragments.
    * 128: Limit the pbuf/memory overhead to 20%. * TCP_MSS: Try to create unfragmented TCP packets. * TCP_MSS/4: Try to create 4 fragments or less per TCP packet.

1.7.3.61 CONFIG_NET_TCP_TIMESTAMPS: Enable Timestamp

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_TCP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/tcp/Kconfig

    support the TCP timestamp option.

1.7.3.62 CONFIG_NET_TCP_WND_UPDATE_THRESHOLD: TCP Window Update Threshold

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 536
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_TCP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/tcp/Kconfig

    Difference in window to trigger an explicit window update Default value : LWIP_MIN((TCP_WND / 4), (TCP_MSS * 4))

1.7.3.63 CONFIG_NET_ICMP: ICMP Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv4
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

    Enable minimal ICMP support. Includes built-in support for sending replies to received ECHO (ping) requests.

1.7.3.64 CONFIG_NET_ICMP_TTL: ICMP TTL

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 255
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_ICMP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/icmp/Kconfig

    Default value for Time-To-Live used by ICMP packets.

1.7.3.65 CONFIG_NET_BROADCAST_PING: ICMP respond broadcast pings

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_ICMP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/icmp/Kconfig

    Respond to broadcast pings (default is unicast only)

1.7.3.66 CONFIG_NET_MULTICAST_PING4: ICMP respond multicast pings

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_ICMP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/icmp/Kconfig

    Respond to multicast pings (default is unicast only)

1.7.3.67 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ICMP: ICMP6 support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv6
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

    Build in support icmp for IPv6.

1.7.3.68 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ICMP_DATASIZE: bytes from original packet to send back in ICMPv6 error messages

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ICMP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/icmp6/Kconfig

    Bytes from original packet to send back in ICMPv6 error messages.

1.7.3.69 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ICMP_HL: default hop limit for ICMPv6 messages

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 255
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ICMP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/icmp6/Kconfig

    Default hop limit for ICMPv6 messages.

1.7.3.70 CONFIG_NET_MULTICAST_PING6: ICMP respond multicast pings

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv6_ICMP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/icmp6/Kconfig

    Respond to multicast pings (default is unicast only)

1.7.3.71 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_IGMP: IGMP Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv4
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

1.7.3.72 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_MEMP_NUM_IGMP_GROUP: Maximum number of IGMP group

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_IGMP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

    Number of multicast groups whose network interfaces can be members at the same time

1.7.3.73 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_MLD: MLD Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv6
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

1.7.3.74 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_MLD_GROUP: Max number of IPv6 multicast groups

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv6_MLD
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mld/Kconfig

    Max number of IPv6 multicast groups.

1.7.3.75 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_DHCP: DHCPv6 Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_IPv6
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

    Enable DHCPv6 stateful address autoconfiguration.

1.7.3.76 Menu: LWIP Mailbox Configurations

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mbox/Kconfig

1.7.3.76.1 CONFIG_NET_TCPIP_MBOX_SIZE: LWIP Task Mailbox Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mbox/Kconfig

    The mailbox size for the tcpip thread messages. The queue size value itself is platform-dependent, but is passed to sys_mbox_new() when tcpip_init is called.

1.7.3.76.2 CONFIG_NET_DEFAULT_ACCEPTMBOX_SIZE: Default Accept Mailbox Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_TCP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mbox/Kconfig

    The mailbox size for the incoming connections. The queue size value itself is platform-dependent, but is passed to sys_mbox_new() when the acceptmbox is created.

1.7.3.76.3 CONFIG_NET_DEFAULT_RAW_RECVMBOX_SIZE: Default Raw Socket Receive Mailbox Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_RAW
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mbox/Kconfig

    The mailbox size for the incoming packets on a NETCONN_RAW. The queue size value itself is platform-dependent, but is passed to sys_mbox_new() when the recvmbox is created.

1.7.3.76.4 CONFIG_NET_DEFAULT_TCP_RECVMBOX_SIZE: Default TCP Receive Mailbox Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_TCP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mbox/Kconfig

    The mailbox size for the incoming packets on a NETCONN_TCP. The queue size value itself is platform-dependent, but is passed to sys_mbox_new() when the recvmbox is created.

1.7.3.76.5 CONFIG_NET_DEFAULT_UDP_RECVMBOX_SIZE: Default UDP Receive Mailbox Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_UDP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mbox/Kconfig

    The mailbox size for the incoming packets on a NETCONN_UDP. The queue size value itself is platform-dependent, ut is passed to sys_mbox_new() when the recvmbox is created.

1.7.3.77 Menu: Memory Configurations

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mem/Kconfig

1.7.3.77.1 CONFIG_NET_MEM_ALIGNMENT: Memory Alignment

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mem/Kconfig

    should be set to the alignment of the CPU 4 byte alignment -> #define MEM_ALIGNMENT 4 2 byte alignment -> #define MEM_ALIGNMENT 2

1.7.3.77.2 CONFIG_NET_ALLOW_MEM_FREE_FROM_OTHER_CONTEXT: Allow Memory Free from Other Context

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mem/Kconfig

    Set this to 1 if you want to free PBUF_RAM pbufs (or call mem_free()) from interrupt context (or another context that doesn't allow waiting for a semaphore). If set to 1, mem_malloc will be protected by a semaphore and SYS_ARCH_PROTECT, while mem_free will only use SYS_ARCH_PROTECT. mem_malloc SYS_ARCH_UNPROTECTs with each loop so that mem_free can run.

    ATTENTION: As you can see from the above description, this leads to dis-/ enabling interrupts often, which can be slow! Also, on low memory, mem_malloc can need longer.

    If you don't want that, at least for NO_SYS=0, you can still use the following functions to enqueue a deallocation call which then runs in the tcpip_thread context:

    pbuf_free_callback(p); mem_free_callback(m);

1.7.3.77.3 CONFIG_NET_MEM_LIBC_MALLOC: Use System Malloc

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mem/Kconfig

    Use malloc/free/realloc provided by your C-library instead of the lwip internal allocator. Can save code size if you already use it.

1.7.3.77.4 CONFIG_NET_MEMP_MEM_MALLOC: Use mem_malloc/mem_free for Memory Pool

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mem/Kconfig

    Use mem_malloc/mem_free instead of the lwip pool allocator. Especially useful with MEM_LIBC_MALLOC but handle with care regarding execution speed (heap alloc can be much slower than pool alloc) and usage from interrupts (especially if your netif driver allocates PBUF_POOL pbufs for received frames from interrupt)!

    ATTENTION: Currently, this uses the heap for ALL pools (also for private pools, not only for internal pools defined in memp_std.h)!

1.7.3.77.5 CONFIG_NET_MEM_USE_POOLS: Memory Alloc Through Pool

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , !CONFIG_NET_MEM_LIBC_MALLOC
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mem/Kconfig

    Use an alternative to malloc() by allocating from a set of memory pools of various sizes. When mem_malloc is called, an element of the smallest pool that can provide the length needed is returned. To use this, MEMP_USE_CUSTOM_POOLS also has to be enabled.

1.7.3.77.6 CONFIG_NET_MEM_SIZE: Static Memory Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1600
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , !CONFIG_NET_MEM_LIBC_MALLOC , !CONFIG_NET_MEM_USE_POOLS
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mem/Kconfig

    The size of the heap memory. If the application will send a lot of data that needs to be copied, this should be set high.

1.7.3.77.7 CONFIG_NET_MEMP_OVERFLOW_CHECK: Memory Pool Overflow Check

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Range: 0 - 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , !CONFIG_NET_MEMP_MEM_MALLOC
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mem/Kconfig

    memp overflow protection reserves a configurable amount of bytes before and after each memp element in every pool and fills it with a prominent default value. MEMP_OVERFLOW_CHECK == 0 no checking MEMP_OVERFLOW_CHECK == 1 checks each element when it is freed MEMP_OVERFLOW_CHECK >= 2 checks each element in every pool every time memp_malloc() or memp_free() is called (useful but slow!)

1.7.3.77.8 CONFIG_NET_MEMP_SANITY_CHECK: Memory Pool Sanity Check

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , !CONFIG_NET_MEMP_MEM_MALLOC
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mem/Kconfig

    Run a sanity check after each memp_free() to make sure that there are no cycles in the linked lists.

1.7.3.77.9 CONFIG_NET_MEMP_SEPARATE_POOLS: Memory Pool Separate Pools

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , !CONFIG_NET_MEMP_MEM_MALLOC
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mem/Kconfig

    To place memory pools in separate arrays. This may be used to place these pools into user-defined memory by using external declaration.

1.7.3.77.10 CONFIG_NET_MEMP_NUM_PBUF: Memory Pool Pbuf Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , !CONFIG_NET_MEMP_MEM_MALLOC
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mem/Kconfig

    The number of memp struct pbufs (used for PBUF_ROM and PBUF_REF). If the application sends a lot of data out of ROM (or other static memory), this should be set high.

1.7.3.77.11 CONFIG_NET_MEMP_NUM_RAW_PCB: Memory Pool Raw PCB Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , !CONFIG_NET_MEMP_MEM_MALLOC , CONFIG_NET_RAW
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mem/Kconfig

    Number of raw connection PCBs (requires the LWIP_RAW option)

1.7.3.77.12 CONFIG_NET_MEMP_NUM_UDP_PCB: Memory Pool UDP PCB Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , !CONFIG_NET_MEMP_MEM_MALLOC , CONFIG_NET_UDP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mem/Kconfig

    The number of UDP protocol control blocks. One per active UDP "connection". (requires the LWIP_UDP option)

1.7.3.77.13 CONFIG_NET_MEMP_NUM_TCP_PCB: Memory Pool TCP PCB Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 5
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , !CONFIG_NET_MEMP_MEM_MALLOC , CONFIG_NET_TCP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mem/Kconfig

    The number of simultaneously active TCP connections. (requires the LWIP_TCP option)

1.7.3.77.14 CONFIG_NET_MEMP_NUM_TCP_PCB_LISTEN: Memory Pool TCP PCB Listen

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , !CONFIG_NET_MEMP_MEM_MALLOC , CONFIG_NET_TCP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mem/Kconfig

    The number of listening TCP connections. (requires the LWIP_TCP option)

1.7.3.77.15 CONFIG_NET_MEMP_NUM_TCP_SEG: Memory Pool TCP SEG Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , !CONFIG_NET_MEMP_MEM_MALLOC , CONFIG_NET_TCP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mem/Kconfig

    The number of simultaneously queued TCP segments. (requires the LWIP_TCP option)

1.7.3.77.16 CONFIG_NET_MEMP_NUM_REASSDATA: Memory Pool IP Reassemble

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 5
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , !CONFIG_NET_MEMP_MEM_MALLOC , CONFIG_NET_IP_REASSEMBLY
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mem/Kconfig

    The number of IP packets simultaneously queued for reassembly (whole packets, not fragments!)

1.7.3.77.17 CONFIG_NET_MEMP_NUM_FRAG_PBUF: Memory Pool IP Fragment

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 15
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , !CONFIG_NET_MEMP_MEM_MALLOC , CONFIG_NET_IP_FRAG
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mem/Kconfig

    The number of IP fragments simultaneously sent (fragments, not whole packets!). This is only used with LWIP_NETIF_TX_SINGLE_PBUF==0 and only has to be > 1 with DMA-enabled MACs where the packet is not yet sent when netif->output returns.

1.7.3.77.18 CONFIG_NET_MEMP_NUM_ARP_QUEUE: Memory Pool ARP Queue Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 30
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , !CONFIG_NET_MEMP_MEM_MALLOC , CONFIG_NET_ARP_QUEUEING
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mem/Kconfig

    The number of simultaneously queued outgoing packets (pbufs) that are waiting for an ARP request (to resolve their destination address) to finish. (requires the ARP_QUEUEING option)

1.7.3.77.19 CONFIG_NET_MEMP_NUM_IGMP_GROUP: Memory Pool IGMP Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , !CONFIG_NET_MEMP_MEM_MALLOC , CONFIG_NET_IGMP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mem/Kconfig

    The number of multicast groups whose network interfaces can be members at the same time (one per netif - allsystems group -, plus one per netif membership). (requires the LWIP_IGMP option)

1.7.3.77.20 CONFIG_NET_MEMP_NUM_SYS_TIMEOUT: Memory Pool System Timeout

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 6
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , !CONFIG_NET_MEMP_MEM_MALLOC
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mem/Kconfig

    The number of simultaneously active timeouts. The default number of timeouts is calculated here for all enabled modules. The formula expects settings to be either '0' or '1'.

1.7.3.77.21 CONFIG_NET_MEMP_NUM_NETBUF: Memory Pool Netbuf Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , !CONFIG_NET_MEMP_MEM_MALLOC , CONFIG_NET_NETCONN
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mem/Kconfig

    The number of struct netbufs. (only needed if you use the sequential API, like api_lib.c)

1.7.3.77.22 CONFIG_NET_MEMP_NUM_TCPIP_MSG_API: Memory Pool LWIP API Message Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , !CONFIG_NET_MEMP_MEM_MALLOC
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mem/Kconfig

    The number of struct tcpip_msg, which are used for callback/timeout API communication. (only needed if you use tcpip.c)

1.7.3.77.23 CONFIG_NET_MEMP_NUM_TCPIP_MSG_INPKT: Memory Pool LWIP Message INPKT

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , !CONFIG_NET_MEMP_MEM_MALLOC , !CONFIG_NET_TCPIP_CORE_LOCKING_INPUT
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mem/Kconfig

    The number of struct tcpip_msg, which are used for incoming packets. (only needed if you use tcpip.c)

1.7.3.77.24 CONFIG_NET_MEMP_NUM_SNMP_NODE: Memroy Pool SNMP Node Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 50
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , !CONFIG_NET_MEMP_MEM_MALLOC , CONFIG_NET_SNMP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mem/Kconfig

    The number of leafs in the SNMP tree.

1.7.3.77.25 CONFIG_NET_MEMP_NUM_SNMP_ROOTNODE: Memory Pool SNMP Root Node Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 30
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , !CONFIG_NET_MEMP_MEM_MALLOC , CONFIG_NET_SNMP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mem/Kconfig

    The number of branches in the SNMP tree. Every branch has one leaf at least.

1.7.3.77.26 CONFIG_NET_MEMP_NUM_SNMP_VARBIND: Memory Pool SNMP Varbind Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , !CONFIG_NET_MEMP_MEM_MALLOC , CONFIG_NET_SNMP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mem/Kconfig

    The number of concurrent requests (does not have to be changed normally) - 2 of these are used per request (1 for input, 1 for output)

1.7.3.77.27 CONFIG_NET_MEMP_NUM_SNMP_VALUE: Memory Pool SNMP Value Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 3
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , !CONFIG_NET_MEMP_MEM_MALLOC , CONFIG_NET_SNMP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mem/Kconfig

    The number of OID or values concurrently used (does not have to be changed normally) 3 of these are used per request (1 for the value read and 2 for OIDs - input and output)

1.7.3.77.28 CONFIG_NET_MEMP_NUM_PPPOE_INTERFACES: Memory Pool PPPOE Interfaces Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , !CONFIG_NET_MEMP_MEM_MALLOC , CONFIG_NET_PPP_SUPPORT && CONFIG_NET_PPPOE_SUPPORT
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mem/Kconfig

    The number of concurrently active PPPoE interfaces (only used with PPPOE_SUPPORT==1)

1.7.3.77.29 CONFIG_NET_PBUF_POOL_SIZE: Memory Pool Pbuf Pool Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , !CONFIG_NET_MEMP_MEM_MALLOC
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/mem/Kconfig

    The number of buffers in the pbuf pool.

1.7.3.78 Menu: LWIP Task Configurations

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/sys/Kconfig

1.7.3.78.1 CONFIG_NET_TCPIP_CORE_LOCKING: Enable TCPIP Core Locking

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/sys/Kconfig

    Creates a global mutex that is held during TCPIP thread operations. Can be locked by client code to perform lwIP operations without changing into TCPIP thread using callbacks. See LOCK_TCPIP_CORE() and UNLOCK_TCPIP_CORE(). Your system should provide mutexes supporting priority inversion to use this.

1.7.3.78.2 CONFIG_NET_TCPIP_CORE_LOCKING_INPUT: Enable TCPIP Core Locking Input

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/sys/Kconfig

    When LWIP_TCPIP_CORE_LOCKING is enabled, this lets tcpip_input() grab the mutex for input packets as well, instead of allocating a message and passing it to tcpip_thread.

    ATTENTION: this does not work when tcpip_input() is called from interrupt context!

1.7.3.78.3 CONFIG_NET_TCPIP_THREAD_NAME: LWIP Task Name

  • Type: String
  • Default: "LWIP_TCP/IP"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/sys/Kconfig

    The name assigned to the main tcpip thread.

1.7.3.78.4 CONFIG_NET_TCPIP_THREAD_PRIO: LWIP Task Priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 110
  • Range: 0 - 255
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/sys/Kconfig

    The priority assigned to the main tcpip thread. The priority value itself is platform-dependent, but is passed to sys_thread_new() when the thread is created.

1.7.3.78.5 CONFIG_NET_TCPIP_THREAD_STACKSIZE: LWIP Task Stack Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4096
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/sys/Kconfig

    The stack size used by the main tcpip thread. The stack size value itself is platform-dependent, but is passed to sys_thread_new() when the thread is created.

1.7.3.78.6 CONFIG_NET_COMPAT_MUTEX: Enable Compat Mutex

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/sys/Kconfig

    Define LWIP_COMPAT_MUTEX if the port has no mutexes and binary semaphores should be used instead.

1.7.3.78.7 CONFIG_NET_SYS_LIGHTWEIGHT_PROT: Enable Inter-task Protection

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/sys/Kconfig

    Enable inter-task protection (and task-vs-interrupt protection) for certain critical regions during buffer allocation, deallocation and memory allocation and deallocation.

    ATTENTION: This is required when using lwIP from more than one context! 

      If you disable this, you must be sure what you are doing!

1.7.3.78.8 CONFIG_NET_DEFAULT_THREAD_NAME: LWIP Default Thread Name

  • Type: String
  • Default: "lwIP"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/sys/Kconfig

    The name assigned to any other lwIP thread.

1.7.3.78.9 CONFIG_NET_DEFAULT_THREAD_PRIO: LWIP Default Thread Priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Range: 0 - 255
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/sys/Kconfig

    The priority assigned to any other lwIP thread. The priority value itself is platform-dependent, but is passed to sys_thread_new() when the thread is created.

1.7.3.78.10 CONFIG_NET_DEFAULT_THREAD_STACKSIZE: LWIP Default Thread Stack Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/sys/Kconfig

    The stack size used by any other lwIP thread. The stack size value itself is platform-dependent, but is passed to sys_thread_new() when the thread is created.

1.7.3.79 Menu: Debug Options for Network

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/debug/Kconfig

1.7.3.79.1 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_ASSERT: Enable Assert Features

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/debug/Kconfig

    Enable ASSERT options for each layers

1.7.3.79.2 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_ERROR: Enable Error Features

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/debug/Kconfig

    Enable ERROR options for each layers

1.7.3.79.3 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DEBUG: Enable Debug Features

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/debug/Kconfig

    Debug options for each layers

1.7.3.79.4 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DEBUG_LEVEL: LWIP debug level

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Range: 0 - 3
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/debug/Kconfig

    Configure LwIP log level. 0 : debug all 1 : warning (bad checksums, dropped packets, ...) 2 : serious (memory allocation failures, ... ) 3 : severe

1.7.3.79.5 CONFIG_NET_API_LIB_DEBUG: Enable API Library Debugging

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/debug/Kconfig

    Enable debugging in api_lib.c.

1.7.3.79.6 CONFIG_NET_API_MSG_DEBUG: Enable API Message Debugging

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/debug/Kconfig

    Enable debugging in api_msg.c.

1.7.3.79.7 CONFIG_NET_AUTOIP_DEBUG: Enable Auto IP Debugging

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/debug/Kconfig

    Enable debugging in autoip.c.

1.7.3.79.8 CONFIG_NET_ETHARP_DEBUG: Enable ETHARP Debugging

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/debug/Kconfig

    Enable debugging in etharp.c.

1.7.3.79.9 CONFIG_NET_ICMP_DEBUG: Enable ICMP Debugging

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/debug/Kconfig

    Enable debugging in icmp.c.

1.7.3.79.10 CONFIG_NET_IGMP_DEBUG: Enable IGMP Debugging

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/debug/Kconfig

    Enable debugging in igmp.c.

1.7.3.79.11 CONFIG_NET_IP_DEBUG: Enable IP Debugging

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/debug/Kconfig

    Enable debugging for IP.

1.7.3.79.12 CONFIG_NET_IP_REASS_DEBUG: Enable IP Reassemble Debugging

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/debug/Kconfig

    Enable debugging in ip_frag.c for both frag & reass.

1.7.3.79.13 CONFIG_NET_MEM_DEBUG: Enable Memory Debugging

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/debug/Kconfig

    Enable debugging in mem.c.

1.7.3.79.14 CONFIG_NET_MEMP_DEBUG: Enable Memory Pool Debugging

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/debug/Kconfig

    Enable debugging in memp.c.

1.7.3.79.15 CONFIG_NET_NETIF_DEBUG: Enable NIC Debugging

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/debug/Kconfig

    Enable debugging in netif.c.

1.7.3.79.16 CONFIG_NET_PBUF_DEBUG: Enable PBUF Debugging

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/debug/Kconfig

    Enable debugging in pbuf.c.

1.7.3.79.17 CONFIG_NET_POLL_DEBUG: Enable Poll Debugging

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/debug/Kconfig

    Enable debugging for poll.

1.7.3.79.18 CONFIG_NET_RAW_DEBUG: Enable Raw Socket Debugging

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/debug/Kconfig

    Enable debugging in raw.c.

1.7.3.79.19 CONFIG_NET_SOCKETS_DEBUG: Enable Socket Debugging

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/debug/Kconfig

    Enable debugging in sockets.c.

1.7.3.79.20 CONFIG_NET_SYS_DEBUG: Enable System Debugging

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/debug/Kconfig

    Enable debugging in sys_arch.c.

1.7.3.79.21 CONFIG_NET_UDP_DEBUG: Enable UDP Debugging

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/debug/Kconfig

    Enable debugging in UDP.

1.7.3.79.22 CONFIG_NET_TCP_DEBUG: Enable TCP Debugging

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/debug/Kconfig

    Enable debugging for TCP.

1.7.3.79.23 CONFIG_NET_TCP_CWND_DEBUG: Enable TCP Congestion Window Debugging

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/debug/Kconfig

    Enable debugging for TCP congestion window.

1.7.3.79.24 CONFIG_NET_TCP_FR_DEBUG: Enable TCP Fast Retrasmit Debugging

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/debug/Kconfig

    Enable debugging in tcp_in.c for fast retransmit.

1.7.3.79.25 CONFIG_NET_TCP_INPUT_DEBUG: Enable TCP Incoming Debugging

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/debug/Kconfig

    Enable debugging in tcp_in.c for incoming debug.

1.7.3.79.26 CONFIG_NET_TCP_OUTPUT_DEBUG: Enable TCP Output Debugging

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/debug/Kconfig

    Enable debugging in tcp_out.c output functions.

1.7.3.79.27 CONFIG_NET_TCP_QLEN_DEBUG: Enable TCP Queue Length Debugging

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/debug/Kconfig

    Enable debugging for TCP queue lengths.

1.7.3.79.28 CONFIG_NET_TCP_RST_DEBUG: Enable TCP RST Message Debugging

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/debug/Kconfig

    Enable debugging for TCP with the RST message.

1.7.3.79.29 CONFIG_NET_TCP_RTO_DEBUG: Enable TCP Retransmit Debugging

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/debug/Kconfig

    Enable debugging in TCP for retransmit timeout.

1.7.3.79.30 CONFIG_NET_TCP_WND_DEBUG: Enable TCP Window Debugging

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/debug/Kconfig

    Enable debugging in tcp_in.c for window updating.

1.7.3.79.31 CONFIG_NET_TCPIP_DEBUG: Enable LWIP Thread Debugging

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/debug/Kconfig

    Enable debugging in tcpip.c.

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/debug/Kconfig

    Enable debugging in timers.c.

1.7.3.79.33 CONFIG_NET_IPv6_DEBUG: Enable IPv6 Debugging

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DEBUG , CONFIG_NET_IPv6
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/debug/Kconfig

    Enable debugging for IPv6.

  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/debug/Kconfig

1.7.3.80 Menu: Enable Statistics

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/stats/Kconfig

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/stats/Kconfig

    Enable statistics collection in lwip_stats.

1.7.3.80.2 CONFIG_NET_STATS_DISPLAY: Enable Stats Display

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_STATS
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/stats/Kconfig

    Enable stats display.

1.7.3.80.3 CONFIG_NET_LINK_STATS: Enable Link Stats

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_STATS
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/stats/Kconfig

    Enable link stats.

1.7.3.80.4 CONFIG_NET_ETHARP_STATS: Enable ETHARP Stats

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_STATS , CONFIG_NET_ARP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/stats/Kconfig

    Enable etharp stats.

1.7.3.80.5 CONFIG_NET_IP_STATS: Enable IP Stats

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_STATS , CONFIG_NET_IPv4
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/stats/Kconfig

    Enable IP stats.

1.7.3.80.6 CONFIG_NET_IPFRAG_STATS: Enable IP Fragment

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_STATS , CONFIG_NET_IP_FRAG
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/stats/Kconfig

    Enable IP fragmentation stats. Default is on if using either frag or reass.

1.7.3.80.7 CONFIG_NET_ICMP_STATS: Enable ICMP Stats

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_STATS , CONFIG_NET_ICMP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/stats/Kconfig

    Enable ICMP stats.

1.7.3.80.8 CONFIG_NET_IGMP_STATS: Enable IGMP Stats

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_STATS , CONFIG_NET_IGMP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/stats/Kconfig

    Enable IGMP stats.

1.7.3.80.9 CONFIG_NET_UDP_STATS: Enable UDP Stats

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_STATS , CONFIG_NET_UDP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/stats/Kconfig

    Enable UDP stats. Default is on if UDP enabled, otherwise off.

1.7.3.80.10 CONFIG_NET_TCP_STATS: Enable TCP Stats

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_STATS , CONFIG_NET_TCP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/stats/Kconfig

    Enable TCP stats. Default is on if TCP enabled, otherwise off.

1.7.3.80.11 CONFIG_NET_MEM_STATS: Enable Memory Stats

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_STATS , !CONFIG_NET_MEM_LIBC_MALLOC
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/stats/Kconfig

1.7.3.80.12 CONFIG_NET_MEMP_STATS: Enable Memory Pool Stats

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_STATS , !CONFIG_NET_MEMP_MEM_MALLOC
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/stats/Kconfig

    Enable mem.c stats.

1.7.3.80.13 CONFIG_NET_SYS_STATS: Enable System Stats

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_STATS
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/stats/Kconfig

    Enable system stats (sem and mbox counts, etc).

    Enable IPv6 ND stats.

1.7.3.81 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_VLAN: Support VLAN

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

    support receiving ethernet packets with VLAN header. Additionally, you can define ETHARP_VLAN_CHECK to an u16_t VLAN ID to check. If VLAN_CHECK is defined, only VLAN-traffic for this VLAN is accepted.

1.7.3.82 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_VLAN_CHECK: Check VLAN ID for receiviing packet

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_VLAN
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

1.7.3.83 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_VLAN_CHECK_ID: VLAN ID for receiviing packet

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_VLAN_CHECK
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

1.7.3.84 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_LOOPBACK_INTERFACE: Support loopback interface

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

    Support loop interface (127.0.0.1).

1.7.3.85 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_SLIP_INTERFACE: Support serial line IP interface

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_SLIP_INTERFACE
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

  • Type: Boolean

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_PPP_SUPPORT
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

  • Type: Boolean

  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

  • Type: Boolean

  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_PPP_SUPPORT
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1500
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_PPP_SUPPORT
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

1.7.3.96 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_PPP_THREAD_NAME: The name assigned to the pppInputThread

  • Type: String
  • Default: "pppInputThread"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_PPP_SUPPORT
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1024
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_PPP_SUPPORT
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

1.7.3.98 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_PPP_THREAD_PRIO: The priority assigned to the pppInputThread

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_PPP_SUPPORT
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

1.7.3.99 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_SNMP: Enable SNMP

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_UDP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

1.7.3.100 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_SNMP_CONCURRENT_REQUESTS: Number of concurrent requests

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_SNMP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

    Number of concurrent requests the module will allow. At least one request buffer is required. Does not have to be changed unless external MIBs answer request asynchronously

1.7.3.101 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_SNMP_TRAP_DESTINATIONS: Number of trap destinations

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_SNMP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

    Number of trap destinations. At least one trap destination is required

1.7.3.102 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_SNMP_PRIVATE_MIB: Supports Private MIB

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_SNMP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

    When using a private MIB, you have to create a file 'private_mib.h' that contains a 'struct mib_array_node mib_private' which contains your MIB.

1.7.3.103 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_SNMP_MAX_TREE_DEPTH: The maximum depth of the SNMP tree

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 15
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_SNMP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

    The maximum depth of the SNMP tree. With private MIBs enabled, this depends on your MIB! This affects the size of MEMP_SNMP_VALUE elements.

1.7.3.104 Menu: Interface Name

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

1.7.3.104.1 CONFIG_NET_ETH_IFNAME: Ethernet

  • Type: String
  • Default: "en"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig
