1.7.3.104.2 CONFIG_NET_LOOP_IFNAME: Loopback

  • Type: String
  • Default: "lo"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

1.7.3.104.3 CONFIG_NET_STA_IFNAME: Wi-Fi Station

  • Type: String
  • Default: "wl"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

1.7.3.104.4 CONFIG_NET_SOFTAP_IFNAME: Wi-Fi SoftAP

  • Type: String
  • Default: "sa"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

1.7.3.105 CONFIG_NET_LWIP_NETDB: Enable LWIP NETDB Library

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , (CONFIG_NET_IPv4 || CONFIG_NET_IPv6) && CONFIG_NET_UDP
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/Kconfig

1.7.3.106 CONFIG_NET_DNS_TABLE_SIZE: DNS maximum number of entries to maintain locally

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_NETDB
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/netdb/Kconfig

    DNS maximum number of entries to maintain locally.

1.7.3.107 CONFIG_NET_DNS_MAX_NAME_LENGTH: DNS maximum host name length supported in the name table

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_NETDB
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/netdb/Kconfig

    DNS maximum host name length supported in the name table.

1.7.3.108 CONFIG_NET_DNS_MAX_SERVERS: The maximum of DNS servers

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_NETDB
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/netdb/Kconfig

    The maximum of DNS servers The first server can be initialized automatically by defining DNS_SERVER_ADDRESS(ipaddr), where \'ipaddr\' is an \'ip_addr_t\*\'

1.7.3.109 CONFIG_NET_DNS_DOES_NAME_CHECK: DNS do a name checking between the query and the response

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_NETDB
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/netdb/Kconfig

    DNS do a name checking between the query and the response.

1.7.3.110 CONFIG_NET_DNS_SECURE: LWIP_DNS_SECURE: controls the security level of the DNS

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_NETDB
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/netdb/Kconfig

    controls the security level of the DNS implementation LWIP_DNS_SECURE_RAND_XID 1 LWIP_DNS_SECURE_NO_MULTIPLE_OUTSTANDING 2 LWIP_DNS_SECURE_RAND_SRC_PORT 4 Use all DNS security features, set it to 7. This is overridable but should only be needed by very small targets or when using against non standard DNS servers.

1.7.3.111 CONFIG_NET_DNS_LOCAL_HOSTLIST: DNS_LOCAL_HOSTLIST: Implements a local host-to-address list. If enabled, you have to define an initialize

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_NETDB
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/netdb/Kconfig

    Implements a local host-to-address list. If enabled, you have to define an initialize.

1.7.3.112 CONFIG_NET_DNS_LOCAL_HOSTLIST_IS_DYNAMIC: If this is turned on, the local host-list can be dynamically changed at runtime

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_NETDB , CONFIG_NET_DNS_LOCAL_HOSTLIST
  • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/netdb/Kconfig

    If this is turned on, the local host-list can be dynamically changed at runtime.

1.7.4 Menu: Driver buffer configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

1.7.4.1 CONFIG_NET_MULTIBUFFER: Use multiple device-side I/O buffers

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    If this configuration is selected, then the driver can manage multiple I/O buffers and can, for example, be filling one input buffer while sending another output buffer. Or, as another example, the driver may support queuing of concurrent input/ouput and output transfers for better performance.

1.7.4.2 CONFIG_NET_ETH_MTU: Ethernet packet buffer size (MTU)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default Values:
    • Default: 1294

      Dependency: CONFIG_NET_IPv6

    • Default: 590

      Dependency: !CONFIG_NET_IPv6

  • Range: 590 - 1518
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_ETHERNET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    Packet buffer size. This size includes the TCP/UDP payload plus the size of TCP/UDP header, the IP header, and the Ethernet header. This value is normally referred to as the MTU (Maximum Transmission Unit); the payload is the MSS (Maximum Segment Size).

    IPv4 hosts are required to be able to handle an MSS of at least 536 octets, resulting in a minimum buffer size of 536+20+20+14 = 590.

    IPv6 hosts are required to be able to handle an MSS of 1220 octets, resulting in a minimum buffer size of of 1220+20+40+14 = 1294

1.7.4.3 CONFIG_NET_GUARDSIZE: Driver I/O guard size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    Network drivers often receive packets with garbage at the end and are longer than the size of packet in the TCP header. The following "fudge" factor increases the size of the I/O buffering by a small amount to allocate slightly oversize packets. After receipt, the packet size will be chopped down to the size indicated in the TCP header.

1.7.5 Menu: Data link support

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

1.7.5.1 CONFIG_NET_ETHERNET: Ethernet support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default Values:
    • Default: y

      Dependency: !CONFIG_NET_SLIP

    • Default: n

      Dependency: CONFIG_NET_SLIP

  • Selects: CONFIG_NETDEV_MULTINIC, CONFIG_NET_MULTILINK
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    If NET_SLIP is not selected, then Ethernet will be used (there is no need to define anything special in the configuration file to use Ethernet -- it is the default).

1.7.6 Menu: Network Device Operations

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/netdev/Kconfig

1.7.6.1 CONFIG_NETDEV_PHY_IOCTL: Enable PHY ioctl()

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/netdev/Kconfig

    Enable support for ioctl() commands to access PHY registers"

1.7.7 Menu: Protocols

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

1.7.7.1 Menu: Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP)

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

1.7.7.1.1 Choice: DHCP source

  • Default: NET_DHCP
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_NET_DHCP: Default DHCP client/server application

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
    • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DHCP: (Optional) Enabling LwIP DHCP client/server

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
    • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

1.7.7.1.2 CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPC: DHCP client

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_IPv4
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/dhcpc/Kconfig.protocol

    Enable support for the DHCP client.

1.7.7.1.3 CONFIG_LWIP_DHCPC_TIMEOUT: LWIP DHCPC timeout

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 10000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPC
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/dhcpc/Kconfig.protocol

1.7.7.1.4 CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD: DHCP server

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_IPv4
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/dhcpd/Kconfig.protocol

    Enable support for the DHCP server.

1.7.7.1.5 CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD_HOST: Host-based DHCPD build

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD , CONFIG_NET_DHCP , CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/dhcpd/Kconfig.protocol

    DHCPD supports a host based build for testing on a PC. It is enabled by this configuration, however, ti cannot really be used in the context to the TinyAra build as it currently stands.

1.7.7.1.6 CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD_IGNOREBROADCAST: Ignore client broadcast

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD , CONFIG_NET_DHCP
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/dhcpd/Kconfig.protocol

    This is a hack. I've had problems with Windows machines responding to unicast. I think this is associated with a Windows registry key in HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\DHCPServer\Parameters: The IgnoreBroadcastFlag value controls this behavior: A value of 1 will cause the server to ignore the client broadcast flag and always respond with multicast; the value 0 to allows clients to request unicast.

1.7.7.1.7 CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD_LEASETIME: Lease time (seconds)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 864000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD , CONFIG_NET_DHCP
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/dhcpd/Kconfig.protocol

    Default: 10 days

1.7.7.1.8 CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD_MINLEASETIME: Minimum lease time (seconds)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 86400
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD , CONFIG_NET_DHCP
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/dhcpd/Kconfig.protocol

    Default: 1 days

1.7.7.1.9 CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD_MAXLEASETIME: Maximum lease time (seconds)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2592000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD , CONFIG_NET_DHCP
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/dhcpd/Kconfig.protocol

    Default: 30 days

1.7.7.1.10 CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD_MAXLEASES: Maximum number of leases

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 6
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD , CONFIG_NET_DHCP
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/dhcpd/Kconfig.protocol

1.7.7.1.11 CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD_STARTIP: First IP address

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0xc0a82f02
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD , CONFIG_NET_DHCP
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/dhcpd/Kconfig.protocol

1.7.7.1.12 CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD_ROUTERIP: Router IP (0 to disable)

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0xc0a82f01
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD , CONFIG_NET_DHCP
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/dhcpd/Kconfig.protocol

1.7.7.1.13 CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD_NETMASK: Netmask (0 to disable)

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0xffffff00
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD , CONFIG_NET_DHCP
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/dhcpd/Kconfig.protocol

1.7.7.1.14 CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD_DNSIP: DNS (0 to disable)

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x08080808
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD , CONFIG_NET_DHCP
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/dhcpd/Kconfig.protocol

1.7.7.1.15 CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD_OFFERTIME: Offer time (seconds)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 3600
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD , CONFIG_NET_DHCP
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/dhcpd/Kconfig.protocol

    Default: 1 hour

1.7.7.1.16 CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD_DECLINETIME: Decline time (seconds)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 3600
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD , CONFIG_NET_DHCP
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/dhcpd/Kconfig.protocol

    Default: 1 hour

1.7.7.1.17 CONFIG_LWIP_DHCPS_LEASE_DEF: LWIP DHCPS lease time (min)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 120
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DHCP
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/dhcpd/Kconfig.protocol

1.7.7.1.18 CONFIG_LWIP_DHCPS_SERVER_IP: Set DHCP server IP

  • Type: String
  • Default: "192.168.47.1"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DHCP
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/dhcpd/Kconfig.protocol

1.7.7.1.19 CONFIG_LWIP_DHCPS_SERVER_NETMASK: Set netmask

  • Type: String
  • Default: "255.255.255.0"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DHCP
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/dhcpd/Kconfig.protocol

1.7.7.1.20 CONFIG_LWIP_DHCPS_MAX_STATION_NUM: Maximum number of allowed stations

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DHCP
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/dhcpd/Kconfig.protocol

1.7.7.2 CONFIG_NETUTILS_XMLRPC: XML RPC library

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_NETUTILS_NETLIB
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/xmlrpc/Kconfig.protocol

    Enables the Embeddable Lightweight XML-RPC Server discussed at http://www.drdobbs.com/web-development/an-embeddable-lightweight-xml-rpc-server/184405364

1.7.7.3 CONFIG_XMLRPC_STRINGSIZE: Maximum string length

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_XMLRPC
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/xmlrpc/Kconfig.protocol

    Maximum string length for method names and XML RPC string values.

1.7.7.4 CONFIG_NETUTILS_NTPCLIENT: NTP client

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP_NETDB
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/ntpclient/Kconfig.protocol

    Enable support for the minimal NTP client.

1.7.7.5 CONFIG_NETUTILS_NTPCLIENT_STACKSIZE: NTP client daemon stack stack size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2048
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_NTPCLIENT
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/ntpclient/Kconfig.protocol

1.7.7.6 CONFIG_NETUTILS_NTPCLIENT_SERVERPRIO: NTP client daemon priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_NTPCLIENT
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/ntpclient/Kconfig.protocol

1.7.7.7 CONFIG_NETUTILS_NTPCLIENT_SIGWAKEUP: NTP client wakeup signal number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 18
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_NTPCLIENT , !CONFIG_DISABLE_SIGNALS
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/ntpclient/Kconfig.protocol

1.7.7.8 CONFIG_NETUTILS_NTPCLIENT_DEFAULT_SERVER: NTP client default server

  • Type: String
  • Default: "time.google.com"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_NTPCLIENT
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/ntpclient/Kconfig.protocol

1.7.7.9 CONFIG_NETUTILS_NTPCLIENT_DEFAULT_SERVER_PORT: NTP client default server port

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 123
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_NTPCLIENT
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/ntpclient/Kconfig.protocol

1.7.7.10 CONFIG_NETUTILS_NTPCLIENT_DEFAULT_INTERVAL_SECONDS: NTP client default interval seconds

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 60
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_NTPCLIENT
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/ntpclient/Kconfig.protocol

1.7.7.11 CONFIG_NETUTILS_NTPCLIENT_DEBUG: NTP client debug message option

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_NTPCLIENT
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/ntpclient/Kconfig.protocol

    Enable NTP client debug message

1.7.7.12 CONFIG_NETUTILS_WEBSERVER: Webserver

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/webserver/Kconfig.protocol

    Enables the webserver. This webserver supports multi requests and multi instance. User can configure webserver by modifying CONF values in http_server.h.

1.7.7.13 CONFIG_NETUTILS_WEBSERVER_MAX_CLIENT_HANDLER: HTTP maximum client handler

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_WEBSERVER
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/webserver/Kconfig.protocol

    Set maximum client handler number in webserver.

1.7.7.14 CONFIG_NETUTILS_WEBSERVER_LOGD: HTTP debugging log

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_WEBSERVER
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/webserver/Kconfig.protocol

    Enables HTTP debugging logs.

1.7.7.15 CONFIG_NETUTILS_WEBSERVER_LOGE: HTTP error log

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_WEBSERVER
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/webserver/Kconfig.protocol

    Enables HTTP error logs.

1.7.7.16 CONFIG_NETUTILS_FTPC: FTP client

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/ftpc/Kconfig.protocol

    Enable support for the FTP client.

1.7.7.17 CONFIG_DEBUG_FTPC: Debug FTP client

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_FTPC , CONFIG_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/ftpc/Kconfig.protocol

    Enable debug support for the FTP client. This option simple forces CONFIG_DEBUG_NET to be on, but only for the files within this directory.

1.7.7.18 CONFIG_NETUTILS_MDNS: Multicast DNS

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/mdns/Kconfig.protocol

    Enables support for Multicast DNS. The multicast Domain Name System (mDNS) resolves host names to IP addresses within small networks that do not include a local name server.

1.7.7.19 CONFIG_NETUTILS_MDNS_RESPONDER_SUPPORT: mDNS Responder

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_MDNS
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/mdns/Kconfig.protocol

    Enable mDNS Responder

1.7.7.20 CONFIG_NETUTILS_MDNS_XMDNS: xmDNS for supporting site domain

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_MDNS
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/mdns/Kconfig.protocol

    Enable xmDNS for supporting site domain

1.7.7.21 CONFIG_NETUTILS_MDNS_XMDNS_MULTICAST_ADDR: xmDNS Multicast Address

  • Type: String
  • Default: "224.0.0.251"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_MDNS , CONFIG_NETUTILS_MDNS_XMDNS
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/mdns/Kconfig.protocol

    xmDNS Multicast Address

1.7.7.22 CONFIG_NETUTILS_MDNS_XMDNS_PORT_NUM: xmDNS Port Number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 5353
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_MDNS , CONFIG_NETUTILS_MDNS_XMDNS
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/mdns/Kconfig.protocol

    xmDNS Port Number

1.7.7.23 CONFIG_NETUTILS_WEBCLIENT: Webclient

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET , CONFIG_NETUTILS_WEBSERVER
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/webclient/Kconfig.protocol

    Enables the webclient. This webclient supports to send request by sync/async mode. Sync mode is excuted on same task with caller. Async mode is excuted on new task.

1.7.7.24 CONFIG_WEBCLIENT_MAXHTTPLINE: Maximum Httpline Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 200
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_WEBCLIENT
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/webclient/Kconfig.protocol

    Sets Buffer HTTP header data and parse line at a time.

1.7.7.25 CONFIG_WEBCLIENT_MAXMIMESIZE: Maximum MimeType Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 32
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_WEBCLIENT
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/webclient/Kconfig.protocol

    Sets Maximum Mimetype Size.

1.7.7.26 CONFIG_WEBCLIENT_MAXHOSTNAME: Maximum Hostname Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 128
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_WEBCLIENT
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/webclient/Kconfig.protocol

    Sets Maximum Hostname Size.

1.7.7.27 CONFIG_WEBCLIENT_MAXFILENAME: Maximum Filename Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 128
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_WEBCLIENT
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/webclient/Kconfig.protocol

    Sets Maximum Filename Size.

1.7.7.28 CONFIG_WGET_USERAGENT: User Agent

  • Type: String
  • Default: "TinyARA"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_WEBCLIENT
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/webclient/Kconfig.protocol

    Sets user agent. It apply to request message.

1.7.7.29 CONFIG_NETUTILS_FTPD: FTP server

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/ftpd/Kconfig.protocol

    Enable support for the FTP server.

1.7.7.30 CONFIG_NETUTILS_WEBSOCKET: Web socket

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_SECURITY_TLS
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/websocket/Kconfig.protocol

    Enable support for the web socket.

1.7.7.31 CONFIG_NETUTILS_LIBCOAP: libcoap 4.1.1

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_NETDB
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/libcoap/Kconfig.protocol

    Enable support for the libcoap library

1.7.7.32 CONFIG_NETUTILS_LIBCOAP_DEBUG: Enable CoAP Debugging Log

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_LIBCOAP
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/libcoap/Kconfig.protocol

    Enables CoAP logs

1.7.7.33 CONFIG_NETUTILS_TFTPC: TFTP client

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/tftpc/Kconfig.protocol

    Enable support for the TFTP client.

1.7.7.34 CONFIG_NETUTILS_TELNETD: Telnet daemon

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_NETDEV_TELNET
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/telnetd/Kconfig.protocol

    Enable support for the Telnet daemon.

1.7.7.35 CONFIG_NETUTILS_SMTP: SMTP

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/smtp/Kconfig.protocol

    Enable support for SMTP.

1.7.7.36 CONFIG_GRPC: gRPC

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_PROTOBUF
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET && CONFIG_LIBCXX
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/grpc/Kconfig.protocol

    Enable support for the gRPC.

1.7.7.37 CONFIG_GRPC_PTHREAD_SIZE: Set thread size for grpc modules

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16384
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_GRPC
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/grpc/Kconfig.protocol

    set thread size for grpc modules

1.7.7.38 CONFIG_TSI_LOG: Enable TSI Layer Log

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_GRPC
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/grpc/Kconfig.protocol

    Show function calls process in TSI Layer

1.7.7.39 CONFIG_TSI_MBEDTLS_LOG: Set mbedTLS Log Level(0:NONE - 5:ALL)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_GRPC
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/grpc/Kconfig.protocol

    Set Log levels for mbedtls debugging log

1.7.7.40 CONFIG_NETUTILS_MQTT: MQTT

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP_NETDB
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/network/mqtt/Kconfig.protocol

    Enable support for MQTT. MQTT provides a lightweight method of carrying out messaging using a publish/subscribe model. This makes it suitable for "Internet of Things" messaging such as with low power sensors or mobile devices such as phones, embedded computers. You can 

      get more information about MQTT at https://mosquitto.org/.

1.7.7.41 CONFIG_NETUTILS_MQTT_SECURITY: MQTT with security

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_MQTT , CONFIG_NET_SECURITY_TLS
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/network/mqtt/Kconfig.protocol

    Enable support for security mode in MQTT. MQTT security mode will work with mbedTLS library. If you want to change Certificate of Key file or change 

      configurations of security, Please reference mqtt examples.

1.7.7.42 CONFIG_NET_SECURITY_TLS: TLS Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP_NETDB
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

1.7.7.43 CONFIG_TLS_WITH_SSS: Enable HW Accelerator(SSS)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_SECURITY_TLS , CONFIG_NET_SECURITY_TLS , CONFIG_S5J_SSS
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/mbedtls/Kconfig.protocol

1.7.7.44 CONFIG_SUPPORT_FULL_SECURITY: Enable full security features

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_SECURITY_TLS , CONFIG_NET_SECURITY_TLS , CONFIG_S5J_SSS && CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ARTIK05X_FAMILY
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/mbedtls/Kconfig.protocol

    Supports security features with secure storage.

1.7.7.45 CONFIG_TLS_MPI_MAX_SIZE: TLS MPI Max Size (bytes)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 512
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_SECURITY_TLS , CONFIG_NET_SECURITY_TLS
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/mbedtls/Kconfig.protocol

    Specify the maximum ram size to use when encrypting. You can find this value in the information for the certificate to use. ex) Server public key is 2048 bit

1.7.7.46 Menu: HW Selection

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_SECURITY_TLS , CONFIG_NET_SECURITY_TLS , CONFIG_TLS_WITH_SSS
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/mbedtls/Kconfig.protocol

1.7.7.46.1 CONFIG_HW_RNG: HW RNG

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_SECURITY_TLS , CONFIG_NET_SECURITY_TLS , CONFIG_TLS_WITH_SSS
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/mbedtls/Kconfig.protocol

    Supports true random generator by hardware Maximum random size is 256 bytes at one time.

1.7.7.46.2 CONFIG_HW_DH_PARAM: HW supports DH params

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_SECURITY_TLS , CONFIG_NET_SECURITY_TLS , CONFIG_TLS_WITH_SSS
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/mbedtls/Kconfig.protocol

    Generates and caculates diffie-hellman parameter with hardware. Supporting parameter size : 1024, 2048

1.7.7.46.3 CONFIG_HW_ECDH_PARAM: HW supports ECDH params

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_SECURITY_TLS , CONFIG_NET_SECURITY_TLS , CONFIG_TLS_WITH_SSS
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/mbedtls/Kconfig.protocol

    Generates and caculates eliptic curve params with hardware. 

      Supporting curves :
. SECP 192, 224, 256, 384, 512
. Brainpool 256

1.7.7.46.4 CONFIG_HW_RSA_VERIFICATION: HW rsa verification

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_SECURITY_TLS , CONFIG_NET_SECURITY_TLS , CONFIG_TLS_WITH_SSS
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/mbedtls/Kconfig.protocol

    Verifing a RSA signature based on hardware. Supporting key size : 1024, 2048

1.7.7.46.5 CONFIG_HW_ECDSA_VERIFICATION: HW ecdsa verification

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_SECURITY_TLS , CONFIG_NET_SECURITY_TLS , CONFIG_TLS_WITH_SSS
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/mbedtls/Kconfig.protocol

    Verifing a ECDSA signature based on hardware. Supporting curves : 

      . SECP 192, 224, 256, 384, 512
. Brainpool 256

1.7.7.46.6 CONFIG_HW_RSA_ENC: HW rsa encryption

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_SECURITY_TLS , CONFIG_NET_SECURITY_TLS , CONFIG_TLS_WITH_SSS
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/mbedtls/Kconfig.protocol

    Encrypts a data based on hardware. Supporting key size : 1024, 2048

1.7.8 Menu: Wireless

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

1.7.8.1 CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER: Enable Wi-Fi Manager

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_DRIVERS_WIRELESS
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/wifi_manager/Kconfig

    Easy APIs for applications to use and control Wi-Fi features

1.7.8.2 Choice: WiFi library

  • Default: SELECT_WPA_SUPPLICANT
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/wifi_manager/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_SELECT_WPA_SUPPLICANT: select wpa_supplicant

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_WPA_SUPPLICANT, CONFIG_NETUTILS_WIFI
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER
    • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/wifi_manager/Kconfig

      Select the wpa_supplicant

    CONFIG_SELECT_PROPIETARY_SUPPLICANT: Select external vendor supplicant

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER
    • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/wifi_manager/Kconfig

      select the third party supplicant

1.7.8.3 Choice: WiFi Driver

  • Default: SELECT_NO_DRIVER
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/wifi_manager/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_SELECT_NO_DRIVER: No Wi-Fi Driver

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER
    • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/wifi_manager/Kconfig

    CONFIG_SELECT_SCSC_WLAN: Enable SCSC Wireless Module

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_SCSC_WLAN
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER
    • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/wifi_manager/Kconfig

    CONFIG_SELECT_PROPIETARY_WLAN: Enable vendor-specific Wireless Module

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER
    • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/wifi_manager/Kconfig

1.7.8.4 CONFIG_NETUTILS_WIFI: SLSI Wi-Fi API

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SCSC_WLAN, CONFIG_WPA_SUPPLICANT
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER , CONFIG_SELECT_WPA_SUPPLICANT
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/slsi_wifi/Kconfig

    Enable support for the SLSI WI-Fi Networking API.

1.7.8.5 CONFIG_SLSI_WIFI_DEFAULT_WLAN_COUNTRY_CODE: Country code (2 chars)

  • Type: String
  • Default: "00"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER , CONFIG_SELECT_WPA_SUPPLICANT , CONFIG_NETUTILS_WIFI
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/slsi_wifi/Kconfig

    The country code to use for the board when starting the first time. The country code is a two char upper-case value, e.g. DK, KR, JP, US. Use "00" for multi-country international.

1.7.8.6 CONFIG_SLSI_WIFI_DEFAULT_WLAN_TX_POWER: TX power in dBm (12-30)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 30
  • Range: 12 - 30
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER , CONFIG_SELECT_WPA_SUPPLICANT , CONFIG_NETUTILS_WIFI
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/slsi_wifi/Kconfig

    The default tx power value in dBm to use for the board when starting the first time. The tx power value is in the range 0-30 and is of the type dBm.

1.7.8.7 CONFIG_SLSI_WIFI_FILESYSTEM_SUPPORT: Support filesystem

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER , CONFIG_SELECT_WPA_SUPPLICANT , CONFIG_NETUTILS_WIFI
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/slsi_wifi/Kconfig

    The API can utilize the filesystem for configuration files and log files if needed. This is the default behavior but can be disabled on systems without filesystems. If filesystem support is disabled then functionality like auto-reconnect will not work as this uses the config file to store the relevant info across reboots.

1.7.8.8 CONFIG_SLSI_WIFI_DIR: Path to where wifi can store the config files (ommit the trailing /)

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/mnt/wifi"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER , CONFIG_SELECT_WPA_SUPPLICANT , CONFIG_NETUTILS_WIFI , CONFIG_SLSI_WIFI_FILESYSTEM_SUPPORT
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/slsi_wifi/Kconfig

    The path where the wifi system can store the config and log files if needed. The path must be without the trailing /.

1.7.8.9 CONFIG_SLSI_WIFI_LOG_FILE_NAME: Name of the log file to use

  • Type: String
  • Default: "slsiwifi.log"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER , CONFIG_SELECT_WPA_SUPPLICANT , CONFIG_NETUTILS_WIFI , CONFIG_SLSI_WIFI_FILESYSTEM_SUPPORT
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/slsi_wifi/Kconfig

    The name of the file used to store logs from the wifi system.

1.7.8.10 CONFIG_SLSI_WIFI_CONFIG_FILE_NAME: name of the configuration file to use

  • Type: String
  • Default: "slsiwifi.conf"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER , CONFIG_SELECT_WPA_SUPPLICANT , CONFIG_NETUTILS_WIFI , CONFIG_SLSI_WIFI_FILESYSTEM_SUPPORT
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/slsi_wifi/Kconfig

    The name of the file used to store information about the wifi system.

1.7.8.11 Menu: wpa_supplicant

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER , CONFIG_SELECT_WPA_SUPPLICANT
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/wpa_supplicant/Kconfig

1.7.8.11.1 CONFIG_WPA_SUPPLICANT: wpa_supplicant

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER , CONFIG_SELECT_WPA_SUPPLICANT
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/wpa_supplicant/Kconfig

    Start the wpa_supplicant

1.7.8.11.2 CONFIG_WPA_SUPPLICANT_PRIORITY: wpa_supplicant task priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER , CONFIG_SELECT_WPA_SUPPLICANT , CONFIG_WPA_SUPPLICANT
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/wpa_supplicant/Kconfig

1.7.8.11.3 CONFIG_WPA_SUPPLICANT_STACKSIZE: wpa_supplicant stack size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16384
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER , CONFIG_SELECT_WPA_SUPPLICANT , CONFIG_WPA_SUPPLICANT
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/wpa_supplicant/Kconfig

1.7.8.11.4 CONFIG_WPA_SUPPLICANT_ENTRYPOINT: wpa_supplicant entry point

  • Type: String
  • Default: "wpa_supplicant_main"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER , CONFIG_SELECT_WPA_SUPPLICANT , CONFIG_WPA_SUPPLICANT
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/wpa_supplicant/Kconfig

1.7.8.11.5 CONFIG_CTRL_IFACE: wpa_supplicant ctrl_iface flag

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER , CONFIG_SELECT_WPA_SUPPLICANT , CONFIG_WPA_SUPPLICANT
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/wpa_supplicant/Kconfig

1.7.8.11.6 CONFIG_CTRL_IFACE_FIFO: wpa_supplicant ctrl_iface type - fifo

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER , CONFIG_SELECT_WPA_SUPPLICANT , CONFIG_WPA_SUPPLICANT
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/wpa_supplicant/Kconfig

1.7.8.11.7 CONFIG_WPA_CTRL_FIFO_DEV_REQ: Path to WPA Control FIFO device for requests

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/dev/wpa_ctrl_req"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER , CONFIG_SELECT_WPA_SUPPLICANT , CONFIG_WPA_SUPPLICANT , CONFIG_CTRL_IFACE_FIFO
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/wpa_supplicant/Kconfig

1.7.8.11.8 CONFIG_WPA_CTRL_FIFO_DEV_CFM: Path to WPA Control FIFO device for confirm

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/dev/wpa_ctrl_cfm"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER , CONFIG_SELECT_WPA_SUPPLICANT , CONFIG_WPA_SUPPLICANT , CONFIG_CTRL_IFACE_FIFO
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/wpa_supplicant/Kconfig

1.7.8.11.9 CONFIG_WPA_CTRL_FIFO_DEV_GLOBAL_REQ: Path to WPA Control global FIFO device for requests

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/dev/wpa_ctrl_global_req"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER , CONFIG_SELECT_WPA_SUPPLICANT , CONFIG_WPA_SUPPLICANT , CONFIG_CTRL_IFACE_FIFO
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/wpa_supplicant/Kconfig

1.7.8.11.10 CONFIG_WPA_CTRL_FIFO_DEV_GLOBAL_CFM: Path to WPA Control global FIFO device for confirm

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/dev/wpa_ctrl_global_cfm"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER , CONFIG_SELECT_WPA_SUPPLICANT , CONFIG_WPA_SUPPLICANT , CONFIG_CTRL_IFACE_FIFO
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/wpa_supplicant/Kconfig

1.7.8.11.11 CONFIG_WPA_MONITOR_FIFO_DEV: Path to WPA Control monitor FIFO device

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/dev/wpa_monitor"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER , CONFIG_SELECT_WPA_SUPPLICANT , CONFIG_WPA_SUPPLICANT , CONFIG_CTRL_IFACE_FIFO
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/wpa_supplicant/Kconfig

1.7.8.11.12 CONFIG_WPA_CTRL_FIFO_MK_MODE: File access mode for WPA control FIFOs

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 666
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER , CONFIG_SELECT_WPA_SUPPLICANT , CONFIG_WPA_SUPPLICANT , CONFIG_CTRL_IFACE_FIFO
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/wpa_supplicant/Kconfig

1.7.8.11.13 CONFIG_ELOOP_POLL: wpa_supplicant eloop poll mechanism - poll

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER , CONFIG_SELECT_WPA_SUPPLICANT , CONFIG_WPA_SUPPLICANT
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/wpa_supplicant/Kconfig

1.7.8.11.14 CONFIG_WPA_SUPPLICANT_CMD: wpa_supplicant command line interface

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER , CONFIG_SELECT_WPA_SUPPLICANT , CONFIG_WPA_SUPPLICANT
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/wpa_supplicant/Kconfig

1.7.8.11.15 CONFIG_DRIVER_T20: Driver T20 for SLSI WiFi

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER , CONFIG_SELECT_WPA_SUPPLICANT , CONFIG_WPA_SUPPLICANT , CONFIG_SCSC_WLAN
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/wpa_supplicant/Kconfig

1.7.8.12 CONFIG_WIFI_PROFILE_SECURESTORAGE: Store the Wi-Fi Profile in a Secure Storage

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER , CONFIG_SUPPORT_FULL_SECURITY
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/wifi_manager/Kconfig

1.7.8.13 CONFIG_WIFIMGR_SOFTAP_IFNAME: interface name of softap mode

  • Type: String
  • Default: "wl1"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/wifi_manager/Kconfig

1.7.8.14 CONFIG_WIFIMGR_STA_IFNAME: interface name of station mode

  • Type: String
  • Default: "wl1"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/wifi_manager/Kconfig

1.7.8.15 CONFIG_WIFIMGR_DISABLE_AUTO_GET_IP: disable auto get ip (ipv4 dhcp)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/wifi_manager/Kconfig

1.7.8.16 CONFIG_DISABLE_EXTERNAL_AUTOCONNECT: disable external autoconnect

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/wifi_manager/Kconfig

1.7.8.17 CONFIG_WIFIMGR_INTERNAL_AUTOCONNECT: enable internal auto(re)connect

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER , CONFIG_DISABLE_EXTERNAL_AUTOCONNECT
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/wifi_manager/Kconfig

1.7.9 Menu: Network utilities

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

1.7.9.1 CONFIG_NETUTILS_NETLIB: Network support library

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/netutils/Kconfig.netutil

    Enable support for the network support library.

1.7.9.2 CONFIG_NET_NETMON: Enable network monitor

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_NETLIB
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/netutils/Kconfig.netutil

    Enable support for the network monitor.

1.8 Menu: Audio Support

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.8.1 CONFIG_AUDIO: Audio Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./audio/Kconfig

    Enables overall support for Audio library.

1.8.2 CONFIG_AUDIO_MULTI_SESSION: Support multiple sessions

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_AUDIO
  • Kconfig file: ./audio/Kconfig

    Some audio devices, such as USB attached sound cards, may support more than one streaming session at a time (each with one or more audio channels). Selecting this feature adds support for tracking multiple concurrent sessions with the lower-level audio devices.

1.8.3 Menu: Audio Buffer Configuration

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_AUDIO
  • Kconfig file: ./audio/Kconfig

1.8.3.1 CONFIG_AUDIO_LARGE_BUFFERS: Support Audio Buffers with greater than 65K samples

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_AUDIO
  • Kconfig file: ./audio/Kconfig

    By default, the Audio Pipeline Buffers use a 16-bit max sample count, limiting the number of samples per buffer to 65K. Enable this option to specify a 32-bit max sample count for increased samples / buffer capability. channel capability.

1.8.3.2 CONFIG_AUDIO_NUM_BUFFERS: Number of buffers for audio processing

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_AUDIO
  • Kconfig file: ./audio/Kconfig

    Specifies the number of buffers to allocate for audio processing. If Driver Specified buffer sizes is enabled (below), then the low-level drivers will have the opportunity to override this value.

1.8.3.3 CONFIG_AUDIO_BUFSIZE: Size of each audio buffer for audio processing

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2048
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_AUDIO
  • Kconfig file: ./audio/Kconfig

    Specifies the allocation size of frame for each audio buffer If Driver Specified buffer sizes is enabled (below), then the low-level drivers will have the opportunity to override this value.

1.8.3.4 CONFIG_AUDIO_DRIVER_SPECIFIC_BUFFERS: Support for Driver specified buffer sizes

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_AUDIO
  • Kconfig file: ./audio/Kconfig

    By default, the Audio system uses the same size and number of buffers regardless of the specific audio device in use. Specifying 'y' here adds extra code which allows the lower-level audio device to specify a partucular size and number of buffers.

1.8.4 Menu: Exclude Specific Audio Features

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_AUDIO
  • Kconfig file: ./audio/Kconfig

1.8.4.1 CONFIG_AUDIO_EXCLUDE_GAIN: Exclude gain controls

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_AUDIO
  • Kconfig file: ./audio/Kconfig

    Exclude building support for changing the recording gain.

1.8.4.2 CONFIG_AUDIO_EXCLUDE_VOLUME: Exclude volume controls

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_AUDIO
  • Kconfig file: ./audio/Kconfig

    Exclude building support for changing the playback volume.

1.8.4.3 CONFIG_AUDIO_EXCLUDE_BALANCE: Exclude balance controls

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_AUDIO
  • Kconfig file: ./audio/Kconfig

    Exclude building support for changing the balance.

1.8.4.4 CONFIG_AUDIO_EXCLUDE_EQUALIZER: Exclude equalizer controls

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_AUDIO
  • Kconfig file: ./audio/Kconfig

    Exclude building support for setting equalization.

1.8.4.5 CONFIG_AUDIO_EQUALIZER_NBANDS: Number of equalizer bands

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_AUDIO, !CONFIG_AUDIO_EXCLUDE_EQUALIZER
  • Kconfig file: ./audio/Kconfig

    If equalizer support is not excluded, then it will be necessary to provide the (maximum) number of equalization bands to be supported.

1.8.4.6 CONFIG_AUDIO_EXCLUDE_TONE: Exclude tone (bass and treble) controls

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default Values:
    • Default: y

      Dependency: !CONFIG_AUDIO_EXCLUDE_EQUALIZER

    • Default: n

      Dependency: CONFIG_AUDIO_EXCLUDE_EQUALIZER

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_AUDIO
  • Kconfig file: ./audio/Kconfig

    Exclude building support for changing the bass and treble. Normally you would not select both tone controls and equalizer support unless your underlying hardware supports both options.

1.8.4.7 CONFIG_AUDIO_EXCLUDE_PAUSE_RESUME: Exclude pause and resume controls

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_AUDIO
  • Kconfig file: ./audio/Kconfig

    Exclude building support for pausing and resuming audio files once they are submitted. If the sound system is being used to play short system notification or error type sounds that typicaly only last a second or two, then there is no need (or chance) to pause or resume sound playback once it has started.

1.8.4.8 CONFIG_AUDIO_EXCLUDE_STOP: Exclude stop playback controls

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_AUDIO
  • Kconfig file: ./audio/Kconfig

    Exclude building support for stopping audio files once they are submitted. If the sound system is being used to play short sytem notification or error type sounds that typically only last a second or two, then there is no need (or chance) to stop the sound playback once it has started.

1.8.4.9 CONFIG_AUDIO_EXCLUDE_FFORWARD: Exclude fast forward controls

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default Values:
    • Default: n

      Dependency: !CONFIG_AUDIO_EXCLUDE_STOP

    • Default: y

      Dependency: CONFIG_AUDIO_EXCLUDE_STOP

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_AUDIO
  • Kconfig file: ./audio/Kconfig

    Exclude building support for fast forwarding through audio files once they are submitted. Selecting this option would only make if the underlying audio decoding logic is capable of sub-sampling in the stream of audio data.

1.8.4.10 CONFIG_AUDIO_EXCLUDE_REWIND: Exclude rewind controls

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_AUDIO
  • Kconfig file: ./audio/Kconfig

    Rewind may be supported by some audio devices, but not the typical device that receives a non-seekable, stream of audio buffers.

1.8.5 CONFIG_AUDIO_CUSTOM_DEV_PATH: Use custom device path

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_AUDIO
  • Kconfig file: ./audio/Kconfig

    By default, all audio devices on the target are are registered in the /dev/audio directory. Select this option to change the default location for the device registration.

1.8.6 CONFIG_AUDIO_DEV_ROOT: Place audio devices in /dev

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_AUDIO, CONFIG_AUDIO_CUSTOM_DEV_PATH
  • Kconfig file: ./audio/Kconfig

    This option causes all device entries to appear in /dev with all the other device entries. This option generates the smallest code and RAM footprint.

1.8.7 CONFIG_AUDIO_DEV_PATH: Base path for Audio devices

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/dev/audio"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_AUDIO, CONFIG_AUDIO_CUSTOM_DEV_PATH , !CONFIG_AUDIO_DEV_ROOT
  • Kconfig file: ./audio/Kconfig

    The path on the target where audio devices are registered. The default is to place all audio devices in the /dev/audio/ directory.

1.8.8 CONFIG_AUDIO_MIXER: Planned - Enable support for the software based Audio Mixer

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_AUDIO, CONFIG_AUDIO_PLANNED
  • Kconfig file: ./audio/Kconfig

    The Audio mixer is a software-only based component that can be used to perform audio channel or device mixing.

1.8.9 CONFIG_AUDIO_MIDI_SYNTH: Planned - Enable support for the software-based MIDI synthisizer

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_AUDIO, CONFIG_AUDIO_PLANNED
  • Kconfig file: ./audio/Kconfig

    Builds a simple MIDI synthisizer.

1.8.10 CONFIG_AUDIO_OUTPUT_JACK_CONTROL: Planned - Enable support for output jack control

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_AUDIO, CONFIG_AUDIO_PLANNED
  • Kconfig file: ./audio/Kconfig

    Builds a simple MIDI synthisizer.

1.8.11 CONFIG_AUDIO_FONT: Planned - Enable support for the Audio Font

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_AUDIO, CONFIG_AUDIO_PLANNED
  • Kconfig file: ./audio/Kconfig

    The Audio font provides common audio symbols.

1.9 Menu: Media Support

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.9.1 CONFIG_MEDIA: Media Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_HAVE_CXX, CONFIG_HAVE_CXXINITIALIZE
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_AUDIO
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/media/Kconfig

    Enables overall support for Media library.

1.9.2 CONFIG_MEDIA_PLAYER: Support Media player

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MEDIA
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/media/Kconfig

    Enable media player functions

1.9.3 CONFIG_MEDIA_PLAYER_STACKSIZE: Media Player thread stack size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4096
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MEDIA, CONFIG_MEDIA_PLAYER
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/media/Kconfig

1.9.4 CONFIG_MEDIA_PLAYER_OBSERVER_STACKSIZE: Media Player Observer thread stack size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2048
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MEDIA, CONFIG_MEDIA_PLAYER
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/media/Kconfig

1.9.5 CONFIG_INPUT_DATASOURCE_STACKSIZE: InputDataSource thread stack size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4096
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MEDIA, CONFIG_MEDIA_PLAYER
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/media/Kconfig

1.9.6 CONFIG_HTTPSOURCE_DOWNLOAD_BUFFER_SIZE: Http DataSource download buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4096
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MEDIA, CONFIG_MEDIA_PLAYER
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/media/Kconfig

1.9.7 CONFIG_HTTPSOURCE_DOWNLOAD_BUFFER_THRESHOLD: Http DataSource download buffer threshold

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2048
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MEDIA, CONFIG_MEDIA_PLAYER
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/media/Kconfig

1.9.8 CONFIG_HTTPSOURCE_DOWNLOAD_STACKSIZE: Http DataSource download thread stack size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8192
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MEDIA, CONFIG_MEDIA_PLAYER
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/media/Kconfig

1.9.9 CONFIG_MEDIA_RECORDER: Support Media recorder

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MEDIA
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/media/Kconfig

    Enable media recoreder functions

1.9.10 CONFIG_MEDIA_RECORDER_STACKSIZE: Media Recorder thread stack size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 12288
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MEDIA, CONFIG_MEDIA_RECORDER
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/media/Kconfig

1.9.11 CONFIG_MEDIA_RECORDER_OBSERVER_STACKSIZE: Media Recorder Observer thread stack size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2048
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MEDIA, CONFIG_MEDIA_RECORDER
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/media/Kconfig

1.9.12 CONFIG_OUTPUT_DATASOURCE_STACKSIZE: OutputDataSource thread stack size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4096
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MEDIA, CONFIG_MEDIA_RECORDER
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/media/Kconfig

1.9.13 CONFIG_MEDIA_VOICE_SPEECH_DETECTOR: Support Media/Voice Speech Detector

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_VOICE_SOFTWARE_EPD
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MEDIA
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/media/Kconfig

    Enable Media/Voice Speech Detector functions

1.9.14 CONFIG_AUDIO_RESAMPLER_BUFSIZE: Audio Resampler Buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4096
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MEDIA, CONFIG_AUDIO
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/media/Kconfig

    Buffer size for resampler

1.9.15 CONFIG_FILE_DATASOURCE_STREAM_BUFFER_SIZE: File DataSource stream buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4096
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MEDIA
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/media/Kconfig

1.9.16 CONFIG_FILE_DATASOURCE_STREAM_BUFFER_THRESHOLD: File DataSource stream buffer threshold

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2048
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MEDIA
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/media/Kconfig

1.9.17 CONFIG_BUFFER_DATASOURCE_STREAM_BUFFER_SIZE: Buffer DataSource stream buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4096
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MEDIA
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/media/Kconfig

1.9.18 CONFIG_BUFFER_DATASOURCE_STREAM_BUFFER_THRESHOLD: Buffer DataSource stream buffer threshold

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MEDIA
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/media/Kconfig

1.9.19 CONFIG_AUDIO_CODEC: Software Audio Codec Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_AUDIO
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/media/Kconfig

    Enable software audio codec functions

1.9.20 CONFIG_AUDIO_CODEC_RINGBUFFER_SIZE: Audio Decoder Ringbuffer Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16384
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_AUDIO_CODEC
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/media/Kconfig

    Ring buffer size that used for decoding MP3/AAC

1.10 Menu: File Systems

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.10.1 CONFIG_DISABLE_MOUNTPOINT: Disable support for mount points

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/Kconfig

1.10.2 CONFIG_DISABLE_PSEUDOFS_OPERATIONS: Disable pseudo-filesystem operations

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default Values:
    • Default: y

      Dependency: CONFIG_DEFAULT_SMALL

    • Default: n

      Dependency: !CONFIG_DEFAULT_SMALL

  • Kconfig file: ./fs/Kconfig

    Disable certain operations on pseudo-file systems include mkdir, rmdir, unlink, and rename. These are necessary for the logical completeness of the illusion created by the pseudo-filesystem. However, in practical embedded system, they are seldom needed and you can save a little FLASH space by disabling the capability.

1.10.3 CONFIG_FS_AIO: Asynchronous I/O support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SCHED_LPWORK
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/aio/Kconfig

    Enable support for aynchronous I/O. This selection enables the interfaces declared in include/aio.h.

1.10.4 CONFIG_FS_NAIOC: Pre-allocated AIO containers

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_AIO
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/aio/Kconfig

    The AIO containers hold an AIO control block and appends information needed by the logic running within the RTOS. These structures are pre-allocated, the number pre-allocated controlled by this setting.

    This setting controls the number of asynchronous I/O operations that can be queued at one time. When this count is exhausted, the caller of aio_read(), aio_write(), or aio_fsync() will be forced to wait for an available container. That wait is minimized because each container is released prior to starting the next I/O.

    The AIO logic includes priority inheritance logic to prevent priority inversion problems: The priority of the low-priority work queue will be boosted, if necessary, to level of the waiting thread.

1.10.5 CONFIG_FS_NAMED_SEMAPHORES: Named semaphore support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/semaphore/Kconfig

    Include support for named semaphores.

1.10.6 CONFIG_FS_NAMED_SEMPATH: Path to semaphore storage

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/var/lock"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_NAMED_SEMAPHORES
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/semaphore/Kconfig

    The path to where named semaphores will exist in the VFS namespace.

1.10.7 CONFIG_FS_MQUEUE_MPATH: Path to message queuee

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/var/mqueue"
  • Dependencies: !CONFIG_DISABLE_MQUEUE
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/mqueue/Kconfig

    The path to where POSIX message queues will exist in the VFS namespace.

1.10.8 CONFIG_FS_SMARTFS: SMART file system

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Selects: CONFIG_FS_READABLE, CONFIG_FS_WRITABLE
  • Dependencies: !CONFIG_DISABLE_MOUNTPOINT
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/smartfs/Kconfig

    Enable TinyAra SMART Flash file system (SMARTFS) support. Arch-dependent fs automount option can be found at "os/arch/arm/src/<board>/Kconfig"

1.10.9 Menu: SMARTFS options

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_SMARTFS
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/smartfs/Kconfig

1.10.9.1 CONFIG_SMARTFS_ERASEDSTATE: FLASH erased state

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0xff
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_SMARTFS
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/smartfs/Kconfig

    The erased state of FLASH. This must have one of the values of 0xff or 0x00. Default: 0xff.

1.10.9.2 CONFIG_SMARTFS_MAXNAMLEN: Maximum file name length

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 32
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_SMARTFS
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/smartfs/Kconfig

    The maximum size of a SMARTFS file name at a given directory level. Overall path name is not restricted by this value, only individual segments in a path, such as (assuming /usr is the mount point):

      /usr/games/chess/player_stats/game1.xml

    Default: 16.

1.10.9.3 CONFIG_SMARTFS_MULTI_ROOT_DIRS: Support multiple Root Directories / Mount Points

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_SMARTFS
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/smartfs/Kconfig

    Enables support for multiple root directory entries on the SMART FLASH. Multiple root directories means the device can have multiple mount point in the VFS, each with it's own unique directory structure under it.

    When this option is enabled, instead of reporting the SMART block devices as "/dev/mtdsmart0", they will be reported as "/dev/mtdsmart0d1", "/dev/mtdsmart0d2", etc. The number of root entries actually created is set during the "mksmartfs" command when the device is initialized.

    Default: y.

1.10.9.4 CONFIG_SMARTFS_ALIGNED_ACCESS: Ensure 16 and 32 bit accesses are alined

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_SMARTFS
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/smartfs/Kconfig

    Performs little endian byte accesses to 16 and 32 values within the directory list to ensure processors that can't handle un-aligned accesses don't bomb out. Default should probably by 'Y', but set to 'N' in case any existing Big Endian instances of SmartFS exist that already have directories with data stored in big endian mode.

1.10.9.5 CONFIG_SMARTFS_BAD_SECTOR: Bad Sector Management

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_SMARTFS
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/smartfs/Kconfig

    Enables Bad Sector Management for SMART FS to ensure data 

      consistency of the persistant storage (Flash).

1.10.9.6 CONFIG_SMARTFS_DYNAMIC_HEADER: Dynamic Header

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_SMARTFS
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/smartfs/Kconfig

    Using Modified Used Byte Method to Reduce Sector Relocation

1.10.9.7 CONFIG_SMARTFS_JOURNALING: Enable filesystem journaling for smartfs

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_SMARTFS
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/smartfs/Kconfig

    Enables logging of write operations on filesystem, so that in case of power failure the filesystem can be brought to a stable state with minimal data loss. Enabling journaling will increase the delay in filesystem operations, because before doing any fs operation, journaling will first log it in journal area. The journal area will also take up space in the flash, leaving lesser space for filesystem. The space reserved for journal area is proportional to max number of file descriptors allowed and sector size defined. Thus, to minimize the area reserved for journaling, it is advised to keep sector size small.

1.10.9.8 CONFIG_SMARTFS_JOURNAL_VERIFY: Verify Journal logging

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_SMARTFS, CONFIG_SMARTFS_JOURNALING
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/smartfs/Kconfig

    The read & verify joural value after right Sometimes electronic power grow up after power off, in this case FS decide write finished properly, but it doesn't finished properly. To prevent this, verifying needed. On the other hands, it takes more time for most of file operation that using journal Logging.

1.10.9.9 CONFIG_SMARTFS_SECTOR_RECOVERY: Enable recovery of lost sectors in Filesystem

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_SMARTFS, CONFIG_MTD_SMART
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/smartfs/Kconfig

    Enables recovery of lost sectors after power failure. Lost sectors are the sectors which are allocated but not reachable from root directory.

1.10.10 CONFIG_FS_PROCFS: PROCFS File System

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_FS_READABLE
  • Dependencies: !CONFIG_DISABLE_MOUNTPOINT
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/procfs/Kconfig

    The PROCFS file system provides access to task status and other driver status through the TinyAra file system. The PROCFS may, for example, be mount at /proc. Then information about all of the currently active tasks and threads will be available in /proc.

1.10.11 CONFIG_FS_AUTOMOUNT_PROCFS: Auto mount PROCFS File System

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_PROCFS
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/procfs/Kconfig

    This provides an option to enable auto mounting of PROCFS during File System initialization.

1.10.12 Menu: Exclude individual procfs entries

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_PROCFS
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/procfs/Kconfig

1.10.12.1 CONFIG_FS_PROCFS_EXCLUDE_PROCESS: Exclude process information

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_PROCFS
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/procfs/Kconfig

    Causes the process information to be excluded from the procfs system. This will reduce code space, but then giving access to process info was kinda the whole point of procfs, but hey, whatever.

1.10.12.2 CONFIG_FS_PROCFS_EXCLUDE_UPTIME: Exclude uptime

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_PROCFS
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/procfs/Kconfig

1.10.12.3 CONFIG_FS_PROCFS_EXCLUDE_VERSION: Exclude version

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_PROCFS
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/procfs/Kconfig

1.10.12.4 CONFIG_FS_PROCFS_EXCLUDE_CPULOAD: Exclude CPU load

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_PROCFS, CONFIG_SCHED_CPULOAD
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/procfs/Kconfig

1.10.12.5 CONFIG_FS_PROCFS_EXCLUDE_IRQS: Exclude irqs

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_PROCFS
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/procfs/Kconfig

1.10.12.6 CONFIG_FS_PROCFS_EXCLUDE_MTD: Exclude mtd

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_PROCFS, CONFIG_MTD
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/procfs/Kconfig

1.10.12.7 CONFIG_FS_PROCFS_EXCLUDE_PARTITIONS: Exclude partitions

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_PROCFS, CONFIG_MTD_PARTITION
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/procfs/Kconfig

1.10.12.8 CONFIG_FS_PROCFS_EXCLUDE_SMARTFS: Exclude fs/smartfs

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_PROCFS, CONFIG_FS_SMARTFS
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/procfs/Kconfig

1.10.12.9 CONFIG_FS_PROCFS_EXCLUDE_POWER: Exclude power/domains

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_PROCFS, CONFIG_PM
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/procfs/Kconfig

1.10.13 CONFIG_FS_ROMFS: ROMFS file system

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_FS_READABLE
  • Dependencies: !CONFIG_DISABLE_MOUNTPOINT
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/romfs/Kconfig

    Enable ROMFS filesystem support Arch-dependent fs automount option can be found at "os/arch/arm/src/<board>/Kconfig"

1.10.14 CONFIG_FS_TMPFS: TMPFS file system

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_FS_READABLE, CONFIG_FS_WRITABLE
  • Dependencies: !CONFIG_DISABLE_MOUNTPOINT
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/tmpfs/Kconfig

    Enable TMPFS filesystem support

1.10.15 Menu: TMPFS options

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_TMPFS
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/tmpfs/Kconfig

1.10.15.1 CONFIG_FS_AUTOMOUNT_TMPFS: AUTOMOUNT TMPFS file system

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_TMPFS
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/tmpfs/Kconfig

    This provides an option to enable auto mounting of TMPFS during File System initialization.

1.10.15.2 CONFIG_FS_TMPFS_BLOCKSIZE: Reported block size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 512
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_TMPFS
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/tmpfs/Kconfig

    Various queries expect the file system to report resources in units of blocks. There are, of course, no blocks with the TMPFS. This options is available to control how sizes are reported. For very small TMPFS systems, you might want to set this to something smaller the usual 512 bytes.

1.10.15.3 CONFIG_FS_TMPFS_DIRECTORY_ALLOCGUARD: Directory object over-allocation

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_TMPFS
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/tmpfs/Kconfig

    In order to avoid frequent reallocations, a little more memory than needed is always allocated. This permits the directory to grow without so many realloctions.

1.10.15.4 CONFIG_FS_TMPFS_DIRECTORY_FREEGUARD: Directory under free

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 128
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_TMPFS
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/tmpfs/Kconfig

    In order to avoid frequent reallocations, a lot of free memory has to be available before a directory entry shrinks (via reallocation) little more memory than needed is always allocated. This permits the directory to shrink without so many realloctions.

1.10.15.5 CONFIG_FS_TMPFS_FILE_ALLOCGUARD: Directory object over-allocation

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 512
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_TMPFS
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/tmpfs/Kconfig

    In order to avoid frequent reallocations, a little more memory than needed is always allocated. This permits the file to grow without so many realloctions.

    You will probably want to use smaller value than the default on tiny TMFPS systems.

1.10.15.6 CONFIG_FS_TMPFS_FILE_FREEGUARD: Directory under free

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1024
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_TMPFS
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/tmpfs/Kconfig

    In order to avoid frequent reallocations, a lot of free memory has to be available before a directory entry shrinks (via reallocation) little more memory than needed is always allocated. This permits the file to shrink without so many realloctions.

1.10.16 CONFIG_RAMDISK: RAM Disk Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/block/Kconfig

    Can be used to set up a block of memory or (read-only) FLASH as a block driver that can be mounted as a files system. See include/tinyara/fs/ramdisk.h.

1.10.17 CONFIG_MTD: Memory Technology Device (MTD) Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/Kconfig

    Memory Technology Device (MTD) drivers. Some simple drivers for memory technologies like FLASH, EEPROM, NVRAM, etc. See include/tinyara/fs/mtd.h

    (Note: This is a simple memory interface and should not be confused with the "real" MTD developed at infradead.org. This logic is unrelated; I just used the name MTD because I am not aware of any other common way to refer to this class of devices).

1.10.18 CONFIG_MTD_PARTITION: Support MTD partitions

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/Kconfig

    MTD partitions are build as MTD drivers that manage a sub-region of the FLASH memory. The contain the original FLASH MTD driver and simply manage all accesses to assure that (1) FLASH accesses are always offset to the beginning of the partition, and (2) that FLASH accesses do not extend outside of the partition.

    A FLASH device may be broken up into several partitions managed, each managed by a separate MTD driver. The MTD partition interface is described in:

      os/include/tinyara/fs/mtd.h
FAR struct mtd_dev_s *mtd_partition(FAR struct mtd_dev_s *mtd,
off_t firstblock, off_t nblocks, uint16_t tagno);

    Each call to mtd_partition() will create a new MTD driver instance managing the sub-region of flash beginning at 'offset' (in blocks) and of size 'nblocks' on the device specified by 'mtd'.

1.10.19 CONFIG_MTD_PARTITION_NAMES: Support MTD partition naming

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_FS_PROCFS , CONFIG_MTD_PARTITION
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/Kconfig

    MTD partitions can be assigned a name for reporting via the procfs file system interface. This adds an API which must be called to specify the partition name.

1.10.20 CONFIG_MTD_PROGMEM: Enable on-chip program FLASH MTD device

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/Kconfig

    Enable to support an MTD device that supports the on-chip FLASH using the interfaces defined in include/tinyara/progmem. Those interfaces must be exported by chip-specific logic.

1.10.21 CONFIG_MTD_FTL: Enable MTD ftl layer

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/Kconfig

    Enable to support a MTD FTL layer.

1.10.22 Menu: MTD_FTL Configurations

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_MTD_FTL
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/Kconfig

1.10.22.1 CONFIG_FTL_WRITEBUFFER: Enable write buffering in the FTL layer

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_MTD_FTL , CONFIG_DRVR_WRITEBUFFER
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/Kconfig

1.10.22.2 CONFIG_FTL_READAHEAD: Enable read-ahead buffering in the FTL layer

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_MTD_FTL , CONFIG_DRVR_READAHEAD
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/Kconfig

1.10.23 CONFIG_MTD_CONFIG: Enable Dev Config (MTD based) device

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/Kconfig

    Provides a /dev/config device for saving / restoring application configuration data to a standard MTD device or partition.

1.10.24 Menu: MTD Configurations

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_MTD_CONFIG
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/Kconfig

1.10.24.1 CONFIG_MTD_CONFIG_RAM_CONSOLIDATE: Always use RAM consolidation method (work in progress)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_MTD_CONFIG
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/Kconfig

    When the MTD device used for /dev/config contains more than one erase block, the "unused entry" consolidation reserves one erase block by default for cleanup purposes. This consumes the minimum amount of RAM, however it "wastes" one erase block on the device. (For configurations that have only a single erase block assigned to the config device, RAM consolidation is the ONLY option.)

    Another approach is to allow the driver to use the entire MTD device (or partition) to save config data, and then allocate a RAM buffer (the size of one erase block) to perform the consolidation. Enabling this feature basically trades off RAM usage for FLASH usage. If the MTD device used for config data has small erase sizes (4K, etc.) and there is plenty of free RAM available, then this is probably a good option.

    Another benefit of this option is it reduces code space a bit since the "reserved block" consolidate routine is not needed.

1.10.24.2 CONFIG_MTD_CONFIG_ERASEDVALUE: Erased value of bytes on the MTD device

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0xff
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_MTD_CONFIG
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/Kconfig

    Specifies the value of the erased state of the MTD FLASH. For most FLASH parts, this is 0xff, but could also be zero depending on the device.

1.10.25 CONFIG_MTD_BYTE_WRITE: Byte write

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/Kconfig

    Some devices (such as the EON EN25F80) support writing an arbitrary number of bytes to FLASH. This setting enables MTD interfaces to support such writes. The SMART file system can take advantage of this option if it is enabled.

1.10.26 CONFIG_MTD_M25P: SPI-based M25P FLASH

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SPI
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/Kconfig

    Build support for M25PX family of flash.

1.10.27 Menu: SPI-based M25 flash options

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_MTD_M25P , CONFIG_MTD_M25P
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/m25px/Kconfig

1.10.27.1 CONFIG_M25P_SPIMODE: M25P SPI mode

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_MTD_M25P , CONFIG_MTD_M25P
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/m25px/Kconfig

1.10.27.2 CONFIG_M25P_MANUFACTURER: M25P manufacturers ID

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x20
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_MTD_M25P , CONFIG_MTD_M25P
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/m25px/Kconfig

    Various manufacturers may have produced the parts. 0x20 is the manufacturer ID for the STMicro MP25x serial FLASH. If, for example, you are using the a Macronix International MX25 serial FLASH, the correct manufacturer ID would be 0xc2. Manufacturers ID for Eon silicon en25f80 flash is 0x1c.

1.10.27.3 CONFIG_M25P_MEMORY_TYPE: M25P memory type ID

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x20
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_MTD_M25P , CONFIG_MTD_M25P
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/m25px/Kconfig

    The memory type for M25 "P" series is 0x20, but the driver also supports "F" series devices, such as the EON EN25F80 part which adds a 4K sector erase capability. The memory type for "F" series parts from EON is 0x31. The 4K sector erase size will automatically be enabled when filesytems that can use it are enabled, such as SMART.

1.10.27.4 CONFIG_EN25F80_FLASH: Enable EN25F80 flash driver for mikroequail

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_MTD_M25P , CONFIG_MTD_M25P , CONFIG_M25P_MANUFACTURER
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/m25px/Kconfig

    Enable EN25F80 (click board) flash driver for mikroequail.

1.10.27.5 CONFIG_EN25F80_READONLY: Enable readonly feature for EN25F80 flash for mikroequail

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_MTD_M25P , CONFIG_MTD_M25P , CONFIG_M25P_MANUFACTURER
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/m25px/Kconfig

    Enable readonly feature for EN25F80 flash for mikroequail

1.10.27.6 CONFIG_M25P_SUBSECTOR_ERASE: Sub-Sector Erase

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_MTD_M25P , CONFIG_MTD_M25P
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/m25px/Kconfig

    Some devices (such as the EON EN25F80) support a smaller erase block size (4K vs 64K). This option enables support for sub-sector erase. The SMART file system can take advantage of this option if it is enabled.

1.10.28 CONFIG_RAMMTD: RAM-based MTD driver

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/Kconfig

    Build support for a RAM-based MTD driver.

1.10.29 Menu: RAM MTD options

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_RAMMTD , CONFIG_RAMMTD
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/rammtd/Kconfig

1.10.29.1 CONFIG_RAMMTD_BLOCKSIZE: RAM MTD block size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 512
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_RAMMTD , CONFIG_RAMMTD
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/rammtd/Kconfig

1.10.29.2 CONFIG_RAMMTD_ERASESIZE: RAM MTD erase block size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4096
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_RAMMTD , CONFIG_RAMMTD
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/rammtd/Kconfig

1.10.29.3 CONFIG_RAMMTD_ERASESTATE: Simulated erase state

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0xff
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_RAMMTD , CONFIG_RAMMTD
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/rammtd/Kconfig

1.10.29.4 CONFIG_RAMMTD_FLASHSIM: RAM MTD FLASH Simulation

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_RAMMTD , CONFIG_RAMMTD
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/rammtd/Kconfig

    RAMMTD_FLASHSIM will add some extra logic to improve the level of FLASH simulation.

1.10.30 CONFIG_MTD_SMART: Sector Mapped Allocation for Really Tiny (SMART) Flash support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/Kconfig

    The MP25x series of Flash devices are typically very small and have a very large erase block size. This causes issues with the standard Flash Translation Layer block driver since it tries to allocate a RAM block the size of a flash erase block, which is typically 64K. This block driver uses a different approach to sacrifice performance for RAM memory footprint by saving data in sectors (typically 2K - 4K based on memory size) and relocating sectors as needed when an erase block needs to be erased.

1.10.31 Menu: SMART Device options

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_MTD_SMART
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/Kconfig

1.10.31.1 CONFIG_MTD_SMART_SECTOR_SIZE: SMART Device sector size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1024
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_MTD_SMART
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/Kconfig

    Sets the size of a single allocation on the SMART device. Larger sector sizes reduce overhead per sector, but cause more wasted space with a lot of smaller files.

1.10.31.2 CONFIG_MTD_SMART_WEAR_LEVEL: Support FLASH wear leveling

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_MTD_SMART , CONFIG_MTD_SMART
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/Kconfig

    Adds extra logic and RAM to guarantee equal wear leveling of the FLASH device by recording and monitoring erase block operations and selecting sector allocations to ensure all erase blocks are worn evenly. This will evenly wear both dynamic and static data on the device.

1.10.31.3 CONFIG_MTD_SMART_ENABLE_CRC: Enable Sector CRC error detection

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_MTD_SMART , CONFIG_MTD_SMART
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/Kconfig

    Enables logic to compute and validate a CRC for logical sectors. The CRC is calculated for all bytes in the logical sector. The CRC size is selectable (8-bit, 16-bit, 32-bit). For added protection, larger CRCs should be used with larger (2K - 4K) sector sizes. Enabling CRC protection will cause increased sector relocation and increased erase block erasures since directory and wear-level status updates can no longer be performed in-place and mandate re-writing the information to a new sector.

    An 8-bit CRC protection scheme can be added to an existing non-CRC formatted SMART volume without needing to reformat the drive. As sectors are re-written or relocated, they will be converted to CRC protected sectors.

1.10.31.4 Choice: CRC level selection

  • Default: SMART_CRC_8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_MTD_SMART , CONFIG_MTD_SMART_ENABLE_CRC
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/Kconfig

    • Select the level of CRC protection implemented in the SMART MTD layer. Smaller CRC selection uses less overhead per logical sectors, but also has a higher probability of not detecting multiple bit errors. Devices with larger logical sector sizes should use a larger CRC.

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_SMART_CRC_8: CRC-8

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_MTD_SMART
    • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/Kconfig

    CONFIG_SMART_CRC_16: CRC-16

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_MTD_SMART
    • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/Kconfig

1.10.31.5 CONFIG_MTD_SMART_SECTOR_ERASE_DEBUG: Track Erase Block erasure counts

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_MTD_SMART , CONFIG_MTD_SMART
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/Kconfig

    Allocates an Erase Block erase count array and keeps track of the number of erases per erase block. This data is then presented on the procfs interface.

1.10.31.6 CONFIG_MTD_SMART_ALLOC_DEBUG: RAM Allocation Debug

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_MTD_SMART , CONFIG_MTD_SMART
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/Kconfig

    Records all SMART MTD layer allocations for debug purposes and makes them accessible from the ProcFS interface if it is enabled.

1.10.32 CONFIG_MTD_W25: SPI-based W25 FLASH

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SPI
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/Kconfig

1.10.33 CONFIG_W25_SPIMODE: W25 SPI Mode

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_MTD_W25
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/Kconfig

1.10.34 CONFIG_W25_SPIFREQUENCY: W25 SPI Frequency

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 20000000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_MTD_W25
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/Kconfig

1.10.35 CONFIG_W25_READONLY: W25 Read-Only FLASH

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_MTD_W25
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/Kconfig

1.10.36 CONFIG_W25_SECTOR512: Simulate 512 byte Erase Blocks

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_MTD_W25
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/Kconfig

1.10.37 CONFIG_W25_SLOWREAD: W25 Slow Read

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD, CONFIG_MTD_W25
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/driver/mtd/Kconfig

1.10.38 CONFIG_SYSLOG: Advanced SYSLOG features

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/Kconfig

    Enables generic system logging features. NOTE: This setting is not required to enable system logging. If this feature is not enable system logging will still be available and will log to the system console (like printf()). This setting is required to enable customization of the basic system logging capability. If this is enabled with SYSLOG2LOGM feature, syslog messages will be printed through logm.

1.10.39 CONFIG_SYSLOG_TIMESTAMP: Prepend timestamp to syslog message

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/Kconfig

    Prepend timestamp to syslog message.

1.10.40 CONFIG_SYSLOG_CHAR: System log character device support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSLOG
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/Kconfig

    Enable the generic character device for the SYSLOG. The full path to the SYSLOG device is provided by SYSLOG_DEVPATH. A valid character device (or file) must exist at this path. It will by opened by syslog_initialize.

    Do not enable more than one SYSLOG device.

1.10.41 CONFIG_SYSLOG_DEVPATH: System log device

  • Type: String
  • Default Values:
    • Default: "/dev/console"

      Dependency: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TESTCASE_KERNEL

    • Default: "/dev/syslog"

      Dependency: !CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TESTCASE_KERNEL

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSLOG, CONFIG_SYSLOG_CHAR
  • Kconfig file: ./fs/Kconfig

    The full path to the system logging device. For the RAMLOG SYSLOG device, this is normally "/dev/ramlog". For character SYSLOG devices, it should be some other existing character device (or file) supported by the configuration (such as "/dev/ttyS1")/

1.11 Menu: Database

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.11.1 CONFIG_ARASTORAGE: AraStorage database Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/arastorage/Kconfig

    Enables overall support for AraStorage library.

1.11.2 CONFIG_NODE_LIMIT: AraStorage Bplustree node limit

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 110
