  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARASTORAGE
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/arastorage/Kconfig

    Default : 110

1.11.3 CONFIG_BUCKETS_LIMIT: AraStorage Bplustree bucket limit

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 80
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARASTORAGE
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/arastorage/Kconfig

    Default : 80

1.11.4 CONFIG_BRANCH_FACTOR: AraStorage Bplustree Branch Factor

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 5
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARASTORAGE
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/arastorage/Kconfig

    Default : 5

1.11.5 CONFIG_DB_TUPLES_LIMIT: AraStorage Bplustree tuples limit

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARASTORAGE
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/arastorage/Kconfig

    Default : 1000

1.11.6 CONFIG_ARASTORAGE_ENABLE_FLUSHING: Enable Flushing

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARASTORAGE
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/arastorage/Kconfig

    Enables delete old tuples based on policies

1.11.7 CONFIG_ARASTORAGE_ENABLE_VACUUM: Enable Vacuum

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARASTORAGE
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/arastorage/Kconfig

    Enables Vacuum Functionality

1.11.8 CONFIG_ARASTORAGE_ENABLE_WRITE_BUFFER: Enable Write Buffer

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARASTORAGE
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/arastorage/Kconfig

    Enables insert buffer for AraStorage.

1.12 Menu: Memory Management

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.12.1 CONFIG_MM_KERNEL_HEAP: Support a protected, kernel heap

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_BUILD_PROTECTED || CONFIG_BUILD_KERNEL
  • Kconfig file: ./mm/Kconfig

    Partition heap memory into two parts: (1) a protected, kernel-mode heap accessible only by the TinyAra kernel, and (2) an unprotected user-mode heap for use by applications. If you are only interested in protected the kernel from read access, then this option is not necessary. If you wish to secure the kernel data as well, then this option should be selected.

    The kernel heap size that is used is provided a a platform-specific up_allocate_kheap() interface. This configuration setting is made available to that platform specific code. However, the up_allocate_kheap() interface may chose to ignore this setting if it has a more appropriate heap allocation strategy.

1.12.2 CONFIG_MM_KERNEL_HEAPSIZE: Kernal heap size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8192
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MM_KERNEL_HEAP
  • Kconfig file: ./mm/Kconfig

    This is the size of the a protected, kernel-mode heap (in bytes). The remaining of available memory is given to the unprotected user-mode heap. This value may need to be aligned to units of the size of the smallest memory protection region.

1.12.3 CONFIG_REALLOC_DISABLE_NEIGHBOR_EXTENSION: Disable Realloc Neighbor Extension

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./mm/Kconfig

    If enabled, realloc will not expand from old node to neighbor freenode. Instead, realloc will do "malloc new node, memcpy, free old node" which is safe, but waste of time and memory space. And it will be one of debugging features, especially when you modify existing malloc/free logic.

1.12.4 CONFIG_MM_SMALL: Small memory model

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./mm/Kconfig

    Each memory allocation has a small allocation overhead. The size of that overhead is normally determined by the "width" of the address support by the MCU. MCUs that support 16-bit addressability have smaller overhead than devices that support 32-bit addressability. However, there are many MCUs that support 32-bit addressability *but* have internal SRAM of size less than or equal to 64Kb. In this case, MM_SMALL can be defined so that those MCUs will also benefit from the smaller, 16-bit-based allocation overhead.

    WARNING: This selection will also change the alignment of allocated memory. For example, on ARM memory will have 8-byte alignment by default. If MM_SMALL is selected, then allocated memory will have only 4-byte alignment. This may be important on some platforms where 64-bit data is in allocated structures and 8-byte alignment is required.

1.12.5 CONFIG_MM_REGIONS: Number of memory regions

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Kconfig file: ./mm/Kconfig

    If the architecture includes multiple, non-contiguous regions of memory to allocate from, MM_REGIONS should be set to the number of memory. Or if you want to use RAM to multiple region(heap), MM_REGIONS should be set to the number of heaps.

1.12.6 CONFIG_MM_NHEAPS: Number of heaps

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Kconfig file: ./mm/Kconfig

    A number of heap memory. If MM_NHEAPS sets to 1, RAM memory can be used for one heap memory. If MM_NHEAPS sets more than equal to 2, it can be split for multi-heap. You can refer to "https://github.com/Samsung/TizenRT/blob/master/docs/HowToUseMultiHeap.md"

1.12.7 CONFIG_GRAN: Enable Granule Allocator

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./mm/Kconfig

    Enable granule allocator support. Allocations will be aligned to the granule size; allocations will be in units of the granule size. Larger granules will give better performance and less overhead but more losses of memory due to alignment and quantization waste.

    NOTE: The current implementation also restricts the maximum allocation size to 32 granaules. That restriction could be eliminated with some additional coding effort.

1.12.8 CONFIG_GRAN_SINGLE: Single Granule Allocator

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_GRAN
  • Kconfig file: ./mm/Kconfig

    Select if there is only one instance of the granule allocator (i.e., gran_initialize will be called only once. In this case, (1) there are a few optimizations that can can be done and (2) the GRAN_HANDLE is not needed.

1.12.9 CONFIG_GRAN_INTR: Interrupt level support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_GRAN
  • Kconfig file: ./mm/Kconfig

    Normally mutual exclusive access to granule allocator data is assured using a semaphore. If this option is set then, instead, mutual exclusion logic will disable interrupts. While this options is more invasive to system performance, it will also support use of the granule allocator from interrupt level logic.

1.12.10 CONFIG_DEBUG_GRAN: Granule Allocator Debug

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_GRAN && CONFIG_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./mm/Kconfig

    Just like DEBUG_MM, but only generates output from the gran allocation logic.

1.12.11 CONFIG_MM_PGALLOC: Enable Page Allocator

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_GRAN
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_USE_MMU
  • Kconfig file: ./mm/Kconfig

    Enable support for a MMU physical page allocator based on the granule allocator.

1.12.12 CONFIG_MM_PGSIZE: Page Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4096
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MM_PGALLOC
  • Kconfig file: ./mm/Kconfig

    The MMU page size. Must be one of {1024, 2048, 4096, 8192, or 16384}. This is easily extensible, but only those values are currently support.

1.12.13 CONFIG_DEBUG_PGALLOC: Page Allocator Debug

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MM_PGALLOC, CONFIG_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./mm/Kconfig

    Just like DEBUG_MM, but only generates output from the page allocation logic.

1.12.14 CONFIG_MM_SHM: Shared memory support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MM_PGALLOC && CONFIG_BUILD_KERNEL && CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL
  • Kconfig file: ./mm/Kconfig

    Build in support for the shared memory interfaces shmget(), shmat(), shmctl(), and shmdt().

1.13 Menu: Power Management

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.13.1 CONFIG_PM: Power management (PM) driver interfaces

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SCHED_WORKQUEUE
  • Kconfig file: ./pm/Kconfig

    Power management (PM) driver interfaces. These interfaces are used to manage power usage of a platform by monitoring driver activity and by placing drivers into reduce power usage modes when the drivers are not active.

1.13.2 CONFIG_DEBUG_PM: Power Management Debug Features

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PM
  • Kconfig file: ./pm/Kconfig

1.13.3 CONFIG_PM_TEST: Power Management Functionality Test

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PM
  • Kconfig file: ./pm/Kconfig

1.13.4 CONFIG_PM_DEVNAME_LEN: Registered device name length

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 32
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PM
  • Kconfig file: ./pm/Kconfig

1.13.5 CONFIG_PM_METRICS: Power management (PM) metrics

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PM
  • Kconfig file: ./pm/Kconfig

    Power management's metrics for CONFIG_PM_METRICS_DURATION

1.13.6 CONFIG_PM_METRICS_DURATION: History Duration (secs)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 60
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PM, CONFIG_PM_METRICS
  • Kconfig file: ./pm/Kconfig

1.13.7 CONFIG_PM_SLICEMS: PM time slice (msec)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PM
  • Kconfig file: ./pm/Kconfig

    The power management module collects activity counts in time slices. At the end of the time slice, the count accumulated during that interval is applied to an averaging algorithm to determine the activity level.

    CONFIG_PM_SLICEMS provides the duration of that time slice in milliseconds. Default: 100 Milliseconds

1.13.8 CONFIG_PM_NDOMAINS: Number of PM activity domains

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PM
  • Kconfig file: ./pm/Kconfig

    Defines the number of "domains" that activity may be monitored on. For example, you may want to separately manage the power from the Network domain, shutting down the network when it is not be used, from the UI domain, shutting down the UI when it is not in use.

1.13.9 CONFIG_PM_MEMORY: PM memory (msec)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2
  • Range: 1 - 6
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PM
  • Kconfig file: ./pm/Kconfig

    The averaging algorithm is simply: Y = (An*X + SUM(Ai*Yi))/SUM(Aj), where i = 1..n-1 and j= 1..n, n is the length of the "memory", Ai is the weight applied to each value, and X is the current activity. These weights may be negative and a limited to the range of int16_t.

      CONFIG_PM_MEMORY provides the memory for the algorithm.  Default: 2
CONFIG_PM_COEFn provides weight for each sample.  Default: 1

    Setting CONFIG_PM_MEMORY=1 disables all smoothing.

1.13.10 CONFIG_PM_COEFN: PM coefficient

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PM
  • Kconfig file: ./pm/Kconfig

    See help associated with CONFIG_PM_MEMORY.

1.13.11 CONFIG_PM_COEF1: PM coefficient 1

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PM
  • Kconfig file: ./pm/Kconfig

    See help associated with CONFIG_PM_MEMORY.

1.13.12 CONFIG_PM_COEF2: PM coefficient 2

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PM
  • Kconfig file: ./pm/Kconfig

    See help associated with CONFIG_PM_MEMORY

    Ignored if CONFIG_PM_MEMORY <= 2

1.13.13 CONFIG_PM_COEF3: PM coefficient 3

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PM
  • Kconfig file: ./pm/Kconfig

    See help associated with CONFIG_PM_MEMORY

      Ignored if CONFIG_PM_MEMORY <= 3

1.13.14 CONFIG_PM_COEF4: PM coefficient 4

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PM
  • Kconfig file: ./pm/Kconfig

    See help associated with CONFIG_PM_MEMORY

    Ignored if CONFIG_PM_MEMORY <= 4

1.13.15 CONFIG_PM_COEF5: PM coefficient 5

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PM
  • Kconfig file: ./pm/Kconfig

    See help associated with CONFIG_PM_MEMORY

    Ignored if CONFIG_PM_MEMORY <= 5

1.13.16 CONFIG_PM_IDLEENTER_THRESH: PM IDLE enter threshold

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PM
  • Kconfig file: ./pm/Kconfig

    State changes then occur when the weight activity account crosses threshold values for certain periods of time (time slice count).

      CONFIG_PM_xxxENTER_THRESH is the threshold value for entering state xxx.
CONFIG_PM_xxxENTER_COUNT is the count for entering state xxx.

    Resuming to normal state, on the other hand, is usually immediate and controlled by wakeup conditions established by the platform. The PM

    Default: <=1: Essentially no activity

1.13.17 CONFIG_PM_IDLEEXIT_THRESH: PM IDLE exit threshold

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PM
  • Kconfig file: ./pm/Kconfig

    State changes then occur when the weight activity account crosses threshold values for certain periods of time (time slice count).

      CONFIG_PM_xxxENTER_THRESH is the threshold value for entering state xxx.
CONFIG_PM_xxxENTER_COUNT is the count for entering state xxx.

    Resuming to normal state, on the other hand, is usually immediate and controlled by wakeup conditions established by the platform. The PM

    Default: >=2: Active

1.13.18 CONFIG_PM_IDLEENTER_COUNT: PM IDLE enter count

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 30
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PM
  • Kconfig file: ./pm/Kconfig

    State changes then occur when the weight activity account crosses threshold values for certain periods of time (time slice count).

      CONFIG_PM_xxxENTER_THRESH is the threshold value for entering state xxx.
CONFIG_PM_xxxENTER_COUNT is the count for entering state xxx.

    Resuming to normal state, on the other hand, is usually immediate and controlled by wakeup conditions established by the platform. The PM

    Default: Thirty IDLE slices to enter IDLE mode from normal

1.13.19 CONFIG_PM_STANDBYENTER_THRESH: PM STANDBY enter threshold

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PM
  • Kconfig file: ./pm/Kconfig

    State changes then occur when the weight activity account crosses threshold values for certain periods of time (time slice count).

      CONFIG_PM_xxxENTER_THRESH is the threshold value for entering state xxx.
CONFIG_PM_xxxENTER_COUNT is the count for entering state xxx.

    Resuming to normal state, on the other hand, is usually immediate and controlled by wakeup conditions established by the platform. The PM

    Default: <=1: Essentially no activity

1.13.20 CONFIG_PM_STANDBYEXIT_THRESH: PM STANDBY exit threshold

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PM
  • Kconfig file: ./pm/Kconfig

    State changes then occur when the weight activity account crosses threshold values for certain periods of time (time slice count).

      CONFIG_PM_xxxENTER_THRESH is the threshold value for entering state xxx.
CONFIG_PM_xxxENTER_COUNT is the count for entering state xxx.

    Resuming to normal state, on the other hand, is usually immediate and controlled by wakeup conditions established by the platform. The PM

    Default: >=2: Active

1.13.21 CONFIG_PM_STANDBYENTER_COUNT: PM STANDBY enter count

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 50
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PM
  • Kconfig file: ./pm/Kconfig

    State changes then occur when the weight activity account crosses threshold values for certain periods of time (time slice count).

      CONFIG_PM_xxxENTER_THRESH is the threshold value for entering state xxx.
CONFIG_PM_xxxENTER_COUNT is the count for entering state xxx.

    Resuming to normal state, on the other hand, is usually immediate and controlled by wakeup conditions established by the platform. The PM

    Default: Fifty IDLE slices to enter STANDBY mode from IDLE

1.13.22 CONFIG_PM_SLEEPENTER_THRESH: PM SLEEP enter threshold

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PM
  • Kconfig file: ./pm/Kconfig

    State changes then occur when the weight activity account crosses threshold values for certain periods of time (time slice count).

      CONFIG_PM_xxxENTER_THRESH is the threshold value for entering state xxx.
CONFIG_PM_xxxENTER_COUNT is the count for entering state xxx.

    Resuming to normal state, on the other hand, is usually immediate and controlled by wakeup conditions established by the platform. The PM

    Default: <=1: Essentially no activity

1.13.23 CONFIG_PM_SLEEPEXIT_THRESH: PM SLEEP exit threshold

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PM
  • Kconfig file: ./pm/Kconfig

    State changes then occur when the weight activity account crosses threshold values for certain periods of time (time slice count).

      CONFIG_PM_xxxENTER_THRESH is the threshold value for entering state xxx.
CONFIG_PM_xxxENTER_COUNT is the count for entering state xxx.

    Resuming to normal state, on the other hand, is usually immediate and controlled by wakeup conditions established by the platform. The PM

    Default: >=2: Active

1.13.24 CONFIG_PM_SLEEPENTER_COUNT: PM SLEEP enter count

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 70
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_PM
  • Kconfig file: ./pm/Kconfig

    State changes then occur when the weight activity account crosses threshold values for certain periods of time (time slice count).

      CONFIG_PM_xxxENTER_THRESH is the threshold value for entering state xxx.
CONFIG_PM_xxxENTER_COUNT is the count for entering state xxx.

    Resuming to normal state, on the other hand, is usually immediate and controlled by wakeup conditions established by the platform. The PM

    Default: Fifty IDLE slices to enter SLEEP mode from STANDBY

1.14 Menu: Debug Options

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.14.1 CONFIG_DEBUG: Enable Debug Output Features

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_DEBUG_ERROR
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    Enables built-in debug features. Selecting this option will (1) Enable debug assertions in the code, (2) enable extended parameter testing in many functions, and (3) enable support for debug output to the SYSLOG. Note that enabling this option by itself does not produce debug output. Debug output must also be selected on a subsystem-by-subsystem basis.

1.14.2 CONFIG_DEBUG_ERROR: Enable Error Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    Enables ERROR debug output (assuming debug features are enabled). If you enable DEBUG_ERROR, debug messages for error will be reported in the debug SYSLOG output. Errors are significant system exceptions that require immediate attention.

1.14.3 CONFIG_DEBUG_WARN: Enable Warning Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    Enables Warning debug output (assuming debug features are enabled). If you enable DEBUG_WARN, debug messages for warning will be reported in the debug SYSLOG output. Warnings are considered to be various unexpected conditions, potential errors or errors that will not have serious consequences.

1.14.4 CONFIG_DEBUG_VERBOSE: Enable Informational(Verbose) Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    Enables Informational debug output (assuming debug features are enabled). If you enable DEBUG_VERBOSE, debug messages for information will be reported in the debug SYSLOG output.

1.14.5 CONFIG_DEBUG_AUDIO: Audio Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_AUDIO
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    Enable Audio debug SYSLOG output (disabled by default)

1.14.6 CONFIG_DEBUG_AUDIO_ERROR: Audio Error Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_DEBUG_AUDIO , CONFIG_DEBUG_ERROR
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    Enable audio error debug SYSLOG output.

1.14.7 CONFIG_DEBUG_AUDIO_WARN: Audio Warning Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_DEBUG_AUDIO , CONFIG_DEBUG_WARN
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    Enable audio warning debug SYSLOG output.

1.14.8 CONFIG_DEBUG_AUDIO_INFO: Audio Infomational Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_DEBUG_AUDIO , CONFIG_DEBUG_VERBOSE
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    Enable audio informational debug SYSLOG output.

1.14.9 CONFIG_DEBUG_LIB: C Library Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    Enable C library debug SYSLOG output (disabled by default)

1.14.10 CONFIG_DEBUG_LIB_ERROR: C Library Error Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_DEBUG_LIB , CONFIG_DEBUG_ERROR
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    Enable C Library error debug SYSLOG output.

1.14.11 CONFIG_DEBUG_LIB_WARN: C Library Warning Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_DEBUG_LIB , CONFIG_DEBUG_WARN
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    Enable C Library warning debug SYSLOG output.

1.14.12 CONFIG_DEBUG_LIB_INFO: C Library Informational Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_DEBUG_LIB , CONFIG_DEBUG_VERBOSE
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    Enable C Library informational debug SYSLOG output.

1.14.13 CONFIG_DEBUG_FS: File System Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    Enable file system debug SYSLOG output (disabled by default)

1.14.14 CONFIG_DEBUG_FS_ERROR: File System Error Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_DEBUG_FS , CONFIG_DEBUG_ERROR
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    Enable file system error debug SYSLOG output.

1.14.15 CONFIG_DEBUG_FS_WARN: File System Warning Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_DEBUG_FS , CONFIG_DEBUG_WARN
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    Enable file system warning debug SYSLOG output.

1.14.16 CONFIG_DEBUG_FS_INFO: File System Infomational Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_DEBUG_FS , CONFIG_DEBUG_VERBOSE
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    Enable file system informational debug SYSLOG output.

1.14.17 CONFIG_DEBUG_IOTBUS: IoTbus Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_IOTBUS
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    This config makes ibdbg printing messages.

1.14.18 CONFIG_DEBUG_MEDIA: Media Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_MEDIA
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    Enable Media debug SYSLOG output(disable by default)

1.14.19 CONFIG_DEBUG_MEDIA_ERROR: Media Error Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_DEBUG_MEDIA , CONFIG_DEBUG_ERROR
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    Enable Media error SYSLOG output

1.14.20 CONFIG_DEBUG_MEDIA_WARN: Media Warning Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_DEBUG_MEDIA , CONFIG_DEBUG_WARN
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    Enable Media warning SYSLOG output

1.14.21 CONFIG_DEBUG_MEDIA_INFO: Media Informational Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_DEBUG_MEDIA , CONFIG_DEBUG_VERBOSE
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    Enable Media informational SYSLOG output

1.14.22 CONFIG_DEBUG_MM: Memory Manager Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    Enable memory management debug SYSLOG output (disabled by default)

1.14.23 CONFIG_DEBUG_MM_ERROR: Memory Manager Error Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_DEBUG_MM , CONFIG_DEBUG_ERROR
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    Enable memory management error debug SYSLOG output.

1.14.24 CONFIG_DEBUG_MM_WARN: Memory Manager Warning Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_DEBUG_MM , CONFIG_DEBUG_WARN
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    Enable memory management Warning debug SYSLOG output.

1.14.25 CONFIG_DEBUG_MM_INFO: Memory Manager Informational Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_DEBUG_MM , CONFIG_DEBUG_VERBOSE
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    Enable memory management informational debug SYSLOG output.

1.14.26 CONFIG_DEBUG_DOUBLE_FREE: Debug Double Free Attempt

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_DEBUG_MM
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    This flag would help to debug following operations Attempt to free Null pointer Attempt to free an Unallocated pointer Attempt to free an abruptly initialized pointer (Security exploitation) Attempt to free an already released pointer ( double free detection )

1.14.27 CONFIG_DEBUG_NET: Network Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_NET
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    Enable network debug SYSLOG output (disabled by default)

1.14.28 CONFIG_DEBUG_NET_ERROR: Network Error Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_DEBUG_NET , CONFIG_DEBUG_ERROR
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    Enable network error debug SYSLOG output.

1.14.29 CONFIG_DEBUG_NET_WARN: Network Warning Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_DEBUG_NET , CONFIG_DEBUG_WARN
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    Enable network warning debug SYSLOG output.

1.14.30 CONFIG_DEBUG_NET_INFO: Network Informational Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_DEBUG_NET , CONFIG_DEBUG_VERBOSE
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

1.14.63 CONFIG_DEBUG_WLAN_SUPPLICANT_ERROR: Enable WLAN Supplicant ERROR Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_DEBUG_WLAN , CONFIG_WPA_SUPPLICANT
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    Enables MSG_ERROR, MGS_WARNING, MSG_INFO debug output from the SLSI wpa supplicant. If DEBUG is enabled and this is disable no logging is printed from supplicant. Errors are significant system exceptions that require immediate attention.

1.14.64 CONFIG_DEBUG_WLAN_SUPPLICANT_DEBUG: Enable DEBUG Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_DEBUG_WLAN_SUPPLICANT_ERROR

  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    Enables further logging MSG_DEBUG debug output from the SLSI wpa supplicant.

    Enable DMA-releated debug SYSLOG output (disabled by default). Support for this debug option is architecture-specific and may not be available for some MCUs.

1.14.71 CONFIG_DEBUG_HEAP: Heap usage debug hooks

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_HEAPCHECK
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    Enable hooks to check heap usage. Only supported by a few architectures.

1.14.72 CONFIG_DEBUG_MM_HEAPINFO: Heap Info debug option

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    Enable task wise malloc debug.

1.14.73 CONFIG_DEBUG_CHECK_FRAGMENTATION: Show where and how memory is fragmented

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_DEBUG_MM_HEAPINFO
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    Count the number of freed memory segments with the range from size 2^n to 2^(n+1).

1.14.74 CONFIG_DEBUG_IRQ: Interrupt Controller Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    Some (but not all) architectures support debug output to verify interrupt controller logic. If supported, then option will enable that output. This may interfere with normal operations! You should *not* enable interrupt controller debug unless you suspect that here is a problem with that logic. On some platforms, this option may even cause crashes! Use with care!

1.14.75 CONFIG_DEBUG_IRQ_INFO: Interrupt Debug information

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_DEBUG_IRQ , CONFIG_DEBUG_VERBOSE
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    List the registered interrupts, it's occurrence count and corresponding isr.

1.14.76 CONFIG_DEBUG_PAGING: Demand Paging Debug Output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_PAGING
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

1.14.88 CONFIG_IRQ_SCHED_HISTORY: IRQ Scheduling history

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_DEBUG_SYSTEM
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_DEBUG_SYSTEM
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

1.14.90 CONFIG_TASK_SCHED_HISTORY: Task Scheduling history

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_DEBUG_SYSTEM
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

1.14.91 CONFIG_DEBUG_IRQ_MAX_COUNT: Maximum count for irq history

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x20
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_DEBUG_SYSTEM , CONFIG_IRQ_SCHED_HISTORY
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

1.14.92 CONFIG_DEBUG_SEM_MAX_COUNT: Maximum count for sem history

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x20
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_DEBUG_SYSTEM , CONFIG_SEMAPHORE_HISTORY
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

1.14.93 CONFIG_DEBUG_TASK_MAX_COUNT: Maximum count for task history

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x20
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG, CONFIG_DEBUG_SYSTEM , CONFIG_TASK_SCHED_HISTORY
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

1.14.94 CONFIG_STACK_COLORATION: Stack coloration

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_STACKCHECK
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    Enable stack coloration to initialize the stack memory to the value of STACK_COLOR and enable the stack checking APIs that can be used to monitor the level of stack usage.

    Only supported by a few architectures.

1.14.95 CONFIG_DEBUG_SYMBOLS: Generate Debug Symbols

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    Build with debug symbols (needed for use with a debugger).

1.14.96 CONFIG_FRAME_POINTER: Enable backtracking using Frame pointer register

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    This option uses -fno-omit-frame-pointer flag of gcc. This flag makes use of frame pointer register to push PC,SP and FP for every function call in the stack during runtime. If you say N here, the resulting binary will be slightly smaller amd faster. However, if neither FRAME_POINTER nor ARM_UNWIND are enabled, the information reported during system crash is very limited.

1.14.97 Menu: Logger Module

  • Dependencies: !CONFIG_DISABLE_SIGNALS
  • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

1.14.97.1 CONFIG_LOGM: Logger Module

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./logm/Kconfig

    Logger.

1.14.97.2 CONFIG_PRINTF2LOGM: Route printf through logm

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_LOGM
  • Kconfig file: ./logm/Kconfig

1.14.97.3 CONFIG_SYSLOG2LOGM: Route all syslogs through logm

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_LOGM
  • Kconfig file: ./logm/Kconfig

1.14.97.4 CONFIG_LOGM_TIMESTAMP: Prepend timestamp to message

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_LOGM
  • Kconfig file: ./logm/Kconfig

1.14.97.5 CONFIG_LOGM_BUFFER_SIZE: Logm Buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 10240
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_LOGM
  • Kconfig file: ./logm/Kconfig

    Logm buffer size (default : 10KB) This value should be sufficient to avoid buffer overflow. If buffer overflow happens, some messages would be dropped.

1.14.97.6 CONFIG_LOGM_PRINT_INTERVAL: Interval for flusing logm buffer (ms)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_LOGM
  • Kconfig file: ./logm/Kconfig

    Logm queues messsages for several seconds and then spits out. This value decides how frequently buffer is flushed. The smaller this value is, the more frequent messages are shown.

1.14.97.7 CONFIG_LOGM_TASK_PRIORITY: Logm Task priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 110
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_LOGM
  • Kconfig file: ./logm/Kconfig

1.14.97.8 CONFIG_LOGM_TASK_STACKSIZE: Logm Task stack size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1024
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_LOGM
  • Kconfig file: ./logm/Kconfig

1.14.97.9 CONFIG_LOGM_TEST: Test code for logger module

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_LOGM
  • Kconfig file: ./logm/Kconfig

    Test code for logger module

1.15 Menu: System Call

  • Dependencies: CONFIG_BUILD_PROTECTED
  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.15.1 CONFIG_LIB_SYSCALL: System call support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./syscall/Kconfig

    Build in support for "system calls". System calls are used to implement a call gate mechanism that can be be used to call from user code into the kernel. This is only useful for user code that lies outside of the kernel such as when the BUILD_PROTECTED or BUILD_KERNEL builds are selected.

    This permits calls from user-mode code into kernel mode; the call gate will change the mode of operation from user to supervisor mode, then call into the OS code on behalf of the user-mode application.

    If if there are no privilege issues preventing the call, system calls may also be of value because it can eliminate the need for symbol tables when linking external modules to the TinyAra base code. The selection will build libsyscall. External modules can then link with libsyscall when they are built and they can call into the OS with no knowledge of the actual address in the OS. In this case, they call into a proxy that is link with the external code; that proxy then marshals the call parameter and invokes the system call to accomplish the interface.

1.15.2 CONFIG_SYS_RESERVED: Number of reserved system calls

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_LIB_SYSCALL
  • Kconfig file: ./syscall/Kconfig

    Kernel system calls may share the same software trapping mechanism as other functions used by architecture port. Those software traps must be reserved for use exclusively by the architecture. These value specifies the number of reserved software traps used by the architecture; number of the kernel system calls will begin with this number.

1.15.3 CONFIG_SYS_NNEST: Number of nested system calls

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_LIB_SYSCALL
  • Kconfig file: ./syscall/Kconfig

    This is architecture dependent. Most architectures allocate resources to manage a fixed, maximum number of nested system calls. A nested system call occurs in the following scenario: (1) A non- privileged user thread executes a system call, (2) part of the system call processing cause a call back into the user space code, and (3) the user space code performs another system call.

    In the current design, this can happen only under one condition: When the kernel calls back into user space in order to allocate user space memory. So it is expected that the maximum nesting level will be only 2.

1.16 Menu: Built-in Libraries

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.16.1 CONFIG_STDIO_BUFFER_SIZE: C STDIO buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    Size of buffers using within the C buffered I/O interfaces (printf, putchar, fwrite, etc.). This function sets the initial I/O buffer size. Zero disables I/O buffering. That size may be subsequently modified using setvbuf().

1.16.2 CONFIG_STDIO_LINEBUFFER: STDIO line buffering

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    Flush buffer I/O whenever a newline character is found in the output data stream.

1.16.3 CONFIG_NUNGET_CHARS: Number unget() characters

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    Number of characters that can be buffered by ungetc() (Only if NFILE_STREAMS > 0)

1.16.4 CONFIG_LIB_HOMEDIR: Home directory

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/"
  • Dependencies: !CONFIG_DISABLE_ENVIRON
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    The home directory to use with operations like such as 'cd ~'

1.16.5 CONFIG_LIBM: Standard Math library

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: !CONFIG_ARCH_MATH_H
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/math/Kconfig

    By default, no math library will be provided by TinyAra. In this this case, it is assumed that (1) no math library is required, or (2) you will be using the math.h header file and the libm library provided by your toolchain.

    This is may be a very good choice is possible because your toolchain may have have a highly optimized version of libm.

    Another possibility is that you have a custom, architecture-specific math libary and that the corresponding math.h file resides at arch/<architecture>/include/math.h. The option is selected via ARCH_MATH_H. If ARCH_MATH_H is selected,then the include/tinyara/math.h header file will be copied to include/math.h where it can be used by your applications.

    If ARCH_MATH_H is not defined, then this option can be selected to build a generic, math library built into TinyAra. This math library comes from the Rhombus OS and was written by Nick Johnson. The Rhombus OS math library port was contributed by Darcy Gong.

1.16.6 CONFIG_NOPRINTF_FIELDWIDTH: Disable sprintf support fieldwidth

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    sprintf-related logic is a little smaller if we do not support field widths.

1.16.7 CONFIG_LIBC_FLOATINGPOINT: Enable floating point in printf

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_LIBM
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    By default, floating point support in printf, sscanf, etc. is disabled.

1.16.8 CONFIG_LIBC_FLOATPRECISION: Default floating point Precision value

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 6
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_LIBC_FLOATINGPOINT
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    Precision point support for floating point values.

1.16.9 CONFIG_LIBC_SCANSET: Scanset support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    Add scanset support to sscanf().

1.16.10 CONFIG_NOPRINTF_LONGLONG_TO_ASCII: Disable long long type in printf

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    sprintf-related logic is a little smaller if we do not support long long type conversion

1.16.11 CONFIG_LIBC_IOCTL_VARIADIC: Enable variadic ioctl()

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    By default, TinyAra implements the "old style," three-parameter, ioctl() interface with this function prototype:

      int ioctl(int fd, int req, unsigned long arg);

    That function is implemented as part of the VFS. If LIBC_IOCTL_VARIADIC is selected, then an additional compatibility layer will be provided in the C library. The enabled, then function prototype will become:

      int ioctl(int fd, int req, ...);

    The ioctl() is not controlled by any standard so it is really arbitrary which format you used. You may select the variadic function prototype with this option. That will slightly increase code size and ioctl() processing time. It will not support a variable number of arguments and it still always expects to see a third argument of type 'unsigned long'. The only benefit of this alternative function signature is that it may provide greater compatibility if you are porting code from other platforms that use the variadic ioctl() function.

    WARNING: Use of this option could cause subtle system errors is the third argument is omitted or if the sizeof the thread argument is anything other than sizeof (unsigned long). Most small integers will be promoted to 'int'. The following assertion appears in ioctl():

      DEBUGASSERT(sizeof(int)        == sizeof(unsigned long) &&
sizeof(FAR void *) == sizeof(unsigned long));

    Do not enable this option if the above is not true. 32-bit ARM should pass this test with all three types having sizeof(type) == 4 bytes. 'float' should also be tested. But 'long long' and 'double' are out of the question! Don't event try to pass them.

    And what will happen if no third argument is passed? In most cases, this should just result in a garbage value for arg. But you may discover cases where something worse happens!

1.16.12 CONFIG_LIBC_WCHAR: Enable wide-characters (Unicode) support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    By default, wide-characters support is disabled.

1.16.13 CONFIG_LIBC_LOCALE: Enable I18N (LOCALE) support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    By default, i18n (locale) support is disabled.

1.16.14 CONFIG_LIB_RAND_ORDER: Order of the random number generate

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Range: 1 - 3
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    The order of the random number generator. 1=fast but very bad random numbers, 3=slow but very good random numbers.

1.16.15 Choice: Newline Options

  • Default: EOL_IS_EITHER_CRLF
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    • This selection determines the line terminating character that is used. Some environments may return CR as end-of-line, others LF, and others both. If not specified, the default is either CR or LF (but not both) as the line terminating charactor.

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_EOL_IS_CR: EOL is CR

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    CONFIG_EOL_IS_LF: EOL is LF

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    CONFIG_EOL_IS_BOTH_CRLF: EOL is CR and LF

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    CONFIG_EOL_IS_EITHER_CRLF: EOL is CR or LF

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

1.16.16 CONFIG_LIBC_STRERROR: Enable strerror

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    strerror() is useful because it decodes 'errno' values into a human readable strings. But it can also require a lot of memory. If this option is selected, strerror() will still exist in the build but it will not decode error values. This option should be used by other logic to decide if it should use strerror() or not.

1.16.17 CONFIG_LIBC_STRERROR_SHORT: Use short error descriptions in strerror()

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_LIBC_STRERROR
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    If this option is selected, then strerror() will use a shortened string when it decodes the error. Specifically, strerror() is simply use the string that is the common name for the error. For example, the 'errno' value of 2 will produce the string "No such file or directory" is LIBC_STRERROR_SHORT is not defined but the string "ENOENT" is LIBC_STRERROR_SHORT is defined.

1.16.18 CONFIG_LIBC_PERROR_STDOUT: perror() to stdout

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    POSIX requires that perror() provide its output on stderr. This option may be defined, however, to provide perror() output that is serialized with other stdout messages.

1.16.19 CONFIG_LIBC_TMPDIR: Temporary file directory

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/tmp"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_WRITABLE
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    If a write-able file system is selected, this string will be provided to specify the full path to a directory where temporary files can be created. This would be a good application of RAM disk: To provide temporary storage for application data.

1.16.20 CONFIG_LIBC_MAX_TMPFILE: Maximum size of a temporary file path

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 32
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_WRITABLE
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    If a write-able file system is selected, then temporary file may be supported at the path provided by LIBC_TMPDIR. The tmpnam() interface keeps a static copy of this last filename produced; this value is the maximum size of that last filename. This size is the size of the full file path.

1.16.21 CONFIG_ARCH_LOWPUTC: Low-level console output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: "y"
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    architecture supports low-level, boot time console output

1.16.22 CONFIG_LIBC_LOCALTIME: localtime API call support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: "n"
  • Dependencies: !CONFIG_DISABLE_ENVIRON
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    localtime API call support

1.16.23 CONFIG_TIME_EXTENDED: enable time extended

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: "n"
  • Dependencies: !CONFIG_LIBC_LOCALTIME
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

1.16.24 CONFIG_LIBC_TZ_MAX_TIMES: Maximum number of times in timezone

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_LIBC_LOCALTIME
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

1.16.25 CONFIG_LIBC_TZ_MAX_TYPES: Maximum number of TZ types

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_LIBC_LOCALTIME
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

1.16.26 CONFIG_LIBC_TZDIR: zoneinfo directory path

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/etc/zoneinfo"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_LIBC_LOCALTIME
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

1.16.27 CONFIG_LIB_SENDFILE_BUFSIZE: sendfile() buffer size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 512
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    Size of the I/O buffer to allocate in sendfile(). Default: 512b

1.16.28 CONFIG_ARCH_ROMGETC: Support for ROM string access

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_ROMGETC
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    In Harvard architectures, data accesses and instruction accesses occur on different buses, perhaps concurrently. All data accesses are performed on the data bus unless special machine instructions are used to read data from the instruction address space. Also, in the typical MCU, the available SRAM data memory is much smaller that the non-volatile FLASH instruction memory. So if the application requires many constant strings, the only practical solution may be to store those constant strings in FLASH memory where they can only be accessed using architecture-specific machine instructions.

    If ARCH_ROMGETC is defined, then the architecture logic must export the function up_romgetc(). up_romgetc() will simply read one byte of data from the instruction space.

    If ARCH_ROMGETC is selected, certain C stdio functions are effected: (1) All format strings in printf, fprintf, sprintf, etc. are assumed to lie in FLASH (string arguments for %s are still assumed to reside in SRAM). And (2), the string argument to puts and fputs is assumed to reside in FLASH. Clearly, these assumptions may have to modified for the particular needs of your environment. There is no "one-size-fits-all" solution for this problem.

1.16.29 CONFIG_ARCH_OPTIMIZED_FUNCTIONS: Enable arch optimized functions

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    Allow for architecture optimized implementations of certain library functions. Architecture-specific implementations can improve overall system performance.

1.16.30 CONFIG_ARCH_MEMCPY: memcpy()

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_OPTIMIZED_FUNCTIONS
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    Select this option if the architecture provides an optimized version of memcpy().

1.16.31 CONFIG_MEMCPY_VIK: Vik memcpy()

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_OPTIMIZED_FUNCTIONS, !CONFIG_ARCH_MEMCPY
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    Select this option to use the optimized memcpy() function by Daniel Vik. Select this option for improved performance at the expense of increased size. See licensing information in the top-level COPYING file.

1.16.32 CONFIG_MEMCPY_PRE_INC_PTRS: Pre-increment pointers

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_OPTIMIZED_FUNCTIONS, CONFIG_MEMCPY_VIK
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    Use pre-increment of pointers. Default is post increment of pointers.

1.16.33 CONFIG_MEMCPY_INDEXED_COPY: Array indexing

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_OPTIMIZED_FUNCTIONS, CONFIG_MEMCPY_VIK
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    Copying data using array indexing. Using this option, disables the MEMCPY_PRE_INC_PTRS option.

1.16.34 CONFIG_MEMCPY_64BIT: 64-bit memcpy()

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_OPTIMIZED_FUNCTIONS, CONFIG_MEMCPY_VIK
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    Compiles memcpy() for architectures that suppport 64-bit operations efficiently.

1.16.35 CONFIG_ARCH_MEMCMP: memcmp()

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_OPTIMIZED_FUNCTIONS
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    Select this option if the architecture provides an optimized version of memcmp().

1.16.36 CONFIG_ARCH_MEMMOVE: memmove()

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_OPTIMIZED_FUNCTIONS
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    Select this option if the architecture provides an optimized version of memmove().

1.16.37 CONFIG_ARCH_MEMSET: memset()

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_OPTIMIZED_FUNCTIONS
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    Select this option if the architecture provides an optimized version of memset().

1.16.38 CONFIG_MEMSET_OPTSPEED: Optimize memset() for speed

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_OPTIMIZED_FUNCTIONS, !CONFIG_ARCH_MEMSET
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    Select this option to use a version of memset() optimized for speed. Default: memset() is optimized for size.

1.16.39 CONFIG_MEMSET_64BIT: 64-bit memset()

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_OPTIMIZED_FUNCTIONS, CONFIG_MEMSET_OPTSPEED
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    Compiles memset() for architectures that suppport 64-bit operations efficiently.

1.16.40 CONFIG_ARCH_STPNCPY: stpncpy()

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_OPTIMIZED_FUNCTIONS
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    Select this option if the architecture provides an optimized version of strpcpy().

1.16.41 CONFIG_ARCH_STRCHR: strchr()

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_OPTIMIZED_FUNCTIONS
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    Select this option if the architecture provides an optimized version of strchr().

1.16.42 CONFIG_ARCH_STRCMP: strcmp()

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_OPTIMIZED_FUNCTIONS
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    Select this option if the architecture provides an optimized version of strcmp().

1.16.43 CONFIG_ARCH_STRCPY: strcpy()

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_OPTIMIZED_FUNCTIONS
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    Select this option if the architecture provides an optimized version of strcpy().

1.16.44 CONFIG_ARCH_STRNCPY: strncpy()

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_OPTIMIZED_FUNCTIONS
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    Select this option if the architecture provides an optimized version of strncpy().

1.16.45 CONFIG_ARCH_STRLEN: strlen

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_OPTIMIZED_FUNCTIONS
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    Select this option if the architecture provides an optimized version of strlen().

1.16.46 CONFIG_ARCH_STRNLEN: strlen()

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_OPTIMIZED_FUNCTIONS
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    Select this option if the architecture provides an optimized version of strnlen().

1.16.47 CONFIG_ARCH_BZERO: bzero()

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_OPTIMIZED_FUNCTIONS
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    Select this option if the architecture provides an optimized version of bzero().

1.16.48 CONFIG_LIB_USRWORK: User mode worker thread

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_BUILD_PROTECTED, !CONFIG_DISABLE_SIGNALS
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    User space work queues can also be made available for deferred processing in the TinyAra kernel build.

1.16.49 CONFIG_LIB_USRWORKPRIORITY: User mode priority worker thread priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_BUILD_PROTECTED, CONFIG_LIB_USRWORK
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    The execution priority of the user-mode priority worker thread. Default: 100

1.16.50 CONFIG_LIB_USRWORKPERIOD: User mode worker thread period

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 100000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_BUILD_PROTECTED, CONFIG_LIB_USRWORK
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    How often the lower priority worker thread checks for work in units of microseconds. Default: 100*1000 (100 MS).

1.16.51 CONFIG_LIB_USRWORKSTACKSIZE: User mode worker thread stack size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2048
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_BUILD_PROTECTED, CONFIG_LIB_USRWORK
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig

    The stack size allocated for the lower priority worker thread. Default: 2K.

1.16.52 CONFIG_C99_BOOL8: sizeof(_Bool) is 8-bits

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libxx/Kconfig

    This setting means (1) your C++ compiler has sizeof(_Bool) == 8, (2) your C compiler supports the C99 _Bool intrinsic type, and (2) that the C99 _Bool type also has size 1.

1.16.53 CONFIG_HAVE_CXX: Have C++ compiler

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libxx/Kconfig

    Toolchain supports C++ and CXX, CXXFLAGS, and COMPILEXX have been defined in the configurations Make.defs file.

1.16.54 CONFIG_CXX_NEWLONG: size_t is type long

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_HAVE_CXX
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libxx/Kconfig

    size_t may be type long or type int. This matters for some C++ library routines because the TinyAra size_t might not have the same underlying type as your toolchain's size_t.

1.16.55 CONFIG_LIBCXX: Build LLVM libcxx

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_HAVE_CXX
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libxx/Kconfig

    LLVM libc++ can be built by selecting this option.

1.16.56 CONFIG_LIBCXX_EXCEPTION: Enable Exception Suppport

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_HAVE_CXX, CONFIG_LIBCXX
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libxx/Kconfig

1.16.57 CONFIG_LIBCXX_IOSTREAM_BUFSIZE: IO Stream Buffer Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 32
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_HAVE_CXX, CONFIG_LIBCXX
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libxx/Kconfig

1.16.58 CONFIG_LIBCXX_HAVE_LIBSUPCXX: Have libsupc++ (required)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_HAVE_CXX, CONFIG_LIBCXX
  • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libxx/Kconfig

    Select if your toolchain provides libsupc++. This option is required at present because the built-in libsupc++ support is incomplete.

1.17 Menu: External Libraries

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.17.1 CONFIG_AUDIO_CODEC: Software Audio Codec Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_AUDIO
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/audiocodec/Kconfig

    Enable software audio codec functions

1.17.2 CONFIG_AUDIO_CODEC_RINGBUFFER_SIZE: Audio Decoder Ringbuffer Size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16384
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_AUDIO_CODEC
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/audiocodec/Kconfig

    Ring buffer size that used for decoding MP3/AAC

1.17.3 CONFIG_AVS_DEVICE_SDK: Alexa Voice Service Device SDK

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_MEDIA, CONFIG_MEDIA_PLAYER, CONFIG_MEDIA_RECORDER, CONFIG_AUDIO_CODEC, CONFIG_ENABLE_CURL, CONFIG_ARASTORAGE
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/avs/Kconfig

    Enable AVS Device SDK

1.17.4 CONFIG_AWS_SDK: AWS IoT SDK

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/aws/Kconfig

    enable AWS IoT Device SDK

1.17.5 CONFIG_NETUTILS_CODECS: CODEC Library

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/codecs/Kconfig

    Enables the netutils/code library: Base64 coding, URL coding, MD5.

1.17.6 CONFIG_CODECS_BASE64: Base 64 Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_CODECS
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/codecs/Kconfig

    Enables support for the following interfaces: base64_encode(), base64_decode(), base64w_encode(), and base64w_decode(),

    Contributed NuttX by Darcy Gong.

1.17.7 CONFIG_CODECS_HASH_MD5: MD5 Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_CODECS
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/codecs/Kconfig

    Enables support for the following interfaces: MD5Init(), MD5Update(), MD5Final(), MD5Transform(), md5_sum() and md5_hash()

    Contributed NuttX by Darcy Gong.

1.17.8 CONFIG_CODECS_URLCODE: URL Decode Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_CODECS
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/codecs/Kconfig

    Enables support for the following interfaces: urlencode() and urldecode()

    Contributed NuttX by Darcy Gong.

1.17.9 CONFIG_CODECS_URLCODE_NEWMEMORY: URL Allocating Decode Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_CODECS
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/codecs/Kconfig

    Enables support for the following interfaces: url_encode() and url_decode()

    Contributed NuttX by Darcy Gong.

1.17.10 CONFIG_CODECS_AVR_URLCODE: URL Raw Decode Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_CODECS
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/codecs/Kconfig

    Enables support for the following interfaces: urlrawdecode() and urlrawencode()

    Contributed NuttX by Darcy Gong.

1.17.11 Menu: CURL Options

  • Kconfig file: ./../external/curl/Kconfig

1.17.11.1 CONFIG_ENABLE_CURL: Enable CURL

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_LIBC_LOCALTIME, CONFIG_LIBC_SCANSET
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/curl/Kconfig

    Libcurl supports various Application level protocols. HTTP, FTP, Gopher etc.

1.17.11.2 CONFIG_DISABLE_HTTP: Disable HTTP

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ENABLE_CURL
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/curl/Kconfig

1.17.11.3 CONFIG_USE_NGHTTP2: Use NGHTTP2

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ENABLE_CURL, !CONFIG_DISABLE_HTTP , CONFIG_ENABLE_NGHTTP2
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/curl/Kconfig

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ENABLE_CURL, !CONFIG_DISABLE_HTTP
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/curl/Kconfig

1.17.11.5 CONFIG_DISABLE_COOKIES: Disable COOKIES

  • Default: n

1.17.11.22 CONFIG_DISABLE_CRYPTO_AUTH: Disable Crypto Authentication

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ENABLE_CURL
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/curl/Kconfig

1.17.11.23 CONFIG_CA_PATH: Certificate Path

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/rom"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ENABLE_CURL, !CONFIG_DISABLE_CRYPTO_AUTH
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/curl/Kconfig

1.17.11.24 CONFIG_CA_BUNDLE: Certificate Bundle

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/rom/curl-certificates.crt"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ENABLE_CURL, !CONFIG_DISABLE_CRYPTO_AUTH
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/curl/Kconfig

1.17.11.25 CONFIG_CA_FALLBACK: CA Fallback

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ENABLE_CURL, !CONFIG_DISABLE_CRYPTO_AUTH
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/curl/Kconfig

1.17.11.26 CONFIG_SSL_SUPPORT: SSL Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ENABLE_CURL, CONFIG_NET_SECURITY_TLS , CONFIG_FS_ROMFS
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/curl/Kconfig

1.17.11.27 CONFIG_MBEDTLS: Mbed TLS

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ENABLE_CURL, CONFIG_SSL_SUPPORT
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/curl/Kconfig

1.17.11.28 CONFIG_CURL_DEBUG: Curl Debug

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ENABLE_CURL
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/curl/Kconfig

1.17.11.29 CONFIG_LOG_CURL_FAIL: Fail Logs

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ENABLE_CURL, CONFIG_CURL_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/curl/Kconfig

1.17.11.30 CONFIG_LOG_CURL_INFO: Info Logs

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ENABLE_CURL, CONFIG_CURL_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/curl/Kconfig

1.17.11.31 CONFIG_LOG_CURL_DEBUG: Debug Logs

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ENABLE_CURL, CONFIG_CURL_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/curl/Kconfig

1.17.11.32 CONFIG_AGGRESSIVE_TEST: Aggressive Test

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ENABLE_CURL, CONFIG_CURL_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/curl/Kconfig

1.17.12 CONFIG_ERROR_REPORT: Error Report Module

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/error_report/Kconfig

    enable Error Reporting

1.17.13 CONFIG_ERROR_REPORT_NENTRIES: Number of Error Records

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 6
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ERROR_REPORT
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/error_report/Kconfig

    Maximum number of error records to store in memory

1.17.14 CONFIG_DEBUG_ERR_REPORT_ERROR: Debug Error Reporting for errors

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ERROR_REPORT, CONFIG_DEBUG_ERROR
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/error_report/Kconfig

    Debug Error Reporting errors

1.17.15 CONFIG_DEBUG_ERR_REPORT_WARN: Debug Error Reporting for warnings

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ERROR_REPORT, CONFIG_DEBUG_WARN
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/error_report/Kconfig

    Debug Error Reporting warnings

1.17.16 CONFIG_DEBUG_ERR_REPORT_INFO: Debug Error Reporting for Info

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ERROR_REPORT, CONFIG_DEBUG_VERBOSE
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/error_report/Kconfig

    Debug Error Reporting info

1.17.17 CONFIG_WIFIMGR_ERROR_REPORT: WiFi Manager Errors

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ERROR_REPORT, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/error_report/Kconfig

    Report errors in WiFi Manager

1.17.18 CONFIG_LWIP_SOCKET_ERROR_REPORT: LWIP socket errors

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ERROR_REPORT, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/error_report/Kconfig

    Report errors at LWIP socket layer

1.17.19 CONFIG_EIPADDR_ERROR_REPORT: IPv4 address of endpoint

  • Type: String
  • Default: "127.0.0.1"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ERROR_REPORT
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/error_report/Kconfig

    Enter IP address of endpoint server where error logs will be gathered

1.17.20 CONFIG_EPORT_ERROR_REPORT: Port of endpoint

  • Type: String
  • Default: "5001"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ERROR_REPORT
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/error_report/Kconfig

    Enter Port of endpoint server where error logs will be gathered

1.17.21 CONFIG_GMOCK: gmock

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_HAVE_CXX
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/gmock/Kconfig

    enable gmock

1.17.22 CONFIG_ENABLE_IOTIVITY: enable / disable iotivity stack

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_NET_LWIP_NETDB, CONFIG_TIME_EXTENDED, CONFIG_ARCH_STDARG_H
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/iotivity/Kconfig

    select to enable the iotivity stack in tinyara

1.17.23 CONFIG_IOTIVITY_RELEASE_VERSION: iotivity stack version

  • Type: String
  • Default: "1.2-rel"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ENABLE_IOTIVITY
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/iotivity/Kconfig

    define this to iotivity stack release veriosn in use

1.17.24 CONFIG_IOTIVITY_ROUTING: Enable routing, allowed values : 'EP' / 'GW'

  • Type: String
  • Default: "EP"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ENABLE_IOTIVITY
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/iotivity/Kconfig

    define this to enable routing, allowed values : 'EP' / 'GW'

1.17.25 CONFIG_IOTIVITY_PTHREAD_STACKSIZE: Default pthread stack size for iotivity threads

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8192
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ENABLE_IOTIVITY
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/iotivity/Kconfig

    Default pthread stack size for iotivity threads

1.17.26 CONFIG_IOTIVITY_QUEING_PTHREAD_STACKSIZE: Default pthread stack size for the queing thread

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 3072
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ENABLE_IOTIVITY
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/iotivity/Kconfig

    Default pthread stack size for the queing thread

1.17.27 CONFIG_IOTIVITY_RETRANSMIT_PTHREAD_STACKSIZE: Default pthread stack size for the retransmission pthread

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1024
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ENABLE_IOTIVITY
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/iotivity/Kconfig

    Default pthread stack size for the retransmission pthread

1.17.28 CONFIG_IOTIVITY_TCPRECEIVE_PTHREAD_STACKSIZE: Default pthread stack size for the TCP-receive thread

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8192
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ENABLE_IOTIVITY
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/iotivity/Kconfig

    Default pthread stack size for the TCP-receive thread

1.17.29 CONFIG_IOTIVITY_RECEIVEHANDLER_PTHREAD_STACKSIZE: Default pthread stack size for the receive-handler thread

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8192
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ENABLE_IOTIVITY
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/iotivity/Kconfig

    Default pthread stack size for the receive-handler thread

1.17.30 CONFIG_ENABLE_IOTIVITY_SECURED: enable iotivity security

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_NET_SECURITY_TLS
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ENABLE_IOTIVITY
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/iotivity/Kconfig

    select to enable the security for iotivity stack in tinyara

1.17.31 CONFIG_ENABLE_IOTIVITY_CLOUD: enable iotivity cloud

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ENABLE_IOTIVITY
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/iotivity/Kconfig

    select to enable the cloud for iotivity stack in tinyara

1.17.32 CONFIG_IOTIVITY_DEBUG: enable iotivity stack logs

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ENABLE_IOTIVITY
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/iotivity/Kconfig

    select to enable all iotivity stack logs (DEBUG / INFO etc.)

1.17.33 CONFIG_IOTIVITY_NS_PROVIDER: enable iotivity notification service(provider only)

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ENABLE_IOTIVITY
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/iotivity/Kconfig

    select to enable iotivity Notification Provider Service

1.17.34 CONFIG_NETUTILS_JSON: cJSON library

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/json/Kconfig

    Enables the cJSON library. cJSON is an ultra-lightweight, portable, single-file, simple-as-can-be ANSI-C compliant JSON parser, under MIT license. Embeddable Lightweight XML-RPC Server discussed at http://www.drdobbs.com/web-development/an-embeddable-lightweight-xml-rpc-server/184405364. This code was taken from http://sourceforge.net/projects/cjson/ and adapted for NuttX by Darcy Gong.

1.17.35 CONFIG_LIBTUV: libtuv

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/libtuv/Kconfig

    enable libtuv

1.17.36 CONFIG_ENABLE_NGHTTP2: Enable NGHTTP2

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MBEDTLS
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/nghttp2/Kconfig

    nghttp2 is an implementation of HTTP/2 and its header compression algorithm HPACK.

1.17.37 CONFIG_NGHTTP2_DEBUG: Nghttp2 Debug

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ENABLE_NGHTTP2, CONFIG_DEBUG
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/nghttp2/Kconfig

1.17.38 CONFIG_PROTOBUF: protocol buffer

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_LIBCXX
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/protobuf/Kconfig

    enable Protocol Buffer

1.17.39 CONFIG_LWM2M_WAKAAMA: LWM2M_WAKAAMA

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET_LWIP_NETDB
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/wakaama/Kconfig

    enable LWM2M WAKAAMA external feature

1.17.40 Choice: LWM2M WAKAAMA modes

  • Default: LWM2M_CLIENT_MODE
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_LWM2M_WAKAAMA
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/wakaama/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_LWM2M_CLIENT_MODE: CLIENT_MODE

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_LWM2M_WAKAAMA
    • Kconfig file: ./../external/wakaama/Kconfig

      enable LWM2M WAKAAMA client mode

    CONFIG_LWM2M_SERVER_MODE: SERVER_MODE

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_LWM2M_WAKAAMA
    • Kconfig file: ./../external/wakaama/Kconfig

      enable LWM2M WAKAAMA server mode

1.17.41 CONFIG_LWM2M_LITTLE_ENDIAN: LITTLE_ENDIAN

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_LWM2M_WAKAAMA
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/wakaama/Kconfig

    LWM2M supports LITTLE_ENDIAN and BIG_ENDIAN mode. according to server configuration, LWM2M client should match it. default value is LITTLE_ENDIAN and if you do not select as LITTLE_ENDIAN, BIG_ENDIAN will be used instead of it

1.17.42 CONFIG_WL_BCM4390X: BCM4390X Wireless Module support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_WICED, CONFIG_BCM4390X_WIRELESS, CONFIG_NET_NOINTS
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_CY4390x
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/WICED/Kconfig

    Enable support for BCM4390X WiFi driver

1.17.43 CONFIG_WIRELESS_FIRMWARE_FILESYSTEM: BCM43909B0 wireless firmware can be loaded from file system

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_MTD_PARTITION, CONFIG_FS_ROMFS
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_WL_BCM4390X
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/WICED/Kconfig

    Enable when file system includes its wireless module firmware

1.17.44 CONFIG_WICED: WICED code Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_WL_BCM4390X
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/WICED/Kconfig

1.17.45 CONFIG_NET_NOINTS: NOINTS Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_WL_BCM4390X
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/WICED/Kconfig

1.17.46 CONFIG_CODEC_LIBOPUS: libopus 1.2.1

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_AUDIO_CODEC
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/libopus/Kconfig

    select to enable the libopus library

1.17.47 Choice: Opus Application Mode

  • Default: OPUS_APPLICATION_AUDIO
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_CODEC_LIBOPUS
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/libopus/Kconfig

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_OPUS_APPLICATION_VOIP: VoIP

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_CODEC_LIBOPUS
    • Kconfig file: ./../external/libopus/Kconfig

    CONFIG_OPUS_APPLICATION_AUDIO: Audio

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_CODEC_LIBOPUS
    • Kconfig file: ./../external/libopus/Kconfig

    CONFIG_OPUS_APPLICATION_RESTRICTED_LOWDELAY: Restricted_lowdelay

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_CODEC_LIBOPUS
    • Kconfig file: ./../external/libopus/Kconfig

1.17.48 CONFIG_OPUS_ENCODE_COMPLEXITY: Complexity for encoding, value in [0, 10]

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 5
  • Range: 0 - 10
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_CODEC_LIBOPUS
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/libopus/Kconfig

    Complexity for opus encoding, avaiable complexity is in range [0, 10]

1.17.49 CONFIG_OPUS_ENCODE_FRAMESIZE: Frame size for encoding, value in msec

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_CODEC_LIBOPUS
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/libopus/Kconfig

    Frame size for opus encoding, it's duration of each packet. 5, 10, 20, 40, 60, 80, 100, 120 milliseconds is available.

1.17.50 CONFIG_OPUS_ENCODE_BITRATE: Bitrate for encoding, bits per second

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_CODEC_LIBOPUS
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/libopus/Kconfig

    Bitrate for encoding, bits per second, e.g. 16000

1.17.51 CONFIG_STRESS_TOOL: Enable Stress Tool

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/stress_tool/Kconfig

    Enable support for stress tool APIs.

1.17.52 CONFIG_VOICE_SOFTWARE_EPD: Software EndPoint Detector(Fixed Float) Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/swepd/Kconfig

    Enable software endpoint detector(Fixed float) functions

1.17.53 CONFIG_VOICE_SOFTWARE_EPD_FRAMESIZE: Software End Point Detector Framesize

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_VOICE_SOFTWARE_EPD
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/swepd/Kconfig

    Software end point detector frame size that used for processing end point.

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    • Dependencies: CONFIG_INIT_ENTRYPOINT

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_INIT_ENTRYPOINT, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SPEECH_DETECTOR_TEST

    • Dependencies: CONFIG_INIT_ENTRYPOINT, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TASK_MANAGER_SAMPLE

  • Type: String
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_INIT_ENTRYPOINT
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/apps_entry/Kconfig

    The name of the entry point for user applications.

1.18.3 CONFIG_BUILTIN_APPS: Support builtin applications

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/builtin/Kconfig

    If this configuration is enabled (is set to y), enabled applications are registered at TASH automatically.

1.18.4 Menu: Examples

  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/Kconfig

1.18.4.1 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_ARTIK_DEMO: Artik API Demo Example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DM
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/artik_demo/Kconfig

    Enable the artik demo example

  • Type: String
  • Default: "SSID"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_ARTIK_DEMO
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/artik_demo/Kconfig

1.18.4.3 CONFIG_AP_PASS: wifi ap password

  • Type: String
  • Default: "PASSWORD"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_ARTIK_DEMO
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/artik_demo/Kconfig

  • Type: String
  • Default: "wpa2_aes"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_ARTIK_DEMO
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/artik_demo/Kconfig

  • Type: String
  • Default: ""
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_ARTIK_DEMO
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/artik_demo/Kconfig

  • Type: String
  • Default: ""
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_ARTIK_DEMO
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/artik_demo/Kconfig

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/avs_test/Kconfig

    Enable the AVS Device SDK test example

1.18.4.8 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_AVS_TEST_SSID: SSID of AP

  • Type: String
  • Default: "NULL"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_AVS_TEST
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/avs_test/Kconfig

    Select SSID of AP which you want to connect to

1.18.4.9 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_AVS_TEST_PASSPHRASE: Passphrase of AP

  • Type: String
  • Default: "NULL"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_AVS_TEST
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/avs_test/Kconfig

    Passphrase of AP which you want to connect to

1.18.4.10 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_AVS_TEST_AUTHENTICATION: Authentication type

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_AVS_TEST
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/avs_test/Kconfig

    0 : Open 1 : WEP Shared 2 : WPA PSK 3 : WPA2 PSK 4 : WPA and WPA2 PSK 5 : Unknown

1.18.4.11 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_AVS_TEST_CRYPTO: Encryption type

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_AVS_TEST
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/avs_test/Kconfig

    0 : None 1 : WEP 64 bits 2 : WEP 128 bits 3 : AES 4 : TKIP 5 : TIKP and AES 6 : Unknown

1.18.4.12 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_AWS: AWS demo application

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_AWS_SDK, CONFIG_NETUTILS_WIFI
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/aws/Kconfig

    Enable AWS IoT Device example application

1.18.4.13 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_CURLTEST: curl test example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ENABLE_CURL
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/curl_test/Kconfig

1.18.4.14 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_CXXTEST: C++ test program

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_HAVE_CXX

1.18.4.15 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_CXXTEST_CXXINITIALIZE: C++ Initialization

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_CXXTEST, CONFIG_HAVE_CXX && CONFIG_HAVE_CXXINITIALIZE
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/cxxtest/Kconfig

    By default, if CONFIG_HAVE_CXX and CONFIG_HAVE_CXXINITIALIZE are defined, then this example will call the NuttX function to initialize static C++ constructors. This option may be disabled, however, if that static initialization was performed elsewhere.

1.18.4.16 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_CY4390x_DEMO: cy4390x demo example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_CY4390x

1.18.4.17 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_DM_WIFI_TEST: DM WIFI example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DM, CONFIG_NETUTILS_WIFI
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/dm_wifi_test/Kconfig

    Enable the WIFI APIs example. This application features a set of DM API calls to start WiFi, connect to an Access Point, perform DHCP, as well as channel scanning.

  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/grpc_greeter_client/Kconfig

    By default, if CONFIG_HAVE_CXX and CONFIG_HAVE_CXXINITIALIZE are defined, then this example will call the TinyAra function to initialize static C++ constructors. This option may be disabled, however, if that static initialization was preformed elsewhere.

  • Type: Boolean

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y

  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/grpc_route_client/Kconfig

    By default, if CONFIG_HAVE_CXX and CONFIG_HAVE_CXXINITIALIZE are defined, then this example will call the TinyAra function to initialize static C++ constructors. This option may be disabled, however, if that static initialization was preformed elsewhere.

1.18.4.42 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_HELLO: \"Hello, World!\" example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/hello/Kconfig

    Enable the \"Hello, World!\" example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/helloxx/Kconfig

    Enable the \"Hello, World!\" C++ example
