  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_HELLOXX, CONFIG_HAVE_CXX && CONFIG_HAVE_CXXINITIALIZE
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/helloxx/Kconfig

    By default, if CONFIG_HAVE_CXX and CONFIG_HAVE_CXXINITIALIZE are defined, then this example will call the TinyAra function to initialize static C++ constructors. This option may be disabled, however, if that static initialization was preformed elsewhere.

1.18.4.45 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_I2SCHAR: I2S character driver test

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_I2S && CONFIG_AUDIO && CONFIG_AUDIO_DEVICES && CONFIG_AUDIO_I2SCHAR
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/i2schar/Kconfig

    Enable the I2S character driver test

1.18.4.46 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_I2SCHAR_DEVPATH: I2S character device path

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/dev/i2schar0"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_I2SCHAR
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/i2schar/Kconfig

    The default path to the I2S character device. Default: /dev/i2schar0

1.18.4.47 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_I2SCHAR_TX: Use I2S transmitter

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_I2SCHAR
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/i2schar/Kconfig

    This should be set if the I2S device supports a transmitter.

1.18.4.48 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_I2SCHAR_TXBUFFERS: Number of TX buffers

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_I2SCHAR, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_I2SCHAR_TX
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/i2schar/Kconfig

    This is the default number of audio buffers to send before the TX transfers terminate. When both TX and RX transfers terminate, the task exits (and, if a builtin, the i2schar command returns). This number can be changed from the TASH command line.

1.18.4.49 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_I2SCHAR_TXSTACKSIZE: Transmitter thread stack size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1536
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_I2SCHAR, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_I2SCHAR_TX
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/i2schar/Kconfig

    This is the stack size to use when starting the transmitter thread.

1.18.4.50 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_I2SCHAR_RX: Use I2S receiver

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_I2SCHAR
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/i2schar/Kconfig

    This should be set if the I2S device supports a receiver.

1.18.4.51 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_I2SCHAR_RXBUFFERS: Number of RX buffers

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_I2SCHAR, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_I2SCHAR_RX
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/i2schar/Kconfig

    This is the default number of audio buffers to receive before the RX transfers terminate. When both TX and RX transfers terminate, the task exits (and, if a builtin, the i2schar command returns). This number can be changed from the TASH command line.

1.18.4.52 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_I2SCHAR_RXSTACKSIZE: Receiver thread stack size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1536
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_I2SCHAR, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_I2SCHAR_RX
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/i2schar/Kconfig

    This is the stack size to use when starting the receiver thread.

1.18.4.53 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_I2SCHAR_BUFSIZE: Audio payload size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8192
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_I2SCHAR
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/i2schar/Kconfig

    The size of the data payload in one audio buffer in bytes. Applies to both TX and RX audio buffers.

1.18.4.54 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_I2SCHAR_DEVINIT: Architecture-specific device initialization

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_I2SCHAR, !CONFIG_BUILD_PROTECTED && !CONFIG_BUILD_KERNEL
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/i2schar/Kconfig

    Define if architecture-specific I2S device initialize is available. If defined, the the platform specific code must provide a function i2schar_devinit() that will be called each time that this test executes. Not available in the kernel build mode.

1.18.4.55 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_IOTBUS_TEST: Iotbus example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/iotbus_test/Kconfig

    Enable the Iotbus example example

1.18.4.56 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_IOTBUS_TEST_RED_LED_GPIO_NUM: GPIO number of RED LED

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 45
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_IOTBUS_TEST
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/iotbus_test/Kconfig

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 49
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_IOTBUS_TEST
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/iotbus_test/Kconfig

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 42
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_IOTBUS_TEST
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/iotbus_test/Kconfig

  • Type: Boolean

  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/iotjs_startup/Kconfig

    Enable the IoT.js StartUp example, that run a Javascript on start using IoT.js

1.18.4.62 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_IOTJS_STARTUP_PROGNAME: Program name

  • Type: String
  • Default: "iotjs_startup"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_IOTJS_STARTUP, CONFIG_BUILD_KERNEL
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/iotjs_startup/Kconfig

    This is the name of the program that will be use when the NSH ELF program is installed.

1.18.4.63 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_IOTJS_STARTUP_JS_FILE: Main javascript file

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/rom/example/index.js"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_IOTJS_STARTUP
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/iotjs_startup/Kconfig

    This is the name of the javascript loaded by IoT.js runtime

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/rom/example/iotjs_modules"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_IOTJS_STARTUP
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/iotjs_startup/Kconfig

    This is the name of the javascript loaded by IoT.js runtime

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_IOTJS_STARTUP
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/iotjs_startup/Kconfig

    Enable WiFi on start

1.18.4.66 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_IOTJS_STARTUP_WIFI_SSID: SSID of AP

  • Type: String
  • Default: "public"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_IOTJS_STARTUP, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_IOTJS_STARTUP_WIFI
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/iotjs_startup/Kconfig

    Select SSID of AP which you want to connect to

1.18.4.67 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_IOTJS_STARTUP_WIFI_PASS: Passphrase of AP

  • Type: String
  • Default: ""
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_IOTJS_STARTUP, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_IOTJS_STARTUP_WIFI
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/iotjs_startup/Kconfig

    Passphrase of AP which you want to connect to

1.18.4.68 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_IOTJS_STARTUP_WIFI_AUTH: Authentication type

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Range: 0 - 5
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_IOTJS_STARTUP, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_IOTJS_STARTUP_WIFI
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/iotjs_startup/Kconfig

    0 : Open 1 : WEP Shared 2 : WPA PSK 3 : WPA2 PSK 4 : WPA and WPA2 PSK 5 : Unknown

1.18.4.69 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_IOTJS_STARTUP_WIFI_CRYPTO: Encryption type

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Range: 0 - 5
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_IOTJS_STARTUP, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_IOTJS_STARTUP_WIFI
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/iotjs_startup/Kconfig

    0 : None 1 : WEP 64 bits 2 : WEP 128 bits 3 : AES 4 : TKIP 5 : TIKP and AES 6 : Unknown

1.18.4.70 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_KERNEL_SAMPLE: OS test example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/kernel_sample/Kconfig

    Enable the OS test example

1.18.4.71 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_KERNEL_SAMPLE_LOOPS: OS test loop

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_KERNEL_SAMPLE
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/kernel_sample/Kconfig

    Used to control the number of executions of the test. If undefined, the test executes one time. If defined to be zero, the test runs forever.

1.18.4.72 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_KERNEL_SAMPLE_STACKSIZE: OS test stack size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8192
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_KERNEL_SAMPLE
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/kernel_sample/Kconfig

    Size of the stack used to create the kernel_sample task. Default is 8192.

1.18.4.73 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_KERNEL_SAMPLE_NBARRIER_THREADS: Number of barrier threads

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_KERNEL_SAMPLE
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/kernel_sample/Kconfig

    Specifies the number of threads to create in the barrier test. The default is 8 but a smaller number may be needed on systems without sufficient memory to start so many threads.

1.18.4.74 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_KERNEL_SAMPLE_AIO: Asynchronous I/O Tests

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_KERNEL_SAMPLE, CONFIG_FS_AIO && CONFIG_FS_WRITABLE
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/kernel_sample/Kconfig

    Enables test of asynchronous I/O. You must have a mounted, writable directory in place to use this test.

1.18.4.75 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_KERNEL_SAMPLE_AIOPATH: Scratch file path

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/tmp"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_KERNEL_SAMPLE, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_KERNEL_SAMPLE_AIO
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/kernel_sample/Kconfig

    This is the location of a directory in a mounted file system that the AIO test can write into.

1.18.4.76 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_KERNEL_SAMPLE_RR_RANGE: Round-robin test - end of search range

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 10000
  • Range: 1 - 32767
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_KERNEL_SAMPLE
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/kernel_sample/Kconfig

    During round-robin scheduling test two threads are created. Each of the threads searches for prime numbers in the configurable range, doing that configurable number of times.

    This value specifies the end of search range and together with number of runs allows to configure the length of this test - it should last at least a few tens of seconds. Allowed values [1; 32767], default 10000

1.18.4.77 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_KERNEL_SAMPLE_RR_RUNS: Round-robin test - number of runs

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 10
  • Range: 1 - 32767
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_KERNEL_SAMPLE
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/kernel_sample/Kconfig

    During round-robin scheduling test two threads are created. Each of the threads searches for prime numbers in the configurable range, doing that configurable number of times.

    This value specifies the number of times the thread searches the range for prime numbers and together with end of search range allows to configure the length of this test - it should last at least a few tens of seconds. Allowed values [1; 32767], default 10

1.18.4.78 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_LIBCOAP_CLIENT_TEST: \"libcoap Client Test\" example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_LIBCOAP
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/libcoap_client/Kconfig

  • Type: Boolean

  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/mqtt_test/Kconfig

    Enable the \"MQTT Test\" example

1.18.4.96 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_MTDPART: MTD partition test

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_RAMMTD && CONFIG_MTD_PARTITION && !CONFIG_BUILD_PROTECTED && !CONFIG_BUILD_KERNEL
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/mtdpart/Kconfig

    Enable the MTD partition test example.

    NOTE: This example uses some internal NuttX interfaces and, hence, is not available in the kernel build.

1.18.4.97 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_MTDPART_ARCHINIT: Architecture-specific initialization

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_MTDPART
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/mtdpart/Kconfig

    The default is to use the RAM MTD device at drivers/mtd/rammtd.c. But an architecture-specific MTD driver can be used instead by defining EXAMPLES_MTDPART_ARCHINIT. In this case, the initialization logic will call mtdpart_archinitialize() to obtain the MTD driver instance.

1.18.4.98 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_MTDPART_NEBLOCKS: Number of erase blocks (simulated)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_MTDPART, !CONFIG_EXAMPLES_MTDPART_ARCHINIT
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/mtdpart/Kconfig

    When EXAMPLES_MTDPART_ARCHINIT is not defined, this test will use the RAM MTD device at drivers/mtd/rammtd.c to simulate FLASH. In this case, this value must be provided to give the nubmer of erase blocks in MTD RAM device.

    The size of the allocated RAM drive will be:

      EXAMPLES_MTDPART_ERASESIZE * EXAMPLES_MTDPART_NEBLOCKS

1.18.4.99 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_MTDPART_NPARTITIONS: Number of partitions

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_MTDPART
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/mtdpart/Kconfig

    This setting provides the number of partitions to test. The test will divide the reported size of the MTD device into equal- sized sub-regions for each test partition.

1.18.4.100 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_NETTEST: Sample App for testing network related functionalities like TCP/UDP/IGMP?ICMP etc.

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/nettest/Kconfig

    Enable the network test API's

1.18.4.106 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_PROTOBUF: Protocol Buffers example

  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/protobuf/Kconfig

    Enable the Protocol Buffers example

1.18.4.107 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_PROTOBUF_CXXINITIALIZE: C++ Initialization

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_PROTOBUF, CONFIG_HAVE_CXX && CONFIG_HAVE_CXXINITIALIZE
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/protobuf/Kconfig

    By default, if CONFIG_HAVE_CXX and CONFIG_HAVE_CXXINITIALIZE are defined, then this example will call the TinyAra function to initialize static C++ constructors. This option may be disabled, however, if that static initialization was preformed elsewhere.

1.18.4.108 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_PROTOBUF_TEST: Protocol Buffers test

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_HAVE_CXXINITIALIZE && CONFIG_LIBCXX && CONFIG_PROTOBUF && CONFIG_GMOCK
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/protobuf_test/Kconfig

    Enable the Protocol Buffers test

  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_TLS_WITH_SSS && CONFIG_SUPPORT_FULL_SECURITY
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/security_test/Kconfig

  • Type: String
  • Default: "security selftest"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SECURITY_TEST, CONFIG_BUILD_KERNEL
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/security_test/Kconfig

  • Type: Boolean

  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/select_test/Kconfig

    Enable select test

1.18.4.112 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SELECT_TEST_PROGNAME: Program name

  • Type: String
  • Default: "select_test"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SELECT_TEST, CONFIG_BUILD_KERNEL
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/select_test/Kconfig

    This is the name of the program that will be use when the TASH ELF program is installed.

1.18.4.113 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SENSORBOARD: Sensor Board Example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ANALOG, CONFIG_ADC, CONFIG_S5J_ADC, CONFIG_GPIO, CONFIG_S5J_GPIO, CONFIG_SPI, CONFIG_SPI_EXCHANGE, CONFIG_S5J_SPI, CONFIG_SERIAL, CONFIG_S5J_UART0, CONFIG_S5J_UART1, CONFIG_S5J_UART2, CONFIG_S5J_UART3, CONFIG_I2C, CONFIG_I2C_USERIO, CONFIG_S5J_I2C, CONFIG_PWM, CONFIG_S5J_PWM0, CONFIG_S5J_PWM1, CONFIG_S5J_PWM2, CONFIG_S5J_PWM3, CONFIG_S5J_PWM4, CONFIG_S5J_PWM5
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/sensorbd_demo/Kconfig

    Enable the Sensor Board Example

1.18.4.114 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SETJMP_TEST: setjmp/longjmp test

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/setjmp/Kconfig

    setjmp/longjmp pair of functions facilitate execution context management in plain C. You can think of them as exception handling/coroutine facilitating mechanism.

    This option enables test application of this feature. In order to have it 

      accessible out of the box, enable BUILTIN_APPS.

1.18.4.115 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART: SMART file system example

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/smart/Kconfig

    Enable the SMART file system example

1.18.4.116 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART_ARCHINIT: Architecture-specific initialization

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/smart/Kconfig

    The default is to use the RAM MTD device at drivers/mtd/rammtd.c. But an architecture-specific MTD driver can be used instead by defining EXAMPLES_SMART_ARCHINIT. In this case, the initialization logic will call smart_archinitialize() to obtain the MTD driver instance.

1.18.4.117 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART_NEBLOCKS: Number of erase blocks (simulated)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 32
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART, !CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART_ARCHINIT
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/smart/Kconfig

    When EXAMPLES_SMART_ARCHINIT is not defined, this test will use the RAM MTD device at drivers/mtd/rammtd.c to simulate FLASH. In this case, this value must be provided to give the nubmer of erase blocks in MTD RAM device.

    The size of the allocated RAM drive will be:

      RAMMTD_ERASESIZE * EXAMPLES_SMART_NEBLOCKS

1.18.4.118 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART_MAXNAME: Max name size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 32
  • Range: 1 - 255
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/smart/Kconfig

    Determines the maximum size of names used in the filesystem

1.18.4.119 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART_MAXFILE: Max file size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 8192
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/smart/Kconfig

    Determines the maximum size of a file

1.18.4.120 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART_MAXIO: Max I/O

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 347
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/smart/Kconfig

1.18.4.121 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART_MAXOPEN: Max open files

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 512
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/smart/Kconfig

1.18.4.122 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART_MOUNTPT: SMART mountpoint

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/mnt"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/smart/Kconfig

1.18.4.123 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART_NLOOPS: Number of test loops

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/smart/Kconfig

1.18.4.124 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART_VERBOSE: Verbose output

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/smart/Kconfig

1.18.4.125 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_SMART_TEST: SMART filesystem test tool

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/smart_test/Kconfig

    Performs a file-based test on a SMART (or any) filesystem. Validates seek, append and seek-with-write operations. This test can be built only as an TASH command

1.18.4.129 Choice: ST Things Sample list

  • Default: EXAMPLES_ST_THINGS_LIGHT
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_ST_THINGS
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/st_things/Kconfig

    • This selection builds a sample of ST_things.

Choice Options:

    CONFIG_EXAMPLES_ST_THINGS_LIGHT: LIGHT

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_IOTBUS_GPIO
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_ST_THINGS
    • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/st_things/Kconfig

      This is a Light Sample.

    CONFIG_EXAMPLES_ST_THINGS_BLINK: BLINK

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_IOTBUS_GPIO
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_ST_THINGS
    • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/st_things/Kconfig

      This is a Blink Sample.

    CONFIG_EXAMPLES_ST_THINGS_MSG_HANDLING: Message Handling Example

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_IOTBUS_GPIO
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_ST_THINGS
    • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/st_things/Kconfig

      This is a Message handling Sample.

1.18.4.130 CONFIG_RESET_BUTTON: Reset_Button

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_ST_THINGS, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_ST_THINGS_LIGHT
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/st_things/Kconfig

    Decide whether to use the button to reset the connection on your board.

1.18.4.131 CONFIG_LIGHT_SWITCH_BUTTON: Light_Switch_Button

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_ST_THINGS, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_ST_THINGS_LIGHT
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/st_things/Kconfig

    Decide whether to use the button to trigger the light switch on your board.

1.18.4.132 CONFIG_RESET_BUTTON_PIN_NUMBER: Pin Number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 44
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_ST_THINGS, CONFIG_RESET_BUTTON
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/st_things/Kconfig

    The default is the reset button pin number 44 for the ARTIK 053. If you use another board, you can set the pin number for the board.

1.18.4.133 CONFIG_LIGHT_SWITCH_BUTTON_PIN_NUMBER: GPIO Number of handle notify switch resource observers manually

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 42
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_ST_THINGS, CONFIG_LIGHT_SWITCH_BUTTON
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/st_things/Kconfig

    The default value of switch SW702 for the ARTIK 053 is 42 gpio number. If you use another board, you can set the pin number for the board.

1.18.4.134 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_ST_THINGS_RED_LED_GPIO_NUM: GPIO number of RED LED

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 45
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_ST_THINGS, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_ST_THINGS_BLINK
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/st_things/Kconfig

    This is a red led gpio num.

1.18.4.137 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TELNETD_NOMAC: Use Canned MAC Address

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TELNETD
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/telnetd/Kconfig

    If the hardware has no MAC address of its own, define this =y to provide a bogus address for testing.

1.18.4.138 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TELNETD_IPADDR: Target IP address

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0a000002
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TELNETD
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/telnetd/Kconfig

    The target IP address. Default 10.0.0.2 (0x0a000002)

1.18.4.139 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TELNETD_DRIPADDR: Default Router IP address (Gateway)

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x0a000001
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TELNETD
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/telnetd/Kconfig

    The default router address. Default 10.0.0.1 (0x0a000001)

1.18.4.140 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TELNETD_NETMASK: Network Mask

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0xffffff00
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TELNETD
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/telnetd/Kconfig

    The network mask. Default: 255.255.255.0 (0xffffff00)

1.18.4.141 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TELNETD_DAEMONPRIO: Telnet daemon priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TELNETD
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/telnetd/Kconfig

    Priority of the Telnetd server daemon. Default: 100

1.18.4.142 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TELNETD_DAEMONSTACKSIZE: Telnet daemon stack size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2048
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TELNETD
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/telnetd/Kconfig

  • Default: 100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TELNETD
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/telnetd/Kconfig

1.18.4.185 CONFIG_TC_KERNEL_MQUEUE: Mqueue

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TESTCASE, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TESTCASE_KERNEL , !CONFIG_DISABLE_MQUEUE
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps/examples/testcase/le_tc/kernel/Kconfig

1.18.4.245 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TESTCASE_TCP_TLS_AUTHENTICATION: Authentication type

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TESTCASE, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TESTCASE_TCP_TLS_STRESS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps/examples/testcase/le_tc/tcp_tls/Kconfig

    0 : Open 1 : WEP Shared 2 : WPA PSK 3 : WPA2 PSK 4 : WPA and WPA2 PSK 5 : Unknown

1.18.4.246 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TESTCASE_TCP_TLS_CRYPTO: Encryption type

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TESTCASE, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TESTCASE_TCP_TLS_STRESS
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps/examples/testcase/le_tc/tcp_tls/Kconfig

    0 : None 1 : WEP 64 bits 2 : WEP 128 bits 3 : AES 4 : TKIP 5 : TIKP and AES 6 : Unknown

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TESTCASE, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TESTCASE_DM_UTC
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps/examples/testcase/ta_tc/device_management/utc/Kconfig

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TESTCASE, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TESTCASE_DM_UTC
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps/examples/testcase/ta_tc/device_management/utc/Kconfig

  • Default: "NULL"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TESTCASE, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TESTCASE_WIFI_MANAGER_UTC

1.18.4.320 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TESTCASE_WIFI_MANAGER_UTC_AUTHENTICATION: Authentication type

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TESTCASE, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TESTCASE_WIFI_MANAGER_UTC
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps/examples/testcase/ta_tc/wifi_manager/utc/Kconfig

    0 : Open 1 : WEP Shared 2 : WPA PSK 3 : WPA2 PSK 4 : WPA and WPA2 PSK 5 : Unknown

1.18.4.321 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TESTCASE_WIFI_MANAGER_UTC_CRYPTO: Encryption type

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TESTCASE, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TESTCASE_WIFI_MANAGER_UTC
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps/examples/testcase/ta_tc/wifi_manager/utc/Kconfig

    0 : None 1 : WEP 64 bits 2 : WEP 128 bits 3 : AES 4 : TKIP 5 : TIKP and AES 6 : Unknown

1.18.4.322 CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TESTCASE_WIFI_MANAGER_UTC_SOFTAP_SSID: SSID of SoftAP

  • Type: String
  • Default: "PKES"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TESTCASE, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TESTCASE_WIFI_MANAGER_UTC

  • Default: y

1.18.4.338 CONFIG_LIBCXX_UTC_CONTAINERS_LIST: UTC for Libc++ List

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TESTCASE, CONFIG_LIBCXX_UTC_CONTAINERS
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/libcxx-test/Kconfig

    UTC for Libc++ Containers(List)

1.18.4.339 CONFIG_LIBCXX_UTC_UTILITIES: UTC for Libc++ Utilities

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TESTCASE, CONFIG_LIBCXX_UTC
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/libcxx-test/Kconfig

    UTC for Libc++ Utilities

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_TESTCASE, CONFIG_LIBCXX_UTC
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/libcxx-test/Kconfig

    UTC for Libc++ Diagnostics(stdexcept)

  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/timer/Kconfig

    This application is an example program that opens /dev/timer0 to set the timer and registers the callback which is called at the end of the timer.

  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/wifi_manager_sample/Kconfig

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 5
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WIFIMANAGER_TEST, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WIFIMANAGER_STRESS_TOOL

  • Type: String
  • Default: "SSID"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WIFIMANAGER_TEST, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WIFIMANAGER_STRESS_TOOL

    Select SSID of AP which you want to connect to

1.18.4.369 CONFIG_WIFIMANAGER_TEST_AP_PASSPHRASE: Passphrase of AP

  • Type: String
  • Default: "NULL"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WIFIMANAGER_TEST, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WIFIMANAGER_STRESS_TOOL
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/wifi_manager_sample/Kconfig

    Passphrase of AP which you want to connect to

1.18.4.370 CONFIG_WIFIMANAGER_TEST_AP_AUTHENTICATION: Authentication type

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WIFIMANAGER_TEST, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WIFIMANAGER_STRESS_TOOL
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/wifi_manager_sample/Kconfig

    0 : Open 1 : WEP Shared 2 : WPA PSK 3 : WPA2 PSK 4 : WPA and WPA2 PSK 5 : Unknown

1.18.4.371 CONFIG_WIFIMANAGER_TEST_AP_CRYPTO: Encryption type

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WIFIMANAGER_TEST, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WIFIMANAGER_STRESS_TOOL
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/wifi_manager_sample/Kconfig

    0 : None 1 : WEP 64 bits 2 : WEP 128 bits 3 : AES 4 : TKIP 5 : TIKP and AES 6 : Unknown

1.18.4.372 CONFIG_WIFIMANAGER_TEST_SOFTAP_SSID: SSID of SoftAP

  • Type: String
  • Default: "PKES"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WIFIMANAGER_TEST, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WIFIMANAGER_STRESS_TOOL
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/wifi_manager_sample/Kconfig

    Name SSID of SoftAP

1.18.4.373 CONFIG_WIFIMANAGER_TEST_SOFTAP_PASSWORD: Passphrase of SoftAP

  • Type: String
  • Default: "password"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WIFIMANAGER_TEST, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WIFIMANAGER_STRESS_TOOL
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/wifi_manager_sample/Kconfig

    Passphrase of SoftAP

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WIFIMANAGER_TEST, CONFIG_EXAMPLES_WIFIMANAGER_STRESS_TOOL

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETUTILS_XMLRPC
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/examples/xmlrpc/Kconfig

1.18.5 Menu: Platform-specific Support

  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/platform/Kconfig

1.18.5.1 CONFIG_PLATFORM_CONFIGDATA: Platform configuration data

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/platform/Kconfig

    Set this option if the platform retention of configuration data. This storage mechanism is platform dependent and must be implemented in the platform specific directory under apps/platform/. The storage mechanism is not visible to applications so underlying non- volatile storage can be used: A file, EEPROM, hardcoded values in FLASH, etc.

1.18.5.2 CONFIG_HAVE_CXXINITIALIZE: Have C++ initialization

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_HAVE_CXX
  • Kconfig file: ./../apps/platform/gnu/Kconfig

    The platform-specific logic includes support for initialization of static C++ instances for this architecture and for the selected toolchain (via up_cxxinitialize()).

1.18.6 Menu: Shell

  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/shell/Kconfig

1.18.6.1 CONFIG_TASH: Enable shell

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NFILE_DESCRIPTORS != CONFIG_0
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/shell/Kconfig

1.18.6.2 CONFIG_TASH_MAX_COMMANDS: Max number of TASH commands

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 32
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_TASH
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/shell/Kconfig

    The maximum number of TASH commands to register.

1.18.6.3 CONFIG_TASH_USLEEP: Enable 'usleep' command in TASH

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_TASH, !CONFIG_DISABLE_SIGNALS
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/shell/Kconfig

    Enable 'usleep' command in TASH.

1.18.6.4 CONFIG_TASH_COMMAND_INTERFACE: enable command interface to TASH

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_TASH
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/shell/Kconfig

    Enable to use TASH commands APIs

1.18.6.5 CONFIG_TASH_CMDTASK_STACKSIZE: TASH task stack size to run command with ASYNC type

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 4096
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_TASH
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/shell/Kconfig

    The stack size allocated for TASH command task

1.18.6.6 CONFIG_TASH_CMDTASK_PRIORITY: TASH task priority to run command with ASYNC type

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_TASH
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/shell/Kconfig

    The priority set for TASH command task

1.18.6.7 CONFIG_TASH_SCRIPT: enable shell script

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_TASH, !CONFIG_DISABLE_ENVIRON
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/shell/Kconfig

    This suppors parsing and executing shell script. See "sh" on TASH help command.

1.18.7 Menu: System Libraries and Add-Ons

  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/Kconfig

1.18.7.1 CONFIG_SYSTEM_CLE: EMACS-like Command Line Editor

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NFILE_STREAMS != CONFIG_0
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/cle/Kconfig

    Enable support for TinyAra tiny EMACS-like command line editor.

    Omitted features: 

      - No keypad cursor control support
- No word oriented operations.

    Assumptions and Limitations: 

      - A VT100 host terminal is assumed.
- A fixed width character set (like Courier) is assumed

    Memory Usage: Looks like 1.5-2KB

1.18.7.2 CONFIG_SYSTEM_CLE_DEBUGLEVEL: Debug level

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Range: 0 - 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_CLE
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/cle/Kconfig

    0=Debug off; 1=Print errors on console; 2=Print debug information on the console.

    Debug output is generated with syslog. The editor works on /dev/console. In order to get both a usable display and also readable debug output, syslog'ing should sent to some device other than /dev/console (which is the default).

1.18.7.3 CONFIG_SYSTEM_CUTERM: CU serial terminal

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/cu/Kconfig

    Enable the CU serial terminal. This is a minimalistic implementation of the 'cu' terminal program (part of Taylor UUCP for ages). Using it, you can simply open a serial port and interact with it. Using '~.' you can leave the terminal program and drop back to TASH.

    This terminal might come in handy for other people that have e.g. GS modems, GPS receivers or other devices with text based serial communications attached to their TinyAra systems.

1.18.7.4 CONFIG_SYSTEM_CUTERM_DEFAULT_DEVICE: Default serial device

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/dev/ttyS0"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_CUTERM
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/cu/Kconfig

    Normally, the serial device to be used is provided on the command line. If no device is provided then this is the default device that will be used.

1.18.7.5 CONFIG_SYSTEM_CUTERM_DEFAULT_BAUD: Default serial baud

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 115200
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_CUTERM
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/cu/Kconfig

    Normally, the BAUD to be used is provided on the command line. If no BAUD is provided then this is the default device that will be used.

1.18.7.6 CONFIG_SYSTEM_CUTERM_STACKSIZE: CU terminal stack size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2048
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_CUTERM
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/cu/Kconfig

    This is the stack size that will be used when starting the CU terminal.

1.18.7.7 CONFIG_SYSTEM_CUTERM_PRIORITY: CU terminal priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_CUTERM
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/cu/Kconfig

    This is the task priority that will be used when starting the CU terminal.

1.18.7.8 CONFIG_SYSTEM_FLASH_ERASEALL: FLASH eraseall tool

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_MTD && CONFIG_BUILTIN_APPS && !CONFIG_BUILD_PROTECTED && !CONFIG_BUILD_KERNEL
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/flash_eraseall/Kconfig

    Enable support for the FLASH eraseall tool.

1.18.7.9 CONFIG_SYSTEM_FOTA_HAL: FOTA HAL Application Library

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_FOTA_DRIVER, CONFIG_LIB_BOARDCTL, CONFIG_BOARDCTL_RESET
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/fota_hal/Kconfig

    Enable FOTA HAL Application Library

1.18.7.10 CONFIG_SYSTEM_FOTA_DEVNAME: Device name of OTA partition

  • Type: String
  • Default: "/dev/fota"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_FOTA_HAL
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/fota_hal/Kconfig

    Specifies the device name of the partition for OTA like "/dev/fota"

1.18.7.11 CONFIG_SYSTEM_FOTA_SET_SPECIFIC: Set binary and partition type

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_FOTA_HAL
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/fota_hal/Kconfig

    Specifies binary and partition type. If they are set automatically, let's disable this.

1.18.7.12 CONFIG_SYSTEM_I2CTOOL: I2C tool

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_I2C
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/i2c/Kconfig

    Enable support for the I2C tool.

1.18.7.13 CONFIG_I2CTOOL_MINBUS: Minimum bus number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_I2CTOOL, CONFIG_SYSTEM_I2CTOOL
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/i2c/Kconfig

    Smallest bus index supported by the hardware (default 0).

1.18.7.14 CONFIG_I2CTOOL_MAXBUS: Maximum bus number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 3
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_I2CTOOL, CONFIG_SYSTEM_I2CTOOL
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/i2c/Kconfig

    Largest bus index supported by the hardware (default 3)

1.18.7.15 CONFIG_I2CTOOL_MINADDR: Minimum I2C address

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x03
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_I2CTOOL, CONFIG_SYSTEM_I2CTOOL
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/i2c/Kconfig

    Minium 7-bit device address (default: 0x03)

1.18.7.16 CONFIG_I2CTOOL_MAXADDR: Maximum I2C address

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0x77
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_I2CTOOL, CONFIG_SYSTEM_I2CTOOL
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/i2c/Kconfig

    Largest 7-bit device address (default: 0x77)

1.18.7.17 CONFIG_I2CTOOL_MAXREGADDR: Maximum I2C register address

  • Type: Hexadecimal
  • Default: 0xff
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_I2CTOOL, CONFIG_SYSTEM_I2CTOOL
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/i2c/Kconfig

    Largest I2C register address (default: 0xff)

1.18.7.18 CONFIG_I2CTOOL_DEFFREQ: Default I2C frequency

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 400000
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_I2CTOOL, CONFIG_SYSTEM_I2CTOOL
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/i2c/Kconfig

    Default I2C frequency (default: 400000)

1.18.7.19 CONFIG_SYSTEM_INIFILE: INI file parser

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/inifile/Kconfig

    Enable support for a simple INI file parser.

1.18.7.20 CONFIG_SYSTEM_INIFILE_MAXLINE: Max line length

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 256
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_INIFILE
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/inifile/Kconfig

    The largest line that the parser can expect to see in an INI file.

1.18.7.21 CONFIG_SYSTEM_INIFILE_DEBUGLEVEL: Debug level

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Range: 0 - 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_INIFILE
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/inifile/Kconfig

    0=Debug off; 1=Print errors on console; 2=Print debug information on the console.

1.18.7.22 CONFIG_SYSTEM_PREAPP_INIT: Preapp Init

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/init/Kconfig

    Enable Preapp Init.

1.18.7.23 CONFIG_SYSTEM_PREAPP_STACKSIZE: pre-app thread stack size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2048
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_PREAPP_INIT
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/init/Kconfig

    The size of the stack to allocate for the pre-application thread that is started as soon as the OS completes its initialization.

1.18.7.24 CONFIG_SYSTEM_IPERF: iperf App

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET_LWIP && CONFIG_NETUTILS_JSON && CONFIG_LIBC_FLOATINGPOINT, CONFIG_NET_LWIP_NETDB
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/iperf/Kconfig

    Enable the \"IPERF App\" example

1.18.7.25 CONFIG_SYSTEM_IPERF_PROGNAME: Program name

  • Type: String
  • Default: "iperf"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_IPERF, CONFIG_BUILD_KERNEL
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/iperf/Kconfig

    This is the name of the program that will be use when the TASH ELF program is installed.

1.18.7.26 CONFIG_SYSTEM_MDIO: MDIO tool

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NETDEV_PHY_IOCTL
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/mdio/Kconfig

    Enable the MDIO tool

1.18.7.27 CONFIG_SYSTEM_NETDB: netdb interface

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET_LWIP_NETDB
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/netdb/Kconfig

1.18.7.28 CONFIG_SYSTEM_NETDB_STACKSIZE: netdb task stack size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 2048
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_NETDB
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/netdb/Kconfig

1.18.7.29 CONFIG_SYSTEM_NETDB_PRIORITY: netdb task priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_NETDB
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/netdb/Kconfig

1.18.7.30 CONFIG_SYSTEM_POWEROFF: Power-Off command

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_BOARDCTL_POWEROFF
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/poweroff/Kconfig

    Enable support for the TASH poweroff command. NOTE: This option provides the TASH power-off command only. It requires board-specific support to actually implement the power-off.

1.18.7.31 CONFIG_SYSTEM_RAMTEST: RAM Test

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/ramtest/Kconfig

    Enable a simple RAM test.

1.18.7.32 CONFIG_SYSTEM_RAMTEST_PRIORITY: RAM test task priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_RAMTEST
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/ramtest/Kconfig

1.18.7.33 CONFIG_SYSTEM_RAMTEST_STACKSIZE: RAM test stack size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 1024
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_RAMTEST
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/ramtest/Kconfig

1.18.7.34 CONFIG_SYSTEM_READLINE: readline() support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/readline/Kconfig

    Enable support for the readline() function.

1.18.7.35 CONFIG_READLINE_ECHO: Echo character input

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_READLINE
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/readline/Kconfig

    Echo received character input back via stdout. This is normal behavior and should be selected unless the source of stdin input already has local echo support or you need to suppress the back-channel responses for any other reason.

1.18.7.36 CONFIG_DEBUG_SYSTEM_APP: Enable system debug application with tash inerface

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_TASH, CONFIG_DEBUG_SYSTEM
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/sysdbg/Kconfig

1.18.7.37 CONFIG_SYSTEM_INFORMATION: System Information

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/sysinfo/Kconfig

    print System Information like version, time and etc

1.18.7.38 CONFIG_KERNEL_CMDS: Kernel shell commands

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_TASH
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/utils/Kconfig

    register shell commands for kernel

1.18.7.39 CONFIG_FS_CMDS: FS shell commands

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_TASH && (CONFIG_NFILE_DESCRIPTORS != CONFIG_0)
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/utils/Kconfig

    Disable File System command in TASH. Command including ls, cd, cat, mount, and so on.

1.18.7.40 CONFIG_FSCMD_BUFFER_LEN: Buffer length of FSCMD

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 32
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_CMDS
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/utils/Kconfig

    Buffer length of FS command's I/O operation Using this buffer in cat, and so on.

1.18.7.41 CONFIG_NET_CMDS: Network shell commands

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_TASH && CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPC && CONFIG_NETUTILS_NETLIB && CONFIG_NET_LWIP
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/utils/Kconfig

    Disable Network command in TASH. Command including ifconfig, ifdown, ifup, and so on.

1.18.7.42 CONFIG_NET_PING_CMD: Network 'ping' command

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET_CMDS
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/utils/Kconfig

    Network ping command

1.18.7.43 CONFIG_NET_PING_CMD_ICOUNT: ping command iterations

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 5
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET_CMDS, CONFIG_NET_PING_CMD
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/utils/Kconfig

    Number of iterations that 'ping' has to be run.

1.18.7.44 CONFIG_ENABLE_CPULOAD_CMD: cpuload

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SCHED_CPULOAD && !CONFIG_FS_PROCFS_EXCLUDE_CPULOAD
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/utils/Kconfig

    Display current cpuload or start/stop CPU load monitor. CPU load monitor is a daemon that will periodically assess CPU usage by all live tasks and threads in the system.

1.18.7.45 CONFIG_ENABLE_CPULOAD_MONITOR: cpuload monitor

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ENABLE_CPULOAD_CMD && !CONFIG_CONFIG_DISABLE_PTHREAD && !CONFIG_CONFIG_DISABLE_SIGNALS
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/utils/Kconfig

    The CPU load monitor is a daemon that will periodically assess CPU usage by all live tasks and threads in the system. It is available if both signal and pthread are supported only, !DISABLE_SIGNALS && !DISABLE_PTHREAD.

1.18.7.46 CONFIG_CPULOADMONITOR_PRIORITY: CPU load monitor daemon priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ENABLE_CPULOAD_MONITOR
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/utils/Kconfig

    The priority to use the the CPU load monitor daemon. Default: 100

1.18.7.47 CONFIG_CPULOADMONITOR_INTERVAL: CPU load monitor frequency

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 5
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ENABLE_CPULOAD_MONITOR
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/utils/Kconfig

    The rate in seconds that the CPU load monitor will wait before dumping the next set CPU load usage information. Default: 5 seconds.

1.18.7.48 CONFIG_ENABLE_DATE_CMD: date

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/utils/Kconfig

    Display or set time

1.18.7.49 CONFIG_ENABLE_DMESG_CMD: dmesg

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSLOG && CONFIG_RAMLOG_SYSLOG
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/utils/Kconfig

    Print the contents of log message buffer

1.18.7.50 CONFIG_ENABLE_ENV_GET_CMD: env get

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: !CONFIG_DISABLE_ENVIRON
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/utils/Kconfig

    print the current contents of env

1.18.7.51 CONFIG_ENABLE_ENV_SET_CMD: env set

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: !CONFIG_DISABLE_ENVIRON
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/utils/Kconfig

    set a env variable

1.18.7.52 CONFIG_ENABLE_ENV_UNSET_CMD: env unset

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: !CONFIG_DISABLE_ENVIRON
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/utils/Kconfig

    unset a specific env variable

1.18.7.53 CONFIG_ENABLE_FREE_CMD: free

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/utils/Kconfig

    Show information about memory status

1.18.7.54 CONFIG_ENABLE_HEAPINFO_CMD: heapinfo

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG_MM_HEAPINFO
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/utils/Kconfig

    Show information about memory status per thread

1.18.7.55 CONFIG_HEAPINFO_USER_GROUP: Enable User defined Group Memory Usage

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ENABLE_HEAPINFO_CMD
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/utils/Kconfig

1.18.7.56 CONFIG_HEAPINFO_USER_GROUP_LIST: Thread Name List for measuring Alloc Size

  • Type: String
  • Default: ""
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ENABLE_HEAPINFO_CMD, CONFIG_HEAPINFO_USER_GROUP
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/utils/Kconfig

    Task/Thread name is separated with ',' and Group is separated with '/'. For example, "abc,def/ghi,jklmn/opqr".

1.18.7.57 CONFIG_ENABLE_IRQINFO_CMD: irqinfo

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_DEBUG_IRQ_INFO
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_TASH && !CONFIG_FS_PROCFS_EXCLUDE_IRQS
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/utils/Kconfig

    List the registered interrupts, it's occurrence counts and corresponding isr.

1.18.7.58 CONFIG_ENABLE_KILL_CMD: kill

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: !CONFIG_BUILD_PROTECTED
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/utils/Kconfig

    Send a signal to processes or process groups. When SIGKILL(9) is sent, a task/pthread which received signal will be terminated without any garbage collection. Users can register their own handler for SIGKILL to free the allocated memory. CONFIG_SIGKILL_HANDLER should be enabled for user's own handler.

1.18.7.59 CONFIG_ENABLE_KILLALL_CMD: killall

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: !CONFIG_BUILD_PROTECTED
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/utils/Kconfig

    Send a signal to all processes running any of the specified commands

1.18.7.60 CONFIG_ENABLE_PS_CMD: ps

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: !CONFIG_FS_PROCFS_EXCLUDE_PROCESS
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/utils/Kconfig

    List of tasks/threads

1.18.7.61 CONFIG_ENABLE_STACKMONITOR_CMD: Stack monitor

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_STACK_COLORATION
  • Dependencies: !CONFIG_FS_PROCFS_EXCLUDE_PROCESS
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/utils/Kconfig

    The stack monitor is a daemon that will periodically assess stack usage by all tasks and threads in the system. This feature depends on internal OS features and, hence, is not available if the kernel build or protected build is selected.

1.18.7.62 CONFIG_STACKMONITOR_PRIORITY: Stack monitor daemon priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ENABLE_STACKMONITOR_CMD
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/utils/Kconfig

    The priority to use the the stack monitor daemon. Default: 100

1.18.7.63 CONFIG_STACKMONITOR_INTERVAL: Stack monitor dump frequency

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 5
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ENABLE_STACKMONITOR_CMD
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/utils/Kconfig

    The rate in seconds that the stack monitor will wait before dumping the next set stack usage information. Default: 2 seconds.

1.18.7.64 CONFIG_ENABLE_UPTIME_CMD: uptime

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/utils/Kconfig

    print how long the system has been running

1.18.7.65 CONFIG_SYSTEM_VI: Tiny VI work-alike text editor

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: (CONFIG_NFILE_DESCRIPTORS != CONFIG_0) && (CONFIG_NFILE_STREAMS != CONFIG_0)
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/vi/Kconfig

    Enable support for TinyAra tiny VI work-alike editor.

    Omitted features: 

      - No keypad cursor control support
- No word oriented operations.

    Assumptions and Limitations: 

      - A VT100 host terminal is assumed.  At 115200 BAUD, screen
update times with a 24x64 edit region are noticeable but
acceptable.
- A fixed width character set (like Courier) is assumed
- Files are edited in memory so unless you have a lot of memory
to spare, this editor will only be useful for very small files.

    Size: As of 2013-01-30, it appears that the size will vary from about 8.5 to 10.5KB, depending upon the efficiency of the underlying architecture.

1.18.7.66 CONFIG_SYSTEM_VI_COLS: Display width (columns)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 64
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_VI
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/vi/Kconfig

    The editor does not have the capability to query the display for its width or height. This setting provides the default width of the display in columns. The actually width can be overridden using command line options.

1.18.7.67 CONFIG_SYSTEM_VI_ROWS: Display height (rows)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 16
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_VI
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/vi/Kconfig

    The editor does not have the capability to query the display for its width or height. This setting provides the default height of the display in rows. The actually width can be overridden using command line options.

1.18.7.68 CONFIG_SYSTEM_VI_DEBUGLEVEL: Debug level

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Range: 0 - 2
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_SYSTEM_VI
  • Kconfig file: /home/sunghan/Work/TinyAra/Forked_TizenRT/apps/system/vi/Kconfig

    0=Debug off; 1=Print errors on console; 2=Print debug information on the console.

    Debug output is generated with syslog. The editor works on /dev/console. In order to get both a usable display and also readable debug output, syslog'ing should sent to some device other than /dev/console (which is the default).

1.19 Menu: Runtime Environment

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.19.1 CONFIG_ENABLE_IOTJS: IoT.js

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SPI_EXCHANGE, CONFIG_IOTBUS, CONFIG_IOTBUS_GPIO, CONFIG_IOTBUS_I2C, CONFIG_IOTBUS_PWM, CONFIG_IOTBUS_SPI, CONFIG_IOTBUS_UART
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/iotjs/config/tizenrt/Kconfig.runtime

    Enable IoT.js framework

1.19.2 CONFIG_IOTJS_PRIORITY: IoT.js task priority

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 100
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ENABLE_IOTJS
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/iotjs/config/tizenrt/Kconfig.runtime

1.19.3 CONFIG_IOTJS_STACKSIZE: IoT.js stack size

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 32768
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ENABLE_IOTJS
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/iotjs/config/tizenrt/Kconfig.runtime

1.19.4 CONFIG_IOTJS_JERRY_HEAP: Jerryscript Heaplimit

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 128
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ENABLE_IOTJS
  • Kconfig file: ./../external/iotjs/config/tizenrt/Kconfig.runtime

1.20 Menu: Device Management

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.20.1 CONFIG_DM: DM

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_NET_LWIP_NETDB, CONFIG_LWM2M_WAKAAMA
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/dm/Kconfig

    enable the DM functionality

1.20.2 CONFIG_DM_WIFI: Set Up Wifi Info For DM Demo

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DM
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/dm/Kconfig

    Enable the artik demo example

1.20.3 CONFIG_DM_AP_SSID: wifi ap ssid

  • Type: String
  • Default: "SSID"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DM, CONFIG_DM_WIFI
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/dm/Kconfig

1.20.4 CONFIG_DM_AP_PASS: wifi ap password

  • Type: String
  • Default: "PASSWORD"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DM, CONFIG_DM_WIFI
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/dm/Kconfig

1.20.5 CONFIG_DM_AP_SECURITY: wifi join security

  • Type: String
  • Default: "wpa2_aes"
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_DM, CONFIG_DM_WIFI
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/dm/Kconfig

1.21 Menu: Task manager

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.21.1 CONFIG_TASK_MANAGER: Enable Task Manager

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_SCHED_ATEXIT, CONFIG_SCHED_WORKQUEUE, CONFIG_LIB_USRWORK
  • Dependencies: !CONFIG_DISABLE_SIGNALS && !CONFIG_DISABLE_MQUEUE && CONFIG_TASK_NAME_SIZE != CONFIG_0
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/task_manager/Kconfig

    Enables Task Manager.

1.21.2 CONFIG_TASK_MANAGER_MAX_TASKS: Task Manager Max Task Num

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: MAX_TASKS
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_TASK_MANAGER
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/task_manager/Kconfig

    Task Manager can register this number of tasks. Maximum MAX_TASKS tasks can be alive at the same time although it is greater than MAX_TASKS.

1.21.3 CONFIG_TASK_MANAGER_MAX_MSG: Task Manager Max Msg number

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: MAX_TASKS
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_TASK_MANAGER
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/task_manager/Kconfig

    Task Manager can receive under this value.

1.21.4 CONFIG_TASK_MANAGER_USER_SPECIFIC_BROADCAST: Enable User Specific Broadcast Message

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_TASK_MANAGER
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/task_manager/Kconfig

    User defined broadcast messages are enabled to use at the Task Manager.

1.21.5 CONFIG_TASK_MANAGER_UNICAST_REPLY_TIMEOUT: Task Manager Unicast Reply Timeout(sec)

  • Type: Integer
  • Default: 0
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_TASK_MANAGER
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/task_manager/Kconfig

    If timeout argument in task_manager_unicast is TM_RESPONSE_WAIT_INF, Task Manager will wait for reply during this seconds. But if this config is zero, Task Manager will wait forever until receiving reply.

1.22 Menu: Event Loop Framework

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.22.1 CONFIG_EVENTLOOP: Enable Event Loop Framework

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_LIBTUV
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/eventloop/Kconfig

    Enables Event Loop Framework.

1.23 Menu: Things Management

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.23.1 CONFIG_ST_THINGS: SmartThings Things Management

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_ENABLE_IOTIVITY, CONFIG_ENABLE_IOTIVITY_SECURED, CONFIG_ENABLE_IOTIVITY_CLOUD, CONFIG_NETUTILS_WIFI, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER, CONFIG_WPA_SUPPLICANT, CONFIG_SCSC_WLAN, CONFIG_NETUTILS_JSON, CONFIG_NETUTILS_NTPCLIENT
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_FS_ROMFS
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/st_things/Kconfig

    SmartThings Things Management for applications to use and control devices

1.23.2 CONFIG_ST_THINGS_HW_CERT_KEY: Enable Artik H/W Certificate & Key

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_TLS_WITH_SSS
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ST_THINGS, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ARTIK05X_FAMILY && CONFIG_ST_THINGS_SECURESTORAGE
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/st_things/Kconfig

    Build ST Things to save hardware certification to securestorage(limited under 8KB)

1.23.3 CONFIG_ST_THINGS_SECURESTORAGE: Enable Secure Storage

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Selects: CONFIG_TLS_WITH_SSS, CONFIG_SUPPORT_FULL_SECURITY
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ST_THINGS, CONFIG_ARCH_BOARD_ARTIK05X_FAMILY
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/st_things/Kconfig

    Build ST Things for Secure Storage

1.23.4 CONFIG_ST_THINGS_STG_MODE: Enable ST Things STG Mode

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ST_THINGS
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/st_things/Kconfig

    Build ST Things for STG Server

1.23.5 CONFIG_ST_THINGS_FOTA: Enable ST Things FOTA Service

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: n
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_ST_THINGS, CONFIG_SYSTEM_FOTA_HAL
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/st_things/Kconfig

    Enable a FOTA service for ST Things

1.24 Menu: IoTBus Framework

  • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

1.24.1 CONFIG_IOTBUS: IoTbus framework Support

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/iotbus/Kconfig

    Enables IoTBus (GPIO, I2C, PWM, SPI, UART) framework.

1.24.2 CONFIG_IOTBUS_GPIO: IoTbus GPIO

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Selects: CONFIG_GPIO
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_IOTBUS
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/iotbus/Kconfig

    Enables IoTbus GPIO

1.24.3 CONFIG_IOTBUS_I2C: IoTbus I2C

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_IOTBUS, CONFIG_I2C
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/iotbus/Kconfig

    Enables IoTbus I2C

1.24.4 CONFIG_IOTBUS_PWM: IoTbus PWM

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_IOTBUS, CONFIG_PWM
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/iotbus/Kconfig

    Enables IoTbus PWM

1.24.5 CONFIG_IOTBUS_SPI: IoTbus SPI

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_IOTBUS, CONFIG_SPI
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/iotbus/Kconfig

    Enables IoTbus SPI

1.24.6 CONFIG_IOTBUS_UART: IoTbus UART

  • Type: Boolean
  • Default: y
  • Dependencies: CONFIG_IOTBUS, CONFIG_SERIAL
  • Kconfig file: ./../framework/src/iotbus/Kconfig

    Enables IoTbus Uart

Appendix A: Hidden Configuration Variables

This appendix holds internal configurations variables that are not visible to the user. These settings are presented out-of-context because they cannot be directly controlled by the user. Many of these settings are selected automatically and indirectly when other, visible configuration variables are selected. One purpose of these hidden configuration variables is to control menuing in the kconfig-frontends configuration tool. Many configuration variables with a form like CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_feature, for example, are used only to indicate that the selected archicture supports feature and so addition selection associated with feature will become accessible to the user.

    CONFIG_APPSDIR

    • Type: String
    • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    CONFIG_EXTERNALDIR

    • Type: String
    • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    CONFIG_LIBDIR

    • Type: String
    • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_CUSTOMOPT

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: n
    • Kconfig file: ./Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH

    • Type: String
    • Default Values:
      • Default: "arm"

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM

      • Default: "xtensa"

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_XTENSA

    • Kconfig file: ./arch/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP

    • Type: String
    • Default Values:
      • Default: "s5j"

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_S5J

      • Default: "tiva"

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM

      • Default: "bcm4390x"

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_BCM4390X

      • Default: "stm32"

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_STM32

      • Default: "imxrt"

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_IMXRT

    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: n
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_IRQPRIO, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_RAMVECTORS, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_HIPRI_INTERRUPT
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM4

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: n
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_IRQPRIO, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_RAMVECTORS, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_HIPRI_INTERRUPT
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM7

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: n
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_FPU, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_IRQPRIO, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_IRQTRIGGER, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_RAMVECTORS, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LAZYFPU, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_HIPRI_INTERRUPT, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_RESET, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_COHERENT_DCACHE, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_HARDFAULT_DEBUG, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_MEMFAULT_DEBUG
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: n
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_MPU, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_COHERENT_DCACHE, CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_DABORTSTACK
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_FAMILY

    • Type: String
    • Default Values:
      • Default: "armv7-m"

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3 || CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM4 || CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM7

      • Default: "armv7-r"

        Dependency: CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4

    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_CMNVECTOR

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_FPU

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: n
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_DPFPU

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: n
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LAZYFPU

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARM_HAVE_MPU_UNIFIED

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: n
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

      Automatically selected to indicate that the CPU supports a unified MPU for both instruction and data addresses.

    CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_LOWVECTORS

    • Type: Boolean
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_DABORTSTACK

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: n
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV7M_HAVE_ICACHE

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: n
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV7M_HAVE_DCACHE

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: n
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV7M_HAVE_ITCM

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: n
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV7M_HAVE_DTCM

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: n
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV7M_HAVE_STACKCHECK

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: n
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXM3
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-m/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARMV7R_MEMINIT

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default Values:
      • Default: y

        Dependency: CONFIG_BOOT_SDRAM_DATA

      • Default: n

        Dependency: !CONFIG_BOOT_SDRAM_DATA

    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-r/Kconfig

      If this configuration *not* selected, then it is assumed that all memory resources are initialized via arm_data_initialize() and available at power-up reset time. Other memories, such as SDRAM or some ECC SRAM memories, require some platform-specific initialization first. In that case, this option should be selected and the platform-specific implementation of arm_boot() must perform the memory initialization first, then explicitly call arm_data_initialize().

    CONFIG_ARMV7R_HAVE_L2CC

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: n
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-r/Kconfig

      Selected by the configuration tool if the architecutre supports any kind of L2 cache.

    CONFIG_ARMV7R_HAVE_L2CC_PL310

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: n
    • Selects: CONFIG_ARMV7R_HAVE_L2CC
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-r/Kconfig

      Set by architecture-specific code if the hardware supports a PL310 r3p2 L2 cache (only version r3p2 is supported).

    CONFIG_ARMV7R_HAVE_DECODEFIQ

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: n
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_ARCH_ARM, CONFIG_ARCH_CORTEXR4
    • Kconfig file: ./arch/arm/src/armv7-r/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_CHIP_LM3S

    • Type: Boolean
    • Selects: CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_GPIOA_IRQS, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_GPIOB_IRQS, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_GPIOC_IRQS, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_GPIOD_IRQS, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_GPIOE_IRQS, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_GPIOF_IRQS, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_GPIOG_IRQS, CONFIG_TIVA_HAVE_SSI0

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: n
    • Selects: CONFIG_MCU_SERIAL
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_SERIAL
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/serial/Kconfig-lpuart

    CONFIG_ARCH_USBDEV_STALLQUEUE

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: n
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_USBDEV
    • Kconfig file: ./drivers/usbdev/Kconfig

      This option is set by the USB device controller driver (DCD) selection. These selection means that the DCD can support queuing of stall requests. By this, it is meant that, (1) the stall is not sent until all write requests preceding the stall request are sent, (2) the stall is sent, and then after the stall is cleared, (3) all write requests queued after the stall are sent.

      If the driver does not support this feature, that the class drivers will enable some hokey and inefficient delay logic to workaround the lack of queuing.

    CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_NET

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: n
    • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_PHY

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: n
    • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    CONFIG_NET_SOCKET

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: y
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NET_LWIP
    • Kconfig file: ./net/lwip/configs/socket/Kconfig

    CONFIG_NET_MULTILINK

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: n
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET
    • Kconfig file: ./net/Kconfig

    CONFIG_LWIP_DHCPC

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: y
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPC
    • Kconfig file: ./../external/dhcpc/Kconfig.protocol

    CONFIG_LWIP_DHCPS

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: y
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_NETUTILS_DHCPD , CONFIG_NET_LWIP_DHCP
    • Kconfig file: ./../external/dhcpd/Kconfig.protocol

    CONFIG_ENABLE_EAP_FOR_SUPPLICANT

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: n
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_NET, CONFIG_WIFI_MANAGER , CONFIG_SELECT_WPA_SUPPLICANT , CONFIG_WPA_SUPPLICANT
    • Kconfig file: ./../external/wpa_supplicant/Kconfig

      Enable EAP support for the supplicant. This is disabled by default, because of pending CVE issues in some affected files.

    CONFIG_FS_READABLE

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: y
    • Kconfig file: ./fs/Kconfig

    CONFIG_FS_WRITABLE

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: y
    • Kconfig file: ./fs/Kconfig

    CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_HEAPCHECK

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: n
    • Dependencies: CONFIG_DEBUG
    • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_STACKCHECK

    • Type: Boolean
    • Default: n
    • Kconfig file: ././Kconfig.debug

    CONFIG_ARCH_HAVE_ROMGETC

    • Type: Boolean
    • Kconfig file: ./../lib/libc/Kconfig
